If the grunts get barbecue for their morale, then I propose we assemble a liquor cabinet to cheer up the officers.
But aren't you and the Captain the only officers?

Does that make it any less important? That Colt guy over at Recoil Ridge has the know-how to make decent frontier moonshine. If we can get him the materials, he'll build us the parts we need to set up our own Distillery.
Morale is like sarcasm. It cannot be measured, but neither can its importance.
A hangover is the wrath of grapes.
Y'know, Sheriff Colt isn't so bad. He's been a real help with this Distillery project. All we need to do while we're waiting is grow some wheat. That way we'll be ready when he is.
Just a quick job at our Field.
I'm told the grain from this frontier soil makes some fine liquor. I can't wait.
Hey there. Got your Distillery plans right here. Is that guy with the tall head around?
Is that how you think of me?
Just forgot your name, kid. Don't be so sensitive-like. Anyway, follow these plans and you should be all set up for some damn fine Northern Moonshine.
All is forgiven. Let's get on this, Captain. My morale can't wait any longer.
We need something to celebrate. Something like the completion of the Distillery!
Always remember that I have taken more out of alcohol than alcohol has taken out of me.
Great, now place the Supply Drop.
Tap on the Build button, then on the Supply Drop.

Well, if I'm reading the map right, this is where High Command thinks we'll find the Uranium for the secret weapon that will turn the tide against the Rebels. The sooner we find it, the sooner we can all go home as heroes!
First things first: High Command will need to know where to drop off supplies, so let's get a Supply Drop set up.
Keep an eye on the Supply Drop for bonuses!

Wow - look at that! The Empire must've paid extra shipping to get our first supply drop here so fast!
Now just tap to collect the drop! Come on - open it!
I love opening presents. Make sure to keep an eye on the Supply Drop. The Empire sent a note telling us to expect three more drops sometime soon.
Wait, what is that above the Supply Drop?

Oh, of course! We need housing to run our buildings! Tap the Build button and build a Shelter.

Perfect! Now that their front row is empty, we can finally advance on that bloody cannoneer!

HAHAHA, non importa Perkins — è solo un gran simpaticone.
This bottle and I are going to take a little nap.
Now we're talking! Fantastic things, those Nanopods - you can use them to HURRY almost anything!
Specialista Perkins a rapporto...Signore!
Ehm...Capitano, signore,
We don't have that kind of time the Raiders could attack at any moment! Use your Nanopods to speed things up!
Wait, what do you mean High Command didn't give you any Nanopods? Are you serious? All right, fine - use some of mine. You owe me. These are from my PERSONAL stash.
COSA!? Quanto ci vuole per addestrare un Soldato?
<Morgan hands you some of his Nanopods.>
As cozy as it is with all of us sleeping in a single tent, we should really put up a Camp. It smells like feet wrapped in leathery, burnt bacon in here.
The Camp can be found in the Build Menu, in the Housing category.
The Empire is proud to announce that it's got the bedbug problem under control. Mostly.
High Command sent us here to find Uranium. The sooner we find some, the sooner we can defeat the Rebels once and for all!
Diamo un'occhiata intorno, ti va?
High Command needs Uranium for their secret weapon project to defeat the Rebels.
Hmm... no Uranium, but the nearby sources of Wood and Stone will come in handy as we build up the Outpost.
I'm not sure why they're watching us, but let's drive them off before they get comfortable!
Capitano, io continuo a vedere Predoni che spiano l'avamposto.
Tap on a Raider encounter to drive them off of our land!
Until we have defenses, anyone can get in our base!
Sounds like we'll need a ton of building materials. We should ask Floyd what he thinks. He IS our Civil Engineer, after all.
L'Alto Comando vuole che costruiamo un Avamposto minerario.
We're going to need plenty of Stone. We'll use it to construct the factories, defenses, and other buildings for our Outpost. Let's begin by building a Stone Quarry.
Costruisci una Cava di Pietra su quelle rocce a ovest.
I sure wish Zoey was around to help set up all these machines...
Non dovremmo raccogliere la Pietra dalla cava?
Ehm... Floyd?
Beh, avremo bisogno di Autocarri per trasportare la Pietra che raccogliamo. E per fare ciò dobbiamo costruire un Deposito.
... Possiamo costruirlo qui?
Credevo stessimo parlando di una situazione ipotetica. Certamente, cominciamo!
… … Oh, certo!
È necessario un Deposito affinché le risorse vengano immagazzinate.
Place the Resource Depot within range of the resources you're trying to collect!
Guidavo un Autocarro per arrotondare. Non era divertente.
I nostri Autocarri raccolgono automaticamente la Pietra prodotta alla Cava e la portano al Deposito, così possiamo usarla.
The buildings and units we need for this Outpost will cost a lot of Gold.
I'm sure with the proper persuasion we can convince our workers to part with some of their Gold. We'll call it a 'tax.'
Ci servono soldi, un sacco di soldi!
I civili che vivono in tutte queste case hanno denaro....
Houses generate tax money. Nicer houses usually pay more in taxes.
Remember - houses give us Gold. Speaking of, how closely are you keeping track of the outpost's finances?
Did you see the way those Raiders were able to just walk into Recoil Ridge? After all this time, they haven't learned the value of a Bunker.
That, my friend, is the difference between an Imperial Outpost and a half-assed frontier town. Oh wait, we don't have any Bunkers yet either. We should build some of those!
Bunkers are available in the Military category of the Build Menu.
That seems good. Now we just need to find some men to stuff in there.
Okay - get some volunteers to man that Bunker!
Remember not to leave your whole army on defense.
Defense is the best defense. Wait, is that how that goes?
We'll show these Raiders who's boss.
These guys should be able to make short work of any Raiders who challenge us.
Abbiamo bisogno di più potenza di fuoco!
Addestriamo alcuni Artiglieri.
You need a couple of troops for a Gunner squad. Train them at the Barracks.
...and look! Here's a picture of Mr. Purrface chasing the shell casings. Isn't he just the cutest?
I just hope it's for the right reasons. It sounds like we'll need a Logging Camp!
Dicono sempre che la guerra spinga avanti la Scienza.
Build a Logging Camp in the forest just to the east.
Our lumberjacks will sleep all night and work all day.
which means we aren't collecting as much as we could be.
Just as I thought - the Stone Quarry and the Logging Camp are generating too much for one Hauler to collect.
Il deposito sta segnalando un'inefficienza,
Make sure you have enough Haulers to keep up with all your resource producers.
Great work! Our little economy is once again operating at peak efficiency!

Whenever a Depot can't keep up, just add another Hauler. But keep in mind that each Hauler you assign takes one worker, so make sure there's enough work for them to do or they'll just be wasting time.
to store all these resources we're collecting!
Avremo bisogno di un Magazzino
With a Warehouse, we'll be able to stock up on resources, and start bigger projects.
The Warehouse lets us store more stone, wood, and other resources without filling up.
In order to sustain a healthy and balanced economy, we need to have a growing population.
Well, that and a large town will certainly get more Imperial attention than a small town.
Sigh... Morgan, sometimes I'm not sure we ARE brothers from another mother after all.
Bigger houses can usually accommodate more workers.
Great work! The Emperor is going to be so proud of our little town!
It sounds like we need to start mining Iron as soon as possible. The closest Iron Deposit is to the east, but there are plenty of others around.
Make sure to place the Expansion so that you have access to the Iron Deposit.
Abbiamo bisogno di espanderci per avere acceso a nuove risorse.
L'Espansione della terra è nella sezione Espansione del Menu Costruzioni.
Try tapping on objects on the map - the info window will tell you what they are.
I can almost taste the Iron! So rusty...
but once we've got the Mine up and running, we can also use that Iron to build new guns and vehicles.
Floyd looks busy with... whatever Floyd does. We don't need to bother him. An Iron Mine is just like a Stone Quarry, right? How hard can it be?
L'imperatore ha bisogno di ferro per il suo progetto,
The Iron Mine is in the Resource category of the Build Menu.
Nice work - with this much Iron coming in, we can build more troops and vehicles.
Wait a minute, something's wrong! The Iron Mine is built, but I don't see any Haulers bringing Iron to the Depot. Ummm... any ideas?
Haulers need to carry resources to the Depot before we can use them.
Oh, THAT'S the problem! Each Resource Depot can only collect resources from a certain area around it. Must be some kinda union regulation or something.
Once we build a Depot close to the Iron Mine, the Haulers from the Depot will be able to collect the Iron. This should be easy!
Abbiamo solo bisogno di costruire un secondo deposito!
Make sure to build the Resource Depot close enough to the Iron Mine.
Boom! Now we're talking!
Hmm? Oh, this? Just adding another entire resource line to our economy, AND building another resource depot. You know. The usual.
What's all the commotion out here?
Hmm? Oh, this? Just adding another entire resource line to our economy, AND building another resource depot. You know. The usual.
With our recent expansion, we've grown to the point that one Bunker cannot possibly cover our entire base.
protecting the newest additions to our Outpost. I further propose that this Bunker be staffed by Perkins.
Signore ! Alcuni dei nostri edifici non sono protetti.
Propongo di costruire un secondo Bunker,
Wait, what?
Try to position the Bunker so that it covers as many buildings as possible.
Don't leave me alone out here!
Sir! I just wanted to mention that Perkins is fine. Everything is A-OK at the new Bunker. He doesn't need any help.
Sergeant, that's the exact opposite of what I asked you to say! I can't protect this place by myself! The more troops we assign to Bunkers, the better we can protect the Outpost.
Attacking well-defended bases can take several assaults.
Nothing says safety like a dozen men living in a single concrete room!
Remember how I suggested growing our base population? Yeah? Well, now we need more housing.
Bunkhouses are nice... for those of us who aren't officers, anyway. You and I will hold out for quality housing.
An officer never bunks with the men under his command.
I want a pool. We're in charge, right? Can I build a house with a swimming pool?
I've always liked the idea of shooting from behind cover.
Yeah, those guys are real tough, but the shield makes it hard for them to aim.
Riot Troopers are great at holding the front lines.
Never call a Riot Trooper a bullet sponge. It's hurtful.
What's a "Cannon Tower," Floyd?
Ah, you must've stumbled across the plans for my latest foray into military solutions using civilian engineering.
Does that mean it doesn't do any damage?
Quite to the contrary. It's a tower with a large cannon mounted on the top level. The structural support leaves something to be desired as it is still a prototype, but -
- but nothing. Sounds good to me. Let's set one up. Trial by fire!
Did that conversation just classify this outpost as a military-industrial complex?
OMG, it looks like one of those Raider Kids built that thing! Stick to civilian stuff from now on, Floyd.
As the Outpost grows, we'll need additional resources. Given our path toward Oil-based vehicles, I'd like to suggest we expand toward the Oil Field to the southwest.
Keep expansion on your mind. You don't want to need a resource and then have to wait.
Have you seen my milkshake? Morgan keeps drinking it.
Vegetable-based fuels can only take us so far. Literally. We need an Oil Pump!
Some resources are far from our starting borders. We'll need to keep expanding to reach everything that this land has to offer.
I was taking a stroll the other day and noticed Oil to the southwest of base.
Drill, baby, drill! Just be cautious of any surrounding wildlife. And the local ecosystem...
Another one of those Recon - uh - 'Tanks' that those Raider Kids found would be really useful against the Raiders.
Do you know how to build them? I want to lead some hit-and-run attacks against the Raiders' supply lines.
Yes! In fact, just the other day the kids earned their Firearms Machining - Level 1 merit badges. Just say when, and we'll build you another one of your tanks!
I've decided to call it a Tank from now on. As a soldier, I know there are some battles you just can't win.
Good. Now we can knock out their supply lines. I love special missions!
Good news first: we're on the Empire's radar! They're impressed with our recent growth.
Now for the bad news: I heard that two other Outposts in the area are almost as big as we are. Let's keep growing so we can find that Uranium - I want to get there first!
The more people, the more taxes, the more soldiers, the more workers, the more... Imperial prestige.
Maybe we should go and "help" some of those other Outposts.
Building a Gun Foundry is a serious feat of engineering. In order to support such large metal casting furnaces, we'll need to build the foundry out of reinforced concrete.
We've got plenty of stone - now we just need the heavy machinery to crush it, and mix it into Concrete for construction.
You can refine each of the raw resources you find out here into something more valuable.
With refined resources like Concrete, we can build even better stuff!
Floyd, let's get this Gun Foundry rolling! If the Imperial High Command isn't going to send us artillery, then I want to build our own as soon as we can!
The Gun Foundry is in the Military category of the Build Menu.
Let's take out this Warlord guy! There's no stopping us now!
We're finally ready to build Light Artillery! I can't wait to just kick back, relax, and lob exploding death at the Warlord's fortress.
Light Artillery is now available in the Vehicle Factory. This is going to be great!
You know what would be fun? Blowing up a whole lot of test dummies with Artillery!
We all know practice makes perfect, so I've had Perkins set us up a test dummy range for us to break in our new Light Artillery.
The artillery test range is ready - tap on the encounter to start!
Artillery is how the Empire conquered everyone except for the Mountain League that invented it.
Manichini d'Allenamento
Until we can get some decent rocket launchers up here, Ramsey has a proposal he'd like to share.
Um, I was just sayin' we should strap a big-ass gun to one of our Haulers and drive it to the battle lines.
It's brilliant! Can we do that, Captain? I told Zoey to add it to the menu at the Vehicle Factory.
Did Morgan refer to my vehicle production schedule as a 'menu'?
We think if you fire the gun and hit the brakes at the same time that you might do a wheelie! Or maybe you'll flip over. That would be so awesome!!!

Captain, for these final assaults against the Raiders, we should have the best of the best. With your permission, I'd like to personally see to training some Imperial Rangers. They're some of the toughest soldiers around!
Rangers are much tougher than regular Troopers, but take more time and money to train.
Nothing like a first battle to test our new Rangers. Let's get back to the fight!
Thought I'd drop by and share a discovery with you. One having to do with ancient weapons.
Ciao, avamposto imperiale.
I'm listening.
In this bag is a collection of rock sets that, when ignited with simple friction, generate enough force to penetrate tank armor.
Come again? And how is that a weapon?
The Ancients alternated mineral compounds from the opposing rock sets into the lining of every other one of the rifling grooves of a launch tube.
Any shell explosive could then be used as ammo with a simple fuse triggering travel of the projectile down the barrel and to the target. This works at limited range of course.
… and here I thought I was the one who went to a Military Academy.
If you follow my instructions, I can have you producing such weapons in a factory setting in no time.
How is the Emperor doing these days?
With great power comes great responsibility.
I don't know what to say but, thanks! Anything we can do to return the favor?
No thanks necessary. Staying here and keeping this outpost healthy is perhaps the most you could do for me right now.  It's nice to have a place to stop by so far north.
Tanks will require Steel. We can produce Steel using the Iron we're already harvesting, but we'll need... Coal... to complete the refinement process.
Coal is basically a dirtier form of dirt that catches fire. Unlike MOST of the bounty our natural world provides.
If there was ANY alternative to Coal, I assure you I'd find it.
If only I could somehow get the Boar fuel to burn hot enough, we'd be free from our need for this filthy Coal.
Now that we've blackened our hands, lungs, and souls with Coal, we can get down to business. Let's get this Steel Mill running!
Steel opens up more advanced building options, in addition to powerful armored units.
Fantastic! With our own Steel Mill, we're really turning into an impressive little town!
Now then, the final stage of the process!
I'll take it from here, Floyd. Now that we've got Steel comin' in, we need a place to work it into armor plates and such. I've got just the people to head up an operation like that.
Hey guys! Zoey taught us to weld! What shape do you want your tanks to be?
Tank shaped?
Armor has been a decisive factor in warfare since tribes began smelting copper and tin...
This is the moment we've all been waiting for. Let's get those tanks into production!
Just knowing we can produce tanks brings me back to my days in the Capital, watching the Armored Corps parade through Maximilian Square.
Hmmph. I was never invited to one of those. Too busy being shipped from one trench to another, all over the Continent for the glory of the Empire.
Hey, those parades are no picnic! You're up there for hours, and there's no place to go to the bathroom...
We're going to need at least one Light Tank, but feel free to build enough of them to support, say, a parade.
Our army meets all the requirements in the War Office's 'A Guide to Exterminating Indigenous Populations.' My dad would be so proud...
Captain, sir, I don't want to be a Negative Nelly or anything, but we should have a backup plan in case this goes badly, and we wind up running home with our tail between our legs.
If we build a Garrison and a Blockhouse, I'd feel a heck of a lot safer.
Non vorreste un posto sicuro dove ritirarvi?
A Garrison can hold more troops than a Bunker and has a wider defensive coverage radius. A Blockhouse is a small fortress.
I can breathe easy knowing Mr. Purrface is secure.
Between the Raider attacks, the wild animals, and the Imperial live fire battle exercises, we've got a lot of wounded soldiers.
and give them a place to recover. It won't be quite as fast as using Nanopods, of course.
Abbiamo bisogno di un ospedale.
Con un ospedale, possiamo salvare quelle truppe
Possiamo addirittura salvare le unità che richiedono Nanopod per essere addestrate.
Avoid the fruit cups.
If anyone gets hurt, just tap on the hospital to get started healing them.
Once we do, we can signal whether or not we want to participate in combat with other Imperial outposts.
Signore! Abbiamo bisogno di erigere la nostra Bandiera da Battaglia!
Cosa sarebbe questa bandiera di cui stai parlando?
To that end, remote outposts are encouraged to engage in live fire combat maneuvers, complete with resource collection.
Vede, l'Impero crede nell'essere costantemente pronti al combattimento.
That's insane!
Hai detto che l'impero vuole che attacchiamo altri avamposti?!
The policies of the Imperial Army have gotten a little... eccentric since General Ashe defected.
The Battle Readiness Flag can be found in the Build Menu in the Military category.
Let's get out there and show 'em what a real army looks like!
Whenever you're ready, you can tap the flag and enter the fray.
Andando in battaglia, possiamo guadagnare oro, risorse e XP.
We can also prove we're the toughest bunch of Imperials the Northern Frontier has ever seen!
I drew up six new plans for tanks we can build.
Ecco qui, Tenente!
Did I ask you to do that? What do we need six entirely new and unproven tank designs for?
Sei nuovi carri armati?
But I've been recovering in the field hospital for weeks! I got stir-crazy! And look how easy these designs are - they're all built using parts we already have!
Beh, non l'avevi chiesto...
Wait, why did you think we needed these three that have feet instead of treads? Seems like they'd be easy to trip up. And why is this one water-propelled?
Lasciami dare un'occhiata a questi...
We might need those. Okay, but what about the last one?! It's the easiest to make, and even you can see why it's useful, right? It's got HUGE honkin' machine guns!
Non lo saprai mai!
Let's see how hard it'll be to build this baby.
... Mi piace davvero quel tizio.
I can't wait to drive that thing.
Ahhh! It should beep when it backs up!
I inverted all the controls just so you don't forget which tank you're in.
Uh... thanks?
Bad guys!
Tenente!
Oh boy! Can I take Zoey's brand new Tempest to show them who's in charge?
convenient. Well, get on with it.
Sembrerebbe...
I just wanted to use it first for the new tank smell.
The new tank makes me feel inadequate.
The guns on this thing are awesome for suppressing large groups. And they also get a bunch of new holes.
Tempest Contro Predoni
So have you decided if you're going to help out with the Charity Drive yet?
I feel like we're gonna be a "maybe", but the kind of "maybe" that sorta means "no"?
Non sono nemmeno passati cinque secondi!
We try to encourage folks with some friendly competition. Biggest donor gets a prize.
I'm in.
What's the prize? Is it a tank? I love tanks.
Sometimes Morgan scares even me.
Everyone, I will have you know that winning the Annual Winter Jubilee Charity Drive takes precedent over rebels, raiders, and especially romantic interests.
I'm looking at you, Ramsey.
...I don't know what you're talking about.
We gotta give those kids somethin' to look forward to!
...Who said anything about kids?
This is about winning!
Qua si parla di SCHIACCIARE LA RESISTENZA.
We'll all work as a team to donate to the Charity Drive. Of course, I'll keep all the winning proceeds.
Floyd, I'll need you to start manufacturing toys instead of valuable household supplies from the recycling plant.
Perkins, I want you to go steal toys from more affluent children.
Isn't that kind of defeating the purpose?
If they really deserve them, they'll get them back from the charity!
OH. That makes sense. I guess.
Does it?
Let's win the charity drive! I want to bask in glory!
Do not touch my spoils of war.
Morgan, you helpin' out these kids for the holidays… Well, I don't want to say it surprises me.
Okay, it surprises the hell out of me.
Yeah, yeah. Did we win or not?
The Outpost has managed to collect the most donations in living history.
Those kids are going to be so happy!
I'd like to present to you these nanopods as a prize.
Tradition is, folks just donate 'em right back. It's really more a formality than anything else–
–No! This is my victory! These are my trophies!
It's that time of year, Morgan.
I already had my yearly Empire intravenous diseases check. I'm clean!
I didn't really need to know that.
But no, the Annual Winter Jubilee Charity Drive for Children is startin' up, and figured you folks might want to chip in.
That sounds like a great idea! Always willin' to help out the kids.
I'll need some time to think about it.
Charity? I worked hard for everything that the government handed to me for free.
I see you haven't built your Hall of Remembrance yet.
Sheriff Colt, you have got to stop coming into the Outpost and saying crazy people things, and then expect me to understand what you're talking about.
Do you Imperials really not celebrate Remembrance? Every year, you get to build a big hall for talking and drinking. You remember the good and the bad times you had. Gets it outta your system.
Well thanks for the backstory, but we're not interested.
I'm not an expert in psychology–
So I'm sure you're about to share your opinion in the matter.
But perhaps a modicum of catharsis could alleviate some mental duress? I'm sure the troops would welcome a chance to relax, celebrate, and grieve?
I wouldn't mind a pint, either.
Sure, let me just allocate a bunch of resources to a useless holiday...Again.
I like…beer?
Floyd, this bar is not fully stocked.
Seems adequate to me.
And the troops are enjoyin' themselves. We even got to talkin' and laughin' 'bout that one time it was Private Johnny's 19th birthday and he rolled a tank into a sandworm pit.
'Course after that everyone got real quiet.
Where is the vintage bordeaux? The anisette? Pre-phylloxera cognac?!
Non posso ancora crederci.
Sir, what is.. Lieutenant Whiskey?

Oh man, I can't believe you guys never heard of Celebratory Lieutenant Remembrance Whiskey. Yeah, every Remembrance the Lieutenant gets his own batch of fine malt whiskey. Look it up. It's in the rulebook or something.
Once you get the whiskey, THEN I'll go inside the Remembrance Hall.
Err… we'll get right on that.
I'll never get used to the military. Things are weird here.
I'm not crying...
Well, it's no pre-revolution Brandy, but I can deal with this.
Don't it make you think of better times?
Zoey, I am not falling for that.
Sir, I'd like to propose a toast. To the Captain, and to your great work as Lieutenant! We couldn't have done it without you!
You better not make me cry.
Oh damn it, If I cry I am charging you all with insubordination!
Morgan, don't'cha think it would do some good to come inside the Remembrance Hall and have some fun with us?
Fun? The bar is understocked, the bathrooms aren't up to code, and someone let their pet raptor loose in the halls. How do you EXPECT ME TO HAVE FUN?
Just seems like it might do yah some good to talk about the year and share a drink with your friends.
I am perfectly fine inspecting the buttons of my jacket, thank you.
Floyd, we gotta get him in here. He's all emotionally repressed and everythin'.
I am NOT stepping foot in there until they upgrade the bar.
If Sheriff Colt can make stuff up, then so can I.
How do yah like the improvements we did on the Remembrance Hall?
Sure, it's fine, whatever, but where is my Celebratory Lieutenant Remembrance Whiskey?
The… what?
Ah, it's a beautiful day in the neighborhood...
Storm clouds worry the sun's yearnings.
Aaagh! Wh-what the...?! How did you get into...?
Shadows slip underfoot, unbidden, untamed. Would you hold the night?
Lady, I have no idea what you're saying. And if you think I...
Uh, Morgan? Who're you talking to?
I'm talking to... Hey, where'd she go? And where'd those Raiders come from? … Wait, Raiders?! Sound the alarm!
How do these guys stab tanks, anyway?
I'll show them… I'll show them all!
SHE let them in! I know she did!
Uh, Zoey, who's Morgan talking about?
I don't know... Maybe it's some kind of heat hallucination thing...?
No! This isn't like that time with the purple mammoths! I *saw* her! She was *here*!
Look, Morgan, I'm not saying I don't believe you...
She was here! She spoke like a fortune cookie! I *talked* to her!  How else do you think those Raiders got in to attack us?
We've searched all over the outpost, but found no sign of her. I'm forced to conclude that you simply imagined the whole—
Those with their heads in the clouds cannot see their feet.
Yikes!
Holy...! How did she get past...?  Hey! She's getting away! After her!!
It's rude to say I told you so, but I did. And am.
Sheesh! This place is well-hidden! I don't think we ever would've suspected it was here if we weren't following her!
That's what's bothering me. She slipped into our outpost so easily.  Couldn't she have evaded us just as easily?  Unless...
It's a trap.  And we just fell into it.  Again.  Swell.
We should really start looking before we leap...
Raider Chick, wherever you are, we'll be back!
Wait, this can't be all of them! Where are the others?  Where'd the crazy Raider chick go?
If I had to guess, I'd say they're hiding.  They seem to be good at that.
Damn! We need another approach!  Back to the outpost!  We'll ask Taos if he knows what's going on.
How to detect the path of Blades in Moonlight? That will be... difficult at best. No human can hope to match her stealth. That is why she is one of Gantas' lieutenants.
There's GOT to be a way. It's not like she's invisible. We just have no idea where she is or where she goes.
Well, Floyd and I have been talking...
On second thought, I think I like being alive better...

Wait, hear us out! We believe that the key to their stealth is shadow. Even at the sun's zenith, there are always *some* shadows cast.  It seems Blades in Moonlight can hide even in the smallest spot of shadow.
We think our best chance is to just get rid of the shadows!  If we created a series of mirrors and set them up around her outpost, we could reflect light all over the place! Poof! No more dark!
That sounds... non-lethal.  Do it!
Make 'em shiny enough to see in!
This IS a nice mirror... And I need a haircut.
Perfect! I've already mapped out the four focal points around Blades in Moonlight's camp. Once we get them in place, there will be nowhere for her to hide!
Will the mirrors also interpret what she's saying? Then it'd be perfect.
Looks like those mirrors are working! I can actually see people in Blades' outpost now!
By the way, Ramsey, who was right about a "nonexistent" Raider woman sneaking into our outpost?
*sigh* You. So please don't do your "I Told You So" speech again.
But everyone loves the "I Told You So" speech!  Oh, don't be so grumpy, Ramsey. At least now Ms. Crazy Blades can't sneak up on us again...
The mighty oak falls at the jaws of the humble termite.
Arrrgh! Not again!  That's it, sister, you're going DOWN!
All those knives make me nervous.
Let's get back while there's something to save.
That was easier than I thought it'd be.
Too easy.  Especially since she escaped us so quickly.  It was almost like she was...
Sirs! You have to come back to the outpost right away! The Raiders just set it on fire!
… a distraction.
Whew! Th-the fire's finally out, sir!
Barely adequate work, Perkins. The rest of you: how exactly did this happen?
It was just like last time! They just snuck in right past our defenses!
That's it, I've had it! If Crazy Blades wants to play this game, we'll play it! We'll make this place so unfriendly that no one will be able to step foot in it without getting it hacked off!
I don't want an ant to pass through without getting shot!
I kinda like it this way...
Ah, sir... One of the turrets almost pumped me full of lead...
Good, good! That means the new defenses are working! Let's see Crazy Blades sabotage us NOW!
But we can't work under these conditions!
But Crazy Blades will be stymied!  That's the important part!
Y'know, maybe Crazy Blades has the right idea.  We need to strike at her outpost the way she's struck at ours.
Huh, that's a good plan.  I guess hatred really does bring out the best in some people...
I'll ignore the implications of that for now.  The question is, how do we hurt her the most?

Well, as you pointed out, they use a lot of knives, and it looks like this group makes their own.  They use a lot of fuel to run their metalworks.  If we cut off that fuel supply, we can put a big hurt on their weapon supply too.
Why do they need so many new knives?
Take your koans and shove it!
The kitten hisses at the mammoth, demanding passage.
Hah! You're frustrated, aren't you! In your FACE, Crazy Blades!
That's our Morgan for you: always gracious in victory.
This is it, men! We're about to fight another of Gantas' lieutenants!
Hopefully the last!
Fists flex to crush the boulder. The boulder cares not.
Morgan raises his pistol, takes down annoying Raider woman!
The sunning lizard listens not to the poet.
I hope Gantas gets the message.
Even the thirsty boar cannot swallow the lake.
I have no idea what you just said, and I don't care. You've lost! Get out, and never come back!
When the sun rises, does the day last forever?
Okay, I think I got that one... And I wish I didn't.
HELP!!!
I'll be in my tent.
No, please! Warlord Gantas' men are after us! Help!
Wait, so you led them here? Wonderful.
Please hurry!
I was hoping I wouldn't ever have to see this place again.
Since when do you guys fight each other?
You took Warlord Gantas' totem and then some people started saying that he couldn't protect the holy site and he should step down and now a bunch of the grown-ups are fighting! Help us, please!
Wait... totem? Holy site? Are you saying that place we attacked wasn't your village?
No - that's our Sanctuary. Only a few of us live there, and now Gantas and his warriors are attacking!
Predoni VS Predoni Bambini
Elder Taos! We brought help!
Help? You bring the source of chaos itself!
You dare impugn the actions of the Empire? No, you know what, that's fair.

Your actions have caused great upheaval. Warlord Gantas has long been a cruel tyrant. When you took his totem, it was the first sign of weakness any of us had seen. There were murmurs of dissent, but Gantas responded with greater cruelty.
You know, Lieutenant, it sounds like this whole situation is a box of powder just about to blow.
And I feel an awful lot like a spark.
Sounds like these Raiders might just take care of each other for us...
A civil war might be kind of a nice change of pace from the Rebellion we've been fighting for the last 10 years.
You have joined together now - this was wise. But you will die alone, broken against the walls of my fortress. BWAHAHA!
So, you have chosen a path for all of us.
What do you mean? Aren't you guys going to rise up and crush your oppressor?
You have created uncertainty in the people. Some will abandon Warlord Gantas, but not all. Until you crush him, utterly, many raiders will call him leader.
Sounds like we're just getting started, sir.
We can lead you back to his base if you want. It's not far from here but would be hidden to someone who didn't know where to look.
I recommend a scout mission, sir. We can get an idea of what we're up against.
Hmm. Sure - why not? Another opportunity for us to get our money's worth out of that Recon Vehicle.
Predoni di Gantas
Villaggio dei Predoni
Villaggio dei Predoni
I demand to face him!
Dov'è quello chiamato Morgan?
You mean Lieutenant Morgan? That's him there!
Morgan?
Remind me to come up with some ways to punish you. Actually, you come up with them, and get me a list.
Che diavolo, Perkins?
Si, signore. Scusi, signore.
I have asked the most beautiful woman in my tribe to join her life to mine. But Yenkcha has said that ever since you came to her defense at Elder Taos' Sanctuary Village, her path is yours.
Basta parlare!
Also, seriously, Yenkcha? That name is terrible.
Non ho idea di che cosa tu stia parlando.
My honor must be satisfied!
Come osi!
Maybe if I shoot him a few times, he'll go away.
What kind of name is Yenkcha?
You fight well, Morgan. I see why Yenkcha has chosen you. Know this: I will not be the last to challenge you for her hand.
Cedo!
Well, that's just SUPER.
I demand to face the Skinny Beast!
Sono venuto per Morgan!
Is that what you guys are calling me?
Bestia Ossuta?
Quindi sei tu Morgan!
No! Aspetta...accidenti. Si.
My Chosen is Yenkcha, the great beauty and-
Io sono in missione d'amore!
Look, I don't know who she is, but if you need me to shoot you or whatever, let's get it over with.
Oh, di nuovo questo. Giusto.
This should be over quick.
Yenkcha. It sounds like someone holding in a sneeze.
So, Yenkcha's beloved Morgan has fought for her hand again.
Benvenuto!
I fought for peace and quiet.
Cosa? No, non l'ho fatto.
Portami Morgan!
Oh ragazzi, di nuovo?
You know why I have come?
Bestia Scheletrica!
and you think I care for some reason. Let's get this over with.
Si, tu vuoi sposare Yenkcha,
È uomo di valore colui che affronta così la propria morte!
I'd have said fool.
Davvero?
Like this guy would ever stand a chance with Yenkcha.
This reminds me to never save strangers, ever.
please tell Yenkcha thanks for the guys trying to murder me and all, but I'm not interested.
Quando arrivi a casa,
Nella nostra tribù, una donna può scegliere chi le pare.
but where does that leave me?
Beh, sono contento che tu sia di così ampie vedute,
Where is the Skinny Beast!
Dov'é?!
É quel tizio là con il caschetto.
Morgan, tell him it's not me!
Cosa? No!
Mi dispiace, MORGAN, non posso mentire a quest'uomo.
and more infirm than I had been led to believe.
La Bestia Scheletrica è piú vecchia
Come osi! Non sono mai stato meglio in vita mia!
Sorry, Floyd. I'm busy... thinking of... a lie. Damn.
I can't believe Morgan did that! Wait, no, I can.
You would make Yenkcha a good match.
Sei più arzillo del previsto.
Io ti... ehm... ringrazio?
you told that Raider I was you, and he tried to murder me?
Morgan, ricordi quando
Wait, I mean... Sorry.
Si, è stato piuttosto divertente.
Anyway, I'd like you to meet my friend. This is Tobor. Tobor, this is the Skinny Beast.
Nessun rancore.
Tu morirai!
Fantastico. Grazie, Floyd.
Sto solo facendo la mia parte!
Revenge is a dish best set on fire by a Raider.
Yenkcha's attracting some pretty dangerous attention lately.
How will I face the tribe? How will Yenkcha see me?
Mi vergogno.
You can't, right? Admit it.
Puoi seriamente distinguere l'uno dall'altro?
Bestia Scheletrica! Ti sfido!
How was the walk?
Mi stavo chiedendo quando saresti arrivato.
uneventful.
Il viaggio è stato...
Say, I'm gonna step inside and mix up an Old Fashioned. Do you want one? I had the cherries shipped in from Cariston.
È carino.
Cos'é... vecchio stile?

Some say you need to dissolve the sugar with bitters and a little water... but personally? I think simple syrup gets the job done perfectly well. Now, adding soda water, that is a travesty. If you ask me-
Allora...
Hai superato il limite! Ti sfido.
I can't believe this guy turned down an Old Fashioned in favor of me shooting him.
Getting the orange zest just right is an art.
are they the source of the Skinny Beast's strength?
Questi fuori moda...
Sì.
Your "Old Fashioneds" will not save you!
Bestia Scheletrica! Battiti!
Anyway, I've been working on falernum lately.
Oh, son finite le ciliegie.
Insensibile alle fiammate?
You macerate some anise, cloves, and lime zest, then you add it to rum. Strain that the next day, then add citrus and simple syrup and let the flavors marry-
È un tipo di liquore.
I will marry Yenkcha! You will not stand in our way!
Sposarsi! Si! Questa è la tua parola.
You found me!
Non starò vicino alla tua strada!
You want four parts dark rum to one part light rum when making falernum.
He is. He's the weird one.
Who brings a knife to a gun fight and then is still really scary? It's weird.
Accoltellamento? Sul serio?
No, TU sei strano.
Sta' zitto, tu lo sei.
You are.
to find me a suitable woman. One with beauty that shines above all others. They have found her.
Ho impartito ordini ai miei uomini
Oh no, non anche tu!
Yenkcha has won my heart. I will do as she has asked, and challenge you.
Davvero, "Bestia Ossuta"
going to come challenge me over her? This is absurd. I DON'T EVEN KNOW WHO SHE IS.
Scherzi a parte, qualcuno di voi non è
and you know how much I will enjoy this.
Ma sai chi sono,
Next Sheriff Colt'll tell me HE'S in love with her.
Maybe I should, like, try to find her and tell her I'm not interested?
When next we meet, I plan to even the playing field.
Sei vivo solo perché combatto alle condizioni di Yenkcha.
We'll see who gets their way.
Beh, ho intenzione di farti saltare in aria con un carro armato.
Dov'è quello chiamato Morgan!
Wow, another one?
She is the most beautiful of all my tribe, but she refuses-
Vorrei passare la mia vita con Yenkcha!
You want to get with Yenkcha, and you can't because one time she saw me and, understandably, she's still madly in love.
Senti, conosco il patto.
Ti distruggerò e le proverò il mio valore!
but it hasn't worked out for the other guys.
Siete invitati a provare,
Altri ragazzi?
This one looks pretty big. Are we sure I can't have backup?
I'm starting to wish I had the slightest idea who Yenkcha is.
Sappi che non sarò l'ultimo a-
I know the drill by now.
Ehi, sul serio?! Sei il nono.
There's a bee in my tent, and I know you're allergic or whatever, but I want you to catch it and release it humanely.
Perkins!
Skinny Beast! Your life path is ending!
You're not Perkins.
I am the shape of your death!
When I was a kid, an old mountain woman told me my death would be equine related.
The old mountain woman knows nothing!
Seriously, I don't like horses. They're weird.
See, you totally rode the wrong thing. My fated death is supposed to involve horses.
Then I will find some horses and I will come back for you!
No, don't. Don't do that.
Imperial, I seek the one called Morgan and Skinny Beast.
Morgan! Another one of them raiders came to get all shot up!
Oh, you mistake my intentions, small one. I do not yearn for Yenkcha. I am happily bonded. I wish to make Morgan an offer.
As long as the offer isn't "bullets in my body", I'm willing to listen.

As your legend grows, more and more of my brothers will make the journey to challenge you. I wish to build a place of rest on the road they take. I will sell food and water, and rent beds to those who wish to earn Yenkcha's hand.
What do you need from me?
I will need some supplies and resources to begin my journey. If you give me aid, I will share my profits with you.
Finally, being the best at everything is paying off!
They could visit that lake we have. Go swimming.
To our continued success!
Indeed! May the people of my tribe hunt for you ceaselessly!
Or not! They could just come say hi or whatever.
La Bestia Ossuta farà-
Morgan! One of those Outcasts is here to shoot you.
Man, Yenkcha's not going to give an Outcast the time of day. What a sap.
Indeed. It seems unlikely that even defeating you in combat would overcome the outgroup status. While the caste systems of Raiders are poorly understood, it seems clearly the Outcasts—
Sono proprio qui!
Oh, right. Let's go get you shot so Floyd and I can finish talking.
I will do the shooting!
I would prefer not to be shot again.
You fight well, Skinny Beast. I see why Yenkcha—
I mean, let's say my gun jammed or something, and he DID beat me. There's no way Yenkcha would have married him. Some other Raider would have shot him in the face like the next day.
I don't think that—

I can't help but wonder though, would being defeated by one of such low status do damage to your legend, and in turn have a negative impact on Yenkcha's standing in the tribe? Damaged goods, as it were?
No! You do not—
Please, grownups are talking. Scoot.
And for my birthday, all I desire is a gift that will unify and inspire each and every one of you: a giant statue of me!
I have asked High Command to calculate how much Stone each town and outpost will be required to contribute to this noble effort.
Miei indolenti cittadini, oggi compio 26 anni e mezzo.
Let's deliver the Stone faster than anyone else. We don't want High Command to forget about me - I mean us. I'll even contribute some Nanopods to the cause.
Dico che dobbiamo prendere in considerazione di presentarci agli altri avamposti.
Once we have enough Stone, tap the Give button in this window to complete the objective!
We got that done in record time! And judging from the reward, it looks like High Command noticed our efforts. The Emperor is an amazing guy...
Hey, Captain! I'm pickin' up a broadcast from the Capital!

My most euphistic citizens - as the 2nd and 5th Corps of the Imperial Army push into the southeast where rebel activity is the strongest, we make a call for celebration in their honor. The Empire will hold a great feast!
In order to support the incredible size and scope of the feast these brave boys deserve, we call on all loyal citizens of the Empire to give what you can to shore up our reserves.

While it is unfortunately impossible for the brave souls we are celebrating to actually be physically present for the feast, we have hired the finest food photographers to ensure that the grandeur is not lost on them completely.
Aww, kinda makes you feel all warm and fuzzy.
Gin.
Sai cosa mi fa sentire caldo e confuso?
We might need to build more farms.
I sure hope this stuff doesn't spoil. I don't see rotten Buddha Hand currying much favor with High Command.
Shh! An Imperial signal is coming through!
As you know, throughout our Empire we have countless research projects working on glorious new ways to crush the Rebels.

Our secret research project at Blackish Butte has been SO successful that we have decided to ratchet back their progress. This "quantitative easing" will be accomplished through a combination of huge piles of wood and several gallons of lighter fluid.
Thank you again for your unquestioning service, and for not venturing within 100 miles of Blackish Butte until further notice.
Vi saluto, miei cittadini più enigmatici!
I always say, have patience. Or just use Nanopods. You know. Whatever.
Wait... the shipping address says "Attn: Imperial Scientific Recovery Ops." Isn't that where she's assigned...? Ahem. Never mind.
Hey, the Emperor is on the radio again!

Salutations, my abstruse peoples! The Republic of Kalakuri has erected an Iron column 400 feet tall. My subjects, I know what you're thinking, but will say it anyway: we must build an Iron column 401 feet tall!
Everyone will take part in this effort. I will personally hire the design team AND choose the shape of the column. All of you will contribute the Iron necessary for its construction.
It will be hard, but in the end, the Republic's pride will turn to shame as they gaze with envy upon our irony monument. These orders are to be carried out with the greatest of haste.
OK - so everyone heard that loud and clear. Take-aways: We're all helping build an Iron column bigger than the other guy's. Wait - do we even have Iron?
I'm sure you can track down some Iron near our Outpost.
Man, the Empire sure is... what's a less insubordinate word for 'needy'?
Captain, we've got a special broadcast from the Empire!

My orotund subjects, I have glorious news! Imperial forces in the southeast have cornered the traitorous General Ashe and his Rebels in the Jungle of Harmath. By hiding there, the Rebels gave us no choice but to burn them out.
Our Flame Troopers began a coordinated assault of controlled fires that went out of control through no fault of their own. The jungle has been completely incinerated, and the locals are upset.

Though I'm 99% sure they understand it's the Rebels' fault and not ours, the Empire requires supplies from each outpost to replace the jungle with fake trees, and prevent the 1% chance this turns into another rebellion.
OK, you heard His Imperial Highness - let's make some fake trees!
I not only think we will tamper with Mother Nature, I think she wants us to.
We're not thinking of "gluing" leafy vegetables to raw wood in order to...?! Never mind. I'm pretending I didn't see that.

It's getting pretty crowded around here. Any chance you civilians would be willing to approve a Land Expansion? It would be really nice to get the shooting range at our Barracks away from heavily trafficked areas.
Ehi, Floyd?
Hmm… It's a bit earlier than I expected, but I suppose I could bend a few rules.
I get the feeling he made up the rules in the first place.
I suppose I'll take it. He DID call dibs.
Cool, thanks Floyd. I CALL DIBS ON THE NEW LAND.
Wha…! Morgan, you can't call dibs, that land is for everyone on the Outpost!
Fine, you guys can use it, but don't forget, it's totally mine and I called it.
Weren't you going to move the Barracks to the new, open space? Wasn't that the whole point of this?
Morgan?

Well, I was, but it turns out once one of the civilians got shot, everyone started going the long way around and leaving the Barracks alone. Now Ramsey and I are gonna use the open space to ride dirt bikes.
Morgan. Move. The. BARRACKS.
Jeez, fine.
They… they went without me.
Floyd! Floyd? Hey, Zoey, where's Floyd? I wanted to make a big deal and pout about how he made me do my job.
Ecco Floyd! L'abbiamo spostata!
Aw, he and Ramsey are off ridin' dirt bikes in all the new empty space.
Floyd?
Earn enough XP, and the Outpost will level up, unlocking better buildings and troops.
Dalle fattorie si ottengono i raccolti. I raccolti ci fanno guadagnare XP e Oro.
Farms grow crops, which earn us XP and Gold. Earn XP to level up and unlock better buildings and troops!
Excellent! Remember, planting crops is a great way to level up and earn Gold!
Piantiamo in terra ancora qualche seme!

D'accordo, avrà un po' più di sporcizia e di vermi rispetto al cavolo che trovi in città. E sì, magari è leggermente appassito. Ma non importa - questo cavolo è il frutto delle nostre fatiche! Ehm... la verdura. La verdura delle nostre fatiche.
Non fermatevi adesso!
These veggies give more than just the satisfaction of getting the job done. They also earn us Gold and XP!
Haha! Wonderful! I'm SURE artichokes are supposed to be this color!
Let's plant some Daikon! I'm not even sure what that is, but it's going to be great! Can you make it into a stew? The boys of the 95th would love that!
The seed packet says Daikon is a type of radish, and that it is poor at supporting life!
Wow! That's quite the reward! Thanks for sticking with me to the end!
Once Gantas organizes all the Raiders, there's no way we can stop them. We have to strike first, but how can we get past those super-mortars? What would General Ashe do?
Non abbiamo più tempo!
Hang on a sec. Raider weapons all still use gunpowder, right? Firing those big mortars must use a TON of the stuff...
They must, you're right! If we can blow up their ammunition stores, we might be able to neutralize the mortars without a fight. A mortar without gunpowder is just a ball in a cup!
I'll start workin' on a remote detonation device!
Wait - it's a big shed full of explosives. Can't we just shoot it, or something...? Zoey?
I'll just whip up a Remote Detonator at my Tool Shop!
Careful you don't set that off by accident now.
All done! The Kids and I whipped up a Remote Detonator to blow up the Raiders' Ammo Dump from a safe distance.
That all sounds great, but we still haven't figured out how we're even going to get into their fortress.
What about us?
Are you KIDDING me? There is no WAY I am leaving this in your hands!
No, I mean our clan. Your alliance with Elder Taos. We might be able to sneak in again!
They'll have stepped up patrols, but if we can pull off some kind of distraction, draw their attention to bait...
Perkins! It's special mission time!

Your mission is to attack the fortress' front gate. Remember - you're the DISTRACTION. You have to convince the Raiders that you are the real threat, but try not to get everyone killed in the process.
Ok, Perkins sei responsabile dei nostri carri.
Tank detachment, ROLL OUT!
Capito, sergente!
It'll be enough to let you guys slip through the back. I hope. Perkins out! *gulp*
Va bene -Tengo occupati i Predoni ai cancelli frontali.
La Distrazione di Perkins
With Perkins at the front lines assaulting Gantas' base with all those tanks, Gantas is sure to counterattack.
But we have all these tanks! What's he going to do? Attack the outpost? It's so far awa... oh. Crap. He's probably going to do that.
Fighting a war on two fronts is always a bad idea, but he probably thinks we've mustered all our forces here, and he'll try to ravage our home territory with any warriors he has left.
Questo è quello che farei.
Don't let the Raiders break any of my stuff.
Maybe I shouldn't have made fun of them.
You've finally done it. Now you're going to find out what the strongest Raiders in Warlord Gantas' command do when we turn our attention to your home.
Imperiali!
We will fall on you like hot rain, melting, melting.
Ti ammazzerò di botte!
Prepare your people for an unending torrent of suffering and war!
I don't think there's a way to prepare for that. I think you probably just have to take it as it comes.
From this moment, the war comes home.
Ridi adesso, cane!
thanks for volunteering for this mission.
Taos l'Anziano...
We do this to ensure our clan's survival.

Once inside, we silence the guards and open the side gate for the Imperial soldiers. If Morgan and his men have done their part, Gantas' thugs will be so distracted at the front gate that we will be as shadows in the distance.
Non credo che siamo amici.
Guerrieri, ricordate il piano.
Unless they turn on us, and join up with Gantas.
Ci vediamo dentro...
I don't trust these guys...
I'd prefer a straight fight to this sneaking around.
Today you have learned the final and greatest truth of the Raider: that ultimate mastering comes not from noise, but from silence.
Sono fiero di voi, figli miei.
Not a single guard escaped to raise the alarm.
Um, ok! Ottimo lavoro amici Predoni!
Our hopes now rest with you. Much as it disturbs me, my clan is depending on you.
Abbiamo reso sicuro l'accesso, Imperiali.
L'Infiltrazione di Taos
Hey, did we set up our defenses back at the base before we came out here?
And by we, I mean you, Ramsey. We need to be prepared in case these Raiders figure out that we didn't leave a single ranking officer to hold down the fort.
Mi sembra di aver dimenticato qualcosa.
Se non lo abbiamo fatto, avremmo dovuto.
Even putting Perkins in charge would have been a better idea.
Aspetta, non abbiamo lasciato nessuno la?
Maybe we could put some training dummies out and make them look like they're running drills. That might fool these natives.
Magari lasciare le luci accese?
Pillboxes, bunkers, who cares? I don't. Just build SOMETHING and put some guys in it.
Thanks for organizing the defense effort, Captain! I clearly wasn't going to do it without you.
Seeing everything bathed in that warm, safe, blue light will just make my day. I can't wait.
but garrisoning your troops is extremely important. Reference page 1451 of the Empire's military command readiness manual. I keep section 32 bookmarked with a picture of Mr. Purrface.
they'll have to go through our garrisons. According to the manual, for a base the size of ours, you need at least 40 troops garrisoned in Bunkers and... Garrisons.
Non c'e' bisogno di parlare di questo,
Se qualcuno vuole arrivare a noi,
One Bunker can only hold so many troops. You don't want to put all 40 of them into one Bunker... trust me.
If you want to brush up any more on the command readiness manual, I have some flash cards in my bunk.
Couldn't have done it better myself, Captain. Not that I would ever overstep my bounds like that, sir!
All right, guys - we're in. Now where's this ammo storage?
The Raiders are rather primitive, but that just makes their civic infrastructure all the more obvious. According to the layout of their roads, I suspect it is to the north.
I think it's over there, to the south.
Either way we choose, let's try to keep it quiet.
I knew I was right about the direction.
Oh - there's the ammo dump! Uh oh...
That's a hella lotta Raiders guarding the ammo dump.
See, this is why I don't go in for plans.

Get Zoey on the radio... If we can't get into the ammo stores, maybe she can tell us how to blow up their gas main...? Or overload their power lines? Damn you Raiders and your primitivity! You are impervious to my high-tech trickery!
She says she has an idea, and to hold on a sec.
Hold on! She's kidding, right?
Morgan! There are a couple of Raiders coming up right behind us!
Whoa! Guys, it's me and Elder Taos! One of his warriors let me borrow an outfit!
Zoey - you said you had a plan?
Yeah! So we don't need to actually get INTO the ammo stores. All we need to do is get into their ammo!
They must have runners bringing the mortar shells to the front...
If you can get me one of those shells, I can rig it with this remote detonator!
There are the ammunition runners right now. The rest of you, slip away! We must take them out - quietly!
Silence is essential!
All right, folks, let's hope this works!
Bombardare i rifornitori
Floyd, cosa stai fissando?
Such majestic creatures... it's not right!
Sono i mammut, Morgan. Rinchiusi in quel modo nel recinto.
You can liberate mother nature some other time.
Ehi, amico, calmati. Siamo in missione segreta.
you're right, Morgan, this can't wait!
Liberare madre natura...
hey, where are you going! Get back here!
Letteralmente è l'esatto opposto di...
Justice is on my side!
I am Floyd the liberator and I am enjoying this!
Be free, magnificent creatures! Wait... my tranquilizer gun versus these padlocks could be interesting... Aha! There we go!
Finalmente!
Guardie dell'allevamento dei Mammut
Ehi, cosa stai facendo?
Io sono un giusto liberatore! Siete stati giudicati!
I said... justice is on my side!
Whew! I feel better.
Floyd! Allontanati da quei mammut! Ti uccideranno!
We- oh lord, that one nearly crushed my foot. I should probably get moving.
No, Morgan, abbiamo una connessione.
Zoey here. All set. Elder Taos and I will deliver the rigged explosive.
Perkins - do you read me? Get ready to make another push on the gates.
Loud and clear, but are you sure, sir? Those Bombardment Cannons are pounding us!
You let Zoey worry about that.
Trust me!
Bombarde
Perkins, vai! Colpiscili ora!
Are you saying "eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee"?
Signore! Non la sento!
Go now! Move out!
Dannazione, Perkins!
I'm hoping that's what you'd want. Perkins out!
Signore, ho intenzione di andare avanti e attaccare!
Well, I've trusted all our lives to Perkins. Sorry, everyone.
Zoey took care of the Bombards! Move in before they can regroup!
Let's move in, troops!
Zoey is hit!! I've got to get her outta the line of fire. Oh no, oh no - there are still so many things I wanted us to build together... so much to retro-engineer...
Oh no... Morgan!
Snap out of it and carry her back behind our lines!
Floyd!
Come on... Old Painless is waiting!
Tempo di vendetta! Fatevi sotto, Predoni...
Let's get a move on!
Can't stop now! The Raiders are right behind me!
Woot! Nothing like being an army of one! Even if I go down, I did it for you, Zoey!
Elder Taos and Zoey are with us.
Ramsey! Qui!
You found Floyd?
just kinda nuts. Oh hell, look who's coming.
Sì, sta bene,
It's so good to see you! It was a heck of a fight back there!
Signori!
Where the hell have you been?
Perkins!
there were these huge cannons, and the Raiders kept-
Beh, come stavo dicendo, Signore,
Remind me to demote you when we get back to the outpost.
Aspetta, ho deciso che non mi interessa.
Yes, sir.
I don't know if any of you have noticed, but Zoey is bleeding, and we're still in a war zone.
Floyd, you stay with Zoey and take care of the bleeding. We'll hold off the Raiders.
Let's bring this place down!
Maybe I shouldn't have made fun of them.
You've finally done it. Now you're going to find out what the strongest Raiders in Warlord Gantas' command do when we turn our attention to your home.
Imperiali!
We will fall on you like hot rain, melting, melting.
Ti ammazzerò di botte!
Prepare your people for an unending torrent of suffering and war!
I don't think there's a way to prepare for that. I think you probably just have to take it as it comes.
From this moment, the war comes home.
Ridi adesso, cane!
Orda di Predoni
All right, guys, no officer ever wants to make a speech like this, but things look bleak. Without reinforcements, the odds of us getting out of here alive are slim.
I wouldn't say that.
We brought help!
I was worried you boys had gotten yourselves into trouble. Again.
Ramsey, tutto ok?
We might just pull this off!
Maledizione!
Man, those guys totally ruined my speech.
Wait, who is Karo?
Are you okay?!
Zoey!
I'm gonna be fine. Now just what in heck are you three doing here? I specifically told you that this was for grown-ups!
But... we went and got other grown-ups to come help and it was Karo's idea and we finished our chores first.
Zoey, these kids did save us - don't be too hard on them.
Well, I've still got to think on it, but ya'll might be grounded.
Orda di Predoni - Round 2!
we've broken down their defenses. What now?
Beh, signori,
Andiamo a casa?
We've gotten the doors open, but we still need to finish the job.
Non ancora, Floyd.
Where do we start?
We can attack the fortress bit by bit, taking it out systematically, or just start shooting and clean up later.
Lasciamolo decidere al capitano.
Start attacking just about anything, and I'll have further advice.
Burn it down and salt the earth.
We can stomp out future Raider hostilities by destroying these Camps now.
Campi di addestramento, eh?
The last thing we need is angry survivors with training.
The best defense is not letting them train more.
That's the last of their training camps! Well done, troops!
I'm pretty sure Floyd more or less-
L'allevamento dei Mammut?
We will make it clear to every Raider in this land. Never. Again.
Distruggeremo i simboli dell'oppressione!
We must avenge the mistreatment of these gentle souls.
Well, I certainly feel good about that.
Now, our brother, the mammoth, is avenged.
If you leave any of the warrior's tents standing, it will be seen as a sign of weakness. We must make sure to destroy them utterly.
La mia gente è molto ostinata.
says the exact same thing. So we're good.
Il manuale della dominazione imperiale
Our conquest of this village must be complete.
You Imperials certainly are thorough.
Well, that's the last of 'em. Not a tent left standing.
Is Zoey gonna be ok?
But I, for one, want to finish the job on those ammo depots.
Starà bene.
Seems reasonable to me.
Let's do it for Zoey!
Aw, shucks, guys, I'm feelin' OK!
Hoo-ey! Those ammo depots burn like nobody's business!

Floyd, I'm going to ask you a question, and I want to be clear that I'm talking about the situation we are actually in right now, not just an abstract thought experiment. How do we best weaken the Raiders leading assaults on our Outpost?
Cut off their food source.
Dammit, Floyd! I specifically said, I want this be concrete and relevant! What food source are you talking about?!
All of the farms that are all around us, here, in Gantas' Fortress.
Oh. Right.
Floyd tricked me by being direct, coherent, and to the point.
As they say, an army marches on its tum-tum.
An army without farms to supply food isn't much of an army.
Let's take out their storehouses and collect the spoils of war.
Forte e chiaro, signore.
Think of it as a performance based incentive.
From their Storehouses to ours.
That's the last of the Storehouses.
If we're going to win this thing, we'll need support from the folks at home.
Right off the bat, we need more boots.
Why boots?
I feel like soldiers always seem to need more boots. It's just one of those things.
Is it the marching? Maybe they should march less.
The Imperial Army is famed for its boots.
Now every Soldier in the 95th Rifles will have a third spare pair of boots.
Don't you think three spare pairs of boots is excessive?
Clearly the words of a man who has never been without boots.
We tried asking Gantas' Raiders to share their food with our troops, but they got really hostile about the whole thing. Some guys got shot.
Indeed, and, as you know, an army marches on its belly. We'll need MREs to keep the boys well fed.
In the service, we say "stomach".
"Stomaco," Floyd.
They ain't perfect, but they beat the MREs I came up on.
Boar's Feet make you strong.
There's no way anyone could call these MREs anything but food.
Actually, I'd argue that the Hooch-
You're either with us, or against us, Floyd.
In times like this, we all need to pull together. I'd like to offer the Machine Shop's services for anything you need.
Thanks, Floyd, but, uh, I don't really understand how any of those things would help.
I figured you might feel that way, and have prepared this diagram to explain it.
Oh, now that I see this diagram, I understand the Machine Shop's value completely! Thanks, Floyd!
I don't know how we could ever hope to win this war without Widgets!
I'm foolish for having doubted the Machine Shop.
Floyd and his utterly essential Widgets will likely be credited by historians as the things that won this war.
Floyd, I was hoping, with the war on and all, maybe you could help the military out with some tools-
Tools of war, Morgan? I've been very clear: the research I've been doing on biological weapons is purely academic and I will NOT hand it over to the Military!
No, I mean like, actual tools. Wrenches and stuff.
Ah, of course! Happy to help. Also, forget the part I said about biological weapons.
Keep a Tool Kit in the trunk of your car for emergencies!
I've never been more frightened of Floyd.
There we are. I hope these tool kits are put to good use!
I wish we had Heavy Tanks. That would be BOSS. If we had tanks bigger than the other guys, we could just blow up their tanks with ours. Like rock, paper, tank... Heavy Tank.
Sai cosa?
I mean... we received pre-authorization to construct Heavy Tanks from High Command. We just need to print out the authorization confirmation forms.
Of course, we do need to fill out each form in triplicate, have them notarized, sealed, and then hand deliver them. The process usually takes several months.
Noi abbiamo Carri Pesanti!
Explain to me why we didn't start this process when we got the forms? Or several months ago, so I could drive a Heavy Tank over your feet?
He's had me organizing his shoe closet. And then, when I went to go print out the forms, we were out of paper! So we're going to need to make more paper. Hopefully some homegrown paper will be okay.
Bene... Morgan.
They're arranged by shininess, except when not.
Hey! WHY ARE MY SHOES OUT OF ORDER?? PERKINS?!
Paper is made out of wood... right?
Grande!
Okay, we have the wood. Now we just need to figure out how to make it into paper.

That should be easy. First, you'll have to turn it into mulch. After that, we can just press and dry the pulp into sheets of paper. It's amazing what you can do with a few household materials and a little know-how!
I'm sure there's something at the Tool Shop that I can use to do that. I'll just clean off anything I use when I'm done.
I never thought I would actually need to know most of this stuff.
I feel so useful!
There's mulch all over the floor, but I managed to make a few good sheets. I even perforated the edges by hand for the printer's feed mechanism. I just hope it doesn't cause a jam!
Ce l'ho fatta!
I was stamping all of the forms with the official seal, and at the bottom of the stack I got to some forms that were already stamped.
Turns out we already had the authorization confirmation response from back home, and the Heavy Tank plans were just sorta paper-clipped onto the back of that one. Oops.
Okay, allora...
I bet the paper-pushers back home don't even know what a tank is. Well, what are you waitin' for! Get those plans to Zoey so I can have my tank.
Ah, tempo di guerra.
I probably coulda made these sooner if you'd just asked.
Where'd this huge tank come from? Did I sleep in?
So what's the big deal? Seems like just another tank to me.
Ok, è pronto.
It's... it's beautiful. Majestic. An engineered killing machine, like a shark... but on land.
Tu non capisci.
These constant attacks are adding up, sir. A lot of buildings have been damaged.
Oh man! Buildings are where I keep all my stuff! Let's get the Lumber Mill producing patches to fix up the damage.
Right away, sir!
For some of those Shacks, this will probably be an improvement.
It was almost like a compliment!
The kits are finished and buildings are being repaired, sir.
Hey, not bad, Perkins.
Sir! Permission to round "Not Bad" up to "Good"?
Permission denied.
Our vehicles are in terrible disrepair!
You don't have to tell me. Our tanks are barely running.
We need armor patch kits as soon as possible!
This'll keep our rigs on the road for a little while longer.
I like Science okay, I guess.
These Armor Patch Kits have our vehicles good as new!
Don't thank me, thank Science!
Hey there, Zoey! How ya been?
Ramsey! Thanks for visitin' me! I'm doin' much better. Should be back on my feet in no time. How're things out there?
Well, mostly. You're not the only soldier that's needed patchin' up.
Bene!
We should make sure we have enough bandages to take care of everyone.
The boys on the front lines need to be taken care of.
A clean wound is a happy wound. Well, less unhappy.
Should be enough clean bandages so we can start changing dressings more than once a week!
The war demands sacrifices from all of us, Morgan.
C'mon, sir, we wouldn't ask if it weren't important.
Oh, fine! You can use the Distillery to make Disinfectant. But it goes back to making booze as soon as we wrap this stupid war up.
It is a better thing I do today than I have ever done.
Vodka keeps my insides clean.
They're done making Disinfectant! Our long national nightmare is over!
You are the Imperial they call Perkins.
Sirs! It's that crazy lady!
Ahhhhh!
You are a distant star. You exploded long ago.
How did you get in here!
We can't even see you yet.
Why me?
Why Perkins?
Crazy Blades told you that you're a star?
She also said I was invisible. It was really weird.
I Predoni di Lama Folle
Now, Imperials, we shall make our move. We must destroy Gantas' personal orchards.
Why? Do they present some kind of strategic advantage?
No, Gantas is just really proud of them. I'm tired of him showing off, and I think if we burn them down, it will really cheese him off.
Also, he refuses to share the fruit. What's his deal?
War makes a man mean.
Oh, man, seriously? My father's father planted those!
Okay, folks, we've got Gantas surrounded and pinned in. This is now a clean-up job.
Remember that the cornered animal fights with the greatest ferocity.
And for those of us who just say what we frickin' mean, understand that cornered isn't beaten. Expect this to get nasty.
My words are as clear as a mountain spring.
Let's finish them off.
The men are tired, sir, but we're with you.
No more talking! I'll kill you! I'll kick your guts out!
Woah! Who was talking? No one was talking! ... Are you all right?
Now we fight!
Must we?
Is it weird that I'm worried about Tronk?
Maybe all Tronk needs is a friend.
Tronk, are you gonna be okay?
I will kill everyone!
He seems fine.
Tronk!
Your skill with a weapon is admirable. I would be honored if you would face me in combat.
Uh... thanks?
Not you. You fight like a boar. No finesse. The girl there, she is an artist.
Gosh, you think so?
Hey!
That sucker better watch his mouth.
Sarin had still better watch himself.
Who fights like a boar now?
It's you. It's still you.
Oh, Ramsey, don't let him wind you up.
Sarin!
There are no new shapes. It dangles over you.
Oh, guys, Crazy Blades is here. She's doing the gibberish thing.
Morgan. Pain kisses skin and oxidizes but rust flakes off. You feel everything.
So, are we gonna fight or what?
Dance with me before the long night falls.
That gal makes me mighty uncomfortable.
I'll be in my bunk.
Man, that lady leaves me confused on, like, a lot of levels.
She's a hell of a woman.
Lama Folle!
One seed. A small crack. Life splits the boulder.
You've worn us down, but finishing us will not be easy. Do not think you can achieve victory without sacrifice.
I'm gonna make hats out of your feet!
They're the last thing between us and Gantas.
Gantas! We're coming for you!
All right, folks. This is it. You feelin' ready?
Not especially, sir.
Is everyone but Perkins ready?
Yes, sir!
Hell, yes.
Gli alleati di Gantas!
You have won nothing! I will crush you beneath my heel like mammoth dung.
Quindi credi di aver vinto?
Eww. You're gross.
Enough. We will decide this in battle.
Finish this once and for all!
We may yet owe you thanks.

You invade our land. You attack my envoy of peace. You create strife among my people. Now you come to my home, and you desecrate that which is sacred. Your villainy will be remembered by my people for generations.
Really? Because I kinda doubt my people will ever even learn your name.
L'ultima sfida di Gantas!
La Guardia d'Élite di Gantas
Capoguerra Gantas!
this does. Let's get something together.
Se mai qualcuno mi chiamasse per una festa,
Let's kick back and enjoy our success!
The vintage is five minutes ago, a very good year.
We made you our favorite! Boar Tail in Crispy Beetle Shells!
It looks fascinating! Thank you!
I ain't so banged up I can't whip together a little show!
OMFG!
We did it! We finally got rid of that maniac! It should be easy marching from here, boys!
That was some damn fine soldierin'. Proud to serve with the 95th!
Guys, we just got a message from the capital...
Hooray! Thank you for helping us! Our people will be forever grateful!
I must say, it was something of an unqualified success!
Ragazzi, per favore!
Did you see the size of the explosion when their ammo stores went up? POW!
We just got a wire from the capital. While we were attacking Warlord Gantas, the Rebels made a surprise attack from the Taray Mountains. They killed the Emperor. The capital city is in ruins...
The Empire has fallen.
RAGAZZI, PER FAVORE!
I've always wanted to tell a group of things to 'roll out!'
I'll keep up the pressure here! Good luck, everyone!
Gotta say, Lieutenant, we're much obliged, you helpin' out with this year's frontier summer festivities. The firework show's always the hardest part.
Hey, if there's one thing we're good at, it's making things go boom. And we have plenty of old leftover ordnance laying around.
Ain't that a little… unsafe?
Oh, extremely. But it's much safer to set it all off than any other disposal method, as long as it's handled carefully and professionally.
Sirs, I could only find a couple of feet of fuse…
Then I hope you've been improving your sprint times.
Just kidding. I don't really care about his sprint times.
Maybe I oughta evacuate, just in case…
There you go.  Pretty impressive, eh, Sheriff?
Well, I gotta say, y'all made a mighty fine—
That heap of firecrackers isn't gonna impress anyone! We need BIGGER! MORE! We need an explosive display that can be seen FROM SPACE!
Failure!
Uh, I don't think that'll be necessary, Sergeant…
You just wait, Sheriff. We'll give you a fireworks show that your grandkids' grandkids will talk about.
No, I think Ramsey's right.
I… think I'll wait back at Recoil Ridge.
Okay, we're making a hilariously over-the-top fireworks show for Recoil Ridge, so I'm gonna need everyone to pitch in.
I'm going to get the troops to start piling on every ounce of unused explosives we can spare.
I'm manufacturin' gunpowder faster than I can safely make it!
I'm stockpiling bandages and burn ointment at the Hospital.
I'm improving my sprint times.
And I'm supervising with a nice glass of iced tea. Sounds good — let's get to work!
Or at least YOU guys get to work.
At the maximum safe rate, we should work through the entire pile in about 27 years...
Okay, Sheriff, bear with us. I know it looks like an irresponsibly dangerous megalith of deadly explosives, but I think you'll warm up to our work—
OUR work?!
… Once we set the whole shebang off and you see how awesome it is.
Wait! We'll all need to put on these three inch thick carbon lens goggles. Without them, I estimate a permanent 54% decrease in vision for anyone within a ten mile viewing radius.
On second thought, maybe we shouldn't set it all off all at once. Maybe… a few at a time? That'll be okay, right?
There's a fight going on outside! It looks like the Raiders have some of our boys pinned down, but all of our soldiers are accounted for.
I hear you, Sarge. We'll drive them off, but I'm counting on you to watch out for a possible ambush.
I gotcha covered, Lieutenant!
Tap on the Raider army to attack.
How can we discover the truth?
Glad we got here when we did! Ramsey, escort these Flame Troopers back to the Outpost. And Sergeant... keep a close eye on them. They could be Rebel spies...
Predoni Vs. Lanciafiamme?

We've got to find out if those Flame Troopers are spies. I've got a bottle of whiskey around here somewhere, right? With a little bit of that, and my tools of persuasion, I'm sure I can get them to talk.
The ability to lie is a liability.
If you always tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything. I sometimes do that.

Great success! First I got drunk, then I used my persuader and made those Flame Troopers talk. Turns out they are part of the Imperial Exotic Flora Control Corps. Basically an Imperial pilot program to manage wild plants with flamethrowers.
But whatever they were before, they're part of the 95th Rifles now!

Daro said we were gonna fight a raptor, and then Taro said the raptor was gonna kill me and I said it wouldn't it would probably kill him cause he's the slowest and he said he'd trip me, so I hit him, and then he pinched me so tell him he's in trouble!
Zoey!
Woah! Fight a raptor? What're y'all talkin' about?
We're old enough! Well, Yaro isn't, but he's tall for his age.
Hmmm, I guess you kids are pretty mature... What the heck, let's go fight that Raptor.
Also, Daro, it's rude to pinch.
Hmm, I don't like the sound of that.
Zoey! Ce l'abbiamo fatta! Ora siamo diventati grandi!
Grown ups, huh?
Yeah! Now no one can tell us what to do!
Ascesa dell'era dei Raptor
So, now that y'all are grown men—
And a lady.
Men, and a lady, what exactly do you aim to do?
We're going to eat... ALL THE COOKIES.
Well, I s'pose y'all know what you're doing.
This ain't gonna end well.
Understanding "too many cookies" is a big part of being an adult.
Ugh, Zoey, what's wrong with us? This is awful!
Y'all ate like forty or fifty cookies each. That's too many cookies!
Too... too many cookies?
Okay, kids, y'all're grown ups now. That means it's time for work.
But... we were gonna go shoot targets...
Nope, that's kids' stuff. Y'all need to earn your keep. Head to the bakery and get to work.
Tough love, y'all.
Now that we're grown ups, we've decided to be kids.
Zoey! Work is awful! There's no guns or welding or anything! Just measuring flour and waiting around!
Kids, work doesn't have to be awful. Y'all just gotta figure out what you love to do, then do that!
But, we love just fooling around and making tanks and being kids!
Maybe you can do that just a little while longer.

I just visited that butcher shop of a hospital you people built. I understand that a military hospital is normally tasked with stabilizing patients before discharging them to the care of better established facilities, but that option is simply untenable.
Morgan! Pretendo di parlare con te.
Hey, which one of us is the civil engineer? Maybe instead of complaining, you should fix the place up!
Oh, that's an excellent point. Hmm, yes… I can think of several improvements I'd make… oh, yes, that would speed things up nicely and… yes we could cut costs by...
He's leaving me alone AND doing work for me? That's perfect!
Well, if they weren't fighting, someone else would be…
Thanks for the new hospital Floyd! The doctors say we can get injured troops patched up and back into combat in record time!
Recent upgrades to the hospital have resulted in administrative breakthroughs! We can now queue up the next unit to heal!
It's very straightforward. Just tap on the injured unit you're looking to heal and tap the Heal button. If you've got space in your queue, they'll just be added to the end of the list automatically!
Buone notizie, Capitano!
