The more you upgrade the hospital, the more units you can queue. Premium Hospitals have even more slots!
Questo è tutto, Capitano!
Oi, ya seem to have a bit of a Sandworm problem there, mates.
We do? Since when? And who the hell are you?
I'm the man who can solve your little critter issues! I travel the world, teasin' huge wild animals until they attack me! Then I kill 'em in self-defense!
Sounds like fun, but we don't HAVE "little critter issues".
Well, not YET, so I took the liberty of lurin' a few Sandworms down here with my special Sandworm call.
Tu cosa?!
Don't you worry - I just wanted t'give a little demonstration of my skills. I'll have them taken care of lickety-split!
You'd better, or spending a hundred years being digested in a Sandworm's gullet is NOTHING compared to what I'll do to you!
Hey, ya yabbos! Prepare t'decorate my den with yer hides!
Just don't expect me to listen!
Wow.  Okay... wow.
Whew! That was a bit more of a fight than I thought it'd be! But no worries for a seasoned hunter like me!
Well, I have to admire your skills... and your mercenary underhandedness. Welcome to the Outpost!
Great! Just lemme know when you got critters t'slaughter; I'll be on 'em like a kelpie on a jumbuck!
I have no idea what you just said. But as long as you keep on doing what you just did, you can blabber whatever nonsense you want!
Vermi ingannati
Let's recruit some of the local boys to be whatdyacalit... soldiers.
Ehi!
All due respect, sir, but, are you drunk?
A little.
Cosa!? No!
Sir, I really don't see what these yokels can offer.
Every one of us has a special gift, something we can offer the world.
Except you, Perkins.
Oh Ramsey, non capisci?
Awww...
These Hunters will be very effective against animals.
No one gets me.
We now have Imperial soldiers sporting the latest in compound bow technology. The pointy sticks they shoot will strike fear in hearts of the Rebels. The Rebels with their big guns.
Beh, Signore, aveva ragione.
All right, I see my point has not yet been proven.
of the new Hunters I've trained up.
Cosi, ne dubiti l'efficacia
I'm really sure they're good at killing rabbits or whatever.
Non proprio, Signore.
Let's send them after the next raptors that attack.
Staremo a vedere.
Sir, you don't need to risk the lives of innocent men to prove a point.
Non dovrei?
These Hunters will prove themselves formidable even if it puts every one of them in the Hospital.
What have I done?
Those Hunters really did a number on the Raptors.
Devo chiedere scusa, Signore.
We're not done. Not by a long shot.
Oh no.
I get it. We can train the locals as Hunters, and they have a lot more experience with all the dangerous wildlife. It was a good idea.
Signore, questo non è davvero necessario.
and until you truly understand that, these Hunters are going to keep risking their lives to prove me right!
Era l'idea migliore,
Sure, Ramsey SAYS he understands. But does he REALLY?
Soon they will understand.
You've made your point. Hunters are great.
Signore, per favore.
you are entering a world of pain.
Sergente Ramsey,
Really, Sir, I'm convinced.
Un mondo. Di dolore.
Cacciatori vs. Cinghiali
I propose a little competition. Your Troopers versus my Hunters.
Sergente Ramsey.
Sir, the Troopers are your soldiers too - you're the second in command.
I'll see you on the field of battle!
Bel tentativo!
I guess this is the only thing that will satisfy him.
Lesson learned.
in the academy, we called this a Teachable Moment. What have we learned?
Va bene, Sergente,
That Hunters are amazing?
Try again.
No.
To never question your orders?
Bingo.
Test di combattimento
Captain, we have to do something about this heat! I can't style Mr. Purrface's fur when it's this muggy!
Hiss!
It's gettin' so sticky, my plastic explosives are actin' all funny!
Okay, besides the point that none of my booze tastes good when it's warm and watery, what Zoey said is absolutely terrifying.
Any ideas, Floyd? That don't involve meddling with the laws of nature?
But that's what Scientists DO! Fortunately, I do have an alternative: an ice factory with a built-in water filtration system. Clean, clear ice and ice-related products on demand!
And exponentially less likely to create killer monsoons than your weather machine. Have at it, Floyd.
I don't think boots are supposed to stick to concrete…
I really should have seen that coming.
A triumph in civil engineering! Efficient, quiet, and best of all, environmentally friendly!
Yeah, well, environmental friendliness doesn't cut it when we have an overheated Outpost. We need to upgrade it to meet demand.

We can't. The resources and pollution needed for the factory to run at a higher rate would cause a massive warming trend in the atmosphere. I project that it would raise the average temperature by half a degree annually over the next ten years.
So there'd be no consequences NOW, right? Then upgrade that sucker! Upgrade it until we squeeze every drop of efficiency from it! Who cares about future generations when my office is too warm!
Hurry up, before I get sweat stains on my uniform.
That's not—! You're missing the—! Arrgh!
Well, the factory should now be able to make enough ice for everyone. We can even build an ice cream stand with all our extra! Problem solved!
Except for our befoulment of the environment. Now the entire region will get hotter and hotter every year — including this Outpost!
So it's lucky that the ice factory is at max capacity, so we can beat the increasing heat! See, everything works out in the end!
Il Generale Ashe ha detto che dovrei tenere un discorso. Ahem. La ribellione è iniziata 11 anni fa, quando ero ancora un bambino. Non so nemmeno perche i ribelli sono così arrabbiati.
Voglio dire erano parte di qualche paese schifoso dove si indossavano degli stupidi cappelli, poi siamo arrivati noi e gli abbiamo resi parte dell'Impero! Dovrebbero solo ringraziarci!
oh, il Generale Ashe vorrebbe dire qualcosa...
Ciao a tutti!
Men, thanks to your bravery, the last of the Rebels are surrounded and outnumbered. This is where we crush the Rebellion once and for all! All divisions - ATTACK!
Grazie, vostra maestà.
Fra lei e il Generale Ashe, questa guerra finirà in un lampo!
Ben fatto, Capitano!
Tap the Build button, and then the Shelter in the Housing category.
Tap the Build button, and then the Shelter in the Housing category.
Sergeant Ramsey will take charge of the troops here while we go north with Floyd to start setting up the new Outpost.
Unless you want to claim the town's saloon in the name of the Empire...
Quasi pronto, Capitano!
Abbiamo iniziato la costruzione delle ultime tende.
Home sweet home! All it needs now are a couple of finishing touches. Like a fireplace. And a wine cellar.
Sir! I've set up a perimeter patrol in rotating four-hour shifts, and I've got troops covering the approaches with .50 cal machine guns. Our camp is secure.
These people are friendly. Or at least not actively hostile. If you want to be useful, try making sure Zoey doesn't burn any of their stuff down.
A proprio agio, Ramsey.
If you'da let me build the entire kitchen out of military grade reinforced steel like I wanted, the explosion wouldn't have done THAT much damage!
Non è giusto, LT!
Let's finish our preparations. Zoey has toaster shrapnel to pick out of the walls.
I'm sure the locals won't mind if we plant some crops in one of the empty fields.
Vieni, Morgan.
Avremo bisogno anche di cibo per continuare.
Now tap on the Artichoke job to plant it.
Tap on the Farm and plant an Artichoke.
Those farms in town have plenty of food ready to harvest - let's just collect some and be done with it.
Sono sicuro che i carciofi di Floyd siano buoni, ma io ho fame ORA.
Let's collect some more!
And one more for good measure!
Tap on a fully-grown Artichoke to collect it.
Excellent - that should be enough veggies for the trip.
Chi di voi viziati Imperiali ha rubato i nostri raccolti?
Er, I mean mind. Whoops.
Eh... Non pensavo che ve ne sareste accorti.
What are you gonna do to make this right?
Voi Ragazzi avete violato le vostre stesse leggi e calpestato tutti i nostri diritti.

all the units of that type get more powerful - even new ones you build in the future.

Predoni delle Segrete

lo era.

why so glum?

Now that's what I like to see! We'll invest these rewards straight back into this outpost!  Good work!  Now where are those troops I wanted trained...?

Oh.  Right.  I did say that, didn't I?  Oh, well, then, I know whose fault this is.
Do not mistake me - I hope you succeed. Were you to prove yourselves honorable to my people, I will have gained an ally, and my leadership would no longer be in doubt.
Well, do you have any ideas, Taos? I'm new to this whole "respecting other cultures" thing. I'm more used to grinding them under the Empire's boot and all.
My people are as the lone pine, weather beaten, but resolute. We prefer not to put our problems onto others. But actions will shout, while mere words whisper.
Actions, huh? Well, we did pretty well the last time we had to defend this place.  Maybe we could do it again...
Oh, my, a mammoth invasion! Wherever did it come from?
Damn. Back to the old drawing board...
Phew! It sure was lucky we were here to drive away all those mammoths!
Indeed. Though I find it strange that you smell of desert herbs known to attract mammoths...
Well, I... Uh...
I am patient, but my people will not be so forgiving. Perhaps you should attempt to solve a problem that you yourself did not create.
Elder Taos! Elder Taos! Look who's here!
Sono venuto per tutti voi!
But...!
Il Capoguerra Gantas?!
Stand aside, everyone! I'll deal with him once and for all!
Fool! I'll crush you in front of all my fellow Raiders, and show you just how weak and pitiful the Empire is!
I'll teach you to leave these good people alone!
I'm gonna have to stop underestimating these people...
Well, Taos, I think that will help with your problems...
E non tornate!
Indeed. Your show has raised many spirits here. I haven't heard my people laugh so hard in a long time.
Right! And... Wait... Show? Laugh?

Your slave boy Perkins made a fine Gantas, but he needs to control the cracking of his voice. Your performance was... adequate, but I admire how it actually appeared as though you were attacking your slave boy.
Right... Appeared.
We were all greatly entertained. My people have not been turned to your cause, but they are appreciative that you did not try another rat-brained scheme to convince us of your intentions.
I... think I need to go now.
Okay, I'm tired of fooling around.  Nothing we've tried has worked and Taos still won't tell me what the Raiders actually need. So I'm asking you kids.  What's gotten the adults worried?
Well... our parents are always talking about water...
Why? You guys live right next to a lake.

But we need to grow more food for all the new people chased out by Gantas but there's not enough water to drink and give to the animals and give to all the farmers and the lake used to go up to our necks but now it only goes up to our waists and...
Okay, I get the message. But if we're going to do anything about it, we'll need the right tools...
Now I have to put in actual effort...
Waltz with me, Morgan! Waltz with me!
And what's all this for?
Well, since being sneaky and underhanded hasn't gotten us anywhere this time, I've decided to try something crazy: actual benevolence! We're going to solve the Sanctuary's water problems!
A civic works project?! Finally, an opportunity to actually do what I was sent here to do! No weapons of mass destruction or dodging bullets! Oh, beautiful, beautiful day!!
… Great, the smartest guy in the outpost's gone insane. Ah, well, at least he's in good company.
So you want an aqueduct to connect the lake in the Raider Sanctuary to the larger one nearby?
Right.  That way the Sanctuary can have the water they need without having to go through the hostile and dangerous Raptor Nest.
That's... actually an excellent plan. But you realize that if we're going to build that aqueduct, WE'LL have to go through the hostile and dangerous Raptor Nest.
Already got that covered.
I'm not even surprised anymore.
It's nice to have options, you know?
This structure will let us flourish in these lands for generations to come. I am... impressed.
But of course. When a military-industrial complex puts its mind to something, there's not much it can't accomplish.
You and your clan deserve great thanks for this. My people will long benefit from this work, and I believe it will shine unto you as the sun upon a calm lake.
Huh.  Respect can be *earned*. I'll have to remember this for future reference.
just outside the base. Naturally, I disciplined him for lying. But on my way over here, I saw one myself. Apparently, it's not just Raiders we have to worry about!
I'm scared of those things. I hear they're smart enough to drive an automatic.
Perkins ha detto che ha visto un Raptor
Difenderci dai Raptors.
Be cool. Let the Raptors come to you. Don't make it weird.
Wait, Morgan told you to ATTACK the Raptors? WHAT A WASTE!
These Raptors aren't just pests we need to wipe out.
We can study them - maybe even breed them! Wouldn't that be fun to watch?
Capitano, ho un'idea!
Mi permetta di costruire una pistola tranquillante, così posso catturare i Raptor.
I'm sure Zoey can build me a Tranquilizer Gun at her Tool Shop.
Great! Now to find some Raptors...
and wait for the next Raptor to show up near our Outpost... ... ...
Va bene, ora devo prepararmi mentalmente
Floyd, alcuni Raptor sono sbucati vicino al nostro avamposto!
Come on, Perkins, let's go do some Science!
Wow, che tempismo fenomenale!
Please don't let me die.
Unconscious, but still breathing. What a specimen! I haven't felt this alive in years!
Raptor!
I can use to tag a Raptor? I want to release one of them and track it back to their nest.
Zoey, mi puoi costruire un Dispositivo di Rilevamento
What color do you want the tracker light to blink?
Ma certo, Floyd!
You're not supposed to see the tracker.
Cosa? Non voglio che lampeggi del tutto.
All of them.
Tutti i localizzatori lampeggiano, Floyd.
I love these special orders!
I went ahead and had the tracker blink red AND blue.
I've got a solid signal!
Perkins, andiamo!
If the fight is too big, don't be afraid to retreat.
Raptor!
At last! Now all I need is a place to keep my Raptors while I prepare my research.
Honestly, at this point I'm more interested in how those things taste.
You can't be serious. I risked Perkins' life to capture those Raptors!
Sure, and we'll make sure to keep enough so that you don't have to do that again. Probably.
It's not like we can't study some and eat the rest…
I wouldn't exactly call them domesticated, but at least we've got livestock!
All right, boys! Our situational vegetarianism is over! Who wants a thigh?
Oooh! Mr. Purrface will be so happy!
I'd like to start with some Raptor Nuggets.
You people are monsters...
I can't wait to see what other animals taste like!
*Sigh* It IS pretty tasty.
Fiori!
Ehm... cosa?
How can we increase taxes without driving our already hostile workforce into a full rebellion?
Oh, mi dispiace, Zoey, stavo pensando.
Potremmo drogare l'acqua?
Drugs in the water works, but people inevitably start to build up a tolerance, and then before you know it, riots riots riots.
No, alziamo i valori delle proprietà con giardini!
will produce higher taxes.
Tenete a mente, solo case vicino ai fiori
Place the Garden so that the circle touches as many houses as possible.
Ah, a lovely place for a stroll.
made the flower beds modular and interlocking, with a stainless steel base. You can move these any time you like.
Tutto fatto. Sono andato avanti e
Always going above and beyond the call of duty or reason.
Grazie, Zoey.
with one of my little distillery projects. Probably Perkins' fault, right? Anyway, I have some stuff that needs long term storage.
Toxic Waste tends to kind of bum people out.
Quindi c'è stato un...incidente
Li vale due barili?
Oh, e ti consigliamo di tenerlo lontano dalle case.
Place these so that they make you look reckless and tough. Or hide them. Whatever.
I'll make sure Perkins is more careful from now on.
50 years? I think? I'm not good with half-lives.
Fantastico. Questi li possiamo smaltire, piú o meno,
Lieutenant! We found the Raider village! The Sarge stayed behind to gather intel. I can lead you to it whenever you guys are ready!
Great work, Perkins! I knew we could count on you! Wait - no... I had my doubts. But it didn't turn out to be a disaster, so good job!
Um... thanks, Lieutenant. By the way, who has been watching the Sarge's cat while we were away? He ordered me to prepare a full report...
His cat? I didn't know the Sarge had a cat...
If I don't find Mr. Purrface, I think the Sarge might actually kill me... Maybe they've got some Catnip at the Farm?
WOO HOO! I get to live! Now let's go give it to those Raiders!
Mrrow?
We're ready to go, Captain! Perkins - lead the way. Those Raiders have no idea what's about to hit them.
Tap on the "Go!" button in this window to take our troops to the Raider village.
Don't worry, Mr. Purrface - daddy is coming home!
I didn't see the Warlord anywhere - that worries me.
Sirs, we found something! This... thing was set up near the center of the Raider camp.
Looks too fancy for the Raiders. I wonder where they stole it from...
They didn't steal it, they found it. That's an Ancient relic you're looking at!
Whoa. Where did you come from?
Sorry if I startled you. I noticed the artifact a few days ago, but the Raider patrols made it impossible to inspect. You showing up certainly improved the situation.
Huh... Well, we shouldn't overstay our welcome. Let's get this thing packed up, and we'll investigate it back at the Outpost.
Zoey, can you do anything with that pile of junk we brought back from the Raider Village?
Um... yeah, about that. I don't even know how to take it apart. There are no seams or screws. It's all one piece.

Allow me. The markings on this 'junk,' as you call it, indicate a production date around Epoch Three of the pre-Imperial age. It will take some time to reactivate it, but it appears to be in working order.
Great. Do you know what it does?
Well, the name is printed here, near the top. It's in an ancient tongue, but I believe it translates roughly to Money Tree.
Wait seriously? The Ancients had Money Trees?
Well, obviously it doesn't especially resemble an actual tree. My research indicates they were somewhat distanced from nature in their daily lives.
No, I mean, does it actually grow money?
Oh, that! Yes, once I get it working, it should.
Well, what are you waiting for!
I'm not saying we SHOULD use Nanopods to hurry this up. I'm just reminding you that we CAN.
I will be so disappointed if that prospector turns out to be as crazy as I think he is.
Well, that should do it. Your Money Tree is up and running.
Money Tree... so it actually makes Gold?
Correct. It just requires manual activation once a day.
I have to push a button every day?! This is the worst Money Tree ever!
It's kind of astonishing how quickly you can go from amazed to entitled.
Remember, the Money Tree will generate gold every day, but only if you remember to turn it on.
Does it strike anyone else as odd that a 4,000 year old Money Tree makes modern money?
Thanks for the help. Just so it's clear, I'm keeping the Money Tree. You can't have it.
It's a little large for me to carry anyway. The Money Tree is yours - just be sure to let me know if you come across anything else... unusual.
Wow - check out the defenses on the Warlord's fortress. Are you sure you guys can handle this?
Ha! Breaking into a fortress is child's play for the Empire. It's like a game of Breakout, but the opposite.
It's always a good idea to scout ahead when attacking an enemy city.
This place is HUGE!
Captain! A patrol has spotted us!
Did those kids call you "Captain?" I don't know whether to be shocked or jealous.
These guys are tough. I miss the good old days when we were fighting the Rebellion.
I see you, Imperials. You buzz like flies around a bonfire, and in the end, you will burn. BWAHAHA!
They're far better defended than we expected, sir. Honestly, ground troops don't stand a chance.
We'll need to build up the Outpost. And I'll see if we can requisition some heavier ordinance from the Empire. This isn't over.
Pattuglia di Predoni
Ready when you are, Captain. The plan is to strike these supply sites and weaken Warlord Gantas' fortress. Perkins has mapped out the locations we'll be hitting. Remember - get in and get out!
Look for unprotected targets if you want less of a fight.
If they can't eat, they can't fight.
We've gotten word from one of Elder Taos' warriors about a Raider training camp. We can hit these guys before they even finish boot camp...
That's a whole lot of Raiders.
Who says we don't have fun out here, way up north?
After my shift the other day, I tracked some Raiders to a remote storage location. We can hit them where it hurts and take a pile of resources for our trouble.
That's a whole lot of Raiders.
That'll put a dent in their recruitment quotas.
Any words of inspiration for the men before we launch the attack?

Tell them, "Men, I expect every one of you to shoot lots of stuff and make the Empire proud. And even if all of you should fall in battle today, I solemnly pledge that I will escape, and that I will personally consider avenging your tragic deaths."
Um. Thank you, sir. I might edit that for you.
Raider defenses are powerful. If you're losing too many men - retreat!
That's showing them Imperial might!
I didn't think we'd need big guns way out here, but those defenses are tough! Can we requisition some Artillery?
I already asked after the first Raider attack. They mentioned problems crossing mountains. Oh and that they couldn't spare any. If we want Artillery, we'll need a Gun Foundry of our own.
We've pushed our way past the fortress's first line of defenses!
Buone notizie, Capitano!
Unfortunately, it looks like they have a defensive line of bunkers waiting for us, each full of crazed Raider warriors.
Could you please let me focus on the positive for one freakin' second? You are like a black cloud lately, Sarge!
Attacking well-defended bases can take several assaults.
A few more strikes to reach the Warlord's Tent.
I look forward to the day when we have cleansed the land of your presence and carved your bones into little flutes for Raider children. It is a dream I have.
Floyd, Zoey says she'll be able to build tanks, real, proper tanks, soon. But first, she needs a lubricant for the T-Joints on the main conveyor belts to handle the extra strain.
Hmm, there's a tree that grows not far from the Outpost. We could use the sap and a process I've devised wherein-
That sounds great. Why don't you send Perkins to gather some?
Oh, because it's being guarded by Raiders. I guess they use it for oiling their Mammoth saddles or something.
Oh, good, I was wondering when we'd get to fight some Raiders.
Once we have control of the T-Oil Tree, we'll be one step closer to building our own tanks.
This'll keep the factory runnin' no problem!
I have much to discuss with you.
Saluti, imperiali.
Woah! Did you walk all the way here? At your age?
These men have brought news of a powerful new weapon. A weapon Warlord Gantas believes he can use to turn the winds of war against you.

Two of my elite tribesmen will disguise themselves as simple laborers, and investigate the nature of the threat. If you will supply us with a similarly well trained warrior, he may accompany them on the mission.
Ci sono alcuni negli eserciti di Gantas fedeli a me.
Viaggiamo sullo stesso sentiero.
That sounds like a suicide mission!
Infatti sarà pericoloso.
It's time for another special mission!
Perkins!
This Raider uniform is itchy!
It will not help you. You have proved today that you do not have a warrior's heart!
These are my strongest warriors. They will show you what battle is! What it means to know combat!
AHAH! Mi attaccate con bugie e trucchetti!
Ti faccio un regalo.Ti mostro qualcosa.
You are welcome for the lesson!
Your weapons are powerful, but my fortress is stronger. You are so small, so far from help. How can you hope to defeat us? We will sweep over you like a dust storm. Will you let it come to this?
None here is without sin. But, I have an honorable compromise. Leave this place, and I will spare your lives. Just walk away. Leave this land to us, and let us resolve this conflict ourselves.
Just walk away and I will give you safe passage in the wasteland... just walk away, and there will be an end to the horror. You have one full day to decide...
Soldati imperiali, ora vi rendete conto che non potete vincere.
C'è stata troppa violenza... troppo dolore.
Il Predone "Testimone"
Il Predone "Testimone"
Il Predone "Testimone"
OMG! We can't fight Gantas and those Bombards! Maybe if we just beat the guys in front here, we can escape!
Capoguerra Gantas
It is known to me.
Hai problemi con la fauna selvatica.
And how did you know that! And why did you sneak up on me!
Guh! Che cosa ci fai qui!
I travelled here because three youths of my tribe have been spending time here. They told me of your struggles with the Raptors. I came to help.
Le prime due domande hanno una sola risposta.
Honestly, I think we have the "shoot at them until they die" strategy down pretty well.
I mean training them. Controlling them.
Non intendo ucciderli.
Adesso hai la mia attenzione.
Observe their movements and feeding patterns. Engage them in combat to see their warrior hearts.
Il primo passo è capire il Raptor.
Try talking to a different Raptor. Then maybe the Raptor you're really interested in will get jealous.
Soon, the Raptor will be yours to command.
Hmm. You have made progress, but there is much left to learn.
Sei migliorato molto in questi giorni.
Watching us?
Aspetta, sei stato qui tutto il tempo?
Bring me 5 Teeth, and control of the Raptor will be yours.
Veniamo alla seconda parte del tuo addestramento.
Look, I'll do the teeth thing, but seriously, you have to stop sneaking around. You're freaking everyone out.
The Raptor is a powerful foe.
Wait, did that old weirdo con me?
Mmmm, yes. These will make a sweet necklace. You have done well!
So... about training Raptors...
Oh, you'll want an Animal Trainer for that. In the meantime, I'll get you started with one pre-trained Raptor.
Sergeant Ramsey - the Raiders have been hitting us even harder since Recoil Ridge. See if you can track down where they are coming from.
Understood, sir - I'll take care of it.
Enemy armies sometimes show up on our land. Just tap on them to fight them off.
I love my job. But not as much as I love YOU, Mr. Purrface! You're such a good kitty - come here and give me kisses...

Stop shooting!

Dannazione, Zoey, come facevo a saperlo?
Predoni Tascabili?

We heard the Elders talking about you so we wanted to see you and Daro found something in the desert and it has your flag on it and then Taro wanted to tell you about it and... and we were just trying to help!

Cinghiali

Hmm. A Recon Vehicle would give us an edge exploring all of this... nothing... up here. All right - let's bring it home!
Special locations can be accessed through missions, but may not always be available to visit.
Nice work! Now let's tow this thing back to base. Zoey's got her work cut out for her!

OMG, this is the day every girl dreams about! OK, I'll need some Iron and a couple tools to get this Tank repaired...
Doin' jobs here at the Tool Shop earns us Gold AND XP!

All patched up! Ain't she a beauty? All she needs now is some Oil and she'll be good to go.
You know who has Oil, Lieutenant? Sheriff Colt back at Recoil Ridge. He sent a note just the other day saying, "Have Oil. We'll share for help with the local hooligans."
Well, that's convenient! Let's head back to Recoil Ridge and help ourselves to some Oil... I mean, help the guy out.
Once we have enough Oil, I can fill up the Tank at my Tool Shop!
Getting out of here will be good for them.
Perkins! Stop messin' around. Let's get this... ahem, TANK... going. We've got Raiders to hunt.
Scout. Not hunt. Remember, don't start anything you can't finish. Just find the Raider base and come back. No shooting.
Sir, yes, sir. I remember your orders. I disarmed all the gun turrets to make sure we couldn't -
You did WHAT?!
Nothing - keep ignoring him. Just move out. We'll see you when we see you.
Friends and Allies can ask for your help with enemies on their land.
If I could fill that deputy position, we wouldn't need to be posting these 'Help Wanted' ads so often.
Thanks for the hand. Here's your Oil - now kindly git goin'!
Lupi d'Argento
Zoey, construction isn't your true calling. You need to work on something that plays to your strengths. Something that's SUPPOSED to drive around and endanger people's lives.
You brought me a Tank?! AND it's damaged? Oh my gosh, you guys are just too sweet!
It's not a Tank, it's a 'Night Owl' series Armored Recon Vehicle.
Oh, c'mon! You drive it around, it's got a big ol' gun on top - it's a Tank. And I'll have her good as new in no time!
OMG, this is the day every girl dreams about! OK, I'll need a couple tools...

Man, there were a ton of boars back there!

Ma dai.
Sir, this is perfect! We can take the men back there anytime to practice their combat skills!
Meh. They already know what end of the gun points at the enemy right? At least most of them?
… we also frequently find gold and resources there.
Get those men marching!
Gold buys guns, guns make soldiers. QED.
Don't worry - those pigs had it coming.
That was an excellent combat exercise for the men, Captain! Remember, any time we want to get in a little practice, we can come back here.
Or, you know, when we need a little more operating income.
That too.
We were out in the tank practicing and–
Tenente Morgan!
Did anyone die?
No! Uh, probably not! Anyway! We found some weird old buildings! They look like stuff from the Before!
Ancient Ruins, huh? Percival claimed there could be nanopods buried out there. What the hell, let's give it a look-see.
We thought we hit Mr. Purrface, but he's fine.
But the rewards for winning...
Lieutenant Morgan! I'm surprised to see you here!
Percival. You, uh... you didn't happen to find any nanopods... did you?

I'm afraid not, Lieutenant. In point of fact, I was packing up empty handed. This particular site has old defenses still active. Powerful machines stalk the land. I don't recommend facing them in battle.
I'm not scared of some broken down old robot.
You should be, Lieutenant, you really should be.
Morgan, what are you doing here? I warned you it was dangerous—
I'll admit, it was tricky at first, but we took care of him.
Cosa? Quella lattina gigante?
Indeed you did. Unfortunately, that was simply part of the automated sanitation system. By attacking it, you've triggered some of the actual security robots.
Wait, that thing was like... a garbageman robot?  We were getting our butt kicked by a garbage robot?
That's correct. And you've now woken up something much more dangerous.
Well, I've been picking through some of the scrap from that area—
Ehi LT! Ricordi quella specie di Antico Costrutto?
Bring the cyanide pills and make peace with your higher power!
Perkins! Abbiamo uno scenario Gemini!
It didn't follow me back or nothin'! I think I can rig up a pretty solid approximation of one of the arm fragments, and it would fight for us!
Calmati LT!
Zoey, I'm intrigued. Perkins, keep the cyanide pills on hand.
He has a packet of sealed orders for us. At least, I think they're sealed. I can't figure out how to open them, and he won't talk to me.
Signore, un... imperiale è appena arrivato.
This is probably another request for some obscenely large amount of stone... Wait a minute, Rebels? Out here?
High command has intercepted Rebel communications up here in the north, far too close for comfort. We need to find out why.
Under no circumstances can they find out that we're here… or that anyone would ever want to be out here. Take our new friend and find the Rebels.
Li prendo io quelli.
Questa è una cosa davvero..seria.
This guy looks like he means business. Murder business.
This must be how they took Marin... they had this outpost as a staging ground.
Stop daydreaming, we've got work to do.
This guy looks like he means business. Murder business.
This must be how they took Marin… they had this outpost as a staging ground.
Stop daydreaming and get to work.
We're being sneaky!
Let's move up to the town - that group of Rebels looks like the perimeter watch.
Anything you want, new friend!
I can take out that mortar truck in the back with my explosives. Cover me while I go in.
Aye-aye!
My Demolitions Charge ability devastates vehicles and defensive structures.
Forze Ribelli
If we take out this watchpost silently, we can move into the town and finish the job before they know what hit 'em. I used that trick back at the Battle of Magnessan.
I've heard the stories, but... you were there? They say the city went out like a light being turned off. What was it li-
Magnessan?
We have to move - before the new shift reaches their lookout!
L'orologio sta cambiando!
Knowing when and where to put pressure is key.
Come on, Perkins. Let's go.
I've disrupted their defenses. Return to your outpost and rally a squadron to return here and take the town.
Won't you come with us?
E tu?

I'll stay here and make sure they don't escape or call for help. Guerrilla tactics will make them think there's a much larger force pinning them down, then you can bring the 95th Rifles and finish them off.
Torre di Guardia ribelle
Perkins keeps whining about how he needs to assault the Rebels. He says his friend is there right now fighting for his life. When did this happen? I didn't know he had any friends.
We investigated the Rebel signals and found that they'd invaded the small town of Greenborough, near Marin. We engaged the enemy, and disrupted their defenses.
Perkins took a liking to the Imperial Saboteur we left with. We need to go back and reinforce him with the rest of our army, and destroy the Rebel outpost.
Beh, Signore, ha dormito durante il Briefing.
Oh right, that whole thing. That's still going on? Get back there and stop the Rebels before they find out we're here.
I'm comin' for you, buddy!
Where's the hose? I gotta make some mud.
The Rebel outpost is no longer a threat.
Missione compiuta, Signore.

Grown ups are talking now. Ramsey, are you sure you got all of them?
Calmati, Perkins.
If there are any left, we doubled back on our route and covered our tracks well. They won't find our outpost any time soon.
Perkins! I sent you out for those supplies half an hour ago! What the hell are you still doing here?
Sorry, sir! The convoy truck has a flat tire.
Then take the auxiliary truck!
Uh, I tried, but it has a flat tire too...
You're kidding.  Well, Floyd's been working on puncture-resistant tires.  Now's as good a time as any to try 'em out.
Without these, I'm sure Morgan would make me walk instead...
How is this my life?
Uh, sir... The tires are ready, but the mechanics are having trouble with the jacks right now.
We don't have time for this. Help them out.
That... would require me lifting the trucks so they could put the tires on. I can't do that...
Then lift with your legs, not with your back! God, do I have to think of *everything* around here?!
Predoni cecchini
Holy...! Someone just shot out my brandy snifter!  While I was holding it!
Hold still!  If I can calculate the trajectory of the bullet... Correct for wind conditions...  Aha! It came from over there!
I think we just got an explanation for all those flat tires.  Quick, men! Before the sniper gets away!
I liked that snifter!
The shot came from over that rise!
Ack! My helmet just popped off by itself!
Damn! He's firing at us!  We have to flush him out, or we're sitting ducks!
I liked that snifter!
Please don't let him see me, please don't let him see me...
He's getting away!  After him!
Wait! If we all charge in after him, who knows what he could do?  We'll send a small scouting force to track him back to his headquarters!
Good idea! We'll need someone small, quick, and expendable! Now who do I know who fits that bill...?
Lieutenant! I think we found it! A Raider outpost in the frontier!
Perkins! Your clothes are full of holes! Shame on you, disgracing the proud uniform of the Empire like that!
Uh, sir, that was from the snipers...
Imperial soldiers don't make excuses! Now go clean yourself up before we move out! And spit-shine those shoes, for Pete's sake!
And yes, I'm all right, thank you for asking.
Charming place.  Hellooooo? Anyone home?
So, Imperials, you have come, straight into my sights. I did not think you would be so courageous... or stupid.
I thought you Raiders were all about honorable face to face confrontation. What's with all the sneaking around? You guys scared?
Your attempt to goad me is pathetic.  But if you care to test your mettle, challenge the prowess of my men for yourself.
There's more lead around here than a pencil factory.
Oh man! They're totally the indoor kids!
So you've proven your worth... by slaughtering the outcasts they send to me. I will make you pay for this.
Wait... outcasts? I was right! You guys are totally the kids who got picked last for all the Raider games!
You speak of things you do not understand! The outcasts will show you there is strength in our ways!
Sir! The scouts report that Sarin's guard towers are now fully manned!
Looks like Sarin's done playing with us.  We'll have to take care of those towers if we want to get out of this with our skin intact.
I'll order the tanks to go in first. They'll be rolling shields long enough for us to make our move.
Ah, tanks...  Is there any problem they can't solve?
Tanks!
You wouldn't understand!
So, there are some among you who are not mewling cowards! I welcome your courage, even as I sneer at your idiocy for not surrendering while you have a chance!
Man, talk about overcompensating.
You know, in the Empire, snipers are actually a pretty prestigious group. Maybe you guys are just looking at this wrong.
Silence! My status doesn't concern you! Outcasts make atonement in our own way.
We can't deal with Sarin the way we dealt with Tronk. This guy's a completely different animal.
We can't? I didn't know bullets didn't work against some Raiders. We just have to figure out a way to get them into him without letting his get into us.
Actually, speaking of bullets, I was thinking... It looks like Sarin makes his own bullets at his outpost.  If we take his coal, he'll have a much harder time keeping the fires lit.
Yes, it's stealing, but it's from a bad guy, so it's okay.
I gotta admit, Morgan can be tough if he cares enough.
So, you cowardly Imperials refuse to face me directly, yet skulk like thieves.
Pretty tough talk coming from an outcast.
Silence! You have no concept of or respect for our way of life! Let that fact be what buries you in the ash heap of history!
Blah blah blah, we're all doomed.  I've heard this song and dance before, Sarin.  You want to take us down, get in line.
Sir! We just got word that Sarin is stockpiling weapons at his outpost! He's getting a constant stream from other Raider suppliers!
Hm. If Sarin gets that many weapons, he could outlast us. We have to stop him before he becomes too entrenched to get him out again.
I agree, but something about this doesn't feel right.
Other than our enemy getting a huge advantage over us? Even if your paranoia's right, we don't have much of a choice.  C'mon, Ramsey, we'll lead this attack ourselves.
Let's end this right now!
In the meantime, wallow in your futility!
I don't get you Raiders. We just kicked your butt, but you're still (as far as I can tell) smiling?
I smile because you ignorant Imperials didn't even notice my men surrounding you while you were busy fighting me.
Huh... So they did... This doesn't look good...
Morgan, you have to escape!  I'll cover you while you...
There will be no cowardly flight today! Both of you will be imprisoned while I... negotiate with your outpost for your release.  For your sakes, you had better pray they are receptive.
La Guardia di Sarin
Floyd! Floyd! Is it true?!
I'm afraid so. Ramsey and Morgan have been captured by Sarin.  He is demanding our complete withdrawal from the frontier in exchange for their release.
Captain! We're gonna rescue 'em, right?
Of course we are! The captain would never let those Raiders win like this!
Besides, it's not like we can trust them at this point. Looks like we have little choice.
Okay, Captain, lead the way!
We have to save the Sarge!
One more day of mammoth and I would've gone nuts.
Morgan! Ramsey!
Captain! Zoey! What are you doing here? This could be a trap!
Speak for yourself! I'm glad they're here!
We'd better get out of here now, sirs, before Sarin comes back!
Phew!  Am I glad to be out of there! Having Ramsey as my only company was getting kinda tedious.
Sarin isn't gonna take this lying down.  Our rescue makes him look bad.  He's going to want revenge.
Then we take the initiative.  We regroup right here, right now.  We counterattack before he can prepare - teach him what happens when he takes Imperial citizens hostage!
Agreed.  Men, move out!  We'll hit him hard and fast!
Sarin will pay for feeding us boiled boar!
Perkins? Are you having a stroke or something?
Hah! I knew it!  All talk!
I will grant you fought valiantly... but my defeat does not mean my end. Nor will Warlord Gantas forgive this. Your doom is all but assured.
Blah blah blah. You go running on home with your tail between your legs and tell your boss we'll kick his ass if he so much as shows a pinkie near our outpost!
Uh, sir? Ix-nay on ocking-may the omicidal-hay aider-ray...?
Captain! We just got word Warlord Gantas attacked Recoil Ridge as revenge for our meddling!
Was 'meddling' the exact word that was used?
Unreal timing... right as I sit down to sample the first batch of distilled spirits. Let's get over there fast to help them out. And get back faster so I can sample the moonshine.
Hurry, they've taken over the Distillery!
We've just begun helping them recover.
Gaze upon the destruction you have brought to these people.
Guardate la rovina che portate, Imperiali.
That's weird, I don't remember being the one who destroyed this city. Is that guy an idiot, or am I having blackouts again?
Both, sir.
Predoni di Gantas
Predoni di Gantas
Predoni di Gantas
Let's send supplies to help Sheriff Colt repair the damage to Recoil Ridge. I feel so good about us helping out - all warm and fuzzy.
I'm starting to see our outpost as a beacon of hope in the frontier. This is after a drink, of course.
The folks here in Recoil Ridge appreciate you helpin' us out. An' I guess I do too.

You know, when you Imperials showed up, I figured you were nothin' but trouble. This has generally borne out to be the case. Still, when things got rough, you were there for us. The people of Recoil Ridge want to thank you.
Are you thanking us by throwing a big party where we all get wasted?
That's about the size of it.
Sheriff Colt, you've just made me the happiest man in the world.
Recoil Ridge is throwing the party, but it's rude to show up without refreshments.
Where's Zoey? Last time she drank, my Jeep had feet.
Sheriff, put 'er there.
I can honestly say, knowin' you folks are nearby ain't the worst thing in my life anymore.
You old softie...
If we're going to get Recoil Ridge back on its feet, they'll need raw materials. We can help by building a Lumber Mill and sending them resources.
We'll be using Lumber more and more as the Outpost continues to grow.
As a bonus, these new buildings give fewer splinters by an order of magnitude!
Hey, Floyd! I was reading an article about the scientific potential of Sandworm extract in the latest issue of Imperial Geographic...
Oh, you don't have to trick me into an animal hunt this time. I've always wondered what they tasted like.
... OK. Well, there's a first time for everything, isn't there? Let's go talk to Taos - I hear he knows everything about Sandworms.
I saw a Sandworm the other day. Filthy things.
Hey, Taos. Floyd and I are hunting Sandworms. So, uh... how do we find them?
You seek the Sandworm? You are brave, Morgan, for there is only one sure way to draw out the worm...
Sandworms can smell it, and the scent drives them into a frenzy. Show fear in their feeding grounds, and they will seek YOU out.
Paura.
Fear, huh? I have an idea... Perkins!
Perkins reporting for duty!
Do you love your nation, son?
I do, sir.
That's good to know. You can prove it by standing in the middle of those test dummies over there.
Fear is the greatest killer of all. Except Sandworms.
Let's do our best not to hit Perkins. We're just trying to scare the guy and draw out the Sandworms...
Here are the worms now - it's working! I'm a genius!
Oh god, I can feel them moving under the ground! I have never been so scared...
Er... that makes sense. That must be why there are so many of them... let's catch one!
This Sandworm armor looks really hard to pierce...
Will this smell come out of my uniform?
I see that you do not know the difference between attacking and catching Sandworms. You must build a trap to catch them as they exit their tunnels.
I should've thought of that. Note to self: never hunt on an empty stomach. Thank you, Taos. Let's get back to base.
And here. You have earned this fear charm our hunters use. The worms will seek the one who wears it, even on Imperial lands.
Wait. You had this all along? But I risked my life with those test dummies...
Well, get over it. Sometimes you gotta take one for the team.
Ok. I just finished the blueprints for a one-way Sandworm tunnel reverse trap door. Like a crab trap that anchors itself several feet into the ground. Let's start production.
We just got back! How'd you do that?
Oh, I'm always working on designs in my head. And the two of us had a long walk back.
So that's why I felt like I was giving a monologue.
I'm sorry, what?
I feel like I was denied critical, need-to-know information.
Morgan doesn't even ask nicely.
Great work! The traps are set and ready to recieve Sandworms.
Let's find Perkins and get him to put this fear charm... thing on.
I still don't understand why I have to wear the charm. I was the bait last time.
Sometimes you gotta take two for the team. Move out, son.
And um... there are way more Sandworms than I was expecting. We'll take this group over here but we'll need our troops for the others!
Do we need a hunting license for this?
And THAT'S why we're at the top of the food chain!
Marvelous! The traps worked! Let's set up a Sandworm Ranch. I'm starving.
This is a side of you I haven't seen before, Floyd.
It's my hungry side.
LT! LT! I visited an Ancient archaeological dig with Percival, and I found this neat Ancient sphere! He let me keep it!
Did he? Obviously Percival hates us and wants us dead.
Aw, c'mon, LT, Percival said that the activation protocol was lost ages ago. Besides, it's just a neat gizmo — what's the chances it's some kinda superweapon? It's perfectly safe!
I'm gonna go ahead and muster the troops now.
Called it.
Always happy ta help!
Oops.
Okay, "oops" doesn't even BEGIN to cover it this time.
On the other hand, that thing was pretty badass. Any way you could repair it, so it can kick our enemies' butts instead of ours?
Yeah, I think so. But it uses so much energy, you wouldn't be able to have more than four in any one battle.
Small price to pay. Well, Zoey, it looks like your reckless disregard for safety's actually worked in our favor this time. Kind of.

Ma'am, I want to be clear. The men of the 95th Rifles aren't exactly the cream of the crop, and I think you might well be the best shot in a thousand miles. If you could give the boys a little help, it would do us a world of good.
I don't see what the big deal is. Ya just drop down to one knee, take a deep breath, draw a bead-
Wait, wait! These are great tips, let me grab a pen!
Why don't you give me a look-see at how you usually train yer folks, and I'll try and give you a pointer here and there.
Let's show Cassidy what the Imperial Army is made of!
Hell, if your Gunner just braced himself a little, he wouldn't come so close to fallin' flat on his ass!
Right! Good!
Well, these folks aren't bad, but if you're wantin' a body to make the tough shots, they can't do it behind protection like that.
No armor! You got it!
Well, them Troopers might want to try aiming after each shot, steada just pointin' once and then pulling the trigger fast as they can.
'Try... aiming....' Great! Thanks for the help!
Wouldn't mind seein' that boy Ramsey around again.
Hell, if your Gunner just braced himself a little, he wouldn't come so close to fallin' flat on his ass!
Right! Good!
one of the local frontier towns... oh, what was it...
Ehi, Floyd
Trotbeck? Bernmoth? Recoil Ridge? Skar—
Yeah, one of those. Anyway, apparently they're having some kind of epidemic; no one can work, economic breakdown, boils, that kind of thing.
Oh my word! We should send medical aid at once!
There is nothing nobler than aiding the unwell with Science.
There's a good person in Morgan somewhere.
Well, I'm glad we were able to do our part!
And at a tidy profit!
Good news, Floyd! That frontier town full of sick people is on the mend!
Well, that's excellent news, Morgan! And I'm glad to see you finding joy in such a selfless victory!
Now that they're getting back on their feet, they'll be guaranteed to crave comfort food. And I'll be the guy selling.
There is nothing nobler than seizing an opportunity.
Who is Morgan, deep down?
Well, Ramsey, I see Morgan's saddled you with shipping the soup to those poor frontier folks. I can't believe he would sell—
Sell? Morgan donated all the soup. He took one look at the hospital down there, and ordered up 10 extra barrels. He paid for it himself.
He did? I... I do not understand that man.
Those Silver Wolf goons are at the gates!
Signore, siamo sotto attacco!
Why would they attack us in full force?
I Lupi d'Argento?
their leader is pissed that Imperial forces are eating into the money from the protection scam the Silver Wolves were running.
his boys "Show the Imperial Bastards who runs things up north."
Secondo lo Sceriffo Colt,
È ubriaco, ed esigente
If he's drunk, why are they following orders? I ignore your orders all the time when you're drunk...
Apparently, the last time he went on a bender, he started demanding chicken and waffles. He shot anyone who came near him without them. It lasted two weeks.
Lieutenant! There's somethin' strange goin' on around here...
When isn't there?
I had some "travelers" through Recoil Ridge. Seemed off. Said they was from Bernmoth, but I didn't recognize 'em. Called there, and ain't no one knew their names.
Buon punto a riguardo. Ma credo che abbiamo un problema.
Hmm, they could be spies… but what would the Rebels be doing out here?
If the Rebels find out we're up here...
Questo è grave, Morgan.
Good point, Sergeant. New orders, men: for the foreseeable future, if you find strange groups of frontier citizens wandering around in the area, shoot to kill!
Y'mean, shoot to kill *after* ya ascertain their identity, right?
Hm? Oh, sure, yeah. Totally.
Dozens of them! In groups this time! It's… we've never—
Tenente Morgan! Stanno arrivando!
Who's coming? What are you talking about?
State calmi, ragazzi.

The grownups say springtime's really romantic, and, well, they want to pair up right around the end of winter so all the guys who like Yenkcha got together and decided it was time to get rid of the Skinny Beast once and for all!
Pretendenti!
It's time to defend ourselves from an onslaught of trained killers who want nothing more than to permanently separate me from a woman who loves me despite me not remembering meeting her.
Preparatevi, tutti!
We'll show these Raiders who's boss.
Heck, I'm pretty in love with me, too!
You must really love Yenkcha!
Wow!
Honestly, kids, I love breathing. Being alive is really really high on my priority list. Some lady I don't remember… not so much.
Well, that's not how she sees it. She sent you a statue to commemorate your triumph!
Well, I know one thing about her. She has excellent taste.
Zoey! Zoey! Look at what we found! It was just sitting in a field and there was nobody in it except a dead guy and he smelled bad so we moved him and look what it is!
Y'all found one a'them Silver Wolf catapults just sittin' there?
Zoey? Why are these kids playing on one of our mortal enemies weapons of death and destruction? Also, what's that smell?
They found it, LT! Looks a bit wore down but I reckon I could get it into working order and maybe even add a little "Zoey Charm" to it in the process.
Um… Floyd? I can't believe I'm saying this but can you help Zoey? I suddenly get the feeling that a lot of explosions are going to occur in the near future.
I suppose I can hold off analyzing the flow pattern of this tree sap until later...
There's no way this could be a bad idea...
Wow Zoey! Setting all that stuff on fire was so fun! Can we have our catapult back now?
I don't know kids. This thing is pretty dangerous, maybe I'll let y'all take it out on the weekends.
Now hold on just a minute there Zoey. I do not think it's particularly wise to be letting these young children have ready access to a machine capable of launching hot death...
Perkins! I want you to supervise these children when they take this murder machine out. Make them sign all the proper paperwork, wear goggles, y'know, be safe.
Stop talking Floyd!
A lot of folks lost everything in that last Raider attack, an' now they are cold and hungry. Can't we send them some food and blankets?
Recoil Ridge ha bisogno del nostro aiuto!
We'll organize a relief effort, but we don't really have any clothes or blankets we can spare. Sounds like we need to build a Sweatshop.
Non pensavo fosse cosi male.
Sweatshops should be available in the Build Menu.
A Sweatshop! This is unconscionable!
but I hate the very idea of Sweatshops.
Lo so, l'abbiamo costruito per aiutare Cresta Contraccolpo,
The Emperor? Nature? It was made in an Imperial Sweatshop. We pay the workers - I don't see what the problem is.
Chi pensi che abbia cucito il tuo camice da laboratorio?
I will not stand for these horrifying working conditions. Zoey, are you willing to stand by while your fellow citizens are forced to stitch pair after pair of itchy, uncomfortable socks?
Heck, no, Floyd! I can't stand itchy socks!
Help Zoey and I make a stand against the Sweatshop. Signs can be built at the Tool Shop!
The Sweatshop workers have issued a statement.
Va bene, Floyd, la protesta sta avendo effetto.
I knew they'd stand by us!

Apparently, a bunch of them complained that your marching, chanting, and folk singing is distracting. They ask that if you continue protesting on their behalf, that you please do it where they don't have to listen.
Non esattamente.
Zoey, sappiamo entrambi che questa non era la mia prima scelta.
But they've forced our hand. We got no choice now.
Naturalmente no, Floyd.
That's right. And with your technical skills, and my Scientific know-how, we can put an end to that Sweatshop. Permanently.
I just hope we're doing the right thing...
Have you seen Floyd and Zoey lately? They've been acting pretty suspicious...
Central air makes them Sweatshops in name only.
I hate to do this, but we saw you setting up the bomb, or whatever it was, at the Sweatshop. You and Zoey are under arrest.
Fine della corsa, Floyd.
What? What are you talking about?
The one I just sent Perkins to disarm.
Lo sai. La bomba.
Bomb?! Do you mean the Air Conditioning unit Zoey and I built?
I'll see if I can repair whatever damage Perkins did.
OK, I realize I must seem like a real jerk here. In my defense, most of the things Zoey makes are at least 50% bomb.
So Morgan, when we were beating up the Raptors, I noticed they occasionally drop teeth. I'd like permission to return to collect more.
… what possible use could you have for animal teeth?
Well, Floyd seems to think that they be used to tame animals at the Animal Trainer. I, uh, am not exactly clear on the mechanics of how that works.
Additionally, one of the Grenadiers made this really spiffy looking necklace. It's got teeth and grenade pins and—
Look, if you guys want to go have "creepy arts and crafts hour" out in the wilderness, that's fine. Just leave me out of it.
Woah. Penso di aver sentito abbastanza.
Well, you see, I grind the teeth into nutritious supplement, which I then...
… he's just jealous of my kickin' abs.
Great work, Captain! The men have already found some teeth! Though I think Morgan might have been right about the crafts...
I call it "The Pathetic Rebel Coward's Sorrow". You see, the jacket symbolizes—
Ehehehehehe, guardate che cosa ho fatto!
What's wrong with you? There is no way that's going to wash out of your uniform!
Ugh. I think... I think someone's lost their crafts privileges. You'd better hang onto these.
Tu! Rimettiti i vestiti all'istante!
Sir! Sir! I've gotten a dispatch from the frontier!
Yep. Just when I was starting to enjoy life again.  What is it, Perkins?
Raiders! They've been attacking supply lines to the south!  Some of the frontier towns are getting cut off from needed shipments!
Hmm. I'm not sure we can afford the troops to take care of this.  I'll have to take a look at our numbers and determine if...
They also intercepted the latest whiskey shipment.
Those bastards! They've gone too far! Ramsey! We're leading an attack to wipe those thieves off the map once and for all!
For the Empire!  For Justice!  For the whiskey!
Note to self: quarantine Perkins until further notice....
You know, Lieutenant, these Raiders seem a lot better organized than the ones we've fought before.  I wonder...?
I wonder if they still have some of the whiskey they took.  Perkins! Search the area!
Sir, are you sure we can spare the troops? You were just saying...
Never quote me to me, Perkins.
The scouts are back! They tracked retreating Raiders to an outpost!
That's... actually pretty good news! Ramsey! Get the men! We're going Raider stomping!
This feels a little too easy...
I don't see a lot of defenses. This should be a piece of cake!
Uh, I wouldn't tempt fate like that if I were you.
We're all the way out here.  What could they possibly do to us?
Maybe launch a dozen missiles, like the ones heading right for us...?
Oh. Well.  There is that...
I should've known better.
Heck, I think I need a change of pants...
Ramsey's right. These Raiders are a lot better organized than the ones we've been fighting so far.
I kinda hate being right in this case.  I wonder what whipped them into shape?
Ti strappo le fuori le budella con le dita dei piedi!
Maybe because they're afraid of HIM?
Imboscata di Mortai
Farò degli scacciapensieri con le vostre gabbie toraciche!
I get the feeling he doesn't like us.
Il tuo sangue nutrirà i miei raccolti!
He's definitely the leader of these Raiders.  Orders, Lieutenant?
The wind itself will turn against you and you'll always have sand in your eyes!
Sheesh, this guy is actually MORE hostile than Taos said he'd be.  Though I'd love to run screaming like a little girl, I don't think we have much of a choice. We fight.
Why do I feel like I'm diving into a meat grinder?
I'll go out on a limb and say we might be able to outthink him.
Holy crap! This guy is brutal!
Ha ha! You oppose Gantas, so I squish your heads like grapes!
Ah, fanatical loyalty to Gantas.  Swell.  How are we supposed to deal with this guy?
Okay, so we have a hyperviolent follower of Gantas who loves shooting missiles at us.  Any ideas on how to deal with him?
Hit him where it hurts.  From the looks of his outpost, it doesn't just store the stuff the Raiders are stealing.  It's also supplying iron to the outside.
If we target his production, he'll get angry. Angrier. Anyway, he might get sloppy.
Meanwhile, I'll be standing over there, where it's safe.
Well, he certainly enjoys his work.
I'll turn your skin inside out!!
Hai rubato il mio ferro?!
Congratulations, gentlemen, we've made the homicidal missile freak mad at us.
Anger leads to mistakes. All we have to do is exploit them as they happen.
Well, when you can fill an entire square mile with explosive death, you don't need a lot of margin for error.
The good news is, Tronk's base camp doesn't have a lot of defensive structures.  The bad news is, it's practically swimming with troops.  It'd be suicide trying to engage Tronk right now.
We'll have to start small - move in, hit a target, then pull back before his forces can counterattack.  I suggest starting with his ammo stores; artillery lives and dies by its ammo, after all.
Do it.  And get Perkins to fetch me some earmuffs.  My ears are still ringing from the last round of explosions.
We'll soften him up before delivering the hammer blow!
Tronk wants violence? We'll give him violence!
Finally!  The path to Tronk is all clear!  Well, clear-ish.
We have to press our advantage before he can regroup.  Move out!
Truppe di Tronk
Le Sbandate Truppe di Tronk
Utilizzerò i vostri teschi vuoti come portasapone!
Huh...  I didn't know Raiders bathed.
You'll pay for invading my outpost, stealing my Iron, and making my boars impotent!
Tu disonori i tuoi antenati con la tua debolezza!
I don't... I don't think you can blame us for that last one.
I'll do unspeakable things to your grandmothers!!
Wow, that was a badass speech. I'm so inspired!
Yeah, yeah, you'll tie our arms and legs into square knots.  Is that all you've got?
You mock our ways? You'll regret that!
I'm already regretting meeting you.  It's one thing to be loyal and determined; it's another to be stupid and suicidal.  Now get out of here before you make *us* mad.
Shock Troopers, for example.
Abbiamo bisogno di alcune varietà nelle nostre fila!
Sir, what's a Shock Trooper, sir?
Um, did they not go over this with you in basic training?
Sir, what is basic training, sir?
Humph... OK. A good soldier works with what he has. A Shock Trooper is a tougher, short-range version of a Trooper. But I prefer hands-on training. Tap the world map and follow me!
Let's go pick a fight with some Raiders.
Let's get going! Tap on the World Map.
Attack the Raiders, then tap on our Outpost when you're ready to go back.
It's like someone just handed this kid a rifle...
That was fun! Their guns shoot more bullets than mine!
THAT's your take-away from this? Maybe we should make this training a regular thing.
Shock Troopers are really brave and resist suppression better than regular Troopers!
Sergeant Ramsey, sir, what are these green metal things that look like little pineapples? And why do they have these pins in them?
Those are grenades! Give them to me... carefully!
Dah! Perkins!
Sorry, sir - I didn't know! Lieutenant Morgan gave them to me and ordered me to learn how to juggle.
Whew... All right, come with me. We're gonna learn some more about Grenadiers.
Do I screw everything up?
Perkins has not failed. We have failed HIM.
So what have we learned today?
Not to touch things that aren't ours?
Well... sure. Yes.
The Troopers can't shoot the Raiders behind those rocks. Lob some grenades over there!
Sir, Ramsey, sir! Where are the "mortars"? Morgan told me to drop this "primed potato" into the tube as part of my training.
What? No, no! C'mere kid - let's go teach you about using Mortars. We'll scout around the Outpost until we find a group of Raiders we can attack.
I'm sure glad Morgan has plenty of free time out here.
Sometimes I do things right!
Okay - give me the number one take-away from today's lesson.
A mortar is not a potato gun.
Outstanding, Specialist Perkins!
The Mortars can reach even further behind the rock cover than the Grenadiers can.
This outpost is shaping up quite well, Captain! But we could be doing even better if we were to upgrade some of our buildings. As we upgrade, our buildings and farms will produce more.
For example, our Stone Quarry could produce Stone even faster. By upgrading, we can double its output!
Tap on the Stone Quarry and Upgrade the building!
Upgrading when you can afford it is always a smart strategy!
When the upgrade is finished, tap on the Stone Quarry to complete the process!
We'll be running at full capacity in no time!
Very nice. Our Stone production is way up now!
This outpost is shaping up quite well, Captain! But we could be doing even better if we were to upgrade some of our buildings. As we upgrade, our buildings and farms will produce more.
For example, our Stone Quarry could produce Stone even faster. By upgrading, we can double its output!
Upgrading when you can afford it is always a smart strategy!
We'll be running at full capacity in no time!
Very nice. Our Stone production is way up now!
If we're going to reach the capacity and strength the Empire requires, we'll need even more Stone than this.
True enough - we've got a lot to build. Let's do your upgrade thing to the Stone Quarry again!
Just repeat the same upgrade process as before!
I didn't think I could be this excited about civil engineering. I wonder if Floyd drugged me somehow...
Ah, efficiency! Look how much more Stone we're producing!
I have to admit, upgrading is definitely the way to go.
Remember, almost all of the outpost's buildings can be upgraded!
So, I was talkin' to Floyd, and well, I was hopin' maybe my tool shop could get a little boost too...
Y'know, just fer efficiency and what not.
Ehi là Capitano!
We can save lots of time and resources by removin' the safe guards.
I'll weld all kindsa stuff!
Aw Cap'n, yer the best! I can't wait to get in there and start weldin' stuff together!
Now, we call upon the honored spirits of our sacred ancestors to honor the sacred bonds and give us the strength to pass on our ebullient life force to our progeny for another year.
And then Daro sets the animal traps and Taro and I wait in ambush, and then we slaughter anything that comes near and then we eat cookies!
Well… I'm glad y'all kids are so involved in your community.
Hey, Captain! Our little Raider friends offered to help. I already inducted them as honorary Imperial Wee Cadets!
Wow. You have the coolest Tool Shop ever, Zoey!
I know, right? So to get these guys trained up, I'm gonna need some tools for each of them. Help me out, will ya?
I certainly wouldn't argue if you wanted to build me a second or third Tool Shop to get this done quicker!
Now that I have my own team of Tool Kids, the Raiders won't be able to count all our vehicles! Wait - never mind, Morgan told me Raiders can't count anyway.
With the kids' help, we can get a real assembly line going! Let's get rollin' on this Vehicle Factory!
This is gonna be so much fun! Find the Vehicle Factory in the Build Menu!
I'm so excited! My very own Vehicle Factory! I wonder what I should work on first...
Well, I figure it won't be long before y'all start smashin' the heck outta these vehicles.
Well, I mean, it's not like I'm going to go out of my way to smash them, but, yeah, probably there'll be a lot of smashing.
All our damaged vehicles will get fixed up there.
Faremmo meglio a costruire un Centro Riparazioni prima o poi.
Imagine if we tried fixin' 'em at the hospital. Nuts!
My stance is "against."
Was it Floyd? I bet it was Floyd. That guy is always building stuff all over the place like it's so cool to build things.
Chi ha autorizzato la costruzione di questo Centro di Riparazioni?
I figured we needed it so we could keep our vehicles runnin' and such.
Er, sono stato io, LT.
Just… don't build anything else with robots without asking. You know my stance on robots, Zoey. I've been very clear on this.
Credo che stia bene.
Hey, Floyd, these vehicles I'm buildin' ain't gonna run on enthusiasm alone...
You're right - we need fuel! We're a little short on Oil right now. Lucky for us, basic vehicles can run on a fuel derived from plants we grow right here on base! Well, their byproducts anyway...
We'll need some raw materials first.
Great - now I'll just convert these plants to a fluid we can use in the fuel tanks!
Perkins, Floyd asked us to, uh, PROCESS, these plants into fuel at the Boar Ranch. Take a look at the plans he gave me.
Well, that's not so bad, it looks like we just have to... oh.
Yeah.
And then... and we squeeze that?
Yup.
So we take the... fluid... and...
Floyd's understanding of science is terrifying.
Please... never make me do that again.
Before we let 'em loose on bigger stuff, my crew needs to cut their teeth on somethin' a touch simpler. How about we start 'em with a Scout Bike?
Scout Bikes are like Shock Troopers on wheels.
We're gonna build a ramp in the backyard and do sweet jumps!
Lieutenant... I hate asking you for somethin', especially at a time like this, but...
The Empire isn't the enemy, Sheriff, even if we do tend to blow stuff up that doesn't need blowing up.  Lay it on me.

Life in Recoil Ridge is usually simple: we farm, we mine, we keep to ourselves. So we don't need much. But with all those Raider attacks lately, we're doing more militia training and building. Our food supplies are gettin' stretched mighty thin.
Ah, food.  What would life be without it? Sure, Sheriff, we can probably spare some grub in exchange for future barbeque consideration.
Life without food isn't worth living!
You can't take the Empire out of the man.
That should do it. We'll send a caravan to take it down to Recoil Ridge for you.
Much obliged, Lieutenant. This'll help us out 'til we get back on our feet.

Even better, each item has the official Imperial Industries brand label on them, so every time one of your citizens eats, they'll be reminded of whose generosity and raw military power brought them their sustenance!
… And here I thought you might be learning what it's like to be a good frontier citizen.
Morgan, I want in on tracking down the Silver Wolves. They made me look like a chump, and I don't like it!
You've got nothing to prove to any of us, Ramsey.  But I understand - and heartily approve of - your instincts for revenge.  Now we just need to figure out where they are...
I can help with that. Some of my own people have been victims of their con, so I tracked 'em to a camp west of Recoil Ridge. I was gonna go after 'em, but then the Raiders came, and…
That's all I need! Troopers, move out!
Hurt my body all you want. Hurt my pride - you have to pay!
I'm certainly not standing in Ramsey's way, literally or otherwise.
Sergeant Ramsey reporting, sir. The Silver Wolves have been defeated, and the food is safely in the hands of Sheriff Colt.
Excellent work, Ramsey. It's nice to have something relatively easy to squish.  We need a break from heavily armed and hugely muscled Raiders once in a while.
Speaking of Raiders, can we find some to shoot now? After all those Silver Wolves, I feel PUMPED!
Sheriff Colt needs help with the Winter Jubilee... Huh, I guess that's how they celebrate Festivus out here.
It'll be a huge party, and he wants to have some of it here at the outpost... but that means we need decorations!
A little holiday cheer helps everyone!
Those Raider children want toys!
That seems natural enough.  And pretty simple to make, too... Maybe I can save some Gold by making them myself.
I can't wait to see their little faces!
We really need to upgrade from this tent city we've got going on. I've been in the service too long to be waking up with backaches.
Wait... are you saying you need a house? I can do that! I've never built one before - this will be fun!
Hmm... Hovels have lots of room for workers. They're in the Housin' category of the Build Menu.
Now that Zoey is around I feel... not safe.
All done building the Hovels, LT! I didn't know where you wanted it, so I built it on retractable tank treads. You can move it wherever you like!
I'm sorry... what?
Just try not to overheat the engine, or it might start a fire in the ammo magazine. And THAT would be bad.
I am so sick of the Cabbage that Floyd keeps growing for everybody. I need some real food!
Ooh! I love real food! Can I help? I've got this idea for a Bakery I've been itchin' to try out!
Ehm...
Thanks, LT!
The Bakery's in the Shops category of the Build Menu.
We need to give that girl something to do before she 'helps' us to death.
All set! I rigged up a spare jet engine to help speed up baking times. The oven now goes from 0 to 1600 degrees in 1.4 seconds!
Ah, a bakery! I've always loved the smell of freshly baked... wait... is that jet fuel?
Don't you worry none about the smell. I'm sure it will go away once we fire up the engines - I mean, ovens a couple of times. Here, let me bake somethin' for you!
Bakery jobs are a great way of earning Gold and XP!
All done! Now where'd Floyd run off to?
Ever since we built that Hovel, the residents have been complaining about noise from the Camps and Settlements. Is there some way we can relocate them?
Technically, yes... but we run the risk of eminent domain violations -
Floyd, I don't know what that is, and I'm pretty sure that you just made it up.
You need some distance between the Camps and the Hovel I built? Don't you boys worry, I'll take care of it!
Tap the Move button to relocate the Hovel. If you hear any complainin', tap the Sell button.
There. Now that that's off my plate, I'm going to declare inbox bankruptcy. If something is truly urgent, I'll get another message about it.
Told ya those retractable tank-treads would come in handy!
Tutto fatto, LT!
Zoey, you drove that house RIGHT ON TOP OF MR. PURRFACE!
NOOO!!!
Meow!
Oh, no, he's fine. Sorry. False alarm. Come here, kitty... That must have been so scary!
In the Outpost! I was attacked!
Zombies!
That's impossible! The biology just doesn't make any sense. Where is the energy coming from? How are they breaking down raw materials into fuel in order to—
Zombies?
They came outta nowhere and attacked me! What the heck is goin' on?
I just killed a bunch of Zombies!
Okay, stay calm. Get people inside. Ramsey, you head out to investigate. See if we can figure out what's going on.
Zombies?!
That frog lookin guy hits the back row harder than the front! I'd bet he can't hit worth a damn up close.
This is absurd. Zombies are a myth! It's impossible to reanimate dead tissue! Even nanopods can't bring people back from the dead!
Say what you want, Floyd, but I know what I saw. I saw Zombies. You're so sure there's no such thing, why don't you head out with us and look into it?
I think I'll do exactly that. Now, let's see what we're *really* dealing with!
I know a Zombie when I see one.
A giant enraged monster who attacks people indiscriminately? Gee, we've never seen anything like that around here before.
Huh... now, call me crazy, but maybe trading punches with this guy at close range isn't the best strategy.
I'd bet that scythe zombie probably hits hardest when he's close quarters. If we can keep him away, he'll be easier to beat.
Ow, ow, ow, ooooow! Armor piercing anti-tank cannons!
Since the Captain's taking their time on making the "right choice" with this infecting-our-own-troops thing, I took the liberty of finding a volunteer for the experiment.
Do you have… any idea… how unethical this is?
Morgan! This Trooper is drunk!
It's not really that bad. What? Get that look off your face.
… … … This sort of reminds me of how Perkins joined our beloved army.
Aren't you the one always telling us to do things we don't want to do in the name of Science? This time it just involves alcohol. Besides, he was in the Hospital - what else did he have to do?
That's totally different. C'mon, Floyd!
Morgan volun-told this poor Trooper.
So, these Zombies... that your fault?
I mean... not me personally? But yeah, basically.
Swell. You think you gonna take care of 'em?
I'm on it.
At least they're pretty fun to take out.
So, this is the Zombie motherland.
Indeed. An Imperial cost cutting measure gone very, very wrong.
Or an Imperial super soldier program gone just a little bit wrong.
Ramsey's got a point.
Let's wipe 'em out!
Sirs, we've, uh, we've received this letter, and, well—
Perkins, what part of "take care of my mail" makes it sound like I want you to come talk to me about letters?
Well, sir, it's just that this one is from the Civic League of New Haven, and the Silver Wolves have that place pretty much locked down. It's kind of their headquarters.
So the Silver Wolves sent us a letter?
An invitation, really. They want to meet on the road near Shigurman's Bluff and "discuss our mutual interests."
Shigurman's Bluff? Seriously? It might as well just say "this is a trap!" We'll meet 'em, but we'll be ready.
How does Perkins always know all this stuff?
Better to err on the side of giant guns.
I'll be a lot more comfortable knowing that Sniper has our backs.
Really? After everything the Silver Wolves have done, you're happy with ONE Sniper?
Yeah, you're right. Tell you what, let's bring all the tanks and rockets and stuff too.
All right, Ramsey, is everything ready?
Absolutely, sir. Both the counter ambush, and the counter-counter-counter ambush are in place.
And the counter-counter-counter-counter-counter ambush?
Well, I found a pretty big rock to throw, but I think instead of carrying it, I should probably just find a rock AT the meeting site.
So you want to show up unarmed? You make me sick, Perkins.
Why can't I just bring my rifle?
Drop your weapons!
Cosi è abbastanza vicino!
Seriously? You invited us! You have to pretend this is a real meeting, at least until we let our guard down. THEN you start the ambush.
Ambush? What... what are you talking about?
Dude, you're terrible at this. You ambush, then I'll counter ambush, THEN you come out with your real ambush. You don't just threaten us before we even start talking to anyone!
Counter ambush? We told you we came in peace! Silver Wolves, shoot to kill!
Where did these guys learn to ambush?
So, I don't really trust those guys.
Woah, woah, gentlemen. This is a big misunderstanding. I'd say your pessimism and paranoia got the better of you, mister...
It's Lieutenant Morgan. And my pessimism and paranoia are two of my most respectable traits.

Really? A Lieutenant in what army? Look, Morgan, the world is changing rapidly. We're all trying to keep up. You guys have the knowhow and the training. My associates have the people and the money. I'm thinking we can work something out.
I think you should pack up your band of thugs and get the hell out of here before I get so disgusted I forget to not murder you.
You son of a—
Now, now, boys, no need for name calling. Just keep our offer in mind. Hell, if you want, we'll call you GENERAL Morgan.
How were the ambushes?
Terrible. Total amateur hour. Oh, and they tried to talk us into joining forces.
Wait, like a truce, or... what's their angle?
No idea. But I sure as hell don't trust them.
Ehi, ehm, scusate!
What in hell do you think you're doing here? I told you, we're not interested.
You guys ain't even heard what I'm suggestin'! Look, you guys got all the gear and whatnot you need to deal with stuff like Raiders and Rebels, right? But you got no sense of how to control people.
Excuse me, I happen to have more than one PhD from Cariston University that could be described in exactly the terms you've—
What I'm saying is, you guys got your work cut out for you just surviving. Trying to babysit all these little towns, keep 'em working... we could take that burden off your shoulders.
Yeah, because you've done a bang up job so far. Look, I'm going to be clear with you on this.
There's nothing clearer than bullets.
I mean, I went to school for YEARS.
You just made your last mistake, Morgan.
No. Come on, Doug. We're gonna let them think this over some more. Realize exactly what a bad decision they're making. For everyone.
Morgan, they've got a point. If we went to open war, we'd be pretty evenly matched. Even if we won, there'd be so many casualties...
