Don't worry, Floyd. I'm not gonna go all Ramsey on these guys. But I'm not gonna let them walk in here and pretend they aren't a bunch of thugs and killers, either.
Ms. Aurora, I cannot tell you how refreshing it is to have another trained scientific mind here!  It's been too long since I've been able to talk Science with an intelligent peer!
Actually... I've become weary of theoretical research. This is the most time I've spent out of the Installation in months, and I miss field work. I wish I could return to it, if only for a while...
I see. Well, I need to get specimens of the local fauna for various research projects. Would you like to assist?
I would love to!
It's a bit ecologically damaging, but there's a greater good here.
Always glad to make someone's day!
Ah, that was refreshing! It's been too long since I've been able to get into real blood and guts Science!
I'd be pleased to let you do some of the necropsies, if you like.
Really? A good old-fashioned exploratory surgery? Dissecting muscle tissue and weighing organs? Oh, how marvelous! I feel like a schoolgirl again!
Colonia di Ratti
Branco di Cinghiali
Branco di Raptor
Branco di Mammut
Bugna di Vermi della Sabbia

As exciting as spleens and livers are, my real passion is engineering. That's why I started work with the Installation, after all. But I haven't touched a solder iron or circuit board myself in ages! Can you imagine?
That is certainly a tragedy. Perhaps we can do something about that! How would you like an opportunity to be surrounded by red-hot metal, slaving for hours under stifling protective gear?
… I... I don't know what to say...!
No thanks necessary, my friend. Your smile alone is payment enough.
What's she doin' in my Machine Shop?
Scientists are weirdos.
I don't know how to thank you, Floyd! I haven't felt so alive in years! I even designed a cutting edge Laser Torch through sheer improvisation!
These are the times when Science makes great leaps forward! I'm glad I was able to be a part of it!
Yes, there's nothing like hefting an eight pound wrench during your fifteenth straight hour of punishing experimentation, your mind dizzy with ideas and lack of sustenance!
Indeed.  Moments like that make life the joy it is!
Hey, have you guys seen Ramsey?
Cassidy, as we discussed, he's in his tent.
No, he's not. He hasn't been there for a while.
Aw hell, we need to find him before he does something stupid.
Sir? It looks like one of our recon vehicles is missing...
Cambialo semplicemente con "dobbiamo trovarlo."
I'm no coward.
Over there! I found the recon… and I can see signs of a struggle nearby!
That man has some serious explaining to do.
The trail ends here, sir. Looks like the Sergeant put up a hell of a fight.
I'm still getting a signal from the tracking device he activated, and it's moving. He's been taken prisoner.
Then let's take him back.
Segni di una lotta
OK. How do we get the idiot back?
Well, Ramsey has seen to it that they know we're out here, and they'll be ready for a frontal assault.
We could train Saboteurs! Those guys are amazing!
That sounds great, but are any of you actually qualified to train Saboteurs?
Man, they just run behind the enemy and stick bombs on stuff. We can probably train something just as good.  Like...
I'm going to lord this over Ramsey pretty much forever.
I'm just saying... everyone else will be taking poison.
Look, if they're keeping Ramsey alive, it's probably because they're questioning him, and trying to find us, so... you know...
You guys are safe.
Possono prendermi, ma non mi piegheranno.
Oh! Okay. Because... the Demolitionists are just gonna take poison. But... you know, if you feel like you can just keep quiet, that's, uh... that's fine.
We're all set to go. See you folks soon.
Bring our boy home, Cassidy.
Also, if you were to accidentally wing him a little to teach him a lesson? That would be nice.
Don't think I haven't considered it.
Damn that Ramsey.
Hey, look! There are fresh tire tracks leading down this dirt road.
Giant hidden military complex? Check. 20 foot cement walls around the perimeter? Check.
I'm no Imperial soldier, but if I had to guess, I'd say this is where they're holding Ramsey.
Damn that Ramsey.
Damn that Ramsey.
Let's go!
Cassidy! I can't believe you—
Look, no foolin' around, I like you. I like spending time with you.
But if you think I'm ever, EVER, going to risk my neck because you got some damn fool notion that you need to die for the Empire again, you are sorely mistaken. You will rot before I lift a finger.
Chiudi quella dannata bocca, Ramsey.
That's not—
You say you're sorry, you swear to stop actin' a fool, and we go home.
Zitta!
I'm sorry. You're right.
Damn right I'm right.
Floyd, I heard about the bigfoots! It's just awful!

We were on totally the wrong track all this time! If only we'd gotten funding to research their natural habitat sooner - we'd be years ahead in our understanding! With the Empire gone, who KNOWS when I'll have time to-
Lo è davvero, Zoey!
What the... Floyd! I'm talking about how it turns out they're tool using, problem solving social animals! They're harmless, and we've been gunning them down!
Ah... yes. There is that. What do you suggest?
Well,  why don't we try to keep them out, build fences or something?
I'm willing to give it a shot.
Shoo, bigfoots! Get out of that fence!
Sorry, Zoey, I'm afraid the fences are a little... less than successful.
It's not stopping them?
Well, most of them are going around. Some of them are getting caught in the razor wire. Mostly juveniles. They won't stop crying.
OK, the fences were a bad idea. There was a lot of blood, and we all felt really bad. But I've got a new idea! Since they're attacking because they're hungry, let's just try feeding them!
I don't know about this, Zoey. Floyd asked me to help, but I feel like—
Don't worry, Perkins, you leave the thinking and the feeling to me. Just collect the food and carry it out to the bigfoots.
Oh... OK. Yes, ma'am.
I've heard they're very gentle.
The cure is worse than the disease.
Zoey, aiuto!
What's wrong?
It's the bigfoots! Now that I've fed them, they won't stop following me around. They're getting pretty aggressive!
Don't worry, Perkins, I can solve this. What do you know about the stink glands from skunks?
OK, so the fences are covered in blood and bigfoot fur, Perkins smells like a skunk and it hasn't really stopped the bigfoots from following him, and nothing has really pushed the bigfoots back.
Why am I here?
Because you're going to help me save the bigfoots! We're going to install some sirens, and they'll go off whenever a bigfoot comes near. That'll scare 'em off for sure.
I'm not so sure about this.
IT WAS ALL HER IDEA!
THE SIRENS. YOU NEED TO TURN THEM OFF.
ZOEY.
WHAT?
THE SIRENS NEVER STOP SOUNDING. YOU NEED TO TURN THEM OFF NOW.
OVER THE SIRENS. I DON'T THINK THEY'RE WORKING OUT THAT WELL.
NON TI SENTO
Vorrei parlare con te.
Oh, Elder Taos... uh, sure.
This is not easy to discuss. The Sasquatch will be moving into our territory soon—
Bigfoots? You're seriously worried about bigfoots? We get bigfoots in our basements and warehouses all the time. Just chase them out with a broom.

I am not afraid of the... bigfoots. But there is a migration every five hundred years. I am worried that with the recent chaos, they may trample our crops or chase our livestock. We will be ill prepared to defend ourselves.
Defend yourselves? We're talking about BIGFOOTS. Bang some pots together. Still, this migration sounds interesting. I'll give it a look.
Bigfoots are attracted to bright colors.
Nothing like Science to get the blood pumping.
Wow, I've never seen bigfoots be this aggressive. What's gotten into them?
It is part of the cycle. The old spiderwasp queen dies, and aggressive food collection by the hive's workers drives other animals south.
Spiderwasps? Are these a local insect?
They live in the north. Spiderwasp is a nickname. The full name is Spiderwaspbearbeetle.
Oh, THIS I need to see.
Hey, Floyd?  Noticed anything... unusual lately?
I have been a little occupied with my research... Why do you ask?
Oh, no reason.  I was just wondering what you knew about what bigfoots eat.
Well, they're omnivores, like most primates...  Again, why do you ask?
Because we need to deal with the several dozen bigfoots who have invaded our outpost and are eating every scrap of food we have.
What are you talking ab– Hey, there are bigfoots all over the place! Why didn't someone tell me about this?
You'd think he'd at least notice the smell.
Did I say secret stash? I have no such thing.  Really.
Amazing! I've never seen bigfoots eat so much!  Oh, I do hope this happens again so I can take better notes!
If this happens again, you'll be too busy cooking Perkins into a stew to care about notes.  How about you concentrate on how to keep them from starving us to death?
Oh, that's simple.  Either this culling will scare the others into moving on, or they'll do it themselves... once they've eaten all the food.
Marvelous.  Lucky for me I still have my secret stash of frozen burritos.
Well, I have good news and bad news.  The good news is, the bigfoots have moved on.
I noticed.  Lack of bigfoots is just as obvious as their presence.  So what's the bad news?
They had to go somewhere. And right now they're ravaging neighboring frontier towns, including Sundale, a farming community.

Oh, man, the bigfoots will be like locusts... only without wings.  And bigger.  And hairier.  And smellier.  And with hands instead of pinchers.  So really, not that much like locusts, other than the eating... anyway, the point is, they're gonna need our help.
These things eat more than Ramsey after a bad day.
Floyd can be so cold.

Y'know, if these bigfoots are gonna continue to be a problem, maybe we should find bigger and meaner critters who'll be their predators.  No, wait, we could BREED some!  We could start introducing them everywhere...
Brilliant, Morgan.  Nothing could possibly go wrong with that.  Leave the Science to me, please?
You know, it would be nice if once, just once, you were happy when I took an interest.
Sir, we're getting reports from Trotbeck - it's—
Silver Wolves, Rebels, or Raiders?
Uh, bigfoots, sir.
Really? It's just so silly. I mean, who's scared of a bigfoot? Just open your arms up wide to look big, and they'll scurry off into the bushes.
I usually chase 'em off by clapping real loud.
I enjoy startling the Skinny Beast.
Now, aren't you the least bit concerned what's causing this?
Beh, tu hai certamente curato il sintomo.
It is unusual for the bigfoots to continue their southern rampage this long. There is something wrong in their homelands.
Mamma Pierce ha ragione.
You need to stop sneaking up on people like that. How did you even know I was here?
TAOS. SERIAMENTE.
Your servant boy, Perkins, informed me.
If Taos is right, and the bigfoots are more aggressive than ever, we should investigate their natural habitat.
What's their natural habitat? Don't they just live in sewers and eat people's garbage?

Now, Morgan, those are just myths. Bigfoots are actually clever, curious creatures. Sometimes they wander into our settlements, and they wind up hiding in a basement or drainpipe out of fear or confusion, but most of them live peacefully in the northwest.
I'll believe it when I see it.
Bigfoots like simple shapes and puzzles.
My goodness! The level of complexity is far beyond what we expected.
Really? It's just a bunch of crappy little lean-tos.
Morgan, they've built shelters! Look at the logs around the fire! They clearly have complex social behaviors!
Well, it looks like they've pretty much abandoned the place.
And I think I see why. Spiderwasps!
I think those hollowed out logs are used as cribs!
Something is upsetting the natural order.
Hopefully now the bigfoots will come home and do whatever dumb stuff bigfoots normally do.
Beh, non è stato così brutto.
The spiderwasp forces we just defeated are likely worker drones. They were just out collecting food. It seems their new queen is still hungry.
Sinceramente, non ci credo.
So, if those are just worker drones, and we kill all of them, doesn't that solve the problem?

First, it's unlikely that we could accomplish such a goal. Second, they appear to be an apex predator. Wiping them out would likely further upset the ecosystem, and have massive unintended consequences.
What do you recommend?

Well, longer term, I'm going to need to do some research, and see if I can figure out why their collection of nourishment is taking longer than normal. In the short term, I'd say we should focus on defeating the more aggressive warrior spiderwasps that have advanced on our position.
What are you talking... oh, those guys. Yipes.
I blame Floyd for distracting me.
Has any problem ever been fixed by itself?
Forget it, I'm going home.
Sai cosa?
Morgan, we can't just ignore this problem. Something very bad is happening out here.
I'm not ignoring it. I'm just admitting when I've got too much on my plate. Between Rebels, Silver Wolves, and civil unrest, I can't tackle this right now.
Well, don't leave it on the back burner too long. This isn't getting fixed by itself.
Without raindrops, the mighty oak rots in the dirt. Only a seed.
Gah! It's her! But... she's alone? And she's not attacking us?
I think... she needs our help?
In the dark of a cave, a single spark shines so bright.
Aha, I believe she does! And she has a list of... Hm. I think she wants us to make these for her?
And why exactly should we help her? And what if it's a trap?
Well, she could sneak in and murder us all in our sleep at her discretion if she wanted to. Perhaps if we aid her now, she'll become an ally? Or at least spare us later.
The man has a point.
I don't look good in a straitjacket. But then, who does?
What... What the hell...?
Just lookin' at this stuff kinda gives me the creeps!
She was very specific about what she wanted. I must admit that I can't make heads or tails of it...
The day I understand Crazy Blades is the day you can send me to an asylum.
A wolfpack shares every kill. The lone wolf howls alone, dies alone.
Floyd? You seem to be our Crazy Blades translator. Got any ideas?
Hmm. If I had to guess, given her body language, I'd say she wants us to follow her somewhere.
Can we trust her?
I don't know if the concept of "trust" really applies. It's not like she's lied to us about her intentions...
Oops, there she goes... I guess we should follow her, then.
The old man gave us fire. Soon, he will give fire to all people.
What's she doing?
It looks like she's digging for something. Perhaps she's trying to find another component of whatever it is she's trying to—
There she is! The failure! The Madwoman who couldn't protect the great Warlord Gantas! Blades in Moonlight, you die today!
Looks like we've got company. I guess Crazy Blades is busy with her... sticks, so I guess it's up to us.
I'm actually defending Crazy Blades... This must be a bad dream...
The fool only sees. The wise also know.
Whew. They're gone. And it looks like Crazy Blades finally finished digging. Wonder what she OH MY GOD WHAT IS THAT?!
I think... I think I'm gonna be sick...
It's dripping and it's stinky and... Oh, god, is it *alive*?!
Secrets slumber deep below, dreaming of those who slouch in their footsteps.
Okay, I think this time ignorance is bliss. I'm... I'm going to go over there... far away from... that thing...
The farmer must redouble his reaping as summer ends. Our summer ends soon.
I think she's saying she's almost done... but that the hard part is coming up.
I'll take your word for it. I'm not the philosophical type.
I'm more the direct, shoot-up-the-place type.
Cracks in the mirror cast a poor reflection.
Hmm, this is a tough one... It might have something to do with those Bigfoots and mammoths over there. It seems she wants us to get rid of them for her.
Ehh, well, if nothing else, it's good target practice.
Don't forget to bundle up; it's cold out there.
If we're our own worst enemy, maybe we oughta start imprisoning ourselves?
Ah! It appears she needed the space for some kind of ancient Raider ceremony. The anthropological implications are staggering!
It looks to me like she's juggling the skull while hopping backwards on one foot around the roast and screaming like an eagle.
Please, Morgan, you can't pass judgment on another culture like that.
Well, MY culture gave me booze and tanks, so I feel safe in saying— Huh, looks like she's done. So is it over? Does she need any more help?
To the old man, we are so small. Ants. The way he sees us. But he is wrong. He thinks us small. We are not ants. We are stars.
... And we're back to ominous again. Did we just help create yet another threat against ourselves?

Living on the far side of nowhere has sharpened all the wrong skills. If we're going to cross hundreds of miles of Rebel held territory, we need to practice taking on a modern military with modern defenses.
But sir, we don't have those kind of training facilities.
Then we'll improvise, Perkins.
Fighting all these Raiders has dulled our skills.
We need to stop wasting time.
All right, boys, time for combat maneuvers.
Get out there and remind yourselves what an army looks like.
Let's get this over with.
Our boys'll need every edge we can give.
I hope I know what I'm doing.
Looking good. We might actually pull this off.
We'll need plenty of fuel for both the vehicles and our troops.
We'll collect oil for the journey, and I'll get our sweatshops to work assembling MREs.
We'll need supplies to stay in this for the long haul.
God speed, gentlemen.
That should do it, Morgan. You've got enough to stay mobile for months.
Let's hope we don't need it.
Addestramento Difensivo

After dissecting the Spiderwasp, I've determined that the local fauna have been dying off because of chemical pesticides introduced into the environment. Since they're unable to find food for their queen, they've become more aggressive and widespread.
Just so you know, that definitely wasn't my fault. I learned my lesson after my self-replicatin' farmin' robots became sentient and warped into a crop destroyin' hive mind.
I'm not sure who it was who introduced the pesticides. Possibly Raiders or other locals in an attempt to protect their crops. We'll need to do some further investigation.
So in the meantime, what are you going to do with the Spiderwasp we captured?
I suppose we could eat it? I mean, that seems to be how this works, doesn't it?
Intelligent self-replicatin' farmin' robots seemed like a good idea at the time...
....we seem to eat everything else around here.
I am starving. Perkins, make me a sandwich.
Try this instead, Lieutenant.
Ugh! What the hell is this? This is so god awful, it's basically an assassination attempt. Floyd, this stew is an act of treason.
I suppose I should've marinated the Spiderwasps for longer... are they not tender enough?
Floyd, bugs are gross.
C'è carne di Vespide in questa roba?
Something's rustling out in the fields. You stay put, I'm gonna go check it out.
That ain't no raccoon. It's a Silver Wolves raiding party. And I got no time to get backup.
Ehi Ma!
Dannazione.
Why would the Silver Wolves attack here?
…Can I go now?
I got my scope trained right on you. Just what the hell are you doing in my orchard?
Non ti muovere.
We're sorry! We were short on supplies and got hungry!
I wasn't born yesterday. If you don't want a bullet between your eyes I figure you better get real honest fast.
We planned a distraction in Recoil Ridge so we could lure the Imperials out of The Outpost. We had no idea anyone here would've stopped us so quickly.
Ok, OK!
Damn it. I better go warn Ramsey.
The Silver Wolves should be thanking me for the opportunity to witness such a glorious display of combat ability!
Come ci si sente?!
What are you doing all the way out here?
Ramsey!
Cosa state facendo VOI qui fuori?
What's it look like? I'm trying to save your ass.
... I just want to keep her safe.
Word from The Outpost is more Silver Wolves are on their way. I'd better head back, and you should go back to Recoil.
I'm coming with you. I just took down an entire ambush. I think you could use the help.
Where the hell have you been? It's too early in the goddamn morning for this kind of nonsense.
Ramsey!
I cut some of the Silver Wolves off heading up south, sir.
South? Cassidy, did this idiot go all the way to Recoil Ridge just to check up on you?
I mean, it was to our best tactical advantage to head in that direction.
Allora...
I've officially decided I don't care. Just drive them off so I can go back to sleep.
If this isn't resolved by 11 AM I'm going back to bed anyways.
Something about her makes me blurt out the truth. It's... somewhat uncomfortable.
Ramsey, I've been thinking.
Yes, I came to check up on you! I worry about you!
Mi dispiace!
Oh I already knew that. I mean, I've been thinking about me. I don't want to be tending orchards all my life. Ma and Pa will be disappointed, but I gotta to do something for me.
Are you coming to The Outpost?
I've got to think about it first.
I know. You want to know if I made a decision yet.
If this wasn't an apocalyptic wasteland, I'd invite you to a coffee shop. Somewhere quiet we could talk.
We have coffee in the Convenience Store, but I don't want to drink that crap. Morgan's got a stash he thinks I don't know about.
So what if Morgan finds out I stole his coffee? The more demerits he gives out, the less they matter...
…You do what you think is best.
At first I thought I should come to The Outpost, because I really like you. But in some ways I think that'd just be like staying with my family and that wouldn't do me any good.
Where will you go?
Installation 17. They need to learn to defend themselves, and I think I can help.
Cass, I don't know if you'll be safe up there.
Sneaking up on them Silver Wolves made me realize I got a talent that would be a shame to waste, and I could do some real good up there.
Nulla di cui essere sicuri.
Our scouts have reported Rebel troops in the area! They're on the move!
Signore!
What? That's strange; I thought they were done with this region.
I can head down, take a look see.
You're not going anywhere just yet. I'll scout it out myself. Also, Perkins will be there.
You go AWOL one time!
Holy crap! I think it's eating through my uniform!
What the... *cough* heck was that?!
My eyes are still... *cough* burning! Our masks didn't help at all!
If the Rebels have weapons like this...! We have to figure out what this is and how to fight it, fast!
It sounds like the Rebels have some form of chemical weapon.  Amazing! I wonder if they're going with bio or synthetic... er... not that I approve. Chemical warfare is beneath contempt.
Well, it's not beneath the Rebels. What can we do to stop them?
Without samples? Nothing. There are dozens of known chemical agents, and I can't even begin to form a plan without knowing exactly which one we are dealing with.
Fortunately, we know a group with plenty of samples. Unfortunately, we'll have to get them the hard way...
I mean from the sound of things they're using a corrosive, but...
I can't feel my toes!
Sir, I'm getting dizzy just handling this stuff...
Then I suggest you hold your breath, Perkins. These chemicals are important... unlike some people.
Sir! That was extraordinarily hurtful, sir!
Morgan, we have an issue. It'll take time to properly analyze the chemicals, and I don't think that keeping them in Perkins's footlocker is a good idea.
No? I was going to have him just carry them around, but it seemed like he might hurt other people.
I could draw up plans for a containment facility. It'll have thick walls, security codes - everything you could need! We could store this stuff without much danger to anyone.
Zoey, making something that SAVES lives... I could get used to this!
Boy, cause a few explosions and everyone thinks you're "dangerous"...
Why don't we just shave with chainsaws?
Ta-da! One Chemical Storage Facility!
For such a huge building, it sure doesn't store much...
I needed to use most of the space for triple-reinforced concrete walls! The stuff ate right through the double-reinforced walls I tried first.
Awesome.
E lo stiamo immagazzinando nel bel mezzo del nostro avamposto.
Well, I've started on my analysis of the chemicals, but it's slow going. I'll need more samples. I'm still shocked that the Rebels would stoop this low.
Speaking of the Rebels, looks like they're snooping around that same region we found 'em in earlier.
Sounds like we can kill two birds with one stone. The Rebels should have at least a little more of this stuff.
Hold on! You're not facing those monsters without protection this time!
A Hazmat Suit in time saves nine hours of decontamination.
Math is a merciless mistress.
These should make sure we're safe from the Rebels' chemical attacks.  Relatively speaking, anyway.
Shouldn't we start full scale production of Hazmat Suits?
Are you kidding? Do you know how much that'd cost? It'll be cheaper to just treat our injured at the Hospital.
Economics is the ugliest Science of all.
All suited up?  Good.  Now, we should return as soon as possible once we find more samples.  Fresh is good!
Since when does Floyd have authority over us?
Hey, if YOU want to be in charge of the incredibly lethal chemicals, be my guest.
Please do not drop, shake, or scare the deadly chemicals.
AWK-ward...
So, I've been able to work out the origins of the chemicals. They're organic, which means they have to be grown, not mixed, and only under very controlled conditions.
So, if we take out the lab where they're brewing this stuff, we can cut it off at the source! That'll teach those inhuman monsters a thing or two about trying to fight us with poison!
Well, that's the thing. I did some digging and it seems pretty clear that the source is, uh... it's us. The Empire had a skunk works bio lab somewhere in the southwest working on this stuff.
Oh. Uh... Well. Hmm.
Morgan, if I'm going to be working with these chemicals, I'll need a separate facility to examine and process them.
Say no more.  If we ever want to start using these chemical weapons ourselves, we'll need someplace designed to handle them anyway.
Exactly... Wait, what?
Now we are all sons of bitches.
What's wrong?  Doesn't this meet all your specifications?
Yes, but what's that you said before about USING the chemical weapons?  I thought I was just researching a way to counter them!
Not the fun, low key Look-At-Those-Silly-Rebels war. We're fighting to survive. NOT using the chemicals puts us at a huge disadvantage against the Rebels.
You and I don't have the luxury of doing the right thing. We need to keep our people alive.
Floyd, siamo in guerra.
Damn it, that's pretty compelling.
Sì, ma...!

Hey LT, do ya got a sec? With all the Rebels around, I... I feel like I'm goin' a little crazy.  I keep thinking about them going to Cariston and destroying everything... everyone... I've gotta do SOMETHING!
Well, there might be something you can do. Do you think you might be wracked by ethical questions and doubts about the morality of using terrible agents of death against fellow human beings?
No!
That's my girl! So we have all these lethal chemicals we've stolen from the Rebels, and I think it's high time we give them a taste of their own toxic medicine.  Any ideas?
Hmmm. While I was down at the Barracks, they were trainin' Flame Troopers. I bet I could rig up somethin' like that, but for sprayin' poison instead.
When you don't know what to do, improvise!
The farmers ain't gettin' their sprayers back.
Interesting getup you've created there.

I used old fire extinguishers and borrowed some pesticide sprayers from the Farm.  It uses the same idea as our flamethrowers. Only instead of hot flaming death, it deals out gassy, choking death! Pretty cool, huh?
You know, Morgan, now that we have Chem Troopers, we should test them under actual battle conditions...
Sure. The Rebels will probably return to that chemical weapons lab.  We know the general region it must be in. If we intercept them somewhere along the way...
Exactly. We can give them a taste of their own medicine!
Did Floyd tell you that stuff is medicine? Because it's not.
These Chem guys kinda creep me out.
Perkins just needs a little extra help is all.
Woo! It's sure different when this stuff is on OUR side. Those Rebels hardly knew what hit 'em!
Your delight is both understandable and slightly frightening, Ramsey. At any rate, the Chem Troopers have proven their worth.
Definitely. I'm thinking of training Perkins in gas handling and dispersal.
Seriously? You'd trust *Perkins* with chemical weapons?  Are you sure you didn't inhale some of that gas, Ramsey?
Wow, it's amazing how unstable this chemical stuff is.  One wrong move, and you'd die a really HORRIBLE, NASTY death! It's so cool!
I just wish we didn't have to spray it all over the place...
Ehm... Sì. Forte.
Oh, I've been thinkin' about that. What about grenades? Then we can throw the poison really far, an' we won't have to worry about the wind or nothin'!
Hmm, grenades... Could work!  Just... make sure the pins are in securely, all right?
Sometimes I wonder if I'm enjoying this project TOO much...
They're like the best Easter eggs ever!
All done!
Perché sono così colorati?
Oh, the kids wanted to help, so I let them decorate after I finished.
OK, Ramsey, these grenades are lighter than the plain-old explodey ones; y'all should probably teach the troops how to throw 'em right...
The Empire mandates realistic training scenarios! And there's nothing more realistic than gassing real Rebels!
I feel like I should be slightly disturbed by your recent attitude, Ramsey. Huh. Have fun, boys!
What? All I want is bloody revenge! Is that so wrong?
Hey! I didn't spend all that time making bug bombs!
The Rebels are getting meaner. I think they're angry we're interfering with their chemical salvaging operation.
All the more reason to keep on harassing them, then. I just wish WE knew where that hidden chemical lab was...
We could use it - those Bio Grenadiers kicked ass out there!
Sure did... Hey, let me have one of those grenades. My wine cellar has a bit of an ant problem.
Morgan, we need to talk.
Yeah, you're probably right. Your attitude is becoming...
We need to go on the offensive.  Drive the Rebels back towards the south, away from us, AND from the Imperial lab - wherever it is.
Oh, you just wanted to talk about the Rebels again. Yeah, go ahead and shoot 'em or whatever.
I thought Ramsey was finally opening up to me.
Moral relativism!
So, while I was watching the battles from a safe distance, upwind, I was thinking about the ethics of warfare.
Uh… yeah?
Basically, I've decided that if someone wants to kill me and everyone I know, I don't care if they get poisoned.
Hey, LT, I'm still kinda nervous about the Rebels, but they gave me an idea. We can probably use these chemical weapons to protect our home, here.
You have my attention.
I was watchin' Yaro, Taro, and Daro play in our sprinkler system, and I thought, why not rig up somethin' like that to spray poison gas when it notices bad guys?
Watching children at play made you want to set up sprinklers that will disperse deadly chemical weapons in the middle of our outpost?
More or less?
I'm so glad she's on our side.
Hey, what are these metal hose things...?
I'm a little uncertain about this...
Oh, don't worry, LT! You'll be happy with the Chem Sprinklers when the Rebels attack!  Just don't jostle the spray nozzles... or trip the sensors... or light a match nearby...
I have to tell you, my confidence is not increasing here.
Having deadly weapons of mass destruction is good, but you know what's better? Deadly weapons of mass destruction ON TANKS!
I've been workin' up a design based on the Flame Tanks that can spray poison like - everywhere - without putting the driver in much danger!
Questo è parlare!
The test driver got hardly no burns at all!
Bring 'em on!
Finished! Whew! That's a fine lookin' piece of machinery if I ever saw one!
Let me guess, Ramsey: you want to test it out.
Maledettamente ovvio!
Well, don't worry; I'm sure the Rebels won't be giving up their... OUR chemical weapons that easily.
You look pale, Perkins. What's the matter? Floyd looking for "volunteers" again?
No, sir! It's Rebels! They're everywhere! Literally everywhere, all over the frontier! It looks like they're hauling the chemicals away as fast as they can.
Morgan, I have an idea: we kill two birds with one stone again.  We follow them to the lab. Then we pounce, and kick their butts so hard they'll realize that using it is more trouble than it's worth.
Still, it's a good idea.  Go forth and slaughter, Sergeant.
Amico, nei tuoi piani ci vai pesante con gli omicidi.
Let's get it done!
Ramsey is kind of starting to worry me.
That must be it! An Imperial lab, all the way out here...
An Imperial lab full of chemicals that could kill us all if we look at them funny.  I'm bringing Floyd in; I have a feeling we'll need him.
Better hurry.  There are still Rebels in that lab, and I can't guarantee they'll still be here when you get back.
This equipment... That tang in the air... Yes!  This is definitely the Imperial chemical research lab!
Morgan, I'm going in.
Come se non si vedesse dalla presenza di Ribelli.
Look, I know you're angry, but for god's sake, be careful! The Rebels will be desperate to hold on to this place.

And try not to damage any of the equipment!  Destroying anything could unleash a disastrous tide of gas over the entire area! It would kill all of us and probably upset the local ecology something fierce!
I'm trying to be careful, but that's tricky with a minigun.
So did they move those chemicals from my footlocker?
Damn, there's not much left. Floyd, any chance of getting this up and running again?
After the damage Ramsey did? Not likely.
I said I was sorry!
We've cut off the supply, but it looks like the Rebels were able to move the bulk of it out.
I guess we'll just have to take it back the hard way.
With all the refugees we're taking in and the soldiers we're training, our food supplies are starting to get stretched thin.  Without the Empire sending us support...
Capitano, abbiamo un problemino.
I have an idea: a convenience store! That way, our troops can get lamp-warmed hot dogs and gallons of overcaffeinated energy drinks at all hours!
Really, Morgan? Can't we do better than soda in cups larger than my head and cheese in colors that don't exist in nature?
Sorry, Floyd, beggars can't be choosers. I'm sure the rest of the outpost agrees.  Besides, all the extra fat will keep us going until we get more supplies.
I can almost taste the sugar and cholesterol already!
But that just raises more questions!
Finally, it's open!  Smell that? That's the smell of modern progress! And mass-produced coffee that tastes like liquid road tar. Our food problems are solved!
Wait a moment.  We built this abomination because we don't get food supplies from the Empire.  So where is the Convenience Store getting ITS food?
It came pre-stocked with five years worth of prepackaged processed food-like products!  Now if you'll excuse me, I have a nacho binge to start...
Questa è la parte migliore!
Whoa! It's an earthquake!
A whole herd of them coming straight for us!
È peggio di un terremoto - sono mammut!
Really? But why? They've never bothered us like this before...
Worry about that later! We have to get them out of here before they trample everything!
Ugh...  I'm getting dizzy from the concentrated mammoth smell...
We wouldn't have had this problem with healthy food.
Whew, that's all of them.  But I wish we knew what brought them here in the first place.
I've been studying the mammoth corpses, and discovered that they require an unusually high amount of caffeine in their diet to stay awake in their cold habitats.
Penso di poterti rispondere.
Wait, you mean...?
Yes! They were attracted here by the Convenience Store and the smell of its coffee!  Sorry I didn't know before this, or I would've pushed against it even more strongly...
Well, we're stuck with them now. No way is Morgan going to give up his morning coffee. I'll set up more patrols to keep them away from sensitive areas of the outpost.
Mammut Caffeinati
Mister Lieutenant Morgan? I came by because... well, there's a whole bunch of Silver Wolves hanging out in Recoil Ridge lately, and—
Get the men ready, Ramsey - your lady friend says we've got trouble in Recoil Ridge. Sheriff Colt's going to need a hand!
That's just it! Sheriff's been hangin' out with 'em! Really buddy like!
What? There's gotta be some mistake!
Let's sort this mess out!
Sheriff? What the hell is going on?

Morgan. Damn. I was hoping this could wait. Look, these Silver Wolf fellas, they made me a deal, a deal I couldn't say no to and call myself responsible for these people. It's nothin' personal, I just—
Nothing personal? You're letting a bunch of murderous thugs stage troops just outside my backyard, and you tell me it's nothing personal? I never expected you could stoop this low!
Now you watch yourself, youngun'! This ain't all black and white like you want it to be! I gotta do right by my folks!
What happened to doing right by yourself?
Why, you!
This is unbelievable!
I do what I have to.
I told you not to push me!
Sceriffo! No!
Stanne fuori,Cassidy!
So that's it? You've got us pinned down? What now, you call Bronson and his thugs to come put us down?
Nah, these fools talk so dang much, I already know everything I need to know. I figure I'll let you go, and we can do that double reverse ambush you talked about.
Oh, already? Great!
Wait… what?
I been on your side the whole time, ya damn fool! I just roughed you up to get these Silver Wolves to lower their guard!
I love a plan that comes together!
These guys do keep me on my toes.
So seriously, they already told you their plan?
Yup! Honestly, I think that Bronson is kinda lonely. He just wanted someone to talk to.
So, when were they planning to move on the Outpost?
Oh, they've pretty much given up fightin' you on your home turf. They was planning to head east, and attack some secret Installation. Said once they had that, nobody'd be able to stop 'em.
Well… crap.
Hey, Zoey... it's Zoey, right? I wanted to ask you something.
The odds of long term negative effects from the fallout is EXTREMELY low. I don't even think—
No, I wanted to talk about Ramsey. I really like him, and, well, I think he likes me. But he's so shy, I don't know how to get him to, you know, take the next step.
Hmmm, I've got an idea. Wait here.
Wait, what was that she was saying about fallout…?
Well, I wouldn't say it COULDN'T hurt…
Here! This oughta do the trick!
You want me to hypnotize him? I don't really think...
Oh no! I don't think you should brainwash him or nothin', but if you get him all relaxed like, you can find out for sure if he feels the same way.
Hmm, if you're sure it won't harm him... I don't s'pose it could hurt.
That didn't go so great, Zoey. He just kept goin' on about the queen of diamonds and "the signal". Wouldn't talk about nothin' else.
Huh, figures Ramsey's already got some junk runnin' in there. Well, I suppose you'll have to get him loosened up the old fashioned way.
Booze?
No! Barbeque!
Nothing loosens lips like ribs!
Is he paying any attention at all?
Wow, Cassidy! Thanks! These are delicious!
You're welcome! You know, if we spent more time together, I wouldn't mind making them regularly...
Aww, don't worry about that. If I ate these all the time, I wouldn't stay in fighting shape. Real nice of you to offer, though!
Zoey, you've been talking to Cassidy some lately, right?
No! …Yes. NOTHING. We talked about hammers?
Uh... sure. Look, she's been actin' kinda funny lately, so I was wondering if you—
You know what? No. I'm done bein' in the middle. Y'all go talk it out.
I didn't know there was anything to talk out!
Ramsey? What are you doin' out here?
I wanted to talk to you. Why have you been acting all weird?
Actin' weird? What are you talkin' about ME actin' weird? You're the one who won't talk about nothin'!
What do we need to talk about? And can we talk about it later? There's some pretty scary looking boars moving on your orchard.
This conversation isn't over.
Shoulda known huntin' some boar would fix everything.
I had that under control!
I know! I know you can handle yourself! That's part of why I like you so much! I just like helping when I can!
Well, I appreciate it! I just wish you weren't so weird about saying things like you liking me, and telling me you want to spend time with me!
It's hard! It's not like you're good at saying it! I mean, I want you around all the time, but I'd feel guilty if you weren't here to take care of the family orchards, which obviously needs doing!
That's just... wait, really? That's... you want me around? I mean, you're right, I can't leave the orchards too long but... well, it's nice to hear.
I'm sorry I didn't say something sooner. You're real special to me, and I oughta let you know that.
So, Zoey, I'm thinking it's about time I treat Cassidy to a proper date. I thought maybe with you being a girl and all, you could maybe give me some pointers.
Well, I don't know Cassidy that well, but there ain't many girls who don't appreciate a fella dressin' up nice and sittin' down for a fancy meal.
Dress up? I got that under control... what exactly constitutes "fancy?"
Aww, you know, good food and a bottle of wine!
I think I might pull this off.
It's lucky I love hot dogs.
Hello, Cassidy, I was wondering if you—
* AHEM *
Ramsey, why are you wearing a dress uniform?
Oh, uh... I wanted to look nice so I could ask you out on a date.
You don't need to dress up. Just ask me out, and we'll make plans. When are you free?
Oh, right, I... I kind of already set up the date, and I was just hoping you'd come with me right now and eat hot dogs.
Sure. Let's go eat hot dogs.
Dinner was delicious, hon, thank you so much. What's next?
Next? I... this is everything I planned.
It's fine. Let's just spend some time together. What do you do for fun?
Bersagli.
Hell, why'd we waste time eatin' dinner? Let's go!
I never thought I'd be this happy.
I think I'll keep him.
Sergeant Ramsey, you sure do know how to show a lady a good time.
Well, I don't know that most ladies would enjoy it, but you do, and you're the only one that counts.
Damn right.
Think I could lob in for a kip?
Oi! Morgan, vecchia sagoma!
Sir … he looks like he's been running for a week.
Tell him he can camp outside. Preferably downwind.
E ne ha anche l'odore.
I think you oughta let me in, owing to the army of sandworms that's dead-set on eating me.
In that case, we should probably chain you in the desert with a steak around your neck. We've been looking for some effective sandworm bait.
Morgan! Stanno spuntando Vermi della Sabbia per tutto l'Avamposto! Siamo sotto attacco!
Since this is all your fault, why don't you get in here and help us out? Once the sandworms are gone, I might even forget about that bait idea.
Ehi Cacciatore!
They're in all my favorite buildings!
I'm looking forward to a 100% reduction in people saying things I don't understand.
I've never seen sandworms target our infrastructure so effectively before. It's almost as if they were *guided* … by some kind of intelligence.
I want to do some research, to see if I can determine—
Questo significa lasciare l'Avamposto portandosi dietro quel Cacciatore?
I… suppose it could.
Approvato.
Vermi insolitamente intelligenti
Mr. Hunter, I'd like to take you on an expedition—
"Mr. Hunter" is my old man's name.
But no worries, mate! I'll take you into the never-never. What you got in mind? A bit of wild boar riding? Maybe a raptor-bait? You know, it's mammoth molting season...
Il nome è Bogan, guastafeste.
Actually, I have a very specific purpose in mind. I want to find the source of the sandworm army that chased you here.
I always say, "An ounce of preparation is worth a pound of emergency medical gear."
Ma prima di tutto, dobbiamo prepararci!
He really is always saying that.
Can someone tell me what a "jumper" is?
All right, Bogan… I think we *might* be ready.
Hai abbastanza pannolini in quel pacco, poppante?
I'll have you know that this survival kit is filled with top-of-the-line threat detection and imaging equipment, first-rate water-purification tools, foolproof navigation gear...
… and a sweater in case it gets cold.
This is about to get deadly.
Beh, cerca di non imbrattare il tuo maglione, Sheila.
So I was out in the never-never, trying to rustle up a few of them big chooks for breakfast, when I ran into ...
... il Ridgy-Didge.
You don't say.
Fair dinkum, it was the biggest, *toothiest* sandworm you ever saw. Figured I'd knock it out, drag it home, and sell toothy necklaces for the rest of my life.
But it got away from you?
But then all these *other* sandworms started chasing me ...
No, l'ho preso!
I want to see this "Ridgy-Didge" for myself.
Portami lì, Bogan.
…ideally, from a respectful distance.
I really hope that *we* turn out to be the boss!
Every time we fought the sandworms, we caught the same pattern of subsonic vibrations on the seismograph!
Proprio come pensavo!
What are you chinwagging about?
Your "Ridgy-Didge" is actually *communicating* with the other sandworms! If we could just get a little closer ...
I don't need you snaking in on my catch, and then spitting the dummy and wrecking the whole mess.
If you want in on this, you do it right. Go back and get more of your army mates. Then we show that toothy bludger who's boss.
Resisti, compagno!
Vermi delle Sabbie Tele-controllati
All right, back to the Outpost ...
I needed to mend my sweater, anyway.
Oi! Pivelli, c'é qualcuno tra voi pronto a andare a caccia del Ridgy-Didge?
Floyd, what part of "make him go away" did you not understand?
If we can capture this creature, we might even learn how to communicate with the sandworms, as equals.
Morgan, ho trovato prove di una nuova sottospecie — il Verme della Sabbia Imperatore.
Here's what he won't tell ya — the Ridgy-Didge is made almost entirely outta teeth. It's got rows and rows of 'em, spiraling down its gullet, like some kinda bonzer freak show.
Questo vecchio idiota parolaio vuole discutere con un Verme della Sabbia?
Take Perkins with you, and bring me back those teeth!
Suona come morte certa.
Maybe they'll leave me a few bits of brain to study.
It's not so bad. Some days, I even get a five-minute lunch break!
Sei tornato! Fammi vedere i denti!
Seeing as I found the old bludger, and your offsider Perkins helped me kill it, we should take a fifty-percent share of the proceeds.
Altolà teppistello. Dobbiamo discutere delle condizioni.
It should leave you just enough teeth to pay our new Teeth Tax.
Mi sembra giusto.
How does Teeth Tax work, sir?
Anyone who finds teeth gives them to me. For the good of the Outpost.
Quel mostro ha distrutto la mia casa! Non mi è rimasto niente! Sono rovinato!
Well, if you're looking for work, our army is always hiring...
Il Ridgy-Didge
Hell, while we're being honest, not a single one of us was stationed out here because of the great admiration and respect the Empire held for us.

But I've seen you men rise to every challenge. I've seen combat and hardship reveal your character. I could not be more proud to serve with you, and I can't imagine a more fitting group of soldiers to come to the aid of the Empire in her time of need.
All right, boys, let's go home.
Io e il Capitano non siamo conosciuti per i grandi discorsi.
Cariston, I'll see you soon.
There's some kind of altercation on the road up ahead of us!
Signore!
We don't have time for this!
Dannazione! Andate avanti!
Stand down, Sergeant; the civilians out here are our responsibility.
Grrr... Let's wrap this up quickly!
That was a pretty good plan for a bunch of drunks.
What the hell was that?
Silver Wolves, sir! They've been ambushing refugees looking for safety in the frontier. Apparently, they've gotten pretty aggressive since the Empire fell.
The Empire hasn't fallen yet, Specialist Perkins. Not while the 5th and 2nd Corps are still in the southeast.
When did these guys get so organized?
Altri Lupi d'Argento?
I guess with the protection of the Empire gone, the Silver Wolves must see these little villages as easy pickings.
Well, the protection of the Empire is a lot closer than they think.
Power structures abhor a vacuum.
We've wasted too much time as it is.
Mass executions, entire cities burned to the ground. One guy swears all of Cariston is basically just a crater. There's not much left.
Signore, questi rifugiati stanno disegnando un quadro piuttosto squallido.
Then we better stop talking and get a move on.
Signore, c'è un altro —
I see them, Perkins. More Silver Wolves. How did things out here get so bad without us knowing?
Morgan's been pretty distracted by the destruction of our nation and people.
I don't buy it. No way they took us out that easy.
Percival? What the hell are you doing out here?
Fleeing. I was in the southeast selling artifacts when it happened.
You were there? When did you leave? What state is the Imperial Army in?
What state is the army in? It's over, Morgan... There was a last stand, but one of the Generals betrayed the rest for amnesty. Our troops never stood a chance.
But... the survivors... where are they keeping the prisoners?
I'm sorry - there weren't any... It was a slaughter to the last man.
Gang di Frontiera
Enough moping, Lieutenant. Let's get a move on.
Haven't you been listening? There's nothing to save.
All I've heard are a bunch of rumors from cowards that ran and hid in the frontier. We're taking those Rebel bastards out if I have to do it myself. I hear my Empire calling for help. Don't you?
Perhaps you do, Mr. Ramsey. Perhaps you hear the cries from Bernmoth, a town of Imperial citizens currently under siege from Silver Wolves.
Quale strada per Bernmoth?
You're abandoning the mission! The Empire!
I'm not marching these men to their death to prove a point. I'm helping people that can still be helped.
Once Ramsey calms down, he'll understand.
I guess I check in on old people now?
So, the Empire isn't as gone as I've been hearing. Good to know.
Don't get your hopes up. From the sound of things, we're about the last of it.
Then we better get used to cleaning up our own messes. We'll take it from here.
Are you sure? The Silver Wolves have gotten pretty nasty.
Honestly, if you want to help, I'd appreciate if you could check in on my Ma. She's over in Trotbeck. The Silver Wolves have been pressuring her for protection money but... she's pretty stubborn.

Okay, boys, the Silver Wolves think the Empire is gone. They think they can push these people, these Imperial Citizens, around and not hear anything about it. They're literally picking on little old ladies.
Let's roll out and make it clear to these bastards: the all you can loot buffet is officially closed.
It's important for morale to give your guys an easy win on occasion.
I appreciate the help. Now leave.
So kind of you boys to come to my aid. Thank you. I won't forget it.
Happy to help. It's our duty to protect the citizens of the Empire.
Indeed it is. Now, if you don't mind, I'd appreciate you not wasting time on your way out of town. I'm uncomfortable with people holding guns unless they work for me.
It's fine. We need to get moving south anyway.
OK, that's sorted. When do we leave?
Ramsey, look, I don't think—
Leaving would be a dereliction of duty. Ramsey, I know you want to go join the fight and satisfy your honor, but we don't have time for fantasies. There are Imperial citizens here, and they need us.
Lieutenant, are we taking orders from civilians now?
We do when they're the only people making sense. We're staying up here, and we're helping these people.
Towns like Trotbeck and Bernmoth need our help.
Is that all there is to war?
It would be a lot easier to rein Ramsey in if I didn't agree with him so much.
Morgan, I know this is hard for you, but you're doing the right thing.
I know. I just wish I WANTED to do the right thing...
So, you folks actually intend to stick it out, eh? I guess soldiers like you need to know you've got fights you can win.
That's not it. Well, not entirely. Look, helping you frontier people is probably what's keeping our Outpost from sinking into permanent depression.
If you mean that, we could certainly use some assistance. It's not all gunplay though. We need food, supplies, medicine...
Send me a list.
Nobody accuses ME of half-assing it.
That lady is intense.
These will do. With all the refugees pouring north, the shortages are just going to get worse.
Great. Well... you're WELCOME.
Are you the kind of man that needs a please and a thank-you every time to do the right thing? Because here I thought you actually had some character.
Oh?
Don't you worry.
Ehi, ne ho da vendere di carattere.
I suppose we'll see, won't we?
If you're coming to tell me the Silver Wolves have attacked some tiny little mining town, I want you to tell me something completely different instead.
Fermati lì, Perkins!
Um... applesauce is... good. I'm sorry, sir, I really need to tell you about the Silver Wolves.
Ugh. Go ahead.
They're attacking Recoil Ridge!
Ramsey, let's go!
Hey! In effetti conosco quei ragazzi!
This oughta cheer Ramsey up.
… does he seriously not understand that I meant me?
Ramsey! How've you been! I ain't seen you in days!
Sorry. I guess I've been kinda... distracted.
You should come and talk. It won't help to just bottle things up.
What doesn't help is screwing around with these small town yokels. The Empire needs me in the South!
But, what about people who need you up here?
Aw, you just don't understand.
Lupi d'Argento ubriachi
Morgan! We just got an SOS from the supply truck we sent to Elder Taos' Sanctuary.  They're under attack by the Silver Wolves!
They are jackals who do not deserve to be associated with the elegant, powerful animal whose name they steal.
Ho sentito mormorii di questi Lupi d'Argento.
A thug by any other name still stinks to high heaven.  Don't worry, Taos, we've sent these jokers running home to momma before.
I will send some of my warriors with you. Let the Silver Wolves experience what happens when they insult the pride of my people.
These Silver Wolves will pay for their cruelty.
Now I'm even more glad we never made him mad.
These so-called "Silver Wolves" are really the same as those who have been menacing your land?
What they lack in brains, they make up for in numbers and firepower, I guess.
If you are willing, I would like to bring their corpses home with me. Our tradition demands that we burn dishonorable enemies on our bonfires, cooking our food over their charring flesh.
I... guess that's... okay...?
… Davvero?  Sul serio?
Sir! The Silver Wolves are moving on Ma Pierce again!
That's weird, I remember enlisting as a soldier, not some frontier sheriff.
We're here to help. I won't brook insubordination.
Abbi cura di te, Sergente.
What? Are you going to report me to the superior officers you've abandoned and left for dead?
You're confined to quarters until further notice, Sergeant. Blow off some steam.
We need to get Ramsey under control.
Old people make me uncomfortable.
Well, you're startin' to make quite a habit of this. Keep it up and I'll think you're sweet on me.
Uh, we're just... happy to help. We like helping. Everyone.
I know you're not sweet on me. Learn to take a joke!
Dannazione, ragazzo, io sono 107.
The Rebels have me worried.
Seriously? Ever since my - you're right, BRILLIANT - feint with the Raiders, they've barely moved west of the great range.
That's just it. Not a single search party? No scouts at all? I'm worried they're planning something.
Hmm, that's true. Aww, man. Now you've got me all paranoid. Fine, go take a look. See if you can find any evidence either way, and try not to get caught this time.
You get caught ONE TIME...
When he talks about guerrilla strikes, he gets these puppy dog eyes.
The intel and orders we're finding are pretty consistent. It seems the Rebellion's leaders are approaching the entirety of the west pretty cautiously. It's pretty much just "maintain a presence."
Well, I'm going to pretend I trust Perkins long enough to say I'm satisfied.
Let me just go a little further. They've got a good sized base not far from here. A quick hit, and I'll go home happy.
Aww, you seem so excited. I can't say no to that face.

OK, boys, this is a big one. We're hitting a Rebel base. We know we can't take them, but with luck, Perkins will be able to slip in, steal intel, and we can cover his escape. It's gonna be tough, and the Rebels are gonna hit us with everything they have.
Sarge, I'm ready for the mission, but I'd really appreciate it if you stopped smiling so much. It's kind of unnerving.
I can't, Perkins. I physically can't. Let's get 'em, boys!
Ramsey keeps cleaning his gun and giggling.
Maybe they'll keep leaving us alone?
Okay, Perkins, what did you get? You find anything?

Well... yeah. There's this report, about how while there are clear signs of Imperial troop remnants on the west and north, they appear to be small, and focused largely on self preservation. Not worth pursuing.
Basically, as long as we don't do exactly the kind of thing we just did, they're planning to leave us alone.
Aw hell. You want me to tell Morgan for you?
Where have you guys been?
Ramsey got us worried that the Rebels weren't trying to kill us, so we attacked them, and now they probably ARE trying to kill us.
So you haven't been to Bernmoth? You need to get going! The Silver Wolves showed up in force!
Seriously? I haven't even changed yet!
Go!
Hey... since when does Cassidy give me orders?
We never should have wasted time down south.
Oh god... this is...
Panic later, Perkins. Let's move.
Let's do this. Hit hard, move fast.
There are hostages. Be careful, but don't let it stop you fighting. Better to lose one or two and save the town.
Get a move on!
Nice work, folks. Where's Judge Pierce? We need to start talking about the rebuilding effort.
He's... he's not...
What? Was he hit?
I was with him. He was moving people to safety... It wasn't even...
… He's gone, sir.
It's not... Judge Pierce was...
Sir, I'm sorry to—
What the hell is it, Perkins? What's falling apart and going to hell now?
It's Ma Pierce, sir. She's radioing for help, saying that—
Silver Wolves. Let's move.
Payback is empty, but very satisfying.
Morgan is taking this pretty hard.
Damn, some of them slipped through. We need to hurry. Ma Pierce has enough on her plate.
Trotbeck's in trouble! Let's move!
Okay. Let's take these guys. This WILL NOT be another Bernmoth.
Sono qui. Dannazione!
We'll take them all on at once.
Trotbeck owes you a debt.
Hmph. Pull out, boys. That's enough fun for today.
Non vedo l'ora di sparare a quel tipo.
Haven't enough people been shot today?
Ma! I'm so sorry, I tried to—
Portami da lui.
Il Leader dei Lupi d'Argento
Captain! The Silver Wolves are on the move again! A new contingent is making their way for Sundale!
Sometimes I wonder what would happen if we let those hippies try to pacifism their way out of a disaster. Ah, well. Come on, men; we've got gangsters to hunt!
Silver Wolves are persistent little buggers. Luckily, so are we.
Thank goodness! The bean curd crop was spared!
Maybe it was just a hallucination brought on by isolation and stress, but it looked like there were... Raiders with the Silver Wolves.
I saw 'em too. And they were working together with perfect coordination. Something's definitely fishy here.
As if we didn't have enough problems. If the Silver Wolves are inflating their ranks with bribery or force, we're going to have a hard time keeping up. We need answers, and fast.
My people... collaborating with the Silver Wolves? I have no knowledge of such a thing. Anyone among my tribe doing so would face... terrible consequences.
Please, do me a favor and spare the details. So if they weren't with you, where'd they come from?
I do not know. We are a proud people, unswayed by threats or promises of gold. There must be another reason behind their loyalty to the Silver Wolves.
I know how we can find out! The Silver Wolves communicate by radio, right? If we can find the right frequency, we can intercept their messages and figure out what their next move is!
Just don't stand too close to it while it's operatin'. Seriously, don't.
When something goes wrong, hide.
Ah, Zoey... The northeast quadrant just had a blackout.
I know... The Interceptor takes a *little* more power than I thought it would. But we'll be able to listen in on the Silver Wolves' next communication, no problem!
I hope so. In the meantime, we need to get the electricity back up. Can you hook up a stationary bike to the power generators? Get Perkins to handle it.
LT! I'm picking up a broadcast from the Silver Wolves! They're gonna attack Trotbeck next!
Ah, I love having surprise on my side! Come on, men, let's prepare a good old fashioned ambush!
Only thing better than a "boom" is a surprise "boom"!
People of Trotbeck, surrender now or blah blah...
I don't believe it! You're with the Silver Wolves?!
Gantas?!
Oh. It is you.
What do you mean "oh, it's you"?! It's those Imperial dolts! The ones who took your honor! Remember?!
Yes. I remember.
So what are you gonna do about it?! Attack them! Make them pay for what they did to you!
I suppose I should. Men, march to your deaths.
Maybe it's my imagination, but Gantas seems a little... off.
In the meantime, we have a mystery to solve!
Silver Wolves, retreat! You'll all pay for this!
Yes. Dishonor to all your kind. Your foolish ways will be your undoing. Very bad stuff.
Was that really Gantas? He sure has changed since the last time we saw him.
Then again, the last time we saw him, he was on fire. Those were good days. I'd like to have 'em back.
Predoni dei Lupi d'Argento
If Warlord Gantas has really joined the Silver Wolves, he must have fallen on hard times indeed. The humiliation of being an underling to such dogs has surely sapped his spirit.
I never thought I'd say this, but I feel a little sorry for him. Besides, having someone like him, with his loyalist troops, under the Silver Wolves' thumb could be dangerous...
Fan out and attack! Don't let anyone escape! This outpost falls today!
You heard him. Go and do what he said.
Case in point.
Fighting these guys is like trying to stomp an anthill, I swear...
I'll take Gantas over the Silver Wolves any day of the week, and twice on Tuesdays!
Arrgh! You were supposed to back us up, make us strong enough to take down these bastards! I should've known Raiders were just a bunch of idiot weaklings!
I suppose we are.
Whoa, you're taking that lying down? Are you sure you're the REAL Gantas?
Yeah, he is! He just knows when to join up with winners! And the Silver Wolves are winners, right, Gantas?
More so than me.
Okay, I'm not saying I miss the old Gantas, but I at least knew what I was dealing with. This is totally bumming me out.
That does it! I've had it with you just sitting back and giving orders all day! You're gonna get out there and earn your keep by getting rid of the Imperials once and for all!
I will do what is necessary to be left in peace.
Gantas, what's happened to you? You used to be so full of life... and murderous rage! You're better than this! Remember the good old days, when you were trying to kill us?
Lay off! Career transitions can be very stressful! As for trying to kill you, you're not gonna miss that for long!
Prepare to meet your doom, and... *sigh* Is there a point to any of this?
Uh, Empire? Think you can... help me? Please?
Battle! Real battle! Magnificent! My blood burns with the heat of warfare once more!
Who cares! You LOST, you moron! You Raiders are worthless! Worthl— GAK! C-can't... br-breathe...
I tire of insults against me and my people. I tire of the Silver Wolves. I tire of YOU. I will deal with you personally in a moment. But as for you, Imperials...
You have reminded me what it means to be a proud warrior. I was an honored warlord once; I can become one again. I cannot let a single failure weigh upon me for the rest of my life.

I shall leave you now. That is my gratitude towards you... and so I can "repay" the "kindness" shown to me by the Silver Wolves. When I return, mightier than ever... only then will I avenge myself upon you with the wrath you deserve.
Grazie.
Whew, the world makes sense again. And I'm sure what we just did will have absolutely no consequences that will come back to haunt us.
I came as soon as I heard! You've really saved him? You got Archibald - that is, the Administrator - you got him back from the Silver Wolves?
Damn right, we did! He's one of those guys... right?
Wh-why do you have him tied up? Is he being held prisoner?
The Silver Wolves had all these guys, and we've been trying to sort out who's safe to let go and who's not. So... kind of?
Aurora! Who are these people? Please help me!
Sorry about that, we'll fix him up. Get him a hot meal and a fresh pair of boots.
Nobody doesn't want new boots.
Perkins, figure out who the rest of these guys are.
Sorry about the whole leaving you bound and gagged thing. Can't be too careful.
You could have asked me.
You could have lied. I would have.
Hmmm. Fair enough.
Aurora, it's good to see you. Any news?

Nothing good. If there are any Imperial resistance cells still operating, they've gone dark. We haven't heard anything in months. As far as we can tell, these guys are the only Imperial holdouts left.
Yup. Just us. Oh, she forgot all the stuff about Rebels in the Heartland, and the roving gangs of thugs, but since they were holding you prisoner, you're probably familiar with them.
Indeed. It seems I owe you thanks for more than my rescue.

You know what would have made all of that easier? If we had some lasers. That would be nice. If only someone who knew how to develop and operate lasers owed us their lives, and had all hopes for their continued existence intertwined with our own.
Your point is made. Assuming Aurora approves, I'd be willing to give you the plans to create a facility capable of basic laser production. We can move forward from there.
I don't see any significant alternatives.
The potential applications are incredible!
There you are, Lieutenant Morgan. You've taken quite the burden on your shoulders. I sincerely hope you know what you're doing.
I'm making laser weapons to smite my enemies. Right?

Morgan, while I'm excited about the military applications of our new laser tech, I don't think we should underestimate the potential civic value. I think I can make cuts on the order of 5% from our average build time if—
Here's an idea: how about I arm our troops FIRST, and then you can survive to do some experiments or whatever when we're not all living in constant fear for our very lives?
I suppose you have a point... still, I don't think we should undervalue the cost savings afforded by laser-honed skill saws.
Lasers! Finally!
Almost as sweet as a micron edged skill saw.
Gentlemen, I stand before you at the dawn of a new era. The era of shooting perfectly round cauterized holes into our enemies.
I'm not going to lie to you guys. It's a pretty sweet era.
Morgan, before we go rushing out into combat with these new Laser Troopers, don't you think it would be appropriate to do a bit of field testing?
Floyd, are you asking because you want to verify the quality of our work, or because you want to watch guys blow stuff up with Lasers?
Un po' di entrambi?
Nothing beats a good field test!
I don't really envy them ever.
Well, I'd call that a success.
Indeed. I don't envy the Silver Wolves right now.
Campo Collaudo Laser
Now that we are... allies of a sort, I'd like to ask for your assistance in a delicate matter.
Ehh, why not? We're rescuing everyone and their great-grandma lately.  At least you guys have cool weapons.

It is exactly those, ahem, "cool weapons" that are at issue here.  We were delivering crates containing highly advanced weapon prototypes to Cariston right before the Empire fell. They vanished somewhere along the way. We want them back.
Well, at least we know the Rebels don't have them, then.  The Raiders were busy with us at the time, so that leaves the Silver Wolves.  Of course.

I wager the Silver Wolves are still hungry for new technology and weapons, especially with the problems we're giving them. Perhaps if we were to offer them another "shipment" of weapons, we could draw them out.
Add enough blinking lights, and anything looks high tech!
Beeping... flashing... so... hypnotic...
So we're offering the Silver Wolves actual laser rifles? Why don't we just lend them a few tanks while we're at it?
These rifles look impressive, but their power output is extremely low.  If we want to attract the Silver Wolves, they have to at least appear functional.
And that thing?
It... beeps.  And sparks.  And has little flashing lights.  That's... about it.
Well, the Silver Wolves aren't exactly technical geniuses... or strategic geniuses, or really any kind of genius. I think this has a shot at working - they're pretty dumb.
Aurora, if we're going to make this fake shipment look good to the Silver Wolves, we'll need your help.
Of course.  I can chart the exact route the first shipment took.  I doubt the bandits will have changed their habits much.

Our men will be disguised as Installation scientists, so the Silver Wolves think the caravan is the real deal. Aurora, if you can loan us some Laser Technicians, that would help even more. We'll leave when you're ready.
I love surprise parties!
Sir! There's someone approaching from the mountains!
Stay alert, men! This could be it!
It's them, all right! Hand it over, nerds. If you put up a fight, you'll wind up as dead as that last group.
Oh, yeah? You're the one who will be dead! I mean... Aw man, that was awful. Let's just shoot these guys!
C'mon, Ramsey, keep it together!
Hey, I didn't have lunch...  Ya got a snack on ya somewhere...?
Now talk! What'd you do with the last shipment you hijacked?
I... I ain't tellin' ya squat! Whatever you do to me is nothin' compared to what Mr. Stephenson and the boss would do if they find out I squealed!
Damn. Well, let's take these jokers back to the outpost as POWs. We'll figure out our next move there.
Well, no luck interrogating the prisoners. They're all too scared to talk.
I think Floyd and I may be able to help. We've been examining soil samples from the Silver Wolves' boots.
The samples have unique properties and chemical traces that are found in only one location within a two hundred mile radius of here.
It's worth checking out.  But be prepared for anything, Ramsey; I don't put anything past the Silver Wolves.
Before you go, Ramsey, are your rabies shots up to date?
I must say, you all have certainly made my life more... interesting.
I'd say that welcome means we're in the right place.
I haven't detected any energy signatures from the prototypes stolen from us. But they could have it shielded or stored underground.
Then we don't have any choice: we go in. Better to not leave a bunch of Silver Wolves camped out this close to our outpost anyway.
Okay, men, let's move in!
Ah, pardon... I just got a communique from the installation, and...
Sorry, ma'am, no time.  Now that we know where the Silver Wolves are, we need to strike fast before they move your prototypes somewhere else.
But…!
Let's go, men! Don't you worry, Aurora, we'll take care of this!
Let's show these jokers who's boss around here!
Then again, beating up Silver Wolves is kind of its own reward.
Let's see if the stuff's still there.  Now the Installation can have back their... thermal underwear?!
Trovate le Casse!
That's what I was trying to tell you before. It seems that our shipping clerk mixed up a couple of labels. We had the prototypes in our winter weather storeroom all along!
I theorize the Silver Wolves were either embarrassed, or just never had a chance to open the crates.  I'd call it funny, but I don't suppose you'd think so.
You've got that right.
Sir, do you remember being certain something was up with the Silver Wolves?
Yes...
They've moved the bulk of their forces to Installation 17. It's a full scale assault. They were keeping us busy at New Haven and blocking the Installation's radio signals.

Perkins, what in the world makes you think it's appropriate to deliver that information with a cute "remember being certain blah blah blah?" I mean, you disappoint me almost constantly, but this is really a new low.
I can't believe... Perkins, I need you to leave for a while. Everyone else, put your boots back on.
I was just trying to establish context...
She better be fine.
No time to rest! You lazy sons of bitches get back on your feet and move!
Woah Sergeant, take it—
Cassidy's in there, Morgan. She's in there.
I'm sure she's fine Sergeant.
Defenses at I17 are failing! We need to move!
I'm coming, Cass!
Fine.
Dannazione!
We didn't... They're in, sir. We caught a lot of them, but the Silver Wolves made it inside, and sealed the building. What are we going—
We're gonna blow the damn doors off!
It wouldn't work. We need to go back to the Outpost. Talk to Floyd and Zoey. They'll know how to get us in.
I'm staying.
You can't just sit in the snow and freeze to death. That doesn't help anyone. Trust me on this Ramsey. We'll be back, and we'll get them out. All of them.
First, we gotta disable the electronic locks. Right now, the doors ain't just locked, they're forcin' themselves together. Floyd'll make an EMP discharger that'll give me time to pry the things open.
Ne siamo venuti a capo, LT!
How long until you're ready to move, Floyd?

Less than a day? Though, Morgan, something's been bothering me... The Silver Wolves — all my field interviews imply they've always been disorganized and short sighted. Yet since the fall of the Empire, they've suddenly been galvanized into—
One thing at a time, buddy. Remember our talks about prioritization?
If I'm right, our priorities will shift rather radically.
Zoey's plans are always... interesting.

There you are, phase one of the plan. Activating that will disable all the electronic aspects of the locks at Installation 17. After that, it's just a matter of actually forcing the two 1,578,240 pound doors apart.
A million and a half pounds? Each?
Alt!

I did my calculations assuming a standard density for steel at 68 degrees, but since Installation 17 is well below freezing, the density would be higher, and given that I'm working off the actual dimensions of the doors, they're likely somewhat heavier.
All'incirca?
Don't sweat it LT! I got a plan!
Alright LT, here's my plan. We build a real big wedge, we put an engine in it and treads on it, and we force the doors open.
No bombs or anything?
Davvero?
The doors're on tracks! It'd take forever to blow 'em up, but they're designed to be pulled apart. Trust me LT!
Well, you've done a lot of stuff that sounded crazier than this, and most of it much more likely to kill me. Proceed.
I wouldn't call this plan "unlikely" to kill you exactly.
That converts to 281 Centiclovers in metric.
Well, that should do it. With these and a bit of luck, we'll be cracking I17 open in no time.
Just how lucky will we need to be?
I'm... not aware of an extant unit of measurement for luck. Maybe .38 Rabbit's Feet?
I can't just wait around, sir. I need to keep busy.
Understood, Ramsey. Why don't you head out to the Eastern Wastes, keep the Silver Wolves from reinforcing.
Glad to.
Sometimes you just need to keep busy.
I just want some direction!
They stopped sending guys. I guess word got back.
Sorry pal. If you'd let a few through, they might have kept sending them out.
I'll admit, I considered it.
Me and Floyd're all set LT! We're ready to go!
All right folks, let's move 'em out.
Oh, I should note, don't have any electronics, machines or people you care about near the EMP Discharger when you set it off.
How near is too near?
Well, if you trigger the discharge, then run away as fast as you can, that's probably far enough.
I really don't want to handle this.
Doors are open LT!
How long will the wedge hold?
I don't think the wedge is going anywhere, kinda ever. It's jammed in there pretty good.
Let's move carefully, there are a LOT of civilians down there, and we're here to rescue them, not catch them in friendly fire.
Bene così 95sima!
You catch Cassidy in friendly fire, start running.
Ramsey is scary.
You wanna stop cowering behind scientists for a few minutes and get what's coming?
Bronson!
Be careful now, I have some very important hostages.
You lay one finger... we're gonna find out how long I can keep you alive and bleeding.
It's over Bronson. The feint at New Haven, taking I17, it was smart, but it's too late.
Funny, Stephenson was sure you wouldn't be able to get in here in time... He was usually right about this kinda stuff. He was right about almost everything from the day he showed up.
Well, he picked a hell of a time to be wrong.
Wonder if I'll get my hands on Stephenson before this is over.
Hell of a girl.
Ramsey!
Are you okay?
Cass!
Fine. Hungry. I hid in the vents for days. Picked 'em off. They caught me sneaking out to find food.
I bet you gave those bastards hell, honey.
You say it like I'm done giving them hell.
Bronson
You lovebirds might want to cut this short. We've got failsafe explosives all over this facility. You start running now, some of you might survive.
Move it folks! Sergeant, get these people to safety!
I'm not letting Bronson out of my sight!
I've got him! You go!
If either of y'all thinks I'm leaving without putting some rounds into that sucker, you're dearly mistaken.
There's plenty of Bronson to go around.
It'll be very cozy down there.
Hey, how come we're not blown up?
He was clearly lying about the explosives. I assumed you knew.
… I did?
Lieutenant... it's hard to believe I once hesitated to trust you. Thank you, thank you so much.
Don't sweat it. I don't exactly scream "trustworthy". Anything you can do with the surviving Silver Wolves?
We have some very, VERY secure test chambers in the lower floors of Installation 17. I'm sure we could free up some space.
It's better than they deserve.
I'm unarmed, and I'm Imperial. Please, I need help.
Non sparate!
Uh, okay. Sure.
I'm from an Imperial Science Corps research installation. We're running low on some basic supplies, and well, our reports indicate you guys have been pretty great about helping the local towns.
Well, I don't really have the authority to approve any of this, but... gosh, you seem sincere! Why not?
What could go wrong?
Huh. I suddenly have the urge to punish Perkins.
You're very kind. We won't forget the help.
Grazie, specialista Perkins.
Just one Imperial helpin' out another. Have a good trip!
Who was that?
Oh, some scientist lady. She runs a secret installation out here. Needed some supplies, so I helped her out.
Quick! Someone stop her! I have questions!
Ma'am! Pardon me! Please don't leave.
Excuse me, I'm really in quite a hurry.
I was hoping to discuss the manufacture and operation of the portable laser device. I'm guessing you might have some insight I'd find invaluable.

Damn. Look, I appreciate the help, and if I had anything I could afford to give back, I would, but there's no way I'm giving my research to the first group of Imperial survivors I see. I need to protect my people.
I have no intention of seizing your research, but I'd like a chance to talk. Hold tight, I'll grab us some lunch.
Where am I gonna find lunch?
Another adherent of Science!
interesting meal.
Questo è un...

Sorry, I wanted something enticing and... I kind of panicked. Regardless, I was hoping we could discuss your situation. Now, if you're set up like a standard Imperial Installation, you'll have both a Chief Technical Officer and a Chief Administrator. I have to say I'm surprised to see you here instead of the Administrator.
