He's... indisposed. Look, I'm really not comfortable discussing the specifics of my Installation. I try to avoid going out, but I didn't know what else to do. We're in bad shape.
Well, perhaps we can help each other out.
Look, you seem like decent people, but so did the last guys I dealt with, and that went poorly.

Since you're being direct, I shall be so as well. While your outpost and breakthroughs are of great personal interest, your advances in weaponry would allow us to turn the tide against these Silver Wolves, and ensure safety in the region.

OK, let's say you're successful. What then? Our prototypes won't hold off the rebels. And what happens if the power goes to your heads? What if there's some kind of coup in your outpost? I can't risk releasing the laser technology.
Perhaps I can help you feel a little more secure?
Oh, man! I bet they have a mass spectrometer!
Lightning Troopers! Where did these come from?
Look, Floyd, you seem very nice, and I'd love to sit down some time and discuss some of our findings, but the laser technology is simply off the table.
I fully understand. Is there anything that ISN'T off the table?
Hmm. We have some prototype lightning tech I'd be willing to walk you through.
It's a start!
our hands on the laser weapons from that Aurora lady.
Dobbiamo averlo
She's made it very clear she has no intention of parting with that research.
Yeah, but she's never seen ME turn on the charm!
I cannot say I'm comfortable with this.
I can woo this girl. I can woo ANYONE.
Perfect. I send her the gifts, and we just wait for her to show up and swoon into my arms. Installation 17's lasers will soon be ours!

We have no idea where Aurora lives, or where Installation 17 is, and she only communicates with me via carefully bounced radio message. I can set these aside for her... she's planning to stop by in the next few weeks.
He sent word that you'd be willing to share another load of supplies.
Mi scusi, sto cercando Floyd?
You must be from that secret military base with the lasers and what not! That casin' you folks made sure was impressive. I had a heck of a time breaking it open.
You were able to break it open without damaging the interior? It was designed specifically to make that impossible. How did you pull that off?
I'll give you a walkthrough.
I don't mind showin' off a bit.
All that talent, and she's making tanks!
I see you've met Zoey.
Ah, Aurora!
She's a truly remarkable young woman! Did she really build all those devices herself?
Indeed, along with more than half of this Outpost. I don't suppose you're looking for interns?
Interns? If I still had funding, she'd be running her own research team!
Reports are in, sir. The Silver Wolves have started sending troops east. We don't have much time to cut them off.
Ramsey, you heard Perkins. Let's get the men ready to move.
Sir, I'm not sure we're ready. The weather in the Eastern Wastes is rough. A lot of our hardware might not run in that cold.
No better way to find out than by going.
I'm pretty sure I can think of several better ways.
I got the sniffles.
Okay, Ramsey, good call. We're going to need to do some serious cold weather prep for this.
Let's head home. I'm sure Zoey and Floyd can put something together that'll get us back in the game.
The cold in the Eastern Wastes is brutal! Our troops are freezing, and vehicles are just shutting down.
Indeed, none of our gear is rated for that kind of weather. I'm sure Zoey and I can put something together.
Oh! What about a tank that was just, like, on fire all the time?
Let's not stop brainstorming just yet.
Or we could make trenchcoats out of asbestos!
Who cares about getting shot?
Zoey, you've outdone yourself!
The insulation Floyd and I put together might slow you down a little, but it does double duty as armor. If you can't move, at least getting shot ain't so bad.
Morgan, I just received a message from Aurora. While we were getting our things together, the Silver Wolves started attacking the Installation!
Did she give us coordinates for the base, by chance?
She didn't encode the signal nearly as well as she usually does, which is basically the same thing. It's probably as close as she can get to actually just telling us where to go.
Sì e no?
Government secrets are a pain.
We've got, like, a LOT of practice.
Thank goodness you came! Our men simply aren't trained for this kind of thing.
Well, that's convenient. My men are trained pretty much exactly for this sort of thing.

Floyd, it's good of you to be here. I don't know if we... we held them off, but we suffered some pretty heavy damage. And the casualties... oh, Floyd. They're just scientists, they don't know how to...
I'm just sorry we couldn't get here sooner. We'll want disinfectant and bandages for the wounded, and some metal patch kits for the structural damage.
We're in your hands. I wouldn't have known what to do. I just... we have no experience with this kind of thing.
Sadly, we do.
No time to waste.
I'm glad Archibald is keeping himself occupied.
Good man, Floyd. I consider this further proof that you were the right lot to throw in with. With which to throw in... in with which to throw? I'm sorry. I'm quite out of sorts.
Quite all right. We're here to help.
Sir, Sergeant Ramsey is back from the wastes!
Ramsey, give me good news.
Glad to be able to. Silver Wolves were inbound, but storms have scrambled them. They're lost all over the Eastern Wasteland.
Finally, some luck. Let's move out and clean them up before they can regroup.
This was lucky, but don't get used to it.
I can't believe it worked again!
Sir, I'm worried that this is going a little too smoothly. Like, they're scattered all over the place, but they don't really seem to be regrouping, or doing much of anything...

Perkins, are you suggesting I've been out-strategized? That, once again, the Silver Wolves have diverted my attention from the real target? Because - and I think this is clear - we have their real target, Installation 17, extremely well defended and—
Just got word, Lieutenant: Silver Wolves are attacking the outpost.
Sul serio? Oh cacchio!
Oh man, what if this is some kind of double feint, and he's actually back at I17 right now!
All due respect, sir? It doesn't matter. Silver Wolves are attacking our people, and we're going to stop them.
A fair point, Sergeant.
Sometimes Morgan thinks too much.
I'm just kooky that way!
How's it feel, mister Morgan? Always scrambling to keep up? Never in control? And to know it's your fault? After all, you could have avoided this.
When you and your Silver Wolves shoot innocent people, no matter how you spin it, I don't think it's my fault. I don't know, maybe I'm weird.
Zoey, I'm really sorry, but...
You need to get back to I17. I understand. You head back - I'll get the ol' Outpost back in shape in no time!
Wrap a bandage and splash on some paint!
They wouldn't get ten feet in that cold anyway!
All right. We've got the Outpost back on its legs. Now we just gotta wait for news.
Zoeyyyyyy, c'mon! Let us go help!
I told you kids, no driving your tank to war until you're all thirteen.
NO FAIR!
Awwwww!
We've got incoming, sirs. And ma'am.
This looks like the big one, folks. They've got some pretty incredible numbers.
Are we going to be all right?
You and me? Yes. Everyone else? I'm not so sure.
Just try me!
He wouldn't let me have even a moment of victory.
They're pulling back. We've got 'em on the ropes!
Or this is yet another trick.
Right, that's possible too.
Morgan.
You about done throwing your people into a woodchipper? Have we made it pretty clear that you're not getting Installation 17?
You've made it pretty clear that, before this is over, it's all gonna come down to me and you.
I think that's an oversimplification.
Man, I kinda feel bad for the Silver Wolves.
This isn't over. There are more of us than you could ever hope to stop. We're gonna swallow you up.

Not over, huh?  You know what, he's right. This is the beginning. This guy thinks he knows war? He's never seen anything. We'll show him war. We'll show him the Imperial Army. No more playing defense, no more scrambling.
This is the army that conquered Ateria. This is the army that controlled most of the known world for half a century. This is the army that will fall on the Silver Wolves and grind them into nothing.
You think you're going to conquer the Imperial Army? That you're gonna swallow us up? I guarantee you'll choke.
I swear, I turn my back for ONE rescue mission, and when I get home, friggin' Silver Wolves everywhere.
Figlio di una...
Shucks, if the Silver Wolves want to keep the fun going, I say we thank 'em.
Seems reasonable to me.
When I said thank, I meant that we should shoot them.
I know, honey.
Okay, good.
I just wanted to make sure we both knew I meant shoot them.
Seriously, we're talking Perkins-level trouble.
OK, Colt, we're here. Where are the Silver Wolves? And why is Ramsey here? Is this a surprise party for me? Where are my presents? We do presents first in my family.
Just after I radioed you for help, Ramsey and Cass showed up and took care of things.
Wait! Ramsey! You're back! Great work, Cassidy! Ramsey, you're in a truly insane amount of trouble!
It's great to see you too, Lieutenant.
Morgan, I've been investigating the damage done to Perkins' boot by that laser gun we were attacked with.
These people have created a handheld weapon that can melt or burn through conventional armors, but I don't know how.
We absolutely need to figure out how these guns work, if only so we can protect ourselves from them. I don't like not knowing what I'm up against.
Signore, queste persone sono una minaccia alla sicurezza.
I'll consider authorizing a mission to steal one of these guns. But I'm having Perkins confined to the base. We don't have room in the budget to get new boots for him every day.
Mi avevi già convinto a "danno fatto a Perkins."
Be very very careful. Try not to look directly at the gun while it is firing.
Thanks for the new boots - they fit great!
All right, Floyd. We got your laser gun. Don't make me regret this.
I have the full might of the scientific method behind me. I'll get to the bottom of this!
Non preoccuparti.
Any progress with the laser, Floyd? Morgan told me you might need some help.
The ON/OFF button remains impervious to my prodding. I tried pushing it, holding it down, even tapping it in patterns.
Zoey, do you think you can get the casing off of this weapon? The rivets on the side turned out to be decorative. I think it's fused into a single outer shell.
Wait, do you need whatever is inside to be in one piece?
Si, penso di poterlo aprire a colpi.
Do be careful! The insides could be highly volatile.
I hope Zoey can make more progress than I did.
I was willing to entertain Science. But it won't entertain me.
I'll clamp the gun in this squeezer, then just twist and separate the casing with this chainsaw!
Queste dovrebbero funzionare!
I think this setup might have some applications for our information gathering ops. We could put a prisoner on a platform, and have the laser sloooooowly move toward him, right? Then—
Morgan, you should probably get out of here. You don't even have any safety goggles on.
I believe the device requires more power than we can supply at the moment. I really wish there was another option... but we're going to need coal.
A generator with a large amount of coal and oil might be able to produce enough energy to get this contraption turned on again.
I was trying to avoid this. Coal and I are not on good terms.
What's that smell? It's like burnt hair...
Facciamo scoppiare questa fornace!
It's working! The lights are coming on! And BLINKING!
Uh-oh! The thing's goin' nuts!
BWEEOOOP BEEP BEEP BEEP
Quickly! Shut it down somehow!
What is all that racket?
...eeep.
Yeah! Take that, laser!
BWEEEeeeeeee...
I'm sorry, laser. I wanted to be reasonable.
Your stupid light show destroyed a bottle of hooch I was saving for a special occasion. I expect that replaced, along with an extra bottle for the emotional trauma suffered.
Floyd.
A laser shot through my bunk and singed Mr. Purrface! I've never seen him so scared!
What about the people who were scalded by rogue laser blasts! They need their wounds treated!
Credo che quelle cose possano aspettare!
Don't worry, everyone! I'll fix everything damaged by the laser. I'll also start drafting a job posting for a "Senior Laser Specialist." Assuming we ever want to use lasers again.
I've now had my "took science too far" moment.
It's OK, Mr. Purrface. It was so scary - I know! It's all right now, Daddy's got you.
Well, Floyd, what have we learned today?
That weaponized lasers are scary. And that I'm not trained as a laser scientist.
Let's stick with what we're good at from now on.
I've been working on the laser gun... or what's left of it, at least... and I think I've made a breakthrough!
I don't know. Between you and Zoey, I'm starting to think of "science" as "something that terrorizes and/or puts me in the hospital."
Only if you're doing something interesting! Anyway, I'm THIS close to tracking the origins of the laser, but I need a few more things so Zoey and I can find the last pieces of the puzzle.
Whatever you need, it's not going to be easy to get, is it?
Oh, heavens, no!
Of course not.
This modulator isn't explosive... I don't think.
Who the hell are these guys?
Morgan! Morgan! This... this is incredible!
As incredible as my new recipe for Sandworm Pot Pie?
Yes! Well... maybe.  Anyway!  I finished the analysis. The laser weapon is an experimental design, but my findings prove that it's of Imperial origin!
What?!
What's more, the battery components are unmistakably of recent manufacture!
Then that means...
Yes! There are other Imperial survivors in the region.  And they have laser guns!
Sir, we just got some... interesting intelligence on the Silver Wolves.
Let me guess: they're engaged in armed robbery, extortion, protection rackets, and general looting?
Well, yeah, but more than that! They've had a lot of troops deserting lately.  We've been having so many successes against them that their morale and pay scale are at an all time low.
Huh... So this is what it feels like to be winning. I like it!
You know, Morgan, if their morale is low, we might be able to lure them to our side. They may be thugs, but they're strong. Plus they may have intelligence that we'll be able to use.
Interesting point, Ramsey. But the question remains: how do we lure in a bunch of starving, money-hungry mercenaries who sell their skills to the highest bidder?
Well, money, right? It's money.
Nothing says "loyalty" like bribery!
Certainty is comforting!
So now that we can recruit Silver Wolves, how do we know we can trust them? They've already changed employers once.
As long as we keep winning, and keep the gold flowing, I don't think that'll be a problem.
It's still a precarious position to be in. And I'm not sure I'm comfortable having such morally bankrupt and avaricious persons in our outpost.
No, it's great! If I know one thing about the greedy, it's that they're consistent. We know exactly what to expect: selfish murderers who will turn against us at the first opportunity!
Lieutenant! I'm getting reports of some kind of stand off outside Marin. Shots fired... it's all pretty vague.
Well, I'm sure once we get down there and fire some shots back everything will get a lot less vague.
I'll get the men moving.
I find things get a lot less vague after a few shots.
Not too many, probably a scouting party. But it looks like they've been pinned down by Imperial forces!
Ci sono dei Ribelli, signore!
Seriously? Did I already send Perkins down here to take care of this? It gets hard to keep track of after a while...
Negative, Lieutenant. These aren't our men.
Well, what do you say we give these fine folks a hand?
Seriously, you try keeping track of all the fights I get into. It's rough!
Am I famous?
I gotta tell you guys, it's a hell of a pleasant surprise to see some friendly faces out here. I'm Lieutenant Morgan with the 95th Rifles and—
You're the guys making life complicated for the rest of us.
Sappiamo chi sei, Morgan.
I guess we have been pretty active lately, meeting lots of people... But why haven't we heard of you?
Hai sentito di noi?

Do you see me running off and sticking my nose into every argument a dirt farmer has with his neighbor? Hell no. We're here, protecting Imperial citizens and trying to keep this city from falling apart.
Perché so stare coi piedi per terra e portare a termine un lavoro.
We've been doing that too. Just, you know, in lots of little cities instead of one big one. Though the Outpost is getting to be quite the little city itself...

And making giant targets out of yourselves and every city you visit while you're at it. Look, you love helping so much? Marin doesn't need your guns. We need your steel. Lots of repairs here, not enough steel.
Maybe one of the things that needs repairs is his manners.
Man, I used to be so good at marching. Just super good.
You know, we've actually got a pretty healthy level of steel production going. Not to mention food, medicine, that kind of thing. If you guys wanted more help we could—

Look, I know you think you're doing the right thing, but we don't want to play hero. If you folks want to run up and down the Frontier, that's fine, but we're gonna take care of our own. That's what soldiers do.
Also we march a lot. I mean, yeah, that's kinda secondary I guess, but, you know... we do it.

I feel like we got off on the wrong foot with the troops holed up in Marin. They've got some good points about the way we're overextending ourselves, and it would be really valuable if we could have them as allies...
Well, we could take out the Silver Wolves that are camped outside Marin. That would probably help win them over.
Woah, Silver Wolves? Why haven't we already jumped on this?
This was exactly the kind of help they said they didn't want. I'm generally pretty good at listening to orders.
I mean, lately.
So this is righteous indignation...
What the hell do you think you're doing?
Protecting you from murderous thugs?
The Silver Wolves get a little food and some of that steel you gave us and they leave us alone.
Avevamo un accordo!
You paid them off? With OUR steel?
You took our steel, which you claimed you needed for repairs, and used it to pay off the Silver Wolves?!
We said we needed it to keep Marin safe. And that's what we did.
You gave aid to the enemy!
Our enemy is the Rebel army, and the Silver Wolves are the only thing keeping them from swarming the Frontier and killing or imprisoning every last one of us!
If you weren't so caught up trying to do the right thing, you'd do the smart thing and get out of their way!
So we should roll over and ignore people in need like you cowards?
Men, let's show this pompous ass what cowards we are!
Hit 'em hard, Rifles!
How many people have died on your watch?
I'm not wasting any more time, blood, or bullets on you people. You develop a conscience, let us know.
Abbastanza!
How's that high horse feel, Morgan? You comfy up there? Got a good view of all the death your idealistic crap is causing?
95th Rifles, let's go home.
Battaglione di Canaglie
You want us to send them food? They lie, they give aid and comfort to the enemy, they attack us, and you're sending them food?
That's still a city full of Imperial citizens. They still need food and aid. It's not their fault they're protected by dicks.
I have to agree with Morgan. A lot of people are effectively trapped there. Perhaps our generosity will inspire change from within.
I wouldn't count on it.
All right boys. Let's be good guys.
I hope Floyd is right.
Morgan, between the two of us, I'm extremely proud of the decisions we've made. I really feel like we're doing good.
Do you think so? Are we making the right choice? Are we just perpetuating conflict and putting lives at risk?
I think you could ask any person in Recoil Ridge, or Sundale, or any of the other little towns we've helped. We're making a difference.
Hello, Lieutenant. I hear you've been making yourself useful around these parts. I didn't think you all had it in you, but I'm glad this was one of those rare times I was wrong.
Thanks... I think.  But you don't strike me as the kind who just stops by to issue mildly backhanded compliments...

And you would be right. I don't believe the Silver Wolves are gone. I'm certain they're somewhere nearby, laying low for a future surprise attack. I think this is the time to sniff them out, before they can put any plots into motion.
That's actually a good idea.  I wouldn't trust the Silver Wolves as far as I can throw them.  And frankly, I throw like a little girl.
Unfortunately, I don't have any information as to where they might be hiding out.  You'll just have to search some of the frontier towns until you find 'em. I wish you luck — for all our sakes.
We'll have to search for the wolves in Sundale, Skarborough, Marin, and Recoil. They're bound to be somewhere.
Let's give them a good old fashioned Imperial welcome!
Captain! Marin is crawling with Silver Wolves!
Looks like Ma was right on the money. This is still our territory, as far as I'm concerned. It's time to show the Silver Wolves just what we do to trespassers.
Howdy there, sheriff.  Seen any Silver Wolves around here lately?
Nope.
Any unusual activity anywhere in the region?
Nope.
... You aren't going to say anything else until we move on, are you?
Nope.
Awesome.  We'll... be going, then.
Hail and greetings, Imperial visitors! You're just in time for our harvest feast! We'll be serving the finest organic rye cakes and barley water!
Um, no, thanks.  You seen any Silver Wolves around here?
We haven't, thank Mother Nature.  But if we do, maybe we can turn them to our side with our sugarless gluten-free wheat germ fritters!
Good luck with that.  Later, hippies.
Wait! You forgot your brown rice cream with unsweetened carob!
Well, if it isn't Lieutenant Morgan! I promise we don't have a crisis on our hands that I haven't told you about...
Glad to hear that, Sheriff. But I'm actually here on other business.  Have you seen any trace of the Silver Wolves in the area lately?
Nope, can't say I have, and I've been keeping a sharp eye out. Is there a problem I should know about?
Not yet, Sheriff, but I'll keep you informed.  C'mon, men, let's look somewhere else.
Okay, men, I don't think I have to tell you what to do. Just go out there and do what you do best: wreak widespread mayhem on a massive scale!
Lieutenant, we're trained professionals. We make surgical strikes based on careful strategizing.  We don't "wreak mayhem."
Potato, poh-tah-to.
Nothing like a little mop-up to keep a place tidy.
I should sue him for false advertising.
We've gotten rid of most of them, Lieutenant. But there's still a few holdouts near the center of the city. They're being led by that Doug guy.
"Doug." That name sounds more like the kindly old shopkeeper who wears cardigans and gives you free candy, not a six and a half foot tall killing machine with a badass scar.
Lupi d'Argento invasori
I don't know how you found us, but I'm not gonna let this slide! Yer gonna pay for messing with the Silver Wolves!
You guys really gotta get some more creative priorities.  It's all "get revenge on the Outpost" this and "pillage helpless towns" that. Why not take up speed walking? Or macrame?
You making fun of us again? I'll share with ya the meaning of "pain."
I'm surprised he didn't need a dictionary.
Do they train in leaving with ominous warnings or something?
Argh! Silver Wolves, retreat! I'll get you all for this! Just you wait!
And this is different from a few minutes ago? Like I said, one track minds, the whole lot of you.
Yeah, go ahead and laugh! We'll see who's got the upper hand in the long run!
Boss Doug
I've been observing a few Outpost workers at night through thermal goggles. Due to subtle changes in their body language, I suspect morale has significantly decreased.
What with the Raiders, and the Silver Wolves, and the whole Empire bein' destroyed...
Beh, ecco, immaginavo fosse ovvio.
I've read psychological studies that concluded people feel better when they know they're appreciated. We could write thank you cards to everyone?
I don't know if that's such a good idea.
We should probably automate the process of writing thank you cards an' build an enormous distribution machine to shower the whole Outpost as a sign of our appreciation!
It's so obvious. Why didn't I think of that?
...Why did the card writing machine have to sign in my name?
So what are the results?
Hard to say. When I fired the card cannon, people thought they were gettin' attacked and started screamin' and runnin' for their lives.
Probably shouldn't have made the damn thing so noisy.
Well, they appear to have calmed down now. Perhaps the cards are taking effect? I better start taking notes.
"We value your joyful spirit and enthusiasm. Signed, Floyd."
Are you TRYING to get the firing squad?
Floyd, è una specie di scherzo?
It might be a good idea to call this off and try something else...
The automated card machine was a complete failure and morale is still low. We could... offer free hugs?
How 'bout we throw a big party instead? People got to have a reason to celebrate, even if it's for nothin' at all except still being alive.
In my opinion the only difference between a party and a riot is that parties have balloons.
Non è una buona idea.
Oh come on, it'll be fun. We'll do the baking, and the Raider kids will get the decorations. Right, kids?
We're on it!
I've got dibs on the turret!
Taro, stop kicking the back of my chair!
Guys, be quiet. I see sandworms right over there!
Go for the eyes!
…Where are the eyes?
Everyone is going to love these party decorations!
Floyd, I don't want to say that pie looks terrible, but-
Baking should be just like Science, measurements and analysis. Why do I keep burning the crust? Why is there flour everywhere? Help!
Zoey, non capisco!
We went out to get decorations and then Taro shot a missile at a mammoth and Yaro wouldn't let me drive and we ran into a tent full of grownups and now everyone is chasing us! Help!
Zoey! Zoey!
Kids, when I said decorations, I meant you know, like streamers and balloons.
I burned my hand on the stove! I need emergency medical care!
It's a wonder anyone around here is still alive...
...Well, the battles cheered me up...
Why are there Sandworm corpses hanging up everywhere? And is that a giant pie? And Floyd sobbing?
Hey, LT. We were trying to throw a party to cheer everyone up, but as you can see-
-Yes, I can see it was a complete disaster. Of course I blame Floyd.
I just... can't bake pies...
From here on out, I forbid any sort of parties, thank you cards, or any other sort of non-military related shenanigans you two may have planned. No more trying to cheer anyone up!
Help! Sundale is, like, having a crisis, man! It's boars! They're being chased out of their natural habitat by the bigfoots! Now they're in our farms, eating our crops...  It's a bad scene, man!
Boars, eh? Well, that should be simple to take care of. I'll send a few Hunters to...
No, no! Don't hurt the boars! It's not their fault! We, humanity, are the intruders in their natural world!  Sundale would rather starve than let these magnificent creatures be harmed in our name.

You know, he has a point. I think I can find a natural solution to their problem. Like aversion! I've been developing a strain of hot peppers that may do the trick. I'll just have Perkins plant and harvest them.
Peppers are actually a type of berry.
Aaand it's circling right back to funny again.
I dunno, these peppers don't look so OH MY GOD MY EYES IT'S LIKE THERE'S A FLAME TANK RAMPAGING IN MY SKULL!!!
Perkins, be careful! You'll drop the bushel! I warned you about wearing gloves!
Okay, watching Perkins writhe in agony is starting to get boring, and I think I almost feel sorry for him. What can we do?
Not much, unless there's a vat of milk we can stick his head in.  He'll just have to wash his eyes out and hope for the best.
NON SAPEVO ESISTESSE UNA AGONIA SIMILE! DIO AIUTAMI, NON LO SAPEVO!!!
You might be onto something with these peppers, Floyd. Perkins almost clawed his face off!
Well, we can't just use whole peppers. We'll need to process them into powder to coat the crops. That'll give the boars quite a shock!
Or just cook 'em from the inside out. I'd make Perkins do the processing...
Mommy?  Mommy? Do I have to go to school, Mommy?
... but I think he's still too traumatized to be useful.  I'll just have them refined at the Machine Shop. They have the equipment and protective gear to handle even those peppers.
I'm only three and a half years old!
I'll yell at Floyd once my heart starts again...
This is it! A vial of pure concentrated Death Pepper essence in powder form!
Ah, Floyd... Can you not wave it around like that? You're making me nervous.
Oh, please! I'm a trained Scientist! If I can handle chemical weapons, I can handle- Oops, almost dropped it there. My apologies.
So now that we have your... Powder of Doom, what do we do with it?
The most efficient delivery method would be to dissolve the powder in water and set up a series of sprinklers to spread it over Sundale's fields in aerosol form.
Just to ask... what exactly will this do to their crops?
Oh, only make them a little spicier. I've already sent over my patented antacids.
Okay, fine, but if this ends up creating boars that breathe fire, YOU'RE the one who's going to have to handle them.
Morgan just doesn't seem to trust Science!
Floyd's got a funny definition of "unqualified"...
Well, we put in the sprinklers... after a town hall meeting followed by a community vote, of course...
Yes? And? It worked, didn't it?

Oh, yeah, man, it sure did! The boars took one whiff and headed for the hills!  We're also kinda crying all the time from our mouths burning like a hot asphalt road in the middle of summer, but at least we got food, man!
An unqualified success! Science triumphs once again!
Come, come! There's not a second to waste!
Perkins, ragazzo mio!
Gee, I don't know, Percival. I have to finish polishing Lieutenant Morgan's golf clubs...
Oh, hang the Lieutenant's golf clubs! This is more important! Adventure awaits! There's an Ancient ruin to the northwest that I've long wanted to explore, and you're just the man I'd want by my side!
That sounds... really neat. I guess the golf clubs can wait...
Of course they can! But first things first: we must be properly outfitted! No sense going there without being prepared.
If Perkins does a good job on these clubs, I'll let him polish the real ones.
Percival sure knows how to motivate people...
Capital! I hope you're ready for quite the adventure, Perkins! It's a long walk to Sector 8...
Whoa, whoa, whoa, hold up just a second! Did I just hear you say "Sector 8"? The Empire has specifically forbidden travel there!
Well, the Empire isn't in much position to stop me anymore, is it, Lieutenant? Now come along, Perkins! Fortune favors the bold!
Oh, no you don't! I didn't authorize Perkins to—
Hundred year old brandy.
Have a good trip, you two.
We all packed? Good! Great discoveries and greater peril await us!
That sounds good! Well, half good, anyway.
Oh, come now! Nothing like a good stare at death to get the blood flowing!
Man... Look at this place...
Incredible! See that? That's a photonic refiner! It was used to convert light into energy! And there! An ionic cyclotron! So many fascinating experiments conducted with those!
Wow, you sure know a lot about this Ancient tech stuff...
But of course. Any good explorer must do their research. Ah! That one there was a magnetic field generator! And that over there, of course, is a group of Silver Wolves scavenging for parts.
So what's the thing with the two— Wait, what was that last part again?
Bah, like those fools could understand the wonders they're ripping apart.
Heck, I think this place is probably safer!
Serves them right, meddling with forces they can barely comprehend! Why, if they'd finished removing that tungsten fusion battery, they would've blown half this region to smithereens!
Really?! So, uh... Will we be okay?
Naturally! I'm here, after all. Just... don't touch anything. It's better if you don't know what could happen if you were to bump against the wrong button.
Don't worry; I know the drill. I've been in Zoey's workshop.
Lupi d'Argento Sciacalli
Look, over there! An Ancient vault! The researchers would use them to store and protect their most valuable creations and finds!
How do you know so much about all this Ancient ruin stuff, anyway?
I, er... borrowed some classified Imperial archaeological reports. Please don't tell your Lieutenant this. Ah! We're here!
Hmm, looks like this one's not locked. This should be—
That was close; you almost activated the automatic defenses! They would have sliced you into microparticles in moments!
PERKINS! Non fare un altro passo!
I... Gulp! Thanks for the warning! But how do we get past them?

Now that's a bit of a sticky problem. We'd need protection as thick as a concrete wall. Yet to reach the vault itself, that protection would have to move with us! Where on earth would we find something like that?
Ah. How... resourceful of you all.
There used to be taxes, but with the Empire gone, well...
Excellent! Now we can follow the wall to the vault! Walk behind it... Keep up, now! Drop too far behind, and you'll certainly regret it!
Wow, the wall's taking a beating! What kind of weapons are these?
Oh, the usual assortment: sonic bullets, lasers, particle beams, pico-missiles... Hopefully, the wall will be able to take the damage.
Hopefully...?
This is life, Perkins! There are no guarantees! If you want certainties, death is the only one, and some even question that! So buck up, lad!
The vault! Finally! We're a hair's breadth from success now, Perkins!
Uh, it sort of looks like the last vault we opened. I hope it has something better in it this time...
One must have confidence and optimism, Perkins! If I didn't, I would never have the long, illustrious career I have now! Just let me get the door, and... Ah!
Oh, so che lo fa!
What do you see? What's inside?
And sandworms. It seems they turned the vault into a nest... And now they see us. Hrm, they don't look happy. Not at all.
Vespidi, in effetti.
Never a moment's rest, eh, Perkins? But that's what makes life interesting!
Oh, Perkins! Those golf clubs aren't polishing themselves!
Finally! Now we're in! Hopefully those beasts didn't break everything...
Hey, what's that red glow? It's coming from that box...
Why, it's...! Hmmm. But it's not... Oh! That must be because...
Bagliore rosso?! Fammelo vedere!
I don't see anything else here. I hope you're not too disappointed, Percival...
THIS makes the entire trip worthwhile! Oh, Perkins, if only you knew the kind of power that rests in this box!
Deluso? Neanche un po'!
Really? What is it? What's it do?
Hmm? Oh, I... I couldn't say without a great deal more research. Ah, I apologize, my boy, but I must be off. Thank you for aiding my little endeavor! Until next time and next adventure, Perkins!
Creature delle Segrete
Not that we're not grateful for everything you've done for us, Lieutenant...
Fine, fine, we'll start repairing all the buildings tomorrow.  I'll have Perkins spread mammoth patties for the flower beds...

No no! I actually wanted something different. See, we can't always be callin' on you to defend us every time we get attacked, so I was wonderin' what you'd suggest to help us stand on our own two feet.
... Really?  You mean if I tell you what to do,  you'll actually LISTEN? And without whining or arguing?
Of course! Why not? You're a lieutenant in the Imperial Army, after all. You don't get there by bein' a dummy.
No! No, you don't... All right, then, Judge, my opinion: first you have to train your citizens to defend themselves.  Perhaps if you watch how we train our troops...
Hey, Judge, want to practice cracking the whip for a while?
Finally, the respect I deserve.
I have to admit, these matters are not my area of expertise, but you Imperials seem to have the training regimen down pat!
We have to! We go through a lot of troops.
Well, regardless, my militia captains will be putting your methods into practice at once!  Bernmoth is a whole lot safer now, thanks to y'all!
If you don't mind me saying this, Judge... You're treating us a lot better than Ma.
Ma may like you, or she may not. But she sure as shootin' doesn't trust ya.  You don't get to be her age and build a business empire like hers by trustin' blindly.
Well, then, I'm glad that you, at least, are so gracious.
That's just the way I was raised, son. I give credit where credit is due. Anyhow, what's the next step?
Vehicles. Against the Silver Wolves, infantry may not be enough. Not that you need tanks or anything, but at least some scout bikes will help a lot...
Actually, I'm ahead of you there. We were startin' to build a Vehicle Factory when the riots started.  All we need from you is a little push to help finish up.
I'd get Zoey to help, but I think the judge wants his factory intact.
Me? No, I'm not laughin'… Just… clearin' my throat!
Well, now, ain't that a sight? Not only will we get vehicles to help in our defense, but we can build trucks for farmin', and provide jobs to boot!
Yep, there's nothing like the military-industrial complex to advance civilization!

Y'know, bein' part of the Empire was fine and all... We paid our taxes and got our supplies... But we never got the feelin' anyone CARED. Y'all are the first to actually care about us in a long spell.
Well! Ah... We rugged, masculine frontier types have to stick together, don't we?
What's the next step for the Bernmoth Defense Militia, Lieutenant? We are completely in your capable hands!
Kind of you, Judge... Anyway, I'd like to see what kind of progress your militia is making in their training...
How about a little sparrin' practice? And heck, why not add a little wager? Whoever wins more battles gets his men treated to a rip roarin' barbeque by the losers!
You're on!
Excellent! I'll send the troops on down.  You engage 'em whenever you're ready.  I'll make sure they don't hold back, so make sure you don't either!
You men had better not embarrass me or the Empire out there!
Help... Choking... on... delicious... barbecue...
Wow, look at this spread! I haven't seen this much food since my visits to Grandma's!
Well, your lieutenant and I made a little bet, and I lost, fair and square.  Eat up, folks!
Oh, GOD, this chow is good. You're a very gracious loser, Judge...
Well, the way I see it, we gotta stick together, or we ain't gonna survive.  It's pretty much law in these parts, and I don't see any reason to change it for you folks...
I'm sure the Lieutenant will thank you, Judge, if he ever actually takes a moment between swallows to breathe...
Sirs, after those riots, I got to thinking. If we're going to deal with civilians, we should probably consider training some people in non-lethal methods of crowd control.
Sir, Perkins is making a pretty good point here.
Ramsey, this is a reasonable plan, but I'd like YOU to explain it to me, so I can pretend that it wasn't Perkins' idea.
Soldiers are trained to kill people. Since we're dealing with civilians, we need to train some soldiers to not kill people.
Perfetto.
He called me reasonable!
Help!
I had the Peace Keepers practice on Perkins! It's hilarious!
Hahaha! Guarda!
Sir, is that really appropriate?
He can't get out of the net, Ramsey! HE CAN'T GET OUT OF THE NET!
Morgan, I have some concerns about the Peace Keepers.
We never should have listened to Perkins!
Lo sapevo!
No, that's not it. The troops are fine, but without any lethal options, they feel a little naked out there.
Why not give them some support? Maybe a Riot Truck?
I continue to support this initiative whenever you're the one who explains it to me.
We used a Riot Truck to gas hippies at the Academy.
And I'm no jerk!
Yup, it totally worked. As long as Morgan thinks it's my idea, he'll pay attention.
Thanks for helping out, Sarge. It's nice to know I can help. You know, as long as I accept that I'll never receive any credit or respect.
Respect is for jerks, kid.
We've got more food riots, this time in Trotbeck!
Signore!
Wait a second. This is pretty convenient. Did you and Perkins plan this to show off those new Peace Keepers and Riot Trucks?
Tiriamo fuori il nuovo...
Are you seriously accusing me of starting a riot to prove a point?
Yeah, I guess that's kind of a "me" thing, isn't it?
Riots are a pretty compelling argument.
We didn't murder anyone!
Well, Ma, glad to help out. As you can see, we were SUPER careful not to kill the rioters.
I'm glad you had the self restraint to not murder starving people driven to rash action. I'm sure your family would be very proud.
My family is probably dead!
Ha! Fai vedere cosa sai!
What's going on? Why are there people camped inside the tool shop?
Floyd!

I'm running out of places to put people. Apparently, word has gotten out among displaced Imperials that there's a safe haven in the far reaches of the Frontier. We've become a destination for refugees.
Scusa, Zoey.
Gosh, now I feel awful for chasin' those folks out with my wrench. What can I do to help?
Right now, we just need places to stay. Tents, Compounds, Hovels, anything you come up with.  If people can live in it, we need it.
Let's get these poor folks settled in.
It's a nice change of pace!
Nicely done, Zoey! The streets are largely free from terrified refugees!
And I didn't blow nothin' up!
Perkins! What is making that awful noise!
Oh, hey, guys! You like my new mobile sound system? I call it the "Boom Bus"! Really kickin' bass, right?
Shut it off before I make Perkins shoot it!
What? I can't hear you!
What?!
What?!
That's it, your "Boom Bus" is going down!
How did I get dragged into this?
Drag the wreck over to the Vehicle Factory, and I'll see what I can do...
Next time you want to try out a new sound system, do it on a day when I don't have a hangover.
What day is that?
Wait a minute. How long will it take you to repair this… "Boom Bus" of yours? I want to try it out on some raiders…
Boom Bus
Morgan, I'm beginning to worry about the declining Mammoth population. The sheer number of Mammoths that get mowed down in battle is, frankly, shocking.
Are you kidding? Mammoths are the best thing that ever happened to modern warfare! Even if you lose a battle, you know you're still going home with some delicious Mammoth steaks.
... Be that as it may, I've got a plan to vastly decrease Mammoth mortality. I'll put together a mock battle.
I'm not sacrificing any of our soldiers for this.
You won't be disappointed.
…All right then.
There is no limit to what can disappoint me.
That... wasn't exactly the outcome I had in mind.
So you hollowed out a tank, and stuck a Mammoth under it.
... That's the long and short of it, yes.
Brilliant! I want these in mass production immediately. If we work hard, we can *double* the number of mammoths that we send to the front lines!
Hey, LT! Remember that goo I made? Stuff that won't stop burnin'?
You're going to have to be more specific.
Oh, not the stuff that made all that black smoke, or the stuff that kept popping real loud, or the stuff that made us all real dizzy.
OK, yeah, I remember *that* stuff.
Well, Floyd says it's basically just Napalm, and I figured if it was, why not use it instead of burying it under Perkins' tent?
I'll give you a chance to convince me. Why don't you take out the next batch of Raiders that wanders onto the Outpost?
All right, this oughta make a point!
Wow, just when you think they'd stop screaming, they just scream some more.
Man, that stuff really does burn for a while. It's just a shame about all the screaming.
Well, when you're settin' folks on fire, and the fire just won't go out, no matter what they do, you're gonna get some screamin'.
Napalm Demonstration
Ah, Morgan, it's unfortunate that I have to be the one to relay this information—
Everyone, get the hell out of bed and into position! We're being attacked again!
Good god, again?
I already custom made a laser gun to fit on top of a mammoth's head. Now I need to build a mind controllin' device to get 'em to stop stampedin'...
On it, LT!
I only wanted to explain that we must be more prepared for the next, obviously inevitable attack.

Ever since the Silver Wolves' attack, Aurora and the other scientists at I17 have been developing a new technology. I've found the results quite exciting, and we should capitalize upon this new advantage by training our troops in its use.
We're not being attacked.
Everytime Floyd opens his mouth I assume all hell has broken loose...
To think I could've been saving the planet, but here I am making toys for war games...
Electrically powered electromagnetic projectiles? That WOULD give us the advantage the next time Floyd angers a spiderwasp nest or bigfoots or giant sandworm...
I mean, seriously Floyd, is that like a hobby of yours?
No disrespect, Morgan, but have you seen where we live?
There are not enough demerits I can give to accurately convey my disappointment with you.
...So what you're saying is we should train more Railgun Troopers?
And c'mon, "Railgun Trooper" just sounds cool!
Can you explain to me again why this isn't a terrible idea?
My experimental formula, Chemical B, must be released into the surrounding towns to counteract the harmful pesticides that are driving the spider wasps further south.
Perkins, ricomponiti.
Chemical B? What about Chemical A?
Chemical A was a complete failure and actually created a rapidly mutating autoimmune virus when it came into contact with the pesticide. But I'm sure I'll get it right this time.
I put a glass vial of the deadly virus in my shirt pocket for safekeeping.
Of course, I'm sure I'll be blamed when this goes horribly wrong.
So I figured we could spray Chemical B on a small patch of abandoned land and measure the results before doing anything rash?
Inefficient. We don't know who's spraying the pesticide, or where. Better to hit all the towns first and cover the widest amount of acreage possible. Maybe dump some in the water supply to be safe.
First stop, Recoil Ridge!
I just hope we're not shot on sight when we get there.
Okay, I've covered the east side with Chemical B. Perkins?
I sprayed the west side. But I need to tell you-
-This entire town smells like my grandma's mouthwash. What the hell are you two doing here?
Actually, forget that, what are these Spiderwasps doing here?
Well. That's inconvenient.
I'm just really hoping these chemicals don't make us grow extra limbs or start coughing up blood.
I'm assuming there's some sort of explanation for this.
An unfortunate anomaly, I'm sure. The Spiderwasps are getting more erratic in their behavior these days...
I didn't actually care what the explanation was. I just wanted you to leave.
Well. Let's spray Greenborough next.
Oh.
Going off to Greenborough I guess...
Because Recoil Ridge worked out so well for us.
I've reached the conclusion that I may have miscalculated the effects of Chemical B.
Is that because we're surrounded by Spiderwasps again?
Yes. It is possible that the pyrrolidine spider alkaloids I used in Chemical B could have induced increased aggression in the Spiderwasps.
COSA?
Lower your voice, Perkins! Science is about learning from your mistakes!
...Sometimes other people have to deal with the consequences of those mistakes.
I feel somewhat disappointed I'm not dead already.
This is the end. I see a bright light. Tell my mother I loved her...
If we get you back to the hospital in time we may be able to save all your limbs. Probably half.
While they're amputating your arms to keep the Spiderwasp poison from reaching your heart, I'll be figuring out a way to fix this...
Perkins, che ti avevo detto sul mantere un contegno?
Perkins, I've found the solution to our Spiderwasp problem.
Yes, all my limbs are still attached after the last encounter. Thanks for asking.

Potentially we could be dead tomorrow due to aggressive Spiderwasp attacks as a result of Chemical B. However, Chemical C should neutralize the pyrrolidine spider alkaloids in Chemical B and return the Spiderwasps to their natural, kind of pissed off state.
And what about the pesticide problem we tried to get rid of in the first place?
Sometimes Perkins has trouble grasping the simplest of concepts...
Gloves? I bottled those chemicals wearing full body armor...
Perfect! Perkins, use gloves when you bottle the Chemical C, and let's head out.
No more dithering around. We're going to go directly to the source this time.
I feel like we've already made this mistake. Multiple times.
This is nothing like the last time. We're going to pacify the Spiderwasps, not capture them.
Though I did bring more adrenaline shots. Perkins has a weak heart...
I've sprayed this Chemical C everywhere. Can we leave now?
It's our duty to Science to stay and observe the results.
Can we observe from a safer location? The Spiderwasps don't look any more peaceful.
I'm sure that's their normal behavioral—
No, you're right. They seem pretty angry.
Really. REALLY angry.
Let's not play the blame game here...
Don't worry, I'll throw an adrenaline shot in your back!
Corri, Perkins, corri!
Questo non è necessario!
You're in shock! You don't know what's good for you!
So che non voglio rivedere mai più quella cosa!
I'm beginning to think disrupting the chemical makeup of the environment with no previous testing or research might have been a bad idea!
Really? You're just beginning to think that?!
Continua a correre!
Taos? This is a pleasant surprise...
I cannot call it pleasant. I am burdened with sour news. It concerns the followers of Gantas.
Gantas' people? I just figured they'd all disband or join up with you after we got rid of him.

Many did, but some of those under Gantas are particularly violent. Without a warlord to focus their rage, they have become roving menaces. My scouts say they are advancing on your town of Skarborough as we speak.
Sheesh, those people have been through enough already! Ramsey, gather the troops! Taos, we'd appreciate a hand with this if you can lend it.  You have experience in how they operate.
I will fight our fellows, in the cause of justice.
Yet somehow not surprising.
Gantas' remnants scatter on the winds.
Yeah, we sure showed them! Good work, everyone! Scatter those jerks!
They fly away, but they will land elsewhere. Then it will begin again.
So... even when we win, we lose.  Fantastic.
Lieutenant, our scouts have been closely monitoring Raider movements.
They have? Who ordered that?
Actually, sir... I did. I figured we could try to get ahead of them if they tried for another town.
That was a clever insight, backed up by bold action. Remind me to punish you later for bypassing the chain of command.
Yes, sir.  Anyway, they seem to be concentrating in the area around Recoil Ridge.
Then we'll have to move fast.  Send Sheriff Colt a warning.  Hopefully he'll be able to hold out until we get there.
Let's show those Raiders what we're made of!
In the meantime, time to punish Perkins.
Whew, that was tirin'.  I suppose it was lucky y'all showed up.
No "suppose" about it.  Any idea where these jokers are heading next, Taos?
It is uncertain.  We will have to watch and wait.
I'm a doer, not a watcher.  Or a waiter.  So I guess I'll be doing two things I hate.
The last scouts have reported in from the various frontier towns, sir. No sign of Raiders anywhere.
This is unexpected. These warriors will hunger for combat...
Elder Taos, Elder Taos! You hafta come home quick! The sanctuary is being attacked!
What?! They attack their own people! We must return at once!
Imperials always pay their debts. Usually. Occasionally.
Just the name gave me the willies.
May they spend their afterlives neck-deep in mammoth dung as vultures pluck out their hair strand by strand.
Whoa, there, Taos... They're DEAD; I think that's punishment enough, don't you?
Death was too easy for them. Had they lived, I would put them through the legendary "Eyes with a Thousand Splinters."  In it, you take a thousand wooden splinters, and jab them one by—
I... think I get the picture, thanks.
Sheriff Colt!  And Ma Pierce?  Together?  This is a surprise...
This ain't a social call, Lieutenant.  We've got a real powder keg on our hands.  The recent trouble with the Raiders have gotten some of my people real riled up.

Mine too.  I tried to reason with 'em, tell 'em that the Raiders who attacked us were renegades, but they wouldn't listen.  They've joined up with Colt's folks and gone to attack that Raider settlement near the lake!
Near the lake? That's Taos's people! We have to get there before this whole region blows up!
These are good people; they're just scared, is all.
Yeah, trust me; you do NOT want to anger Taos.
What is the meaning of this?
Our deepest apologies, Elder.  Recent events have left some of our people a mite... jumpy.
It's just scared folks actin' dumb. We'll make sure they learn their lesson.
Look, Taos, I'll vouch for them.  If they say they'll keep their people under control, they will.

Hrm.  I bow to your judgment, Lieutenant.  I understand the tensions the followers of Gantas have inflamed.  But my people are proud, and can also be roused to anger.  See that this does not happen again.
This problem ain't over. Not by a long shot.  There are anti-Raider militias popping up in both Trotbeck and Recoil Ridge.

They haven't done anything major yet, but they're gathering weapons and agitating the townsfolk. If we don't do something, tensions will boil over again, and there's no guarantee we'll be able to stop it.
Maybe a little show of force is in order. Assert your authority, show the folks who might cause trouble what'll happen if they try anything funny.
That just might work. These folks hear actions better than words.
I agree.  Send your troops to Trotbeck and Recoil Ridge as soon as you can, before the situation worsens.
Sometimes, I just wanna go in guns blazing.
There's gratitude for you.
I gotta hand it to you, Morgan: that was fine work. We locked up the leaders. I suspect without 'em, the whole thing should fizzle pretty quick.
I am also impressed. We didn't think you'd be so effective.
I certainly appreciate your– "We"?  Have you two been talking about me behind my back?
Well, wouldja look at the time?  I gotta get back to Recoil Ridge 'fore sundown!  I'll talk to y'all another day, Morgan!
I come to you in shame. My people have failed you.
Uh… what?
Time and again you have come to our aid. When the Silver Wolves descended on you, we were nowhere to be found. I wish to make this right.
Sure thing. Just, you know, make me a creepy chair out of bones or whatever you need to do.
We will hunt the Silver Wolves down and let the wind clean their skulls of flesh.
So... am I getting a bone chair, or what?
So glad he's on our side.
The honor debt is not yet repaid. We will find the Silver Wolves and make merry sport of their deaths.
They've been pretty quiet recently. We might need to hunt around. Not that I mind.
Convoglio dei Lupi d'Argento
Sirs, we've got some sightings of Silver Wolves in the Frontier.
Morgan, your slave boy has done well. You must give him praise.
Oh, I'm not a slave boy, Elder Taos, I'm—
Silence, Perkins. Your impertinence has lost you praise.
This is the way.
Aww, man.
Why is he so fixated on chairs?
The stain is cleaned. What is given is received.
So, I'm for sure not getting a bone chair?
Sirs! The Silver Wolves you attacked have retreated into Trotbeck. They've taken hostages.
We must make haste to punish those who would seed disorder. Your slave boy is most industrious, Morgan.
I, uh... thank you?
I guess I'll take the compliment?
No WAY am I moving out there.
Morgan, it is a matter of much pleasure for me that I will one day call you a member of my tribe.
Excuse me?
When the challenges end, and you triumph and join your path with Yenkcha's, you will live among us, as a great warrior. This will be a great day for our people.
Floyd, I've been thinking: now that we have lasers, making us the best equipped army in the Frontier, if not all of Ateria, we have certain responsibilities.
I must agree. It falls on us to maintain order, to establish a precedent of judicious applications of power, and to maintain order by demonstrating restraint.
Yeah, totally. Eventually, I mean. First, I'm going to go shoot some of those Armored Mammoth Riders with lasers. Those guys are dicks.
I suppose I can see his point.
Honest communication is the key to successful friendships.
Is your need to express dominance sated?
I was gonna lie and say yes, but screw it, I'm totally going to keep doing this. Like for a while.
Well, I appreciate your honesty. I'll get started on a plan to force you to stop this madness.
Good man, Floyd.
Predoni
Floyd tells me you're on a crazed rampage of vengeance. I want in.
Is this part of his plan to stop me?
It might be? Mostly, I just want to work through some left over issues. By shooting Raptors.
Ramsey, I'm so glad I can be here for you.
I'm doing good work here.
Wheels within wheels.
Huh. I gotta say, Morgan, that felt kinda empty.
Are you kidding? It's great! You find a thing that used to scare you, and you shoot it with a laser!
Yeah, I dunno. I guess that works for you. For me, it kinda felt like cheating.
Huh... if you say so.
Raptor
Vermi della Sabbia!
Excuse me?
Well, Ramsey kinda bummed me out back there with the Raptors, and it feeling like cheating, but Sandworms! I not only hate those guys, but I also feel like killing them is a public service!
Do what you must.
Nobody doesn't like killing Sandworms.
Reasoned action is so disheartening.
How was the hunt?
You tricked me into using the lasers in a responsible and respectful manner, improving the lives and safety of those around me!
Tu!
That's right. Rather than try to stop you, I allowed the whole thing to run its natural course. Before long, shooting things with lasers—
Turned into work. Damn. You win. I'll stop stirring up trouble, and only use the lasers on the dozens of legitimate threats we face every day.
Vermi della Sabbia
Sergeant Ramsey, do you happen to know anything about the Empire's supply of surface-to-surface missiles?
What do you want to know about them? Model numbers, explosive yield, blast radius, cruising speed, launch procedures...? How much volume they displace?
Actually, I was wondering... um... if any had gone missing recently.
A rogue missile! Sheriff, don't you worry! I'll be right over!
No, wait, you don't have to... *sigh*
Sheriff Pierce, why exactly are you asking me about a rogue missile?

Please, if anyone asks, I didn't tell you anything. Some guy claiming to be an Imperial rocket scientist says he has an R-47 surface-to-surface missile, and if we don't pay a ridiculous ransom, he's going to blow Skarborough off the map.
The R-47 has a pretty insane launch procedure. It takes like six hours. Why don't you just go and shoot him in the head before he can fire it off?
He says that if we talk to you, or if we make any moves against him, his henchmen will kill all of the hostages!
Hostages? Why didn't you say there were hostages?
Why do I keep telling him things?
I hope he knows what he's doing...
All right! The hostages are safe. Now let's go get this madman.
Sergeant, he still has the missile. The whole town is being held hostage.
Plus, we don't know where he is.
Never fear, Sheriff. Just give me his list of demands. I'll show you how this is done.
Zoey! I've got a list of demands from a madman—
What's Morgan want now? I already fixed the leak in the distillery...
No, an actual madman. A terrorist.
I mean, I understand how you could make that mistake.
Oh, geez! What do you need?
He's insisting on three truckloads of toaster pastries, along with a mountain of gold. I'm wondering if you could bake a toaster pastry that we could track, like a homing beacon?
Well, yeah! I thought you wanted something *hard*!
Where did I put my confectioner's pliers..?
Isn't the trip to Skarborough longer than a day?
Here you go, chief! I put a tiny radio beacon in there that you could prob'ly track from space!
...It's also totally deadly if you're exposed to it for longer than a day or so.
We don't have that kind of time. Perkins! Hop in that truck, and deliver our "ransom" to the rendezvous. We'll track it right to the madman himself!
Sergeant Ramsey! Your plan backfired! The madman found your tracking device, and now he's about to launch!
Hmm... I should probably have anticipated that a rocket scientist would be good with machines...
We can't waste time talking! We know where he is, so let's go get the bastard!
…Where should I park this truck?
I'm not dead!
Sheriff, your madman is in the ground. I hope you've learned your lesson.
Yes... Next time we need to be rescued by the skin of our teeth, coming within a hair's breadth of total annihilation, we should call you for help.
That's the spirit!
Guardie Ribelli
Sir! We've got trouble!
Silver Wolves? Again?
Oh, no, sir. We have Rebel patrols. I assume they're pursuing Sergeant Ramsey, trying to figure out where we are.
Oh. That's much, much worse.
I'm kinda surprised I didn't get in trouble for telling him.
It's my plan. I'm the genius.
Well done, sir! That'll teach those Rebels not to mess with us.
No, it'll teach them that Rebels who move north vanish, and that there's definitely something worth investigating.
Then we'll give them an answer they'll like.
And you think this plan will work?

Totally! If we attack their northern camp as Raiders, the survivors will all have the same report. Rebel command will suddenly have a very compelling story about how crazed Raiders are wiping out any force that heads north.
Predoni Impazziti eh?
Oh, like you guys DON'T attack people that travel north?
I concede your point.
Such a good plan, you guys.
I'm like 95% sure this will work.
We have done as you requested, Morgan. The Rebels have been struck by the full fury of our people.
Full fury? Some of them survived, right? They'll be able to report back what happened, won't they?
Probably? My people could have survived some of the wounds we inflicted. I cannot speak for your Rebels.
Eh, I'll take it.
Cerchiamo la Bestia Ossuta!
Oh man… can I kill you guys tomorrow? I'm kinda swamped with like… naps and stuff.
We will not be deterred. You have crushed our greatest warriors in single combat. We would learn your ways.
Give these guys some uniforms and point them at the next thing that tries to kill us.
Ehi Ramsey!
It's still more training than Perkins got.
I didn't know Morgan could still find ways to disappoint me.
I thought you guys were working for me now.
Ma che diavolo?
We came to punish the oathbreakers who have joined you, but victory has proven their valor.
Oh, seriously? Sorry, I can't tell you guys apart.
Skinny Beast, that is a messed up thing to say.
Wow, yeah, that is racist.
It's not racist! You're wearing MASKS. It's impossible to distinguish you!
Jeez Morgan, you're just making it worse for yourself.
Lieutenant... Morgan, was it? I'm in a bit of a bind, and I was hoping you folks would be willing to help out.
Well, if you need to blow stuff up, we're certainly experts at that...

Quite the opposite, actually.  Times are tough with the Empire's... troubles.  Supplies are running low, and, well, the people are starting to get riled up.  They're out breaking windows and burning buildings and such.
Wait, Bernmoth is spiralling into civil unrest and you call that "a bit of a bind"? Are all you frontier people so... understated?
Well, they're good people.  They're just hurtin'.  But they still need to be stopped before someone gets hurt.  If you could find your way to Bernmoth sometime, I'd sure appreciate it.
I'd hate to see the kind of situation that would make the judge actually panic.
Whew, this place is a mess!  Okay, spread out and take down those rioters!
Uh, sir? It's one thing to shoot down Rebels and Silver Wolves, but these people are just angry civilians...
I know they're not soldiers, Ramsey. They're rednecks. Take out their trucks, and they'll run home cryin'.
Sembra piuttosto crudele.
Try to shoot gently, I guess.
When did I become a Frontier Cop?
Hmm, this place is a lot more peaceful once you get rid of the burning oil drums and pitchfork-waving mobs.
That it is. Things are a lot calmer here, thanks to you all.
Wow... Being gratefully praised for doing the right thing...  I could get used to this!
Bernmoth isn't out of the woods yet.  There'll be more riots unless we do something.
You were right about one thing: between the Empire's fall and the riots, you don't look in much condition to get the store shelves full anytime soon.

I'm afraid I have to ask for your help again. We have a lot of wheat in our food stores, but we need more meat.  We also gotta get tools to start rebuilding, and the right protective gear so the workers don't get hurt.
Sounds like something we can help with.  Luckily for you, we're in the process of learning to solve more problems than we cause.
We're running out of a lot of things, but I won't need much to calm things down a tad.
Everything's better with meat and violence.
That was quick work!  I think that's just about all we need! Should be a lot quieter from here on in.
Yup, stuff like this reaches into the primal heart of humanity: the part that still wants to rip animals apart with their bare teeth and bash in everything that stands in their way!
Uh... Sure, right. No offense, Sergeant, but... when was the last time you had a vacation?
If it isn't Elder Taos! Long time no see! How is the mantle of leadership feeling? Heavy?
With great power comes great responsibility. Where old difficulties are conquered, new challenges arise from the ashes.  It is with us as I am sure it is with you.
Uh oh... What's the matter?

With Gantas fallen, many who were once under his protection have fled to my lands.  They need much, but most of all shelter. My people are too occupied trying to feed and protect them to secure materials to make more tents.
I suppose since your situation is KIND OF our fault, we can help you out. We're generous that way.
They use the oil to waterproof hides.  Kind of gross, but it's not like they can farm plastic.
I'm suddenly REALLY glad we never made him mad...
No longer will the wind and rain depress the already downtrodden spirits of those who seek shelter with us.  We accept these with gratitude.
We'll just send these up by supply truck.  It'll be faster than you having to carry them up there.
Ah, if only I were still in my youth. I remember the days when I would carry entire mammoths on my back for my tribe's nightly meals.
Really?
You...?
I mean...
I'm not saying that I don't believe you, but... whole mammoths?  Whoa...
Civili arrabbiati
Perkins! Front and center for a special mission of vital importance!
Oh, god, I'm too young to die... I have so much to live for...
My shower isn't draining fast enough. You know how uncomfortable it is to stand in ankle-deep water while you're trying to scrub your armpits?
I can't say I do, sir; I haven't had a hot shower in two weeks.

You smell like it, too. And you call yourself an Imperial soldier!  Anyway, do whatever you have to do to get my shower running again.  Oh, and I better not catch you actually using it, or there'll be hell to pay!
Should I worry that the Distillery can make drain cleaner?
Arrgh! Caught!
Sir... I poured the strongest drain cleaner the Distillery could make down the shower drain. It didn't work.
The Distillery can make drain cleaner...?  Huh. Anyway, I'm displeased to hear about your failure. I'm sure it's your fault somehow.
Of course, sir.
Obviously, this will require backbreaking and completely unrewarding manual labor. I'm sure you... Perkins! Were you trying to sneak away? Ten demerits for insubordination!
So what you're saying is, after taking apart the plumbing and putting it back together FOUR times on my orders, you STILL haven't figured out the problem with my shower?
Not yet, sir.  Do I need to go for number five?
No, this obviously isn't working. So we'll have to take a drastic and nauseating step.  And by 'we,' obviously, I mean 'you.'
Yes, sir…?
You'll have to go down into the sewers and clear out the blockage. Talk to Floyd about making you a suit. I won't have you smelling up this outpost any more than you already have.
This is going to stink, isn't it?
*sigh* I'll go get my rifle...
Perkins? Finally, you're...  PERKINS! You're dripping sewage all over my area rug! You're cleaning that up, mister!
Ratti!
Now, now, Specialist, Imperial troops approach their duties with cheerfulness and aplomb! Do you want to go through my special morale training again?
No, sir, actual rats! In the sewer! They're all over the place! There are so many, they were clogging up the pipes! That's what was causing the clog!
That's hideous and repulsive.  I don't envy the poor sap who has to go down there and take care of the problem.
I don't suppose Mr. Purrface could do this, could he? He was pretty good at dealing with rats before...
Mr. Purrface is... unavailable right now. Ramsey said something about "sunbeam time."  Anyway, I took the initiative and flushed, just, a TON of bleach down the drain to drive out the rats.
Uh, sir... Is that safe?

Hell, no! But it worked! They were driven right out of the sewers and the pipes... but now they're running rampant across the whole outpost. I pity the poor sap who has to wade through that tide of vermin.
Welp, good luck, Perkins. Don't come back until you've cleared them all out.
Yes, sir.
I can't believe Mr. Purrface is treated better than I am!
Join the army, they said.  See the world, they said...
Ahhh, a nice hot shower, and no standing water to bring down the experience! I am fully relaxed and satisfied now!
I'm very happy for you, sir.  Reporting in: all the rats are gone now.

Go take a shower!  Hell, take fifty!  Oh, but you won't have any hot water because I just used it all, so just soak in ice-cold water until you don't smell.  Or you pass out.  Either way, at least you won't be here, stinking up the place.
Perkins! Puzzi di sudore e ratto!
Is there a Lieutenant Morgan around? I'd sure like to speak to him.
Perdonatemi, gente.
My word, you're the spitting image of Judge Pierce!
That's why I'm here actually. He told me if I needed anything, that I could ask Lieutenant Morgan - that the Lieutenant was a good man.
Era mio nonno.
Your grandfather was always kinder to me than I deserved. What can I do for you?
Well, the town where I work, we're having some problems—
Grab your gear, folks. If this guy's gift for understatement is anything like his grandfather's, we've got no time to lose.
I won't have another Bernmoth.
Wait, Ma Pierce is rich?
I've got to admit, I was expecting something a little more bucolic.
I know she ain't much to look at, but Skarborough was a pretty major exporter of steel and iron for the Empire. Stock in these mines is a big part of what made Ma as rich as she is.
So, what are we looking at? Silver Wolves? Riots?

Both. The Silver Wolves want Skarborough's steel, so they're trying to rile folks up and run me out. Right now they're blocking access to the mines, but they're doing it with locals they paid off to act as human shields.
Got it; we'll use the kid gloves on this one.
By kid gloves, I mean firehose.
It's nice to be wanted.
I can't thank you folks enough. My grip on things out here is pretty loose as it is. Knowing I've got you folks on my side is going to help more than you can imagine.
Now we've got Silver Wolves setting up shop on the outskirts of town.
Accidenti, lo sapevo che era troppo facile.
Don't worry about it, kid. If you think we're good with unruly mobs, wait till you see how we handle a real threat.
Let's clean this place up.
I can't let this kid down.
Lieutenant, I can't thank you enough. I'll do my best not to bother you in the future.
Don't you dare. This is a one industry town, and you just lost your only customer. You folks are looking at bumpy times, and I want to know about it BEFORE things go south.
Well, Grampa sure was right about you.
I wish that was true. I'm working on it.
Sheriff Pierce! How're things at Skarborough?
Ah, well, can't complain.  Could be better, though.
Oh, god, what's the major catastrophe that's come up?

It's nothing, really.  It's just... we're a little short on food, with the Silver Wolves squeezing us and there being no Empire to buy iron anymore.  The people are hungry, and, well, hungry people get riled up...
Ah, food riots.  Always a fun time.  Get the men, Ramsey; we've got an uprising to crush.
I'm getting the strangest sense of deja vu.
I think I got the Lieutenant a tad upset...
Well, would you look at that? Skarborough is almost peaceful now! The people owe you, Lieutenant, and so do I!
It's the least I can do, Sheriff.  Your grandpa was a fine man.  But next time, maybe you could, I don't know, TELL us when your town's teetering on the edge of complete societal collapse.
I didn't want to be a bother...
A bother?! Holy hell, is Ma the only one in your family with any sense of self-preservation?! I want you to promise - promise! - you'll come to us the next time you have problems!
As grateful as I am, Lieutenant, this ain't over, not by a long shot.  If I can't make sure that the people are fed, I don't think I can keep the peace for very long.
Well, our Outpost is in a slightly better position to produce food. We can tide you over until we can figure out how to get your economy going again.
That sounds great, but I don't want to be any troub–
If you don't accept our help graciously, I will have someone stab you. For real.
I'll gladly accept your help, thanks!
When in doubt, threaten a stabbing!
Mmmm... Barbecue...
This is more than generous, Lieutenant!  I oughta be able to maintain order for at least a little while longer!
This isn't a permanent solution, but it'll buy us some time to find one.
When this is over, I'm gonna treat y'all to a barbecue! I have my grandpa's recipe for spicy raptor ribs, and– Oh, my, what was that hideous sound? It was like a hundred boars grunting all at once!
That was my stomach.  Sorry.
Looks like the Silver Wolves are acting up again.  They seem to be concentrating on the area around Sundale.
Then that's where we're headed.  Whatever they're doing there, it can't be good.
I'm getting tired of putting out Wolf-related fires.
Hail, visitors! Welcome to Sundale! I'm Jonsey, the foreperson of our little anarcho-syndicalist commune.  Sit down, relax, enjoy.
You in charge here?  We're here to help you out with the Silver Wolves.
Well, we don't, you know, while my role as foreperson does give me certain responsibilities, there's not like... authority isn't something you can HAVE, it's something people let you use.
Are you high?! Look, hippy, do you want an autocratic military dictatorship to get these Silver Wolves off your back so you can get back to following your bliss?
Yes, please.
While we're at it, they could probably use help in farming...
I love it when problems solve themselves.
The Silver Wolves are gone?! Oh, thank go— I mean, uh, those Silver Wolves are history! See, man, everything works out in the end!
Yeah, if you get someone else to do all your work.  If you're just going to sit around and let us do the heavy lifting, then maybe we should—
Hold on, Morgan, I have an idea.  Mr. Jonsey, you must need a lot of iron to keep your farm equipment and machinery in top shape, don't you?
Sure do, man.  Why?
Well, there's a town called Skarborough that has a lot of iron to sell, and is in desperate need of food...
Yeah... yeah! I see what you're getting at, dude!  Send 'em over! We'd be totally stoked to work out some kind of mutually beneficial gift and barter economy!
Is that Sheriff Pierce's truck coming up, sir?
Quiet, Perkins. I have a head—
Rally the troops! We have trouble in Skarborough! What's going on, Sheriff? Sandworms? Silver Wolves? Some other terrible invasion?
Voglio dire, suona l'allarme!
No, nothing like that, Lieutenant Morgan. It's just that... well, see, some of the workers in the mines and factories think it's unfair for the foremen to get the better share of food from Sundale.
It didn't seem like a big deal, but some of their protests turned... violent.
We need batons, not guns.
Arresta quella marcia.
Looks like we won't be using lethal force... yet. Capture the rioters using the Peace Keeper or Riot Truck.
I always appreciate the Lieutenant coming at a moment's notice.
Sheriff, that was not a small problem. That was a full scale riot.
It just didn't seem as bad as Silver Wolves terrorizing the place.
Fair enough.
Rivoltosi
Why do they always go for the windows? And what is that a graffiti of...?
We'll need to get that cleaned up.
Oh.
Do what you can to help Sheriff Pierce put this place back together.
You pick up all these shards of glass so I can supervise some replacement window installations.
Andiamo, Perkins.
Don't I get a broom? A dustpan? At least some gloves?
You don't need to do that. Y'all have done so much already.
Town's looking mighty nice again.
It's the least I could make Perkins do.
I bet we could even make some improvements around here.
Floyd, shouldn't we be worried about these rioters acting up again?
I didn't see you there. I was just thinking: if we made some small adjustments, we could improve the precision of Skarborough's sheet metal cutting 50%! The improvements to speed would be similarly—
Oh, Perkins!
Floyd...
When did all this rioting break out?
Aspetta.
I just got this place all picked up, too.
Pigs, man. Always turning to violence.
We've put an end to the riots, sir.
Maiali fascisti!
This one seems to be the leader.
Anyone could see that, Perkins.
What makes a person want to set their home town on fire?
E questo che significa?
Actually, sir, he's not covered in soot like the other people of Skarborough. I'm betting he's from a different Frontier town.
We have ways of making people talk.
Zitto Perkins, sto pensando.
That won't be necessary. That sharp fella there is right. I'm from Sundale.
Woah ora!
I don't think we really have enough hard evidence to keep Henderson here.
And there were very clearly smashed windows!
Ha una mazza!
He could be more useful to us elsewhere anyway.
I'm not going to accept the help of a hoodlum!
You don't have to. Zoey can build us a tracking device. We already know he's from Sundale, but then we can follow him directly to his co conspirators!
I prefer good old fashioned intelligence gathering — with pliers.
You don't wanna know where this thing goes.
I think I've heard enough.
I even made this tracker with a remote self destruct feature.
Tutto pronto, LT!
I'd really rather avoid explosions, Zoey.
Grazie?
No, LT! This just disintegrates the outer shell of the tracker so it can pass easily through...
Esplosioni?
All right, Henderson, you're free to go.
Proprio così?

Well, we don't actually have any evidence against you. I guess that matters now? But frankly, I don't trust you one bit, and whatever you're scheming in Skarborough, I'm going to keep an eye out and stop you.
When united, nothing can stand against us.
What was that?
Oh, nothing.
A united, self-governing workforce is a strong workforce.
I'm 60% sure he made those statistics up.
How did you find our secret gathering place?!
Come—
I have a feeling you'll find out... soon. Anyway, why are you causing trouble in Skarborough? You do realize that all your iron comes from there, right?
Yeah, we send Skarborough food as part of a fair trade agreement for iron. But did you know that 60% of the food goes to 2% of the people in Skarborough?
