Fact is, those workers don't need foremen. They deserve to lead themselves through collective consensus, and only then will they forge a system of equitable distribution of wealth.
what free loving, free sharing nonsense you think, it doesn't justify causing widespread destruction.
Non mi interessa
Then arrest me again, but you can't stop all of us. Together we stand, and together we demand social justice!
Lieutenant Morgan? I was remembering what you, ah, said about making sure to tell you if any small problems came up...
Ramsey, start moving as many troops as you can towards Skarborough NOW.  So, Sheriff, what major crisis will we be resolving today?
Sandworms, Lieutenant.
Say no more.  I'm proud of you for actually asking me for help before Skarborough gets flattened. Now let's go rescue your town.
I'm so glad the sheriff is actually learning.
I'm starting to worry about Morgan's ego...
Reporting in, Captain! All Sandworms have been killed or driven away!
Mighty impressive work, Lieutenant! Y'all are becoming this little town's guardian angel!
Wow, that's the first time anyone's ever called me their angel... I could get used to this!
Infestazione di Vermi
Say, Sheriff, Sandworms are attracted by fear. Has Skarborough been particularly... afraid lately?
Well, we're a pretty laid back town, Lieutenant. But what with the Silver Wolves and the riots and the food shortages...

We need to get town morale back up, or the Sandworms could return. How about a party? Everyone loves parties. We'll provide the decorations if you provide the barbeque. The delicious, delicious barbeque...
Lo prenderò come un "si".
Let's go all out to make top quality stuff this time!
Lemme just get in one last rack of ribs...
Whoo-wee! This is some bash! It's been much too long since I've seen the town so happy!
Me... too... Meat... coma...
Hey, isn't that Elder Taos? What's he doing here?
Either he wants to join in on the festivities, or he's bringing dire news of a great peril that's probably our fault.  I know which one I'm betting on.
Greetings, Imperials. I bring dire news of a great peril that is of your own doing.
See, what'd I tell you?
You killed a great many Sandworms recently, did you not? And you did not bury their corpses at least eight feet underground with a mixture of ceremonial herbs?
Wait, we were supposed to do that? We've killed dozens of Sandworms already and nothing happened!
That is because the Elder Sandworm was not then stirring in its slumber, the death of its warren-mates calling out for vengeance.
Elder Sandworm...  Let me guess: it's strong, huge, and hostile.
Extremely hostile, actually.
Grande.
Oh, yes, and hungry. Very hungry.
I loved those days of blissful ignorance...
Yeesh, that thing was *tough*!
That is why you need to understand this land and all that dwell in it. Ignorance leads nowhere but the grave.
Considering how many things I know that I'd be a lot happier NOT knowing, I beg to differ.
Verme della Sabbia Antico
Morgan, the Silver Wolves are acting—
Like spoiled children who walk around in their parents' clothes pretending to be responsible adults?

That's... surprisingly accurate.  But no.  They're acting... creepy, actually. Their forces have moved into spitting distance of several frontier towns, but they're not doing anything.  Just sitting there.
Wait, silent intimidation tactics?  They can do something other than just loot and pillage?
I'm as surprised as you are.  Still, as long as they're there, they could DO something at any moment.  They need to go.
I'd rather be hunting Rebels, but these jokers are almost as good.
Things are already so hairy, it's practically a mammoth.
Of course, you know that Stephenson isn't gonna be too pleased with us. He can't afford a full-out conflict any more than we can.
Well, unless you want to let them plunder wherever they please, it was going to come to that anyway.  His buddy Bronson doesn't strike me as the patient type.
All I'm saying is that we should be prepared. Things are going to get a lot hairier from here on in.
Don't look now, Morgan, but we have visitors.
Welp, time to face the music.  I'm gonna go see them.  You go do what you need to do.

I am disappointed. I thought you Imperials were more practical than this. Do you not already have your hands full with Rebels and Raiders? Why do you want to fight us? Do you realize how hard you're trying our patience?
Hey, we don't like this any more than you do. But we don't like the whole "exploiting and looting the weak and helpless" thing either.  You're the ones who aren't leaving us with a choice.
You aren't getting our point.  Your forces are making us very... uncomfortable out there.  If you continue, we can make YOUR lives very uncomfortable.
Oh, uncomfortable?  Why didn't you say so?  I've got just the solution!
Is Morgan making them SARCASTIC robes?
Okay, I admit that sounded ominous...
And what... is this?
Well, you said you were being made uncomfortable, so I thought I'd fix that! Put your feet up, maybe have a nice glass of cognac...
Why, you...! I'll give you a scar to match!
Mmm, very witty.  Are all Silver Wolves as bright and charming as you?
Calm down, Doug.  Don't let them bait you. They don't fully grasp the situation.
We're not the dumb thugs you think we are...
Are you a different dumb thug than—
That's enough!
Aww.
We anticipated your... intransigence.  So I have sent some of my men to visit the frontier towns you seem so eager to protect.  They've made... friends there.

Our mutual friends are happy and safe... for now.  But should you continue your reckless interference in our affairs, who knows? Maybe they encounter some unfortunate accidents. If they were to be hurt badly... that would be on your head, wouldn't it?
I... see.  Then I guess there's only one thing we can do.
Perkins, give the signal.
Yes, sir!
Tell the strike teams to move in!
And that lesson is: do NOT mess with the Empire.
What... what just happened?

See, we anticipated your anticipation of our intransigence.  So we hid forces in the towns, and just waited.  When your men popped up, we were ready.  Not quite fast enough to keep you from your hostages, but fast enough to put you down like dogs.
We seem to have underestimated you. We won't make that mistake again.  Mark my words, Imperials, this isn't over.
Well, you apparently haven't learned your lesson, so I guess not.
So, Morgan, I've been thinking—
Oh hell. Who do we shoot this time?

Well, see, that's it exactly. It seems like we're often waiting around here, only hearing about problems when it's already too late. I think we'd win a lot of hearts and minds if we were seen as proactive.
So what do you suggest? We go out, patrol the world map, and improve our reputation by attacking Silver Wolves before they cause much damage? We win friends by shooting enemies?
Yes, basically.
IMPRESSIONANTE.
Sergeant! Don't sneak up on me like that!
Sarcasm is mockery using irony. Why?
Why don't you just take my badge while you're at it.
Grazie per "l'aiuto," Morgan.
See, Morgan! You're a man of the people!
Do you have the slightest idea what sarcasm is?
Morgan, I've just gotten reports that the Silver Wolves are acting strangely.
What, did one of them pay for something?
Actually, they're fanning out over the heartland, far from most settlements. It's almost like they're looking for something.
Whatever it is, I'm sure we don't want to let them have it.  We need to throw a monkey wrench into their plans.
It's fun to stymie.
Just thinking about reading a Silver Wolf's mind makes me gag.
Welp, whatever their plans were, we sure put a crimp on 'em. Bronson ain't gonna like that.
The only question is, what WERE their plans?  I hate to think that they're up to something we have no clue about.
Same here, but unless you can read their minds, all we can do for now is keep a closer eye on them.
Morgan, I have a theory about what the Silver Wolves are up to...
Does it involve hysteria and mindless violence?  That's about par for the course for these goons.
Actually, if I'm right, it's quite the opposite.  But I need more information.
Well, our scouts are reporting that they're sniffing around again. Looks like we need to punch them in the nose. Like a shark. But on land. Anyway, let's see if we can't get you your info too.
Or the gills? Where DO you punch a land shark?
You guys keep getting in our way! We don't appreciate that.  Not at all.
Well, we don't appreciate all the looting and pillaging, either, but you don't see us whining about it. We just march in and kick ass.
We're getting tired of you butting in where you don't belong. We gave you a chance.  Maybe you oughta see just how foolish it was to refuse our generous offer.
I've refused offers much more generous than that!
Being the monkey wrench plays to our strengths.
So how was it out there?
The usual.  We sent Doug running home to his boss with his tail between his legs.  Anything new?
I've been going over your new data, and it's confirmed my theory.  The Silver Wolves are searching for certain rare minerals and ores used in high-level manufacturing.
Manufacturing of what?
Circuit boards, processors, and optics.  This particular combination seems familiar, but I can't quite place it right now...
Well, whatever the reason, they'll have a much harder time of it now, thanks to us.
Sir, sir! The Silver Wolves have Installation 17's Chief Administrator captive! He's being held somewhere in the Heartland, but I'm not sure where.
What? How'd you find that out?
Well, sir, I saw a few Silver Wolves drinking in Trotbeck, and... I've discovered that people kind of... tend to forget that I'm around.  So they keep on talking.
Hm? I'm sorry, I stopped paying attention to you.
Sir, I think I can get more information from these guys if I grease the wheels a little.
You want to pay them off?
I want to get them drunk.
Are there any problems alcohol can't solve?
This is the least I've ever been disappointed in Perkins.
Success, sir! They're holding him at a highway rest stop. They're using the place as a depot.
Send Ramsey and Cassidy down to scout the place. I want to know what we're up against.
All right, their defenses are heavy, but they're sloppy. If we're careful, we can pick our way through with minimal conflict.
Alternately, we can just destroy everything in our path. You know, your call.
I mean, I know which one I'D choose.
Stay! Stay! Stay! Stay! Stay! Stay! Stay! Stay! Stay!
All set. We can move in to retake the prisoner whenever you're ready.
Or we can stay here and you let me finish shooting Silver Wolves. But whatever, you know - you're the captain.
We're close, sir, but there's... a small hiccup.
What did you do?
Well, it looks like they have more than one prisoner and... we don't know which one is the administrator, or who any of the others are.
I'm not totally sure how that's your fault, but I'll accept that it is. In the meantime, just rescue everyone, and leave them tied up. We'll sort it out when we get home.
Save 'em all and let Perkins sort 'em out.
That guy is just the worst.
That's the Imperial Army I remember! Great work, folks!
Woo!
Sirs? Shouldn't we get home so I can start, you know, figuring out who all these prisoners are?
Man, Perkins, you sure know how to ruin a celebration. Let's all do what Specialist Killjoy says. Let's all just go home and get back to work.
Let her know her problems are over.
Va bene! Qualcuno chiami Aurora!
Really, Morgan. At best, a specific subset of her problems are over. Still, I'll send a message. She'll be able to—
Folks, I hate to interrupt, but, well, it seems you've gotten the Silver Wolves mighty upset. And they're... well, they're taking it out on me.
Sheriff! You did it! You asked for help! If I weren't in such a hurry to save your town, I'd hug you!
But... the prisoners!
Yeah, I don't care for him.
You took something from me. That means I take something from you.
Visto cosa hai fatto?
Leave these people out of it. You want us, you come get us.
Why would I do that? Why would I attack you at the outpost, when you got all these towns, these soft, white bellies I can slash at. You made yourself weak. I'm gonna show you how weak.
What can we do?
You can catch them Silver Wolves and make sure they don't do this again.
Certainly, and Morgan and Ramsey are hard at work on that. Now, myself, Zoey, the other civilians - what can WE do?
Folks just want to get things fixed up and get back to work.
That I can do.
But... the prisoners!
Why do people pose questions they don't want the answer to?
I don't know what we'd do without y'all lookin' out for us.
Grazie, gente.

Well, you'd likely have been subjugated by the Silver Wolves. They probably would have kept the skilled laborers alive, and some of the families, both for morale and as leverage. Administrative persons such as yourself would likely have been the first to—
That's, uh, that's plenty of detail, Floyd. Thanks.
Sir, they're moving on Trotbeck.
Then we need to do the same.
Let's take these suckers down.
Why is it you boys only stop by when there's barbarians at the gates?
This is the plan? You attack innocent people, we beat your ass, repeat?
You say that like you're in control. You're running, getting tired. You're right where I want you.
Ma, we're here to help. What was damaged by the Silver Wolves?
Yeah, what can we do to help?
You kids are sweet, but please, let the grownups get work done.
I wouldn't blow 'em off, Ma. The kids helped build pretty much every tank we've got.
Well, we've got a lot of damaged farming equipment. Why don't you start there?
No adding rocket launchers to the backhoes, kids!
That explains the big family.
Well, that's excellent work. It's nice to see you haven't let your young ones lollygag around like most mothers do these days.
Oh, these kids aren't mine. I'm only 22.
Well, what are you wasting time for! You need to get started!
We've got them this time, sirs. They're headed for Recoil Ridge!
Let's move!
They better not touch my orchard.
Uh oh?
Oh, wow, you just keep getting worse at this. I'll tell you what, I'll close my eyes and count to 100, and you guys—
Keep talking. Keep wasting time. I can't believe how easy you made it. I can't believe how weak you were.
Hahahaha!
Sirs, this is... this is very bad.
What? Are they headed for Sundale?
It's the Outpost! We've been invaded!
I'm ready to take up to 20% of the blame.
The Frontier won't know what hit it.
You know, I'm going to go ahead and say it. I'm not a fan of the Silver Wolves.
Well, Morgan, now we've got violent animals, hostile Raider factions, rioting civilians, bloodthirsty rebels, AND the Silver Wolves trying to kill us.
You forgot that hot dog I almost choked on.
Right, hot dogs are also trying to kill us. So, what now?
Now? We win.
Is it just me, or has Zoey been acting odd lately?
More so than usual...? I guess she's been kinda secretive...

Yeah, I'm not comfortable with that. I'd prefer my subordinates not be allowed to have secrets. Or personal lives. It's bad for operational efficiency. I'm gonna investigate to find out what she's up to.
Sir? That sounds like a massive invasion of her privacy...
You think so? I mean, I was going to go with minor, but if you think we can do massive... We're gonna need some sweet sneaking outfits.
I mean... I guess I have always kinda fantasized about being a ninja.
Perkins...? Are you sleeping on the job now...?
Help... Sir... Having... trouble... breathing...
What are you talking ab— Huh, that does look a tad tight. The Factory must've been a little off with your measurements.
Can't... feel... extremities...
Your face is turning blue and your limbs are turning red. That's not good...
You're too colorful; that defeats the whole purpose of the ninja costumes to begin with! Zoey will see you for sure! Use your brain, Specialist!
She's on the move; let's go, Perkins!
I still feel a little guilty about this, sir...
That's why I'm a Lieutenant and you're a mere Specialist. I had my conscience removed by a witch doctor the day I made Sergeant! Now come on!
I keep it in a jar on my desk.
Huh, the Ancient Lab. Wonder what she wants here...
It looks like she's examining some of the old devices.
Hmm, so maybe if I reverse the polarity of the neutron flow, that'll... Oops!
Oh, man, I hate it when she says that.
She's leaving, sir. Should we follow?
Of course we should. Oh, unless we're slaughtered by the hostile critters that just popped up behind us.
Let's take care of them quick, before Zoey escapes.
He has a point.
Bigfoots and spiderwasps fighting *together*? How the heck did that happen?
If I had to guess, I'd say whatever Zoey did caused it.
How do you figure that, sir?
It's *Zoey*.
Welp, we can't let our massive number of incredibly painful injuries stop us! We're on a vital mission here!
Uh, I thought we were following Zoey around just to satisfy your own curiosity...
Of course not! Am I the type who'd break the trust of a subordinate and endanger someone else's life for my own selfish whims?
Well, I mean... Hey! Let's catch up to Zoey!
I'll get answers if it kills Perkins!
Zoey? She just left us.
What did she want? Which way did she go?

I apologize, but I cannot answer. We are in the midst of one of our most important festivals. According to our tradition, all outsiders who come to us during the festival must be tested in the crucible of battle.
Surely that doesn't include us, right? I mean, after all we've been through together, we're practically family! Honorary Raiders! Right? Right...?
I guess that means no.
I don't think my elbow is supposed to bend in two places.
Sir... It hurts...
I can't hear you, Perkins. My ears are bleeding kinda bad. I might be kinda deaf now? Anyway, Elder Taos, now that we've gone through your beatings, tell us what Zoey was doing here.
I told you before: I cannot answer. Why do you not ask her yourselves? Surely that would have been easier than fighting against my warriors?
But...! I...! We...! Arrrrgh!
Festival dei Guerrieri
Welp, I feel like a total failure. We've been following Zoey around all day, and all we have to show for it is an addiction to painkillers.
Sir, look! There she is!
She's setting up something... Now she's walking off. Quick, Perkins, this may be our chance! Let's see what she was doing!
Huh, she set up some kind of sign... But it fell down in the wind.
Well, let's go see what it says.
Got it! It says... "Defense System Testing In Progress. Do Not Approach."
Oh.
This is the *best* day of my life.
Phew! Now I can go back to what I was *really* doin'!
Ohmigosh! LT! Perkins! Are you guys okay?!
And I'm sick of this! Zoey, I order you to answer: what the hell have you been doing today? What were you doing at the Ancient Lab and the Raider Sanctuary?
NO!
What? Have you two been followin' me?
Rispondi!

I was researchin' defensive structures to make improvements to our own! I was lookin' over the automated weapons at the Ancient Lab that Perkins saw, and askin' Elder Taos about the ones Raiders use! Where do ya think the cannon towers came from?
Ok, ok, cavolo!
Oh. That makes sense. So... Perkins and I got clawed at, stomped, and shot up for... basically nothing.
Don't worry, sir. You get used to it.
Strutture Difensive
Captain, the troops are ready to mobilize and head south to reinforce the 3rd Corps stationed west of the capital.
We've wasted too much time as it is! It'll take weeks to get down there, and with all our communications disrupted, joining up with the Imperial Army will be hard enough!
Diamoci una mossa!
We've organized a skeleton crew to keep things running here.
I'll be staying here with the Outpost. Morgan, please keep in contact. Everything is so jumbled right now, I have no idea what the chain of command is like in the rest of the Empire.
Count on it, Floyd. Let's roll out, folks. The Empire needs us.
Let's teach these Rebels a lesson!
Let's head to the Southern Frontier! Look for the signpost.
The last SOS we received gave these coordinates. Scouts are reporting Rebel troops in the area.
Perfect. Let's get in there and show them what happens when the Empire has the element of surprise!
Let's teach these Rebels a lesson!
Our Imperial brothers need us!
Damn, whoever sent that SOS is long gone. We're too late.
It looks like the real battle here ended over a week ago. Most of the Rebels soldiers have already moved on to the southeast. These guys were just staying behind to clean up.
Were you able to get anything relevant from their intel?
Well, it's all a little out of date, but yeah, we've got coordinates of some other Imperial strongholds we can head for.
Then what are we doin' here talkin'? Let's grab our gear and get moving!
I see plenty of Rebel activity, sir, but there's no sign of Imperial troops.
They might be holed up nearby or being held prisoner. Either way, the longer we wait, the worse things get for them.
We have to give it everything we've got!
We can't be late again!
No sign of survivors, sir. If they did take prisoners, they've already moved them out.
Give me some good news, Perkins.
Well, we've been picking up some Rebel radio chatter. They claim to have Imperial troops pinned down not far from here.
Perché diavolo non ci stiamo muovendo?
Bingo! We've got action, men!
According to the scouts, the Imperial forces are pinned down in the center of town. The Rebels have them surrounded, but it looks like they aren't expecting reinforcements.

Okay, we'll enter the town and make our approach using the buildings as cover. Once we're in range, our troops will open fire from an encircling position, and our fast, mobile units will remain in reserve to chase down any survivors.
Schiacciamo questi Ribelli.
Come on, we can do this!
This can't be everyone. There's no way it's over.
The survivors have joined up with us, sir.
Great! What division are these guys from? Where do we move next?
Uh, no division, Sergeant. We're from all over. This was kind of the last stand...
What do you mean?

I mean, we're it. Everyone else is either dead or taken prisoner. Apparently, the rebels have so many POWs, when someone tries to surrender, they're just executing them on the spot. The western front is lost.
I'm sure you boys made a valiant stand, but there's no way this was the last of the 3rd Corps.
Ramsey is right.
Hit and run, boys. There are a lot of Rebel troops scattered to the south of us, and we're going to use their intel to track down the Imperial Army.
We'll strike fast, get what we want, and move out. The Rebels have to know where the rest of the 3rd Corps are, so we'll just keep beating them until they tell us.
No time to waste!
Ramsey is right. There's no way it's already over.
I'm not finding anything about troop locations. The Rebels have orders to move east, and reinforce the divisions that are already fighting the Imperial 2nd and 5th Corps in the southeast.
Damn, the Rebellion must feel pretty sure about the western front to be pulling troops out.
It's the same, sir: orders to reinforce troops in the east.
Are you sure you found everything, Perkins? Nothing encoded?
Pretty sure, sir. They weren't even bothering to encrypt anything. Rebel command seems to think combat in the west is over.
I don't buy it.
Ramsey is right. There's no way it's already over.
What have you got, Perkins?
Sir, I'm sorry, but this is very clear. All troops are moving out. Western combat operations are officially over.
Damn it. What the hell do we do now?
We're trusting Perkins now? Come on, Morgan, no way they wiped us out. We've got to keep pushing.
Sir, are you sure about this? The Rebel forces are huge.
Cowards will be shot, Specialist Perkins. Don't go soft.
That's enough, Sergeant. Perkins, we're Imperial soldiers. This is our responsibility.
To the last man.
All right, folks, let's pack it up.
Oh mio Dio, questo era brutale!
Maledizione! Usciamo fuori di qui!
It's over, Ramsey. The intel says that between here and the 2nd Corps in the southeast there are hundreds of miles of Rebel patrols even bigger than this one. We won't make it.
Sir, with respect, we don't get to make that call.
We are soldiers, and the army is out there. It's our duty to link up with them and retake our country.
What do you want me to do, wish the Rebels away? You've seen their forces. There's nothing for us to do out here but die.
Give me a regiment - even just a dozen men - we'll strike where we can. We'll make them pay, and we'll find where the Imperial Army is hiding!
Quindi ci ritiriamo? Che vadano al diavolo -io non mi muovo!
And draw even more attention? If we're ever going to reach the southeast, we're going to need to head home and regroup. We'll need every able body we can get, Ramsey - you especially.
You can't be — sir, permission to speak freely.
Dannazione, Morgan!
File in, Sergeant. That's an order.
Autorizzazione negata.
What's going on?
Sei a casa!?
These men need food and medical attention.
And boots.
Non ora, Floyd.
We can never have enough boots.
What the hell do we do now?
What's going on? What happened to matching up with the Imperial Army?
There is no Imperial Army. Not in the west anyway. If we want to find them, we'll have to cross more than 1,000 miles of Rebel controlled territory. We're out of our depth.
So what now? We just hole up and hope the Rebels don't come this far north?
I honestly don't know. The Heartland is crawling with Rebels. We might be able to pick them off one by one, but it's going to be a while before we're ready to head east.
Accampamento Ribelle
Ah, Floyd, I was passing by the Bigfoot Camp, and they seem to be getting a little... antsy.

Interesting! Off the top of my head, one thing that could make so many bigfoots so upset is a massive spiderwasp infestation heading this way. But obviously, that's so unlikely, the chances of it happening are a million to-
Ramsey! Sound the alarm!  A massive spiderwasp infestation is heading this way!
But I just told you, the odds...
Floyd, think about everything that's happened to us so far. If the worst case scenario has almost impossible odds, it's BOUND to happen!
I hear our new lasers work pretty well against spiderwasps.
Welcome to my world.
Your theory flies in the face of probability and statistics, but at least in this case, you were right, Morgan.
You can never go wrong overestimating the extent to which fate will screw with you, especially out here.
That does not comfort me in the slightest.
So, Morgan, given recent events, I've been making a concerted effort to be less buried in my research and pay more attention to the outside world...
That's great, Floyd, but I'm a little busy...
So when the spiderwasps started invading this outpost, I noticed! Right away! I've already started devising countermeasures, and even been fighting some!
I'm happy for you, Floyd, I really am, but considering that I am FIGHTING a bunch of those spiderwasps RIGHT NOW, maybe we could talk about this later?
Ah! Pardon!  Looks like I need to redouble my efforts to pay attention...
I want so many lasers flying that I get a haircut!
Then it's time for the hoarding and looting!
All troops present or accounted for, sir! The outpost is officially clear of spiderwasps!
Phew, that took a while!  Floyd, what's the deal?
If I had to guess, the spiderwasps have probably been going through their native food supply at an accelerated rate, and have followed the bigfoots down here looking for more.
First the bigfoots, and now the spiderwasps? What's next, giant cat-dog-mammoths that breathe fire?
That's biologically improbable. But one thing I do know: the spiderwasps won't stop, now that they seem to know there's food here.
Okay, folks, we need solutions.  Considering how long it took us to clear out the last spiderwasp invasion, we can't keep just fighting them forever.
I suggest trying what we tried in Sundale: aversion. I've been examining the dead spiderwasps, and I think a special strain of artichoke I've developed will repel them...
Artichokes? Ugh. That's almost worse than the peppers. Hey, couldn't you just use those again?
The peppers were effective against boars, but these are spiderwasps. They're completely different animals - literally! I think the artichokes will be more likely to succeed with them.
My mom made me eat artichokes. That sucked.
Hey, if Floyd doesn't want the Gold, I'll take it!
There! Now we just have to wait for results! Although I doubt we'll have any more problems with-
Sir! Sir! My patrol just killed five spiderwasps at the edge of the outpost! They were nibbling on some of the artichokes Floyd planted...
Damn! An hour and a half! Looks like you won the pool, Zoey.
Yippee!
Wait, you BET on how long it would take for my plan to fail?  And you were part of this, Zoey?!
Aw, gosh, now I feel bad. Here, Floyd, you can have some of the Gold if you want...
No, no...  Just leave me to my shame...
Oh, don't feel bad, Floyd. Those artichokes will feed our troops for almost nothing! The officers will have *real* food, of course, but...
It's fine; my professional pride is battered, but still standing. But we still have a spiderwasp issue and no solutions...
What about the bigfoots?
But the bigfoots were chased out of their homes BY the spiderwasps...
But the ones at my Bigfoot Camp are a lot stronger and more aggressive! Here, I'll get some more trained up so they can prove themselves!
I'm kinda starting to have second thoughts...
I'm too young and pretty to be a sharecropper.
So you're SURE?
*Yes*, LT, I'm SURE that the bigfoots won't mutiny and enslave us all to work in their fields as indentured servants!
Okay, fine, I believe you. But if they do rise up and conquer humanity, I warn you: I'm gonna be the guy who sells everyone out and lives in comfort as a favored slave!
Sir! Lookouts report another wave of spiderwasps approaching the outpost at disturbing speeds!
Perfect! This is the bigfoots' chance to show off their stuff!

A titanic battle between big hairy beasts and scary insect-like things right in our outpost? If this weren't a matter of life and death, I'd be kind of excited. Or at least starting another betting pool.
Whoever wins, we lose. Wait, no, the Bigfoots work for me. I win.
Don't gloat, Floyd; it doesn't suit you.
Wowee! Did you see that? Those bigfoots can really fight!
I gotta hand it to you, Zoey, they did a good job. Maybe Floyd's right; maybe they ARE more than just annoying fraidy-cat eating machines.
Finally! Finally *I* get to say 'I told you so'!
What the hell was that?! Was that an explosion? Did someone give Zoey coffee?
Santa Polenta!
Sir! There are Silver Wolves in the area! They're apparently testing some explosives they've come across!
Damn! As if we didn't have enough problems! Send out troops to engage, now!
Ah, sir...  It looks like someone is already engaging them.
What?  Ramsey, did you already... Wait, someONE? As in just one guy? Screw the explosions - this I gotta see!
There's a fine line between valor and insanity.
Wait, make that HELL yes.
If I hadn't seen it with my own eyes, I wouldn't have believed it.
I've heard rumors of Imperial Special Ops agents who could penetrate front line defenses like they were nothing. He's got to be one of them.
Sir! The agent says he's willing to offer his services to the outpost!  I think.
You think? Did he say that or not?
Actually, sir, he didn't say anything. He only communicates through coded messages. I think I deciphered it correctly, but I'm not sure.
Well, give him our answer, in plain English: yes!
Demolitori dei Lupi d'Argento
Sir! Silver Wolves on the premises! They're invading!
Oh man! This is gonna be awesome! Get all the laser guys together, and let's remind these guys who kicked their asses last time they were here!
This is gonna be SO great...
Just give me a minute, OK?
What the hell was that? When did they get lasers? Do they just give those out to everyone now?
Sir, I understand your concern, but we should probably focus on defending the Outpost before we get indignant about who does and doesn't have lasers.
I'm only indignant about who DOES have lasers. I'm not really concerned about who doesn't. I want that list to be "everyone but me" like it used to, in the good old days.
We've got more Silver Wolves just outside the Outpost!
If these jerks think a few laser guns are going to turn the tide, they've got another thing coming. Let's remind them what happened last time they attacked us!
They Shall Not Pass!
Silver Wolves with lasers. No big deal.
All right, they've got more coming.
We've got this, folks. Keep focused.
Not feeling so hot now, are you, Morgan?
Really, Doug, you lose what, 40 fights in a row, and you come in bragging?
We both know the scales are even again. You thought you had us solved, and you just realized we're back on your level.
Ridi quanto vuoi, amico.
If I was on your level, I'd kill myself.
Oh man! That made him really mad!
Lasers schmazers. Those guys are screwed.
You ain't won nothin'. This war's just gonna keep building up. You see if you like the man it turns you into.
I figure if I get rid of you, I can't do worse than balance the scales.
Bronson e Doug
Say, Archibald... The Installation didn't happen to give any laser weapons to the Silver Wolves, did they? Say, as a way to get you released?
What? Heavens, no! Are you telling me those ruffians...?
Have been firing on us with hot laser-y death?  Yes.

Hmm, this is most disturbing.  You are correct, though; we are the only possible source of laser weapons. If you can get me some from the Silver Wolves, I may be able to determine where and how they did it.
But that would require tracking down and fighting Silver Wolves! … Hell, I would've done that for free!
I love being able to mix work and pleasure.
Someone's been slacking, and it sure hasn't been me!
Mm hm.  Mm hm.  Mm hmmmmm...
Are you going to tell us something, or just grunt at us all day?

These are our prototypes, all right.  We never missed them because they were supposed to have been junked for major design flaws.  They're listed in our system as having been destroyed, but here they are, in the hands of the Silver Wolves.
Wait, they've been fighting us to a standstill with flawed prototypes? Ramsey, double the brutality of our training, starting now!
So now we know where the Silver Wolves have been getting their lasers, but unless we figure out how, they might be able to get their hands on fully functional models next.

I have a suggestion, Lieutenant.  Aurora could make a false prototype fitted with a tracking device. We can determine how the Silver Wolves have been getting Installation technology, then stop it at the source!
Sounds like a plan. We have some technically-minded people around here who can help her out.  Just don't blow up my outpost, and we'll get along famously.
Pardon me, what?
Do... things explode regularly around here...?
Seriously, sir, what is it with you and explosions...?
Done! And may I say, your Floyd and Zoey are *fascinating* people. Such bright minds! Why, they could-
Yadda yadda egghead.  Do you think this'll fool the Silver Wolves' source?
It should.  Aurora assures me that it will look, feel, and act just like the real thing. I'll put it into circulation at once.
Good. And nothing blew up! I love you Installation guys!
Morgan! The tracking device says that the false prototype is on the move! Based on my calculations, it's headed directly towards Marin!
Makes sense; the Silver Wolves wouldn't expect us to look for them there again.  Huh, that's almost clever of them.  Must be Mr. Stephenson's idea.
Ramsey, let's get moving.  Archibald, Aurora, come with us.  This is probably one of your own, so we might need your help in dealing with them.
Can't wait to put all these jokers in their place.
Look, up ahead...! I don't believe it!
What th-? Damn! Of all the rotten luck...!
Chuck! What is the meaning of this? YOU'RE collaborating with the Silver Wolves?
Yeah, well, at least they're paying me! Wake up! The Empire is gone, and we have nothing left, except what we can take! It's every man for himself now!
You're right! So you'd better hope your pals there are gonna help you once we start kicking your butt all over this town!
This is for all the laser burns I had to treat!
We'd be, like, the ultimate power team!
Wh-who the hell are you people...?
We're the Empire, and don't you forget it!
Splendid work, Lieutenant!  We'll take it from here, if you don't mind. We can determine just what Chuck gave the Silver Wolves. Don't worry; if he doesn't cooperate, we know how to be... unpleasant.
Wow, that was chilling! If that's what science can do, I'll have to listen to Floyd more often!
Chuck
Cosa diavolo era quello?
My boot melted! I can't take it off!
This boot is the only evidence we have that what happened wasn't just some crazy hallucination brought on by stress and sleep deprivation.
Resisti, Perkins.
I think those people attacked us with some kind of portable LASER! This is quite surprising.
The only laser I know of is Tragan University in Cariston. It was used to teach the more prodigal students the values of lateral thinking. And to scare undergrads.
I never imagined it was possible to create a weapon out of it! The one I saw weighed a ton and required more power than entire factories. If it can be made portable...!

If we could get ahold of one of those lasers, why, the applications are endless! We could improve the efficiency of our coal plants, possibly even lower our electricity bill. If my assumptions are correct, that is.
L'Occasione per un po' di Romanticismo

Okay, so my bigfoot ideas haven't been goin' so hot. So I figured I'm goin' at this all wrong! What I need to do is teach the bigfoots to defend themselves! That way, they can beat up spiderwasps without us!
Hmm, you may be on to something there. Giving them their homes and food sources back would certainly be the best solution. What did you have in mind?
Well, we have Barracks to train our Troopers, right? Why can't we have one for the bigfoots? I could make it all automated and everything!
As long as she doesn't teach them explosives use...
I think Floyd's been spendin' too much time with the LT...
There we go! Looks great, doesn't it?
Perhaps, but I'll need to inspect this facility for humaneness and safety standards.
What?! Are you sayin' I'm not humane?! Besides, you never inspect any of the Hovels!
Yes, but those are for Troopers. They signed up for this. These are bigfoots, and *they* deserve to be treated well.
Uh, Floyd, I still have a problem. I got this great Bigfoot Camp, but no bigfoots. I... actually still don't know how to catch 'em.

Well, if you knew, we wouldn't be having problems to begin with. I hear Morgan tried ordering our Peace Keepers to detain some. Apparently, they came back with severe hay fever from all the bigfoot fur.
We've tried everything, and nothin' seems to work! I just need ONE lousy bigfoot in the Bigfoot Camp to get started! Maybe I can herd them by plantin' a series of high-yield explosives and-
OR we can try something a little simpler. Remember, the bigfoots are here in the first place because they're hungry. Perhaps food could lure them in?
Hey, that's a great idea!  Shame, though; I'd already planned where I was gonna put the explosives...
Why do I feel like I just dodged a bullet?
I'm starting to get a little nervous about this whole scheme...
Hey, look, it worked! We caught my very first bigfoot! Aw, he's so cute!
Actually, I think that's a 'she.' Though my bigfoot sexing skills are a tad rusty...
Oh. Huh. Ah, well, the point is, the Bigfoot Camp can now get up and runnin' with its first student!
So, Zoey... How exactly does your Bigfoot Camp train bigfoots?
Well, it has a buncha neat automatic gear that uses positive and negative reinforcement to...
Are you harming the bigfoots?!
Aspetta, rinforzi negativi?
When they get ornery, I just give 'em a mean look.
They just up and behave, no problem!
Certo che no!
Come QUESTO!
Oh, my, that IS a mean look! Why don't we take a look at your training methods in action?
I didn't know Zoey was capable of that kind of glare!
What did I do...?
Hmmm... They don't *look* too domesticated and docile...
Of course not! They wouldn't be able to defend themselves if they were!

You know, Zoey, bigfoots are the perfect cannon fodder: strong, dumb, and plentiful!  As soon as I heard what you were planning, I knew I had to take advantage of the situation! So how about we start giving them rifles and...
LT! Bigfoots don't use weapons! Besides, they don't hafta be "cannon fodder"! I'm sure they'd be happy to help out if we just asked them nicely!
Ask... the bigfoots... nicely...? Floyd, I'm holding you responsible for the corruption of this innocent soul.
See? I told you! I went up and asked the bigfoots nicely if they wanted to help us out, and they said sure!
The bigfoots - the smelly, dumb bigfoots - TOLD you that they'd help us out?
Okay, fine, they didn't SAY anything. But they grunted a lot and looked happy!
Good enough for me! I know the perfect targets for our new allies: there's a Silver Wolf contingent skulking around nearby, keeping an eye on us. Why don't we introduce them to our new friends?
Oh, man, I wish I could see the looks on their faces...
If any of them make Lieutenant, I'm outta here.
Wow, did you see that? Bigfoots totally kick butt!
Te l'avevo detto!
You know, if Floyd were doing all this, he'd be setting up sanctuaries and personally guarding them with an assault weapon...

Aw, the bigfoots just proved they can take care of themselves! Ooh, now that they're Troopers, we can give 'em ranks! We should start Mr. Gray over there as Sergeant Gray, and Miss White as a Private First Class, and...
You know, LT, if all the bigfoots had been able to defend themselves in the first place, we wouldn't be havin' all this trouble...
Are you proposing more meddling with the natural order? If so, talk fast, before Floyd comes back.

I wanna use my bigfoots to teach other bigfoots how to defend themselves too! That way, they can deal with the spiderwasps like they're supposed to, instead of us! All I need is some food to give 'em...
Sure, I guess we can spare some canned potted meat food product...
LT! We can't give that junk to the bigfoots! I'll grow 'em some fresh food at the Farm — that'll really motivate 'em!
Food without chemicals never tastes as good.
Did I hear someone say 'Floyd was right'...?
So, how did it go? Did the bigfoots take to your lessons?
That's the weird part... They already knew 'em. Or at least, they were a lot more territorial and aggressive than normal.  And my bigfoots didn't even DO anythin'.
Oh.  Well, that's good, right? You accomplished your goal, and you didn't have to do a thing.

Well... kinda. But it's gotten me worried.  I did just take peaceful critters and make 'em meaner, and it seems t'be spreadin'. Maybe Floyd was right; maybe this whole "messin' with nature" thing wasn't the best idea...
Ah, sir...?  I was wondering...  Do we still care about the uranium?
Uranium? What does uranium have to do with us?
It's what we were sent here to get in the first place, remember?
Oh, right.  Between ducking bullets and pacifying seven foot tall Raiders who want to rip my head off, sometimes I forget these details.  So what about the uranium?
Well, I'd been hearing rumors of a mine that makes people sick, like uranium would. I've found a local who can tell us where it is, but it won't be cheap.
Nothing worth having ever is.
I hear refugees use bars as money on the black market.
Always happy to help!
We checked out the information the local gave us.  There is indeed a mine where he said it was.
And?
And... it's very curious. It's there, but it's been abandoned for decades, maybe centuries. It's too new for the Ancients to have dug, but far too old for any other civilization we know of.
But there's no uranium there NOW?  We were conned.
You're focusing on the wrong thing! Sure, there wasn't uranium, but Science has given us an incredible mystery!
… Thank you, Floyd.
Floyd, what do you know about uranium?

Not much; this is top secret material.  It's a rock... and if you stand too close to it for too long, you'll die.  I assume the Empire needed it for some weapon or other, but I only had enough clearance to mine it safely...
I must say, I'm not used to this level of intellectual curiosity from you.  Mind explaining why you wanted to know?
Certainly.  If I'm going to interrogate that guy who cheated us to find out if he knows more than he's telling, I'll need to know about uranium to tell truth from lies.
And by "interrogate," I assume you mean "beat him until he sobs like a child."
Of course!
Cheating me is like cheating the entire Empire!
After, I think... Wait, were you joking?
Well?  Are you satisfied? Have you indulged your juvenile need for revenge?
Yes and yes, thank you! And I got our bars back!
I could've used my research to figure out if there was anything of value in the mine, or in the area.  You didn't HAVE to go after that poor man.
Ah, but I did.  You have to teach people like that a lesson, or they'll walk all over you.  Imperial Assertiveness Training 101.
Was that before or after Pillaging the Environment for Fun and Profit 203?
You know, it's strange... That mine is far older than any industrialized civilization.  Were its creators looking for uranium themselves?  If so, for what purpose?
We're surrounded by homicidal Raiders, heavily armed thugs, and hideous wasp-spider-thingies straight out of nightmares, and THAT'S what you think is strange?

I'm serious, Morgan.  This could be key to figuring out why we were sent for uranium to begin with, and how to use it to our advantage in the war!  But I'll need more data.  And for that, I'll need the right tools...
Scientific exploration requires preparedness!
If only we had some idea of who did the mining!
Ah, nothing like a successful expedition to get the heart pumping! It really makes you feel alive!
Successful? So you found answers?
Absolutely none! All I found were more questions!
So the whole thing was a waste?

Are you kidding? It was hugely successful! Science RUNS on questions!  We found traces of uranium, and have some decent theories on the types of the geological conditions in which it occurs. Now I have days and days of research ahead! I'm so excited!
… Well, to each his own, I guess.
Imperials, I have come to you to—
Ramsey, sound the alarm!
Sarin?!
Wait! You must listen—!
"Shoot first and ask questions later" is good policy.
Get away from me with that! I do NOT need a rabies shot!
Now talk! What kind of nefarious scheme were you trying to pull on us this time?
Talk?! Fool! That is what I came here to do in the first place! I need your help!
You... need OUR help...? Floyd! Get the first aid kit! I think we knocked Sarin around a little harder than I thought!
L'Entourage di Sarin
Your meddling with my people's affairs has reached its natural end. With Warlord Gantas gone, a power vacuum was left behind... One that had to be filled sooner or later.
I am an Outcast; none would follow me unless they had to. Blades in Moonlight is... capricious, at best. In fact, she is off on one of her "vision quests." That left...
Tronk? "I'LL PICK MY TEETH WITH YOUR RIBS" Tronk? A warlord? You're kidding, right?
You think I'm joking? Accompany me back to Warlord Gantas' fortress, and see for yourself!
Stay sharp, men. This could still be a trap.
Wow. This place is a lot less... empty than we left it.
You see! Tronk has gained the loyalty of the feeble-minded brutes who were once under Gantas' command!
Huh... I wonder if those guys over there heard you call them "feeble-minded brutes"... Uh oh, they're glaring at us... I think they did...
You handle this. I'll be... over there. Observing your performance.
Our therapy is the battlefield. And beatings. Many beatings.
The alarm! Quickly, you fools, retreat, before we are overwhelmed by reinforcements!
Hey, you don't give out orders around here! Let's get out of here, men, before they call out the big guns.
That's just what I said! Except not as articulate!
This inferiority complex of yours is actually kinda sad, Sarin. Do Raiders have therapists?
Gli Scout di Tronk
Okay, Tronk has a lot of troops. A LOT of troops. If we leave him alone, he could become another Gantas, and that's the LAST thing we need right now.
He must be engaging in forced recruitment. That is the only way he could have amassed those kinds of numbers so quickly.
Well, we don't have that option, but we do have a Barracks. We should shore up our numbers before we try anything else.
I miss the days of forced conscription. Those were fun days.
You did not have to be so hurtful.
Captain, sir! Our new troops are fully trained and ready to go!
Good. Maybe now we can make a dent in Tronk's forces.
Tronk may be a loud, overly aggressive cretin with delusions of grandeur, but he is a formidable opponent, as all of Gantas' lieutenants are. Underestimate him at your peril.
Yeah, well, considering the number of times we've handed your asses to you, excuse me if that doesn't scare me anymore.
Y'know, attacking Gantas' old fortress... It kind of makes me feel nostalgic. Ah, for the times when our enemy was obvious and the Empire still existed...
Not that I don't understand, Morgan, but we should get goin'. The longer we wait, the more time Tronk has to gather and train troops.
Just one second, Ramsey... Let me bask in my memories a moment more.
Okay, let's go.
I take my moments of peace where I can find them.
If only we had bug spray... But the Raiders have gas masks... Hmmm.
DECORERÒ IL MIO BAGNO CON I TUOI FEMORI!
Morgan! There's too many of them! We'll be overwhelmed if we stay!
Dammit! Let's get out of here! Man, how are we going to go up against all these guys? It's like that time Perkins fell on that fire anthill! Except this isn't funny!
Guardia di Tronk
Okay, so we've got Tronk in our backyard, ready to become Gantas the Second, and we don't have the numbers to break through to stop him.

We must also deal with Henderson and his men, who are ready to start an inter-town war. He's also right, so we can't just shoot him, as you'd prefer. So we need to do something with a large group of armed, morally righteous fanatics.
Hold on, Floyd, I think maybe these problems solve each other...
Every solution starts with bribery!
See, there's this Raider named Tronk, and...
What's all this for? If you think you can bribe us into leaving Skarborough alone, you've got another thing—
Not at all. This is a... peace offering. So you'll listen to what I have to say.
... Go ahead, then. I'm listening.
You care about social justice, right? Well, worker's rights are all well and good, but what do you think about kidnapping and slavery...?
... Raiders, huh? I've always respected them, balancing their lives with that of the land. But if this Tronk fella is really enslaving people...
All right, I agree. Skarborough can wait. This is a grave injustice that needs to stop NOW. So, Lieutenant, what can we do?
First, we'll have to be a little sneaky. Fortunately for us, Tronk doesn't do "subtle." I have an idea...
I've already shot my way into Gantas' Fortress once. I don't feel like an encore.
It's great when doing what you love is also doing the right thing!
So you want me to send some men dressed in these into the fortress?
Right. They'll probably be on the lookout for us, but they won't be expecting you. The rest of us will cause a distraction so they won't be suspicious.
We can free some of the slaves, open another front in the battle... Yeah, I think it might work. But I'm still taking a big risk by trusting you.
Believe me, hippie, if I decide to come for you, it'd be face to face, and you'll know I'm coming.
I AM WARLORD NOW! THE SUN BURNS WITH MY HATE FOR YOU!
That... is Tronk?
He's an... interesting fella, that's for sure.
And dangerous. Very dangerous. This will be a difficult battle, so you had best be prepared.
I've never been in command of an army this big before! This is great!
One clean victory, without ominous foreshadowing! Just one!
We did it! We did it!
That we did... Working together... You know, Sheriff, maybe having leaders isn't such a bad thing. As long as they're accountable to the people, they can provide much needed guidance and focus.

That they do... But like you said, they gotta be accountable, so there's no corruption... We could use an overseer in Skarborough. Someone who's sharp, and cares about the workers... So how about it? Lookin' for a job?
Me? Well, I... I accept!
All's well that ends well. The towns are talking, Tronk is gone, and... Wait, where's Sarin?
He left... with the remainders of Tronk's forces. I guess even though he's an Outcast, he was the only one left they could follow.
So now Sarin is in charge of Gantas' old forces... Sarin, who hates us and is a lot smarter than Tronk. That's super cool. That's frickin' great.
Capoguerra Tronk, Adesso
Sergeant Ramsey, prepare the march. We have a rendezvous with New Haven.
Oh.. yeah... OK.
Come on! We're gonna go crush our enemies! There'll be lamentations! You love that stuff!
Davvero?
No, I know I do, it's just... I feel like with a tiny bit more firepower, we'd REALLY be able to destroy these guys.
Hey man, don't say I never did anything special for you.
Mr. Purrface LOVES lamentations.
Mrrow?
There, is that better? I even got you a mercenary Silver Wolf for extra irony.
Well, I'M totally satisfied now but... Mr. Purrface thinks we should build Mechs!
No Sergeant. He doesn't.
Yeah, I know. He doesn't actually possess the power of speech.
Okay guys, for real this time. Let's move out!
If you didn't go yet, hurry and go now.
Sir, they've regrouped and, for some reason, are moving out from the battlements onto the field.
So... they're abandoning their highly defended position? They're probably... um... huh. Yeah, no idea why they'd do that.
Well, it's either a trap or they're suddenly really bad at tactical decision making. I honestly have no idea which is more likely.
Soooo.... I guess we just shoot 'em right? Just kinda mow 'em down?
Jeeeeeeeeeeze, man... I... I think so, right? Yeah. Yeah! Let's mow 'em down!
Gonna mow 'em on down.
It's a figure of speech!
Seems pretty brash Morgan, risking all those civilians.

So, first of all, we got most of the civilians out through a super awesome tunnel, and directed the rest safely away from combat. Even so, you took the battle outside the city. You're so bad at this, it kind of obfuscates how great at it I am.
Say it to my face, punk!
Your face is where I said it. I don't... I don't know how to say it more to your face.
Sir! Our scouts have sighted Doug! He's holed up in the compound in the middle of town.
The leaders live it up in luxury while their grunts and everybody else suffer in their hovels. Typical gangsters.
Okay, men, let's flush this rat out!
I'll take all you jokers on!
This is it Morgan, you and me.
No way, you're like, third in command. I mean, you're a horrible person, and I look forward to your death, but this is not the fight I'm invested in emotionally.
What, you're too scared to face me?

Let me put this a different way. You're about to die in a hail of gunfire from Imperial troops. As happy as that makes me, I can't shake the feeling that you're just a cog in a larger machine, and not even an essential one.
I'm here to watch you fall, but I'm not going to pretend it matters when you hit the ground.
Morgan can be kinda cold.
He got shot like nine times!
The survivors are surrendering, sir! We did it!
No, we didn't. Why did they abandon their defenses? And where are Bronson and Stephenson?
Too slow again, Morgan.
This is... Tie him up, and Ramsey, if he does anything but bleed or breathe, shoot him.
E' sopravvissuto? seriamente?
Let's move, people. We can probably even pick off some Silver Wolf stragglers on their way back to New Haven.
We better leave now then, sir! Intel has them running back with their tail between their legs.
You know the rule about puns. "Tail between their legs?" You stay at the Outpost and think about what you've done.
Dannazione, Perkins!
But no, sir, it's a figure of speech, I was just...
Not. Another. Word.
Nobody makes puns on my watch.
I knew he was incompetent, but lazy?
Nice work, 95th! Perkins, give me a sitrep on New Haven.
He's not here, sir. He's still back at the Outpost.
He's what? What's he doing back there?
Thinking about what he's done?
New Haven, here we come!
Be careful Ramsey, this place is probably a fortress.
We'll take this slow...
Ramsey, is it just me, or are the defenses here kind of...
Crappy?
I was going to say something classier, but yeah, basically.
I guess they assumed no one would try a frontal attack?
Defenses this light... it doesn't add up.
Silver Wolves are the bad kind of smart.
Civilian casualties from your attack are almost 30% below what we projected. Of course, the ratio of killed to injured is higher than expected, but given your overall performance—
Sono impressionato.
What the hell are you talking about?

Civilians, mister Morgan. New Haven isn't a military outpost. It's our home, and while we've protected it well, it's still basically a civilian city. Just imagine the loss of life if you continue the attacks near the more densely populated city center...
You've made your point. 95th Rifles, let's regroup and consider our options.
Wow, sirs, that was fast! I mean, I knew we, that is, you were going to crush the Silver Wolves, but—
We didn't. They're using the civilians of New Haven as human shields.
We'll need to go into Siege mode. Floyd, can we put together some road blocks? Concrete, chains, spikes, whatever we can use to block their movement.
Zoey and I will get started.
What about a section of road that's on an axle, and it flips over when you drive on it? Oh! Or we put up detour signs, and then we paint a tunnel on the side of a mountain, and—
I'll take the lead.
What if we built a road that's really sticky?
If anything, I give him too much credit.
These should do a pretty good job of limiting their movement.
For a while at least. It keeps them to smaller, off road vehicles.
Unfortunately, they have more than passing experience with off road smuggling.
Hey, this was just phase one! Give me a little credit.
OK, we've limited their transport, but we know they'll just get all sneaky on us.
Sure, but while they're working out the logistics, we're going to pin down their gates. Those walls keep them locked out as much as they do us.
I've never seen the Lieutenant this focused.
Why do people forget that I know what I'm doing?
Okay, sir, we've got them locked down pretty tight, they won't be driving much of anything in or out of New Haven. Still, I figure they'll—
They're going to get people on foot over the wall to run supplies in at night.
Uh, yeah, probably.
Ramsey, I know how a siege works. I've been on the wrong side.
Alright boys, we're three for three so far. Now we just clean up the crumbs. We set up shop right outside New Haven, and we pick off as many of the runners as we can.
Seriously? We just catch as many as we can?
We don't need to get all of them, just enough to keep their supplies low, and wait for them to get hungry enough to negotiate.
Negotiate? But... I wanted to shoot 'em!
Wait, now we're not even starving them?
Mister Morgan, I believe you've made your point.
I'm not making a point, I'm using my demonstrably superior military might to utterly crush your forces in a war of attrition that you're losing SUPER BAD.
Indeed. The thing is, all the food that gets through? It's going straight to the Silver Wolves. The only people starving are the civilians you claim to want to protect.
You heard him folks. Let's go home.
Messaggeri dei Lupi D'Argento
Perkins, I'm having a drink. Get some hooch made.
Sir?
I'll be in my quarters.
Is... he okay?
If Stephenson hadn't joined up with them, this would have been over ages ago.
Morgan, I know the Siege went poorly, but you can't just get drunk and pout.
Floyd, I'm celebrating! We've tested them, and there's no doubt we're gonna win. If they had anything up their sleeve, we'd have seen it. They're screwed!
Il Broncio?
Are you sure? While our forces may be superior, they have a rather expansive collection of hostages.
Give yourself a little credit Floyd. We're in a battle of wits. Stephenson is smart, sure, but I've got you, Zoey, and Aurora on my side. They don't stand a chance.
All right Brainiacs. What've you got?
The soil under New Haven is ideal for tunnelling. We can start a tunnel outside, but we'll need some people on the inside to establish a safe, and well hidden point of egress.
Me and the Raider Kids volunteered. I can oversee excavation and construction, but the real trick is goin' to be waste disposal.
Which is where we come in. They'll be using laser drills. We'll be able to burn out any organic materials, and the remaining dirt will melt down to glass and slag.
It's still likely the Silver Wolves will find our disposal sites and get suspicious, but if we're quick, they probably won't put two and two together in time.
What's up first?
Ideal soil or not, a tunnel like this needs support.
Wait, Civil Engineers take vows?
Floyd did you REALLY need that much Steel? I mean, this isn't a permanent structure or anything.

I made certain vows, and I'm sorry if it's inconvenient, but they preclude half-assing the design and construction of a tunnel just because we're planning to blow the whole thing up after we're done evacuating.
Morgan, io sono un ingegnere civile.
Wait, the whole thing is going to be lined with explosive?
Oh, yeah. It was Zoey's idea, but she won us over pretty quickly.
Okay LT, first thing, we're gonna need some disguises.
All right Zoey, this all hinges on you.
And us! We'll be there too!
Right, we're also going to send these children into a combat zone.
YAAAAAAAAY!!!
Disguises are fun!
As long as you're making spy clothes, why not hide roller skates?
These are perfect. The kids'll look exactly like Imperial children!
Wait, we're just disguising them as Imperials? Why did we have to make special clothes? Don't we have children's clothes? Don't you, like, run an orphanage?
It's not just about sneakin' in. These clothes have a bunch'a secret pockets so we can smuggle in our tools.
Yeah, and the shoes have secret roller skates!
Now we just need a disturbance to distract the Silver Wolves while we sneak in.
Please, please, please. PLEASE.
Lasciamelo fare, PER FAVORE.
All yours Ramsey. Remember, we want them distracted, not on alert. You're supposed to pose a minor threat.
I'll keep it as minor as I can. Swear on Mr. Purrface's life.
My trigger finger is ITCHY.
Sorry I swore on your life, Mr. Purrface.
What happened to keeping it small?
Sorry, a little bottled violence. Did Zoey and the kids get in OK?
Yeah, they're reassembling their tools, and expect to start on their end of the tunnel within 36 hours.
Our side of the tunnel is coming along well, but Zoey and the kids are going to need supplies inside to get things moving.
I'm already on it. We'll assist at the Steel and Concrete plants in Skarborough and Recoil Ridge. Then we'll have them ship the raw materials on roads we know the Silver Wolves are patrolling.
So... we're going to... nope, no idea where this is going.
After the Silver Wolves steal the supplies and bring them back to New Haven, Zoey and the Raider Kids will steal them back and use them to finish the tunnel.
That... seems plausible, actually.
I know from plausible.
They grow up so fast.
OK, kids, wait two minutes after I trigger the first explosion, set off charges beta and gamma, I'll slip in during the chaos, then you trigger omega when you see me leavin' in the truck.
Why can't we just storm the gates or smash down the fence or shoot all the guards or—
Now kids, I told you, we're undercover. We can't go riskin' a big fight like that! You keep quiet and set off these bombs like you been told!
Yes, Zoey.
All right, the tunnel is ready. Zoey linked up with a resistance group inside New Haven. They're ready to start moving people out when you give the signal. Of course, to do it safely—
They'll need quite the distraction. I'm sure we can put something like that together.
The distraction will be us shooting them.
How fake is "mostly" fake?
We're out! We got a whole buncha people out too. More'n half!
That helps, but it's still pretty risky to make a direct attack...
We started a mostly fake rumor about gas leaks in northern New Haven. They're movin' everyone south while they investigate.
Non ti preoccupare, LT!
Great work Zoey.
Most of the refugees from New Haven have made their way to Recoil Ridge, Trotbeck, or one of the other frontier towns, but a considerable number have asked to settle on at the Outpost.
Really? Are they just really comfortable around maniacs with guns now?
Regardless, they need somewhere to stay. We should do what we can to settle them in.
È una spiegazione ragionevole.
The waste management situation has grown... complicated.
The capital city is named The Outpost?
They're all settled in. As many as we can manage, at least.
Man, this is definitely the weirdest military outpost I've ever been stationed at.

It's interesting, isn't it? I mean, we're an outpost for a government that no longer exists. Think of all the twists and turns fate has taken to bring us here. It's pretty unbelievable. It's almost as if—
We're the capital now.
It's not safe for you here. With recent events, it's not fair to keep you at the Outpost.
Zoey, Morgan e io abbiamo parlato.
Floyd, first, y'all are sweet, but you got no right to send me away. I want to be here. Second, you honestly think I'd be safe in one of those little towns?
Mi state prendendo in giro?
Frankly, I don't think the town would be safe from you.
Look, both of y'all know building and designing is my passion. Check out my new design, and tell me you can do this without me.
This'll wow 'em!
I see her with a mixture of fondness and terror.
I'm sorry, Zoey, you're right. You belong here, and Morgan and I had no right to suggest otherwise.
It was all Floyd's idea.
Well, it was sweet either way. You do it again, I'll booby trap your quarters.
Understood, kiddo. Please don't blow us up.
You know, Floyd, I've been thinking. We've gotten most of the refugees settled in, but some of them are just kids! They're all alone, and they've got nowhere to stay.
Well, as a military base, we're not especially well equipped to care for unaccompanied minors.
But we're not exactly a military base anymore, are we? I mean, not a normal one. Anyway, I really like working with the Raider kids. Maybe I can help out in a more official way?
What were you thinking?
I'll make sure they get a well rounded education.
The kids will sure get a... diverse set of role models.
Look, Floyd, you know I think Zoey's great, but can she handle that many kids? And, well, do we want that many kids raised by just her? Besides, doesn't she have other work to do?
Oh, we've already thought of that. I'll be working there myself from time to time. Ramsey and Cassidy have also volunteered to spend time with the kids.
It's weird, because I think you're trying to calm me down, but you're just making me more nervous.
Lieutenant, we know there are more infected wandering in the wilderness. I think we should take a preemptive strike against them. It's hazardous to our operation to have them wandering around.
And it's demoralizing for our troops. Perkins is experiencing incontinence and night terrors.
I told you that in confidence!
Perkins, I'm a civil engineer, not a therapist. I'm under no obligation of confidentiality.
Perkins can wet the bed all he wants. If the zombies aren't getting into the Outpost, then it isn't our problem.
Well...
Let me guess, it just became our problem...
I should've taken Perkins with us. He's a good human shield.
Why does Zoey get to stay home and kill zombies?
You're late.
What the hell are you talking about?
There are zombies everywhere. I figured it was your fault somehow.
Being an Imperial doesn't quite have the same prestige it used to...
Another one behind you, Zoey! Here's a wrench! Catch!
Got it! Thanks kids!
Floyd, have you seen Perkins?
I told him to go check on the raptor pen. The poor creatures have a tendency to get skittish.
Uhhh… guys? Do the raptors seem kinda angry to you?
I mean more kinda angry than usual.
There are zombie raptors in the boar pen, and zombie bat… things in the raptor pen.
They are not zombies, Perkins! They are living, breathing, infected human beings! And I guess raptors now!
You and your "zombies" are a disgrace to the last 3000 years of Scientific progress!
Anyways, I think I've discovered a solution to reverse the process of infection and restore these tormented, vicious animals back to their slightly more benign counterparts.
Let's try it. I just broke my best wrench over one of their heads.
Why do I always have to be bait?
More zombies are approaching from the east side!
When are they going to let up? I don't want to die in this god-forsaken, hillbilly hell hole.
Hey! That's my town you're talking about!
I would really like to say no offense intended.
But, you know, let's be honest.
Ramsey, if I die don't let them touch my boots.
After completing extensive research I've determined in order to cure the infected, we need to let a black nanopod interact with a black nanopod, thus negating both of their effects.
What do you mean by extensive? Are you holding a paperback horror novel?
Look, Perkins. I'm the scientist here.
And it's a good book. I'll loan it to you when this is over.
If this doesn't work, can we keep the zombie as a pet?
We're going to hell for creating this thing, I just know it…
I hafta' admit, I'm getting a bit worried about all these zombies. I used a tracking device to find most of the buried black nanopods, but I'm running out of explosives to keep these things away.
For the last time, they're called 'Infected', not zombies!
Not you too, Zoey! And to think I trusted you!
I think I'm still bleeding…
There's only one thing to do now.
Create a super zombie explodin' device?
No. Hide.
Ah, well that'd be unlucky for anyone who went ahead and made some zombie explodin' devices anyways...
Perkins is already starting to look a bit like a zombie already.
That Zombie Hunter has tracked down the zombie nest to a location in the western raider lands. Destroy the nest, and our problems should be over. Temporarily.
I'll take temporary. Can you lead us there?
He says he'll help us… for a price.
Zombie Hunter isn't a real job. He knows that, right?
I figure Jobs are whatever the market will support...
Where is everyone?
There are zombies everywhere!
Guuhhhhhhrrrr
Oh god. Perkins is one of them! How could this happen?
I should have never left you alone, Perkins!
Aww, the poor kid, I never got to tell him…
Why couldn't they have something less likely to blow our entire base apart?
Has anyone found a solution yet?
Come diavolo fanno i Ribelli ad avere degli aerei?
The Imperial Training Manual wants us to hurl ourselves out of catapults, but everyone else is scared to try it.
I've sketched out several plans to create high-powered turbines to direct wind flow outwards and slow the planes down, but I've determined we need to move our base onto a small peninsula beforehand.
…I think I'm relying on Zoey for this one.
I've already been creatin' prototypes. Wanna see?
How about you test them on the planes heading over here right now?
War is kind of like free entertainment.
But... I was helping Zoey...
Success! What do you think, L.T?
Excellent work! I knew someone here wouldn't let me down.
Perkins, you get ten demerits for being useless.
Big news sirs! We've received an encoded communique from General Ashe. He wants to defect!
So, does leaving the Rebels undo him being a traitor, or just make him a double traitor? I'm not totally clear on that stuff.
Double traitor. I'd be happy to have General Ashe on our side, but I believe it like I believe Perkins has kissed a girl. Prep him a room, and bug EVERYTHING.
That was really hurtful.
What are they trying to tell me?
The room is all set sir. There's nothing in the room that isn't a bug. Zoey wove blankets out of tiny fiber optic cameras!
We've got audio too right?

Absolutely. There are over 300 mics, and the tent itself is designed to capture even the smallest sound. Right now Floyd is using it to listen to all the bed bugs in his bunk. He's convinced they communicate.
Update on General Ashe sir! We've got word that he's trapped in the mountains of the Heartland. He's going to need our support to break through.
This feels trappy to me. Just has kind of a trapish flavor.
No doubt. Still, if it IS a trap, we get to shoot a bunch of Rebels.
And I'm back on board!
The way to Ramsey's heart is through his trigger finger.
Simply disgraceful.
Well, they haven't flanked us, and Ashe hasn't suddenly rallied and turned against us. I think this might not have been a trap.
Lieutenant Morgan, did you honestly march your troops into what you believed to be an ambush?
Well, yeah, but, you know. We DID win. I feel like I get a pass on this one.
Hey, General? You're kinda bleeding a lot. I feel like we should look into that.
There's no time, I have to warn you, the Rebels, everything that's been happening, it's what you think—
You guys might want to wrap this up, cause we're SUPER under attack.
Damn, no time!
Well… I guess I'll get a shovel.
Hey, that was awful, what say we get moving and not get shot any more times today?
I won't be joining you, Lieutenant. My time is up.
I'm sure you'll be fine. Lots of people survive after losing that much blood.
No time for comforting lies Morgan. You're in danger. Much worse than you thought. The Rebellion… they're being manipulated. There's something else, and they've got it out for you.
Wait, there's something besides the Rebels? What are you talking about? Who has it out for us.
Not sure. Spreading lies, manipulating information. Clever. Very patient. Be careful who you trust...
Ultimo Baluardo di Ashe
Sirs, we have… a situation. There are a bunch of Rebels outside, surrendering. They've sent a representative
Please! We don't want to hurt anyone!
Then why did you join the Rebellion? Hurting people was the Rebellion's whole plan!
Now that the Emperor is dead, I just want to go home, but the countries leading the Rebellion won't let us! This isn't what we signed up for! It was supposed to be about freedom, not conquest!
Certo che ne avete conquistate un bel po' di nazioni!
So, to be clear, I don't trust you, but I'm also not going to shoot you until you give me a reason. Floyd, let's get these guys a place to stay. Make it kinda crappy.
Let's not make them too comfy.
I sure do hope these guys don't immediately try to murder me!
There! That's inarguably a place that you can live inside of.
It feels kinda… hostile?
Nailed it.
So, have those Rebels-who-are-probably-spies we gave a perfectly good terrible house to turned on us?
Not yet sir! It seems—oh, wait, no, there they go. They're attacking us.
CALLED IT.
I mean, who didn't see this one coming.
How did we let this happen?
Ramsey, round up the remaining Rebels for interrogations slash executions, don't tell them which one they're getting, SURPRISE, they're getting both.
Sir, it looks like only around… 8% of the Rebels we took in attacked us. Some of them even came to our defense. Either they're telling the truth, or they're much longer term liars.
Please! Listen to your Intelligence Officer! We really don't want to keep fighting! We just want to go home!
Intelligence Officer? Do you mean Perkins?
He's just an overreaching Specialist who tells us what's going on and digs up rumors and analyzes troop movement and has a network of informants and OH MY GOD PERKINS IS OUR INTEL OFFICER.

Morgan, I can appreciate how difficult it was for you to house those AWOL Rebels, but making sure we get them comfortable can only improve our chances of further weakening their ranks through defection.
What do you recommend?
Well, we can establish a fundamental change in our relationship by giving back the first thing Emperor Henrik the Great took away. Those stupid hats.
Oh man! They love those hats!
Their culture is shockingly hat-centric.
Wait, don't wreck my reputation as a badass.
We made a bunch of those weird hats you guys love! Check it out dudes! Weird hats comin' atcha! Hats for everyone!
Ehi Ex-ribelli!
You… you would make the hat of my people? The Empire truly HAS changed!
Yeah, we're totally awesome, and way less focused on restricting headwear. Tell your friends. In person. By leaving, and going home.
As soon as we can, we will return home, and we will spread the word of your kindness and brotherhood.
Cassidy and I are separated by hundreds of miles of frozen wastes, but that doesn't mean I can't show my love for her.
Ramsey, if you're looking for advice for your amorous affairs, I'm afraid you're talking to the wrong person.
I just figured I should do something special for her, you know. I mean, so she knows I still care and doesn't get together with one of those… scientist types.
Bet none of them would go boar hunting with her…

Since you're still talking to me, I assume you want my input. I've been studying Spiderwasp mating rituals, I could teach you an interpretive dance that involves smearing your beloved with your viscous pheromones.
Maybe she'd appreciate… a gift instead.
What's wrong with Scientist types?!
This is a thing of beauty. Now just to get it to her...

Bein' here at I17 is okay an' all, but… I miss the days back when I was tendin' the family orchards — every summer we'd rustle up some boars and have us a barbeque. Especially when Ramsey and I got together…
It'd be about summer now in Recoil Ridge...
Miss, I'm having a bit of trouble with this plasma...
Jones, you gotta make sure the dielectric gas is turned on before you move the electrical current through the tube. Here, let me help…
Speaking of "summer" and "seeing ground that isn't snow", we need to get a field team together to go down and research rumors of dangerous radiation levels in the Boar Badlands...
Ah, right, thanks.
Radiation levels in the Boar Badlands? I've never heard of such a thing...
I mean, Jones, you're right. Let's leave immediately.
Hell, any excuse to get out of here for a few hours.
I just want more barbeque...
Damn, I forgot how good these ribs taste, Cass.
I'm not going back to eating freeze-dried spam ever again…
They were so good I almost forgot to give you this. I didn't wrap it or nothin'. Sorry.
A new scope! Aw, hell, you didn't have to…I'm just glad to see ya. Now I'm blushin' in front of mah scientists.
I figured before you have to get back to Installation 17 we should test it out, right?
You tellin' me none of y'all have gone raptor huntin' before?
C'mon, it'll be fun.
If one of them goes after you, just get really still. They can sense movement.
... Can raptors sense a feeling of impending doom?
Yup! They got like… eight or nine senses.
Can't wait to test out this new scope!
As long as the new world has you in it…
I wish it could be like it was in the old days, Cass.
Nothing to worry about but the occasional Raider or Rebel. Before the Empire fell, when things were, well, not simple, but not so damn hopeless.
I don't in particular like this new world either…
But it's the world we live in now.
Hey, Morgan, I have a few questions about recent orders and invoices. I have one here for the Machine Shop. It says "beans". Like, it has quotes around it on the order form...
Oh, hey, sorry, this is the kind of thing we try to keep as quiet as possible.
We're trying to smuggle equipment to the resistance in Recoil Ridge, but we're disguising relief supplies to sneak them in past the Rebels' occupying forces.
So, these beans are actually...
