Now now, Floyd, what you don't know can't be divulged to the enemy under pain of torture.
The best way to keep secrets is to threaten everyone with torture, constantly.
Aww man, I was looking forward to having some Pickled Boar Feet.
Alright, Morgan, the equipment has already been shipped out. NOW can you tell me what we were actually doing?
The "beans" were actually weapons and medical supplies.
And the "Pickled Boar Feet"?
Oh, those were beans. When the folks down in Recoil heard we were going to replace their beans with guns and bandages, they FREAKED OUT.
I guess those guys are really into beans.
LT! We got problems in Recoil! The Rebels flagged the equipment we scheduled for inspection!
Wait, you told ZOEY the plan, but not me?
Not now Floyd, we need to organize a distraction to let the resistance sneak the supplies out.
We could start blowin' stuff up and shootin' folks.
See Floyd? This is why Zoey gets to help with the sneaky plans.
That's not an especially sneaky plan.
OK, well… cool. See you later.
Nicely done folks. With that distraction we managed to smuggle out the supplies you sent, and then a whole bunch of other stuff too. Got me some fancy new sheets.
Oh yeah? What's the thread count?
It's only 250, but they're sateen.
Yeah, the weave really makes a difference.
Lieutenant Morgan! I've just received word from our contacts in Recoil. They've requested an extraction operation for some members of the resistance that have come under suspicion.
What can we do? If we just pull them out, it'll start a cascade, putting suspicion on collaborators and the innocent alike!
I figure we have ta throw suspicion yeah? We capture the bruces in a fake brawly, roit?
Indeed. We'll start a conflict, and when they rush to "fend us off" we can capture them, bringing them safely back to the outpost.
Seriously? All of you are in on the planning, and I wasn't? Is there anyone you didn't invite before me?
Mrow!
The CAT was in on it?
Seriously though, why doesn't anyone trust me? What's the deal?
I'll say this for you folks, you sure make an honest effort of cleanin' up your messes. It's darn near commendable.
Wait, isn't resistance fighters in YOUR town YOUR mess? I think we're actually in the clear on this one, Sheriff.
Aww, they'da given up a while back if y'all didn't keep inspirin' 'em to keep fightin'. Thanks for that, too.
Hey Sergeant Ramsey, sir, I… I really need some advice.
Just go to a doctor, kid. Don't be embarrassed, it's perfectly normal—

Oh, no, this is like, Military Intelligence stuff. Apparently one of the Rebel commanders wants to meet with me. With us. Anyway, I guess there are factions within the Rebellion using us as an excuse to keep the war going, so if we sign a treaty with this guy…
The Rebellion will lose focus and eventually fall apart, likely into infighting, at which point we can crush them and retake the Empire. Great thinking, Perkins!
Yeah, I mean… that or we could just like, live in peace or whatever… Anyway, the contact is demanding a show of good faith. They want 10 bars.
Give it to 'em! When the unstoppable Outpost war machine rolls over their corpses, we'll take it back a hundredfold!
It's like no one but me WANTS peace.
Jeeze, it's like they're actually trying to end the constant bloodshed. Weird.
Sergeant Ramsey! I think it worked! They're arranging a meeting with the Rebel leader. They even gave the bars back. I guess they just wanted me to prove I was serious.
They gave the bars back? Man, they HAVE gone soft.
OK, sir, I'm on my way to the old Silver Wolves' Depot to meet with the Rebel leader. If this is a trap… well… I want you to know—
Don't worry Perkins, I know. You're doing this without talking to Morgan. If it's a trap, I disavow any knowledge and you're on your own.
Oh, no, tell him. Totally tell him, and get everyone you can and come and save me. Let's be honest, I would NOT do well in a prison camp.
Oh man, yeah, they'd eat that kid alive in prison.
Hey, there's the building where I'm supposed to meet the Rebel commander!
And look, between me and him, a whole bunch of Silver Wolves! I mean, I guess that does make a certain amount of sense. They'd be likely to come back here from time to time…
Kinda can't believe I didn't see this coming.
I mean, it is CALLED the Silver Wolves' Depot.
Those guys are like cockroaches. If even ONE of them survives…
My apologies. It seems the reports I've seen regarding the Silver Wolves exaggerate the completeness of their destruction. I would have chosen another location, had I known.
Eh, you get used to it out here.
You are Perkins, correct? I am reliably informed that you are the person I should talk to, if I want to meet with your Lieutenant Morgan and discuss a treaty.
I might be able to get him to listen, but he'll have questions. Questions like "why not just destroy us with your superior numbers and infrastructure."
Hah! It is a reasonable question! Mister Perkins, I am not a man in search of glory, or revenge. All I sought was the freedom of my people. I have that now. I wish only to return home.
But not all in the Rebellion feel this way. Some have developed a taste for power, and for expansion.
The intelligence about your outpost is clearly fabricated. I do not know by whom, but I know why. The Rebel nations need an enemy to unify them. Someone has decided to make you that enemy.
If Lieutenant Morgan is going to meet with you, we'll need to get him in the right mood first. Lower his defenses a little bit. I'll take care of that. Wait for my signal.
Nothing makes him receptive like fine brown liquor.
I am more of a savory breakfast person, myself.
Perkins, I like being buttered up, but this is kinda transparent. I mean, there are things I like besides fine brown liquor. I am a fan of waffles, for example. You could have made some waffles.

Sorry sir, given that I've invited a Rebel general into our home to discuss a peace treaty which is opposed by his own leadership, I felt like maybe it was a good idea to start with something a little stronger than syrup.
Oh man, is he already here? Did he hear me talking about waffles? Look, I'm not even that into waffles, I was just making a point about my diversity of interests.
I am indeed here, Lieutenant, and please trust that while I do not judge a man based on his taste in breakfast foods, if I did, waffles would meet with my approval.
You won't believe what I saw outside the outpost.
An as of yet unseen subspecies of raptor? Or maybe a queen Spiderwasp?
It better be a vision of you leaving me alone, because I want to go take a shower.
It's a giant robot.
You guys are terrible at the guessing game.
I better go find Dr. Harris and find out what the hell is goin' on.
Typical.
Nessuna delle nostre armi può ferire quella cosa!
I don't know the protocol for situations like this, but I for one welcome our new robot overlord.
Wait a sec', I recognize that thing. It's the same color of the fragment I found while I was searching for Dr. Harris. She seemed to have some kind of control over it, tho.
What would it be doing all the way out here? Constructs don't usually wander out of the ruins.
We need a jet engine to build this weapon?
It's a supersonic combustion ram cannon. The only thing powerful enough to increase the muzzle velocity to the speeds required would be a jet engine.
I heard some rumors a while back 'bout the rebels having a secret hangar. Could be a bust, but if we find some planes I got the know-how to reconjigger one of their engines to build our weapon.
I'm excited. I never got to take a plane apart before.
Aren't we just a happy family now...
So, what'd we learn? Do the rebels know where the hangar is?
They don't know anything, but they claim there's a splinter group of rebels near Greensborough that would perhaps know if such a hangar exists.
Sounds like a fools errand.
Aurora, you'd be perfect for it.
We're ALL going.
I hope I'm right about this secret hangar the rebels got.
Look on the bright side. If it doesn't exist, you'll be so busy worried about the ancient tech you won't have time to fight rebels.
We can always count on Dr. Harris for reassurance...
Physical persuasion? Didn't really know Dr. Harris was the type.
After a bit of physical persuasion, they revealed their intelligence.
The rebels DO have a plane hangar, and close by.
There's the hangar.
And of course, guarded by rebels.
I was really hoping for a challenge.
Why so worried? Science is all about experimentation.
Zoey, are you almost finished dismantling the engine?
Yep! You sure this is going to work, Dr. Harris?
Experiment X17's regenerative shield is resistant to most types of attacks. The best shot we have is the scram cannon, which could potentially disrupt the barrier.
But, no guarantees.
Non ho mai detto che ero sicuro.
Zoey, you're back! We've got an emergency on our hands. Floyd is trying to give the robot gifts to placate it and it's already smashed several of our buildings.
I told him robots didn't like needlepoint pictures, but he didn't listen.
Just give me a few hours, L.T. we'll have this weapon up and running.
Can you make that few hours a few minutes?
Dr. Harris has only been moderately insufferable in the last few hours...
Okay, I'm almost ready. Aurora and Dr. Harris, I'll need a hand with buildin' this weapon.
I've never built a weapon that could break the sound barrier.
It could potentially deafen you, so I'd wear earplugs before trying it out.
At least I get to do field work again.
Poor Dr. Aurora, is that six figure salary and air conditioned, state of the art laboratory oh so tedious?
I wouldn't be so righteous, you know. You're the one who left.
And as I recall, you're the one who let the ancient tech get out of control...
It CAN be so tedious being cooped up all day in a lab.
Is Floyd the resident village idiot?
The scram cannon is finished.
Could you hold on a minute? I'm going to test my hypothesis that the ancient tech enjoys cheese and wine baskets.
Ignore Floyd. Let's try this thing out. Now.
Let me just make a few last minute adjustments. I found a loose pin… looks like it would've reversed the direction of the projectile and probably killed a few of us.
And this is the Empire's best mechanic right now?
Wouldn't be surprised if she was the best we ever had.
Poor Experiment X17, such a waste. At least there are still some usable scraps.
It's gone.
Buon Dio, il robot è andato?
Dr. Harris, I never thought I'd say this, but the scram cannon was a fantastic idea.
I never thought I'd say this, Aurora, but you're somewhat decent at your job.
I won't say I'm… glad, we could work together, but at least we're still capable of it.
And perhaps you'd be willing to come to i17 and work on some more weaponry with us?
Depends on if I've got nothing better to do that day.
The scram cannon is still in good condition. Wonder how this thing fares against raiders.
Oh, hey there Lieutenant! I was hoping to talk to you about the problems I'm having with this year's Pierce County Chili Cook Off.
Wow, you really took that whole "don't be afraid to ask for help" thing seriously. Honestly, I think this might be more in Floyd's wheelhouse.

Oh, sure, I just… My grandpa, Judge Pierce, who started the tradition. It's been a big question, can we do it without him, and there's so little meat around with the Rebels hunting and taking so much of the food, and traders haven't brought spices in...
We're in. Let's make this happen, folks.
You know, the Judge got his name from the Cook Off. Joined the judiciary after the fact.
I don't know, isn't that kind of pandering?
OK Sheriff, you're all set. Let us know how the chili comes out.
What are you talking about, Ramsey? We're not done.

Well, I appreciate the thought and all, but from here, it's really about the different cooks bringing their own recipes to the table. No one will tell you what they need for their recipe, or you might be able to figure out the secret.
That's fine. You tell those other cooks to bring their A game, because the 95th Rifles will be making some chili of our own. And we're doing in memory of Judge Pierce!
OK, I did some bold talking, and now I kind of need someone who can actually cook to help me back that up. Anyone have a good chili recipe?
Well, I have a recipe I've been wanting to try out, but it would require a fairly rare pepper, known to grow only in or near raptor nests.
Alright, we're gonna call Floyd's plan "Plan B". Do we have ANYONE else? Anyone. Ramsey?
I could… I like to make ribs?
Cool, Plan B it is.
I'll also be testing the peppers' function as an antisocial behavior deterrent.
You do understand this is food, right?
Success! We've collected the pepper, which should offer a great depth of flavor to the dish, and, I think you'll find, a subtle bouquet of fruit.
Sure, but will it be hot?
I'd recommend protective eyewear in case of splashes.
OK, everyone except Perkins, let's get moving. Perkins, you can join us when you stop yelling.
OKAAAAAAAYAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAGGHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH...
I think his voice is going to give out soon.
Ugh! It's about time!
Floyd, can you put together a release for the people who try our chili?
Stupid human decency.
Once again, I want to thank all of you for coming to the 78th annual Pierce County Chili Cook Off!
I am proud to announce that we have our winner! I'm personally touched that the winner has chosen to dedicate their chili to the memory of my grandfather, founder of the festival, Judge Pierce.
Holy crap, that's us! We won!
The winner is Ray! Ray is one of the former Silver Wolves who recently joined our community, and the guy makes a hell of a pot of chili!
Thank you Sheriff! I just want to really emphasize how much this means to me, and how much I appreciate the way you, and your town have given us a fresh start!
That kind of open hearted kindness is Judge Pierce's legacy, and I'm proud to have a part in it!
Son of a bitch! He was too gracious to even let me vilify him!
Floyd, I'm not so sure about this. Everyone who comes near the prep kitchen starts crying and runs away. They're saying one guy clawed his eyes out to stop the pain.

Ugh, exaggerations like that drive me crazy! Yes, he did claw his face a little, but he barely scratched the cornea, and his eyes are certainly not OUT. Anyway, we just need to give it time to mellow. Let the flavors marry.
So, I'm going to go ahead and note in advance that literally everyone knows that if you let spicy food sit overnight it just gets hotter, but screw it. We don't really have any other options.
Wait… spicy food gets milder with time, right? Hmm...
WHYYYYYAYAAAHAAAAHAHHAAAHHHHHGGGGHHHHHHHHAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA…
Well, the chili is finished. We should, of course, try a bit before we head to the competition. Do we have any volunteers?
Perkins volunteers.
Wonderful! Thank you Perkins!
Yes, sirs… hmm, it's actually pretty… oh… oh my that is that'sohmythat'sprettyuhhhuhhmmmmohOHOHOHAHAHHAHAHAHHHHHHAAAAAAHHHHHHAHAAAAGGGGGGGAAAAAHHHHAAAAA…
Aw man. Well, add a few cans of stewed tomatoes, some grated cheese, and about a gallon of sour cream. We need to get to the cook off, and this is our only option.
Floyd, I think I know who the informant is, but we have to go back to I17.  If I'm right, this is very bad.
Who is it? Can't you tell me now?
I'm not 100% sure, and I'd rather not say anything before I am.
As a man of Science, I understand the need to be sure before voicing a conclusion.
I'll pack some Kale juice for the road.
Really Floyd, that's not necessary.
Oh no!  A Rebel ambush!
You hold them off!  I'll call in back up!
This only confirms my suspicions.
But what if we don't?
Perkins?  PERKINS!
They grabbed him, sir!  It's like they used the battle as a smokescreen to get to Perkins. They must have wanted him for some reason.
Dammit! The ONE TIME I want to hear what he has to say and THIS happens.
Don't worry sir. We'll find him. We'll get him back.
Floyd…what are you doing? Because it looks like you're crushing up pills and putting them in the Lieutenant's coffee.
Your observational skills are acute as ever, because that's exactly what I'm doing.
He seems sullen and distant lately. It's just an experimental mood stabilizing drug I've been giving him for a few weeks to see if he'd cheer up.
Well, you noticed it's been kind of crazy around here with the Rebels and all? I bet he's just focused on work.
...It's much worse than I thought.
I got a bit of the blues once, but then I built myself a robot friend. Maybe L.T. just needs someone around to help 'em with cleaning off his desk and polishin' his medallions and stuff.
And in the meantime let's… lay off giving him these… experimental drugs?
But drastic measures produce more immediate results!
… A reasonable one?
So you can see, one of its arms shoots out cleaning suds and its other arm shoots fire.
… Why does the helper robot shoot fire?
What kinda question is that?
Zoey, can you explain to me why there's a killer robot in my house?
Killer robot? I didn't… wait, do you mean my helper robot?
I mean killer robot.
It's already broken all my Double Old Fashioned glasses and a jar of limoncello I was infusing. And it set fire to my curtains.
While shouting at me through a loudspeaker that it wants me to die.
No.
Well, darn, just give me a minute and I can conjigger the fire pressure…
Get rid of it.
Zoey. I was infusing that limoncello AS A GIFT.
Why do the robots I make always decide to set fire to everythin'...
Maybe I was too insistent on not needing help and it sounded like the complete opposite?
Zoey, why did you set a robot loose in my house?
Just seemed like yah needed the help, is all, LT…
I mean your dishes have been pilin' up and you haven't even trimmed yer eyebrows in a while...
I'm fine. I don't need any help.

Well, that robot certainly didn't cheer Lieutenant Morgan up and—
Floyd, didn't we have an agreement to stop putting experimental drugs in the Lieutenant's coffee?
It's just illegal.
It's not experimental!
I think maybe you should flush those? Not that there's anything like a 'law' anymore to care...
I think I know how to cheer Morgan up...
He just sighed when he looked at his boots...
Finally, Perkins! Is that my coffee? It's been two years and you still can't bring me my coffee on time? I order you to stand there while I drink it so I can stare at you angrily.
Err, yes sir.
Blech! Is this skim milk? It tastes like gray watery garbage.
Never mind the coffee. Just… bring me my whiskey, okay?
I already have it prepared, sir.
Perkins, my mouth feels like a sour, sweat-stained mattress. Like a desert of mediocrity. Like a pedestrian, discount apocalyptic wasteland!
Is this WELL WHISKEY?!!
Oh… stupid me. I guess I really messed up this time, sir.
I don't even have the energy to punish you...
Were you successful, Perkins? Is the Lieutenant amiable now?
Well, he got really angry, and then he just got… really quiet.
I was sure the mixed leather shoelaces would get to him. I know finding creative ways to punish me always made him feel better. But… nothing.
Well, that man's liver is like a cast-iron strainer. The drugs are ineffectual. I however, have another possible solution.
The lieutenant always had a fondness for eating rare, innocent creatures.
Lieutenant Morgan's malaise seems impossible to lift...
I couldn't help but notice you haven't finished your dinner.
Why are you so concerned?
Are you drugging my food again? Floyd, what did I tell you about drugging people?
That it was an immoral abuse of power that I should only wield against people that annoy you.
Hello, sir.
Ramsey, I'm beginning to think we should investigate the water filtration system. Everyone is acting crazy. I mean, like, REALLY crazy. Floyd actually made me dinner out of baby animals.
You know how Floyd is always whining about how "eating babies is wrong" and "it's unethical to torture animals to make them delicious" and boring stuff like that.
They all just think you're depressed and are trying to cheer you up.
Oh.
So, do you want to go blow some stuff up?
Do I ever!
Less strategy, more explosions. I'm going to make that into an inspirational poster.
Well, I sure do feel better. What about you, sir?
I think this is just what I needed. Now, to retroactively punish Perkins for all those previous infractions.
Mister Perkins, Mister Perkins! Elder Taos was talking about how he needs to talk to you and we said we know you and he said no we didn't and we said yes we do too and Daro cried and—
Kids, please, I don't have time right now and… honestly I really don't want to go back there after what happened.
You mean when you survived the trials and ascended?
Yeah. That.
If you don't come back with us we'll get in lots of trouble!
PEEEEEERRRFAVOORE signor Perkins?
Fine…let's go.
Ah! Morgan's Slave Boy! Like raptors to an old nest, have returned to us!
Guys, I'm not really excited about the whole "ascended" thing, but I want to remind everyone that I'm not a slave boy. We don't have slave boys. It's not a thing we do.
Perkins of the Flame, now is not the time to talk of rank and station like old men! Now is the time to celebrate!
I don't know, most celebrations I've had with you guys were kind of terrifying.
Here, eat this, it will give you courage!
Huh, he's right, I feel… ready!
Why aren't I running all the time?
Ahh, the Flame takes readily to the ash of war!
What did you give me to eat why is everything so slow how can you stand still when everything is always moving?
It is a fungus that grows on the underside of the leaves of small plants that grow near the sandworm killing fields.
Great, look, I need everyone to STOP MELTING. Ok, fine, I'm going to go home now, I have a lot of running to do.
Celebrando i Predoni!

Hey LT? Have you seen Perkins? He ran up to my tool shop, told me that when an combustion engine uses explosions to create motion it's like recreatin' the universe in miniature, then climbed on top of a nearby hauler and rode away howlin'.
Wow, that's much more interesting than Perkins usually is.
He also told me beauty was eternal. I kinda want to ask what he means by that.
You carry the weight of compassion, but your body is bent with strain.
Also, there are rebels here.
Morgan.
I am genuinely intrigued by a thing Perkins said. WEIRD.
I really feel like I got through to him, you know?
Perkins, we need to talk. Lately you've been useful and enigmatic, if erratic. What's going on?
Wheels move within wheels, bringing everything into alignment. Soon, we will see the face of four thousand years.
Ok, cool, good talk.
Alright, I've gathered this little group to discuss the environmental damage caused by the uranium mine, and discuss possible solutions.

So far we have "dam up the water, and then when it collects I guess put all the water in lead barrels and then bury those, but try not to get the lead into the water" and "blow it up." Which, Zoey, does not even make sense.
Are your problems always so tiresome? Why not just inject ethanol into the substrate?
Because… I have no idea how that would help?

By stimulating the activity of naturally occurring microbes, which have previously demonstrated the ability to convert Uranium from the hazardous hexavalent oxidation state to the inert tetravalent state, obviously.
It's likely the only remediation effort we can afford at this juncture. Am I seriously having to explain something so elementary to you?
Well… yes. We'll do what Dr. Harris suggests.
She ain't a pleasant lady.
Zoey, I'm not sure if I'm just imagining it, but sometimes I feel like Dr. Harris… well… sometimes when we're talking… Her manner is kind of…
You mean how sometimes she looks at you and the thing you just said made her so mad that she's not even mad at you, she's just mad at the world? Like for lettin' you be in it?
... yes. So you've noticed that too.
Everyone notices it, Floyd.
We've prepared the ethanol, and I've developed a method for injecting it into the ground water. Is there anything we should know about ramifications?
None that I'm aware of. Why do you ask?
Well, I'm just wondering if you're aware of any side effects from previous remediation efforts similar to this.

There were no previous efforts of this nature. I invented the technique while you were rambling on about lead containers. I see no reason it shouldn't work, but I haven't spent a great deal of time considering it.
Oh, so we're just kind of guessing.
Sir, I assume that you've noticed, but, well, we keep getting shot at by Rebels.
Yes Perkins, I HAD noticed. I know you'd think being shot at would just sort of fade into the background for me by now, but, nope, still gets my attention.
Were you working on some kind of a plan? Some way of dealing with it?
A plan for taking on the enormous Rebel army that has already destroyed our capital, defeated our armies and killed our Emperor? Yeah, I thought I might kill them.
I mean, if it WORKS...
Dude, this is a serious bummer.
See? It was a great plan. Dead people rarely, if ever, shoot you.
And with General Ashe away, they've gotten really sloppy about reinforcements. I mean, the next batch probably won't be through here for a day or two!
Wow, even your attempts at celebrating are depressing.
The surviving Rebels seem to think the reinforcements will send scouts ahead. We should be able to intercept them in the southern mountains before they make their way north to us.
That's great intel! These guys must be terrible at keeping secrets.
I mean… I'm actually a pretty good interrogator at this point...
I was being sincere.
HAH. Nailed 'em.
We certainly did sir.
Don't patronize me, Perkins.
Floyd, if you were going to blow up a bridge—
I wouldn't, destroying civic infrastructure is abhorrent.
OK, but if you were because like… you needed to build a better bridge there… that helped ease migration for… ducks or something… if you were going to do that, how would you go about it?
I'll take my answer in the form of a diagram and construction plans.
I DO like ducks...
Man, I'm gonna wind up building some dumb bridge, aren't I?
All done with the bridge explosives LT!
Now, when do we build the new, duck friendly bridge?
Tell you what, you start drafting plans, and I'll be in touch.
I'm picking up some kind of strange interference on my shortwave radio.
…Who gave Perkins a radio?
Oh god, I knew the day would come when Bigfoots would learn to use technology! I've got to get out there!
Seriously, who gave Perkins a radio? I want answers.
Those aren't Bigfoots. It's a distress signal. I'd recognize it anywhere.
And it's coming from the Ancient Ruins. If it's who I think it is...we gotta go rescue them.
...Where did Floyd go?
Dr. Harris is gone, and her traps I got past a few days ago are all busted up.
Someone must've kidnapped her. There's been signs of a struggle.
Can someone explain to me why we're rescuing this Dr. Harris person and not defending ourselves from Rebels and Silverwolves and who the hell knows what else?
She's smart as heck and likes to invent weapons and traps that melt people's faces off.
That's the kind of intelligence we need around here.
Maybe I can ask for some sweet weapons as a rescue reward.
This could be fun.
I must admit, I didn't expect Imperials to come to my rescue.
The rebels thought they could blackmail me into their service. A rather unfortunate mistake on their part.
Hi, I'm Lieutenant Morgan. I rescued you. Can we have some explosives?
Would those be liquid explosives or polymer-bonded explosives?
….why can't Floyd be more like you?
Okay y'all, you've been going through training for a few weeks and I think we're ready to field test these weapons.
Our first prototype isn't ready for field runs, but it'll be fine in a lab setting. It's a plasma cannon. Superheats gas and flings it out.
That sounds super cool, why don't we take those on scouting missions?
They have a tendency to melt into the flesh of the user.
Fred, stop pointing your plasma cannon at me!
I wonder how they'll fare against flame turrets.
These are sweet! And I only got burned a little.
Great job, guys. I'm proud of y'all. Seems like only yesterday y'all were dropping your guns and runnin' around screaming about PTSD flashbacks.
One of the things you'll have to worry about on the battlefield, ain't your enemies. It's the harsh elements.
One of the harshest elements of all is a bullet.
Will there be fire?
Domanda.
You forgot to zip up your thermal suit again?
My doctoral thesis was about how I was afraid of fire.
Scientists never threw a Seasonal Bonfire before?
Can I go to the burn ward?
You're fine, just a lil' spooked.
Cos'è questo rumore?
It sounds like the emergency sirens are going off. I think we have an intruder.
I still don't know how to hold this plasma cannon without getting welts.
I got a long way to go to make these guys ready for war….
Okay Aurora, you can turn the sirens off. Excellent work everyone.
Jones, stop holding your gun like it's gonna bite you. It ain't a rattlensake.
So that…. actually was a drill?
We had to test your stress responses in as close to an actual combat situation as possible.
I think I'm going to go lie down in the flotation chamber for a while.
Archibald, how thorough are your records of personnel here?

Oh, we are very thorough. We're a secret Imperial weapons facility. You basically sign away your rights to privacy to work here. The children's children of our employees are monitored to prevent information leaks.
So do you happen to have financial records, political history, or even ethnic background?

That, and and I have files for everyone they've ever dated, lived with, or taken a class from at the high school level and above. Every job they've ever worked, every medical check-up, and every quirky personality trait.
Of course, these files are strictly confidential.
I have evidence to suspect one of your employees is an informant.
I'll waive the confidentiality. Freelance work is highly forbidden.
Unfortunately, our archives are huge, and completely uncategorized. You'll need to find a way to transport them.
If it was easy, everyone would be an intel officer...
There's nothing I enjoy more than eyeballing the private personnel files of thousands of unsuspecting citizens.
Perkins, I couldn't help but notice you were building something… quite enormous in the machine shop.
Now, I can't say that I'm not intrigued, but you know the policies and regulations we have in place when it comes to using the shop for extracurricular projects—

I'm building an armored file cabinet so I can transport and go through thousands of personnel files to see if I can find the Rebel informant. It's going to take hundreds of hours of data analysis though, so—
Say no more. I'm in.
Aurora, your theory is absurd. If we're to use plasma for operations on injured troops, then the laser would have to be solid-state, not gaseous.
The kind of precision required for surgery could not be achieved with something so unstable as a helium-neon laser oscillating at such variable frequencies.
Where could we find a substance that could handle the excited ion states that you're saying is required for this type of surgery?
It would have to be crystalline in nature, and to manipulate that kind of matter latticework into a useable shape would… well… require tools that are non-existent.
Maybe I can help get ya the tools you need. I'm pretty good with stuff like that.
It's simple, Aurora. You just—
Okay, yeah, thanks for the vote'a confidence. I'll get right on helpin' y'all!
I just love talkin' to myself. Gives me a great boost o' confidence.
Guess she never heard about iteratin' to success...
Do ya like it?
That depends. What is it, exactly?
Well, it takes a plasma laser on that end, blows it up, and wham! You got'cher self a giant operatin' machine.
Zoey, we needed something to focus the laser. What you've done is clearly the complete opposite.
Let me just demonstrate—
Well, you just burned a hole through an entire row of housing. I hope you're proud of yourself.
No!
Eh, nothing a lil' glue and plywood can't fix. I'll just change the settin's—
Zoey. You are a hazard to the community, and currently, a hazard to my good will toward this Outpost. Please leave.
Zoey, would you mind assisting me with something? I've been incredibly busy since a freak accident blew a gigantic, laser-shaped hole through an entire housing complex.
Glad to do whatever I can.
I'm trying to figure out new methods for separating contaminants in the environment. I can't get into the details right now but I need a slightly faster centrifuge.
I mean, sure, I'll get the parts yah need.
… Still?
Sure I got something around here… 'fuge-like…
We just have jet turbines… lying around?
Zoey… the centrifuge…
Aw, you don't have to thank me Floyd, just doin' what I can ta help.

The centrifuge's propulsion was so excessive that it spontaneously caught fire, lifted out of the lab, blew a hole through the scaffolding, and flew off into the heavens. By my calculations, it won't come down for another 300 years.
...What exactly did you make it out of?
Well, you said it needed to be fast, so I just found some jet turbines and—

I don't need to hear the rest of this explanation. Zoey, your intentions were pure, but your execution was mired in the miasma of ill-preparation and lack of forethought. I'm going to have to ask you to stop… helping.
Zoey, what's got you feeling down? I don't usually see you like this.
I'm a danger to everyone. And I almost got Floyd and a whole bunch a'other people killed.
Well it's a good thing you make weapons for us, and not the other guys.
It's obvious you got a gift. Some people are great writers, or political thinkers, and others are just really, really good at setting things on fire.
Yeah… yeah, you're right!
I am the best!
Good thing details don't bother me much!

Hmm. A Plasma artillery blueprint? You DO realize I've already constructed a prototype? It's too dangerous for the field and blah blah blah, ventilation issues, I don't want to bore you with the details because you wouldn't understand them anyway.
The Rebels aren't letting up. What's your advice, sir?

I've got a boat that can fit four. Since it's my boat, I automatically get dibs on riding along. The rest of you have to draw straws. The ones who get the short straws stay behind and die horrible deaths.
We'll drive the boat until we run out of gas. Then we draw straws to see who we eat first. Since it's my boat, I of course am exempt.
Who's ready?
I mean, I built a new super-weapon. Wanna see?
I like the super-weapon idea better than the "cannibal vacation boat" idea.
I've never considered incompetence and willful disregard of safety to be USEFUL skills...
Woo! Look at that thing go!
Yeah, and after it had that… hiccup… the troops are only a little unconscious. Great job.
Hey, Zoey saved all of us!
She could have killed all of us, but she DID save us.
I was having the most peaceful dream, about a beautiful dove with wings made of white noise, surrounding me with a calming aura.
Then I realized it was just Rebel planes flying over the base again and I forced Perkins to spar with me bare knuckles for five rounds.
I may have bruises, but at least I don't have toxic, repressed rage...
I miss living alone in a booby trapped cave in the mountains… Everything was easier then.
The Rebels have been attacking the Outpost with startling frequency, Lieutenant Morgan. What kind of enemies have you made?
I mean, do you want the list?
If you could continue to distract them, I'd appreciate it. I'd prefer if a stray bullet didn't enter the laboratory, cause everything to explode, and shuffle us all off the mortal coil just yet.
Morgan does have the amazing ability to walk in somewhere and have everyone hate him instantly.
Even when you're joking, your words still HURT.
How are those super weapons coming along, Dr. Harris? The troops are running out of steam and frankly, I want to see something explode.
If you people would just let me concentrate and stop bothering me with your inane questions and concerns every five seconds, maybe I could come up with results faster.
C'mon, it's not that—
Five seconds?!
I'd like to issue a formal complaint against the plasma refinery. It's built directly above an underground stream which is home to a rare species of blind trout.
OK, sure, Floyd's concerns are inane, but you exaggerated the regularity.
Please don't come into the lab without prior notice. I'm working on quite a deadly substance.

And what substance is that? We already tried out the bee gun. Perkins blew up like an anaphylaxis balloon and we had to rush him to the hospital to give him a bunch of epinephrine shots before he died.
I mean, it was hilarious, but impractical in the field.
It's plasma, if you're so curious. Don't ask me to explain to you how it works, you wouldn't understand.
Pffft, already been done. Those scientists up at Installation 17 made plasma. What else you got?
I don't expect you to wrap your small, cheap-whiskey pickled brain around this, but what Installation 17 has done pales in comparison to my work.
I'm putting plasma into mass-production, and creating weaponry durable enough for a soldier to take onto the field. Installation 17 can barely keep their test tube beakers from exploding...
Hey, this whiskey wasn't cheap...
Ungrateful...
I'd do a better reveal, but you gave me rather poor facilities. So, well, here it is.
Ta-da.
Behold, plasma.
Don't think I didn't notice that little jab, because I did!
That little plasma vial from all that oil and chemicals?
Ah, yes, this stuff doesn't come cheap.
And we'll need a lot, lot more of it. You should probably get to work...
This is deplorable! I just got orders in for a special factory for plasma weapons?!
The facilities required for making plasma weapons is more than your… You call it a factory? And it doesn't have chemical treatment showers? Or radiation detection chambers?
We need another factory. There is no negotiation on this.
But those kind of special privileges is… classical?
I think the word you're looking for is classist. And what are you, one of those hippies from Sundale?
Okay, fine, I just didn't want to pay for it.
It's adorable, how you expect quality with no consequences.
He's had a difficult time of late...we all have.
Has anyone seen the Lieutenant? I got the bubble bath he asked for. It took me a while to scrape the mold off the soap but I think it should be fine now.
He's been in the chemical treatment showers of the new plasma weapons factory for a while.
Also, he's singing.  Frankly, I find it rather disturbing. I prefer him angry and irrational.
Just let the Lieutenant be for a while.
Not every trooper can wield plasma. It requires a bold mind, quick reflexes, and extraordinary stamina.
Perkins, will you pick up that gun, please?
Yes ma'am!
...And hand it to that trooper over there? Thank you.
I was so close to glory…
Know that your assessment of my mental stability is not something I'm concerned with.
These guns are so shiny and beautiful! I can't wait to go kill things.
With the way things work around here, you won't have to wait long.
Great work, Dr. Harris! I knew bringing you here was the right thing to do.
I mean, I guess I figured there was about a 50/50 chance letting a mad scientist into the Outpost was going to get us all killed, but still. Great work.
Sir… the Rebels…
Ramsey, get the tanks. We'll scout the area.
Where?!
No… directly behind you.
Well, that's unfortunate.
Way to kill my good vibe.
Woo! Would you look at that? Apparently flesh melts, but BONES explode!? With plasma weapons on our side, no one can stop us!
Sir, can I ask you a personal question?
Well, normally I'd say "no", and then make fun of you, but apparently wielding godlike power makes me magnanimous. Permission granted.
I know we were finally able to push back the Rebels, but don't you find this destruction… kind of appalling? Do the ends justify the means?
You seem' a little down.
What makes you think that?
You don't seem quite as gung ho' about trainin' drills and a few hours have gone by since you last cleaned your guns. I think Mr. Purrface might be feral now.
I guess it's pretty obvious, then. I've just been thinking 'bout Cassidy. It's been months since I've seen her.
Good god, Ramsey, it's embarrassing having you moping about. Why don't you just go visit her?
I'M embarrassing? Floyd is trying to build a raptor nursery.
What's that noise? Hey, who's out there?
Take your positions, we got a hostile down here!
Hostile?
Ring any bells?
We're going to need backup! This hostile won't go down easily.
While I'm flattered, I'm not an enemy. Don't any of you guys know Cassidy? Freckles, super cute? Deadly with a sniper rifle?
Ramsey? What are you doing out here? Damn, I almost shot you!
I figured I'd come by and say hello.
We've got more hostiles approaching from the east.
More hostiles? You sure it isn't just Perkins in a bear suit or somethin'?
Ramsey's soft heart is gonna get him killed someday.
This isn't exactly the welcome I was hoping for…
That was weird. What are raiders doing out here?
You know I got a job to do, and so do you. We ain't got time for this.
Come on, I'll take you home.
La vera domanda è che cosa ci fai qua fuori?
Ramsey, we got our own lives now, you can't risk both of ours coming out here.
You don't got nothing to say?
….want some coffee?
Coffee always seems to fix things.
Ramsey, have you seen my coffee stash anywhere?
Really, I appreciate you comin' out to i17, but…
Yeah, I know. You don't want me coming around anymore.
You know I still care 'bout you.
Cassidy, you've always been a good listener, so just hear me out. I get the feeling you're pushing me away because it's easier for you that way.
This is the hardest thing I ever done Ramsey, you know that.
You do what you need to, but you know if things go wrong you're the first person I'm heading for.
And if things keep going the way I want them to, I'll be strong enough you won't have to.
Hey Perkins, remember those jerks down in Marin? What happened to those jerks? Are they dead or what?
I'm not sure, sir. They're always pretty quiet, but recently they've gone totally radio silent. I have some people looking into it, but it's not really at the top of my priority list.
Hmmm… we probably oughta head down and check it out. There were a lot of civilians there and—
Wait… why do I care more about their well being than you? When did I become the empathetic one? This is a bunch of crap is what this is.
A whole bunch of crap.
Oh, there's a bunch of Rebels camped out here. That would explain the whole "radio silence" thing. Well, let's go shoot 'em!
Shouldn't we try to make contact with the Imperials we met previously? Look for some kind of established resistance we can aid?
Man, I shoulda brought Ramsey. He wouldn't have argued with me when I said to shoot guys. HE would have been cool about it.
Fine, let's shoot them.
Perkins, you give up too easily.
First, I want to talk about how dumb you guys are, which is very dumb.
Well, Morgan, you might have gotten us all killed, but damn if I don't envy you for what you did.
Yeah, I'm pretty great. So, how's the whole "going along to get along" thing working out?
Yeah, I've made some mistakes. I'd appreciate it if you didn't waste time rubbing it in.
Well, you'll have to appreciate it when I finally stop, because I am about to unload a rubbing in like you've never seen.
Well, after that very, VERY thorough list of reasons I'm a… what'd you say again? "Disappointment to my uniform, country and species"?
And your mother. You're also a disappointment to your mother.

Right. Well, since I can't imagine this being much worse, I'm gonna go ahead and ask you guys a favor. If the Rebel reinforcements show up and we don't have any injuries they're gonna think we helped.
So you want us to shoot at you and beat you up so that the Rebels don't?
Look, you were right about a lot of things, but we can't just abandon the people here, and we can't evacuate in time. This would let us start doing things right.
Man, it's like Festivus!
Honestly, I can kinda see why.
Man, you guys shot back a lot for guys who were supposed to be taking a beating.
Well, I mean, you said some pretty messed up stuff. The guys were pretty mad.
Eh, that's fair. You think this'll cover you with the Rebels? We can shoot you some more.
Shouldn't be a problem. They've made it clear, we're small potatoes, and as long as it looks like we took shots at you, we'll probably just get medals. They REALLY hate you guys.
It's absolutely unacceptable, Morgan! I will not be a party to the wholesale slaughter of an animal, ESPECIALLY not in an already compromised ecosystem!
Sorry Floyd, the Spiderwasp nest is too dangerous. We can't risk it. It's a matter of public safety.
As the chief civilian representative on the Outpost, public safety is under MY purview! I will block this at every step!
You're in charge of the sewers and sound construction and "slow children at play" sign aspects of public safety. The problems that we solve with machine guns are more my jurisdiction.
This is unconscionable!
I suppose that IS why we have Perkins.
Floyd, this would be a lot smoother if you'd just make a bunch of bug poison or something. You know they're just gonna move again, anyway.

We don't know that! We know they HAVE in the past. Maybe they'll die! Maybe they'll move to a worse location! Also, poison for something that big is just regular poison. Lacing their nest with it would be quite dangerous.
So? Isn't that why we have Perkins?
So, Floyd, about the Spiderwasp queen...
I'm not going to help you murder her, Morgan. Besides, she won't even come out of her hidden and heavily guarded burrow unless her offspring are endangered…
So we CAN murder her if we just kill her eggs and make her show her face… maw… whatever! Just making sure it was possible! It's okay, boys, she's totally murderable!
Wait, Morgan! If you do, one of the other females will simply—! Morgan!
"Murderable" isn't even a word!
Holy—! She's massive!
This was probably a bad idea… But I've never let that stop me before! Let's go, men!
That's the Spiderwasp Queen?
"Leap before you look" is my motto.
It wouldn't hurt to try respecting Science now and again.
Hey Floyd, remember when were talking about murderability vis a vis the Spiderwasp Queen… what were you saying at the end there?

While the hives are similar to bee hives in having only one active queen, they parallel wasps in that multiple fertile females will be preemptively fertilized, both for expansion and in case of emergency.

Depending on the nature of the emergency, the birth rate of males can be modified. Since the previous emergency was food based, we saw mostly drones. We can now expect a huge increase in the number of warrior Spiderwasps.
Um… uh oh?
Hey Floyd, if I was going to not try to wipe out all the fertilized female Spiderwasps, what stuff should I not do? And how long would I have? ...not have?
Morgan. I'm dealing with it. You stay here. I'll be gone a while.
Wait… are you gonna take care of killing them or of NOT killing them? Because I actually DO want to kill them.
That was a ruse.
It was BARELY a ruse.
Besides Zoey. Zoey is always about to make a bomb.
Lieutenant… Morgan, is it?
It is. YOU KNOW IT IS. Why do you do things that hurt people?

Your lack of memorability is not really of importance. I'm concerned about the work your friend Floyd was engaged in at my Laboratory. The combination of chemicals he collected and synthesized was… unusual. He hasn't been seen since.
Is he gonna make a bomb?
I do not believe he intends to create an explosive. If he attempted it with the materials in question, I would not expect it to be successful.
Then again, maybe he is trying to make an explosive and I am underestimating his level of incompetence.
Probably not a big deal then, right? Tell me if you think someone is going to make a bomb.
Still no leads on the informant… who could it be?
OK, let's look at what we know… organize the information…
Make sure to get plenty of string too.
Purrface! That string is for the big board! Stop!
It's someone who knows us, and knows us well… someone we've trusted.
But also someone who was able to get away from the outpost, or send someone…
And most importantly, someone who would benefit from our destruction.
Mrrrowwr?
Who indeed, Mr. Purrface… who indeed?
Lieutenant, Sir? I have some… well, it's definitely not a sure thing, but I think it's worth following up on.
I've been trying to put together a list of suspects and one of the few people I can think of who had opportunity, if not clear motive, is Ma Pierce. It couldn't be her, could it?

It's hard to say… We all know I've been kinda paranoid since Floyd stopped making me that special coffee… Still, I AM pretty sure she's out to get me. You should follow up on this. Also, check my food for poison and bugs.
No better cover story than delivery food!
That was maybe not as good of a cover story as I originally thought.
Ma Pierce! Exactly who I was looking for! I brought you some General Mo's Raptor!
You travelled hundreds of miles, into Rebel occupied territory, to bring me food, food which cannot possibly still be warm?
Yes! I did do those things! Which are reasonable!
Well, it's bad luck to refuse gifts from the touched. Thank you kindly, son.
Lieutenant! Ma Pierce!
Is she against me? I KNEW IT! YOU'RE ALL AGAINST—
No, sir, nothing like that. There's a Spiderwasp attack in Trotbeck! She's trapped in her house! She needs help!
So! The Spiderwasps are in on it too!
Yes ma'am! Sorry ma'am!
Well! You boys certainly have good timing! What made you decide to make this trip?
Sorry Perkins, I'm terrified of her.
PERKINS BUGGED YOUR HOUSE WHEN HE BROUGHT YOU FOOD.
Sorry, I'm just… Someone close to us is feeding information to the Rebels, and I'm starting to get suspicious of everyone...
I've seen enough nervous young miners who had found a vein pass through town in my day. Paranoia can change a man. Make him do crazy things.
Do anything that crazy again, and I'll make you fetch a switch.
Sir, my informants in the southern frontier are reporting some really bizarre rebel troop movements.
Wait, you have informants? Who said you could have informants?
Sir, can I be in trouble later? We should really check this out.
Ramsey and I will check it out. You stay here and write a list of things you're doing that I don't know about.
The gall of him!
Minus all the saving you've depended on us for.
Greetings, Imperial Citizens! You're just in time for the bi-weekly Embrace Circle!
Don't be shy. Hugs are life-affirming!
We're here on business. Have you had any trouble lately?
What sort of trouble?
Well, we've heard a lot about rebel activity in the area. Just wanted to make sure you guys were OK.
Nope! Haven't had any trouble with the Rebels! Honestly, haven't had much trouble at all since we regained our independence from the Empire.
We should swing by Trotbeck. If anyone knows anything, it'll be Ma Pierce. And it'll be lots of things.
Sure, she might yell at me, but she won't try to get me into an "Embrace Circle".
At least Trotbeck isn't full of crazy hippies.
Rebels! But the hippies at Sundale...?
What am I doing out here?
That's the first thing they teach us in Basic Training.
Those rebels were packing some serious weaponry.
They've left us alone so far, but they've been coming and going at all hours through the pass.
Through the pass? You mean toward Sundale?
What did I tell you, Ramsey?
Never trust hippies, sir.
Why would Jonsey have lied to us?
He said they weren't having trouble. If he's working with them, that's technically not lying.
Well why would he have engaged in disingenuous wordplay?
Well, it's not like those guys were ever big fans of the Empire. They seem stupid enough to think the Rebels would treat them better.
I never trusted those hippies.
You've been hiding something from us.
You caught me. I know I should'a told you earlier...it wasn't the bi-weekly Embrace Circle. We threw it together to give you Good Vibes because you looked stressed.
Sto parlando dei ribelli!
What rebels?
Please let me shoot him.
It wasn't our fault! They threatened to kill us if we didn't make weapons for them!
...We're in trouble now.
I detest violence.
That's not very nice. I take those Good Vibes back.
So what happened to this peaceful anarcho-syndicalist commune thing?
For the good of the commune, we unanimously voted to waive our pacifist leanings. That is, we could engage indirectly, you know, as a means of production, and thereby avoid, more direct…
I mean, they were going to beat us up!
You're kind of getting on my nerves.
So where are you making these weapons?
We converted the old farmhouse.
Don't go in there! There are still rebels around!
We're not going in. We're destroying it.
You should ESPECIALLY not trust a hippy with a farmhouse.
But you just destroyed our weapons facility...
What are we supposed to do if more rebels show up?
Come to us.
Or better yet, make your own weapons. You seem to have a knack for it.
'My soul wanders with you, my red-headed love. I seek you out among tusks and teeth.'
Perkins, what are you rambling on about? Are you still under the influence of drugs?
Just a strange letter I found. It sounds like… a love letter?
You're talking nonsense. I better check your temperature.
Tusks and teeth. That would have to be boars?
I wonder who she is...
Well, nobody's here.
Except a bunch of… angry boars.
I mean, I guess that's reasonable.
A poet is in love with me?
I found another letter in one of the boar's nests. It's still got hair on it.
'Love, time is a falling star. Come soon when the moon is swollen above the ridged tents of your blade-wielding mystic.'
The letter says she's somewhere with a 'swollen moon' and 'blade-wielding mystic.' The moon isn't out, so maybe it's metaphorical?
Poets do crazy things for inspiration.
I haven't really thought about romance much since well… third grade. I hope I'm still up on my game.
What's that breathing behind me?
This raptor is negging me.
It wasn't MY raptor.
The exploding star has wounded its sky.
Gah!
The snake will be struck down when it becomes so greedy it eats another's tail.
What are you talking about? There was a raptor attacking me!
Wait, was that your raptor?
I'm sorry! I didn't mean to hurt your pet raptor!
Intention is not a negation of sin.
Did you write those letters?
I will curb the errant stray!
I never thought of Crazyblades as poetic before.
My mom loved me… sometimes.
So those weren't love letters, but missing notices for a pet raptor?
Be honest with yourself. Who the hell would ever love you, Perkins?
Perkins, I have a special assignment for you.
Please don't make me inseminate raptors again. I still don't have all the feeling back in my left hand.
No, the cross-breeding raptors and boars experiment is finished. It was a dismal failure and I partially blame you.

I've been researching ways to reduce the amount of time our troops spend in the hospital. The young sandworm has the rare ability to regenerate parts of its body. Go find one and collect some of its skin.
Why can't his research involve picking flowers? Or petting kittens?
How come I only find sandworms when I don't want to find sandworms?!
Come out sandworms! I just want to play with you… and take your skin.
There's one! Finally.
I feel like a serial killer.
Or the sand out of my underwear...
Ugh, the thing exploded everywhere!
I'm never going to get the taste of ichor out of my mouth.
Sir, can I go lay down? I'm not feeling so well.
Good lord, Perkins, you look like a bigfoot chewed you up and spit you out.
Don't get too close to me.
Perkins, when did you start noticing these symptoms?
About the time I got home with the sandworm you asked for.
You didn't happen to… ingest anything, did you?
No. I mean, I might've swallowed some of its ichor when it… exploded.
Perkins! What have I told you about keeping your mouth open while fighting sandworms!?
That wasn't ichor. He's contracted a deadly parasite. If the thing is allowed to grow to maturation, it'll burst out of his chest. I'll spare you the gory details, but we must administer treatment.
How is a sandworm bursting out of my chest not a gory detail?
Could you kids take me in a stretcher?
Our attempts to cure the sandworm parasite have proven unsuccessful.
Sorry Perkins, what do you want on your epitaph?
HHRRRraaaahGHHHHHHHHHH
You swallowed a parasite? Woah!
Not even my Daddy is brave enough to do that!
Children, you know about this particular condition?
Only the most bravest warriors will swallow the sandworm parasite.
Do you know how to get it out of me? I'm throwing up rainbow colors.
We can ask Elder Taos!
Can we save this trip to the raider camp for some time when I'm less deathly ill?
Daro, get out of the tank so he can fit in!
Why don't I get a say in anything?
Why does a stupid worm get such a cool name?
Elder, Elder! Perkins swallowed a sandworm parasite and he may die so I guess he's pretty brave so we brought him to you!
Morgan's slave boy undertook one of our most sacred rituals?
Solo bisogno di sapere come farlo uscire da me.
There is no getting rid of The Sacred Passenger. It chooses those it deems worthy, and destroys those it does not.
All are profoundly affected by its influence.
Affected…how?
Blades in Moonlight once carried The Sacred Passenger. She was… changed.
I will take you into our purification yurt and give you advisement. The rest is up to you, and The Sacred Passenger.
Has anyone seen Perkins lately?
Come to think of it, no. And I really needed someone to do a long delayed routine cleaning of the sewage system.
Perkins swallowed a deadly sandworm parasite, which is apparently part of some ancient raider ritual, so the children took him to Taos.
I haven't seen him since.
You mean I have to go save his ass?
I mean, to make you feel better, he's probably dead by now.
If I have to go save Perkins, Floyd is going too.
Any luck finding Perkins?
We looked for Elder Taos and we checked the sacred tent even though we aren't supposed to but we can't find anyone!
Ah, Lieutenant, I think I've surmised what happened to Perkins…
Good, I'm already sick of being here. Where is he so I can punish him?
It appears the sandworm burst from his chest and is heading straight for us.
If he had just closed his mouth while fighting the sandworms…
When I get old, I'm going to be a sandworm!
Poor Perkins.
What about us? There are sandworms everywhere now!
Povero Perkins?!
Floyd, you're the scientist here. Don't you have some sort of idea for how to get rid of these things?
Get rid of sandworms? They are an important component of raider culture!
I don't give a damn about culture right now! What I do care about is not getting chewed up and spit out like Perkins!
I'm right here.
Where did all the sandworms go?
Great. Perkins is alive...
Perkins, come back! Aren't you going to wear the ceremonial intestines wreath?
You're alive! And… you scared the sandworms off.
I told them to go away. The little ones listen to me now. It's kind of weird.
What about the big ones?
They'll just try to kill me for dominance.
This is a phenomenal scientific discovery! How did you survive the parasite?
Can we please just get out of here? The whole thing was awkward and the raiders are building a statue in my honor and I really, REALLY don't want to talk about it.
Floyd, you're not doing anything useful. Why don't you make breakfast or something for the General here?
... Why not Perkins?
Because I need Perkins to clear out the sandworms that randomly burst into the Outpost during this delicate time of peace time negotiations.
Obviously! Sometimes, Floyd, I wonder about you…
There is acid eating my face...
I can't take this anymore! I'm out of here!

Sorry about the wait. I brought us breakfast, although the toast is only buttered on one side and the eggs aren't seasoned. Floyd is crying on the kitchen floor. I think he has some kind of cooking PTSD.

It is no rush, Lieutenant Morgan. I've just been talking to your mechanic here. It's amazing what she's been able to accomplish with your limited resources. You said you created a plasma artillery by yourself?
Ah, it's easy, you just gotta take a new ventilator and—
Zoey, before we reveal to the general all of our super weapon secrets, how about me and him have a chat first?
I'd like to negotiate terms. I've drawn up a treaty, but I am willing to negotiate on any point. I only wish to see my people safe, and the land restored.
Perhaps you would like to look it over with me?
I've got to be honest with you, I'm a bit new to this peace talk thing.
It's usually "There was a huge misunderstanding, someone shot an arrow at someone else, now we're going to start a hundred year war because we don't like your face" around here. But I'll do my best.
I mean, really, Raiders do NOT forgive.
Well, this isn't going as well as I hoped.
After we sign, I will immediately withdraw all troops from the territories outlined here and open up all trade routes.
Are the terms satisfactory to you, Morgan?
I mean… hell yeah? Can I say that? Let's do it!
... General Salmanca? Are you okay?
Salmanca!
You killed him?! You monsters!
Killed him, no… wait, what?
Sir, they're calling in reinforcements.
Frankly, we can't hold them off. There's too many of them. I suggest we surrender.
Are you kidding me? We can't surrender. They think we killed Salmanca. They'll eat us alive!

I hate to be the bearer of worse news. I mean, if anything can get worse than our imminent destruction by what appears to be a very calculated attempt to get rid of us, but I'm picking up some disturbances from the north. Something big, and fast, is coming.
More sandworms?!
I think I see it…
It's…
Yep, it's big and terrifying.
Floyd riding a giant spiderwasp queen?
I should be surprised, but I'm not?
I'm just… not.
... Morgan?
Sir?
Leave me alone for a little while, okay, Ramsey?
I know I'm supposed to be happy a giant deus ex machina with wings came in and saved the day, but I'm not.
Wait, you expect me to work for you under these conditions? Is this some kind of a joke? Where are the fire breathing robots? The electrical charged force fields? The SCIENCE lab?
You're right, ma'am. It's a joke. Now if you'll just step aside, I'll show you the REAL outpost.
Seriously, what do you expect? We're stationed in the middle of the damn desert with no support from a dead Empire. Oh, and the entire frontier wants to murder us.
You destroyed my lab and led the Rebels to me so that you could give me this crude excuse for… civilization of any kind? A prison would have better facilities!
If you expect me to help your cause, I'm going to need some resources. And a lot of them.
It's a good thing she's so… agreeable to work with...
I like her.
While you were out, I drew up some blueprints for my lab.
What the hell do you need a lab for? Floyd just uses a stall in the raptor pen.

Well… Floyd doesn't have the qualifications that I do, so he can continue to tinker with his 'My First Beaker' kit in the raptor hay. Now do you want a real scientist working for your sorry excuse for a rag-tag band of… whatever you are, or don't you?
Zoey?
Fine.
Great idea, LT! I've wanted to do this forever! I even got some ideas brewin' on how to make all the furniture flame retardant!
A science lab?!
I'm sorry to disturb your sleep, Lieutenant, but there are Rebels outside the base.
Yeah, I know, I've got Perkins on it.
You have a… private responsible for the safety of your base?
He's just going to frantically wave a white flag around and dodge bullets until they get tired and go away.
Look, Dr. Harris. It's Thursday, and I've already scheduled my 'me' time. I've got the bubble bath drawn and everything.
Don't look at me like that. I'll take care of it.
Words can't quite convey my surprise at his disregard.
I can do private, I can even do clean, but safe? Not around here.
Just when I think your incompetence has reached its peak, you find a way to push the boundaries of your ineptitude.
Well… thanks. I try.
If I'm going to work with deadly, fragile chemicals to produce the weapons you need, I'm going to need a safe place to do it.
It wasn't a compliment.
Lieutenant, here's a list of supplies that I'll need.
... Is this deja vu? Didn't we already get your supplies?
I'm building a lab, Lieutenant Morgan, not a slightly fortified Home for Wayward Children.
We already have a sweatshop for wayward children...
THEN, more fightin'.
Now are you satisfied? Do you have enough supplies for your lab yet, or should I let you scavenge my house for loose parts?
You should watch your tone. I'm the one doing YOU a favor. Unless you can find another physicist who did her graduate work in advanced weaponry and Ancient tech.
C'mon now, less fightin' and more buildin' weapons.
I hope that I don't deeply regret my decision to help you.
With such dangerous weapons comes a new kind of responsibility.
Whatever, when do we get to melt some faces off?
Can we build tanks with heat-detecting explosive cannons?
Or heat-detecting explosive cannons built on TOP OF heat-detecting explosive cannons?
I can even rig up some of our houses so that they'd defensively explode in case of home intrusions!
I've always wanted to experiment with a hybrid raptor-laser. Half gentle dinosaur, half deadly machine.
I'm dealing with an entire troupe of sociopaths…
I am not letting any of them into the laboratory when we're finished with it...
Things that explode. And burn. And go POP. BOOM! Weapons.
So, where are the weapons?
We literally just built the lab, Lieutenant. I'll be doing research for a while before anything is ready for the field.
I need them.
Weapons.
Well, if you insist on being bullheaded, I in fact had been working on a new weapon before this whole fiasco forced me out of my underground lab.
You're welcome to test it out, but we're going to need a production facility in place to make more.
I've noticed that ever since we built your lab, you haven't actually made anything cool or useful.
I'm sorry, do you want something quick or something that works?
Well… both.
Why can't I have both?
Sir, the Rebels have been sighted moving this way through the Heartland.
Dr. Harris, you got something for us?
Just put me on a production line and give me a serial number, why don't you...
That stare will haunt my dreams.
What is this?
It's a bomb that sends out an extremely powerful pulse of hot, excitable kinetic energy that'll stimulate all materials in the nearby environment.
When set off, the plasma entwined with all nearby substances is… an exceptionally strong chemistry to behold.
... Are you hitting on me?
Yes, Lieutenant Morgan. Just looking at you sends a wave of paralyzing attraction and limerence through the core of my being.
Marry me. Marry me now.
So… no?
Ramsey, get Perkins. We'll head to the Heartland and Perkins will plant the plasma bomb at the mountain pass before the Rebels have a chance to get through.
Sir, wouldn't Zoey be more adept at planting a bomb?
Yeah, but I can't afford to lose Zoey.
Cold.
We're too late. The Rebels are already here.
By the looks of it, it's not an entire squad. Notice there's not many vehicles. They've only been sent to guard the pass.
Let's take them out while Perkins plants the bomb.
At least I got to scan an instruction manual for twenty seconds beforehand...
AVALANCHE!
Perkins, you're back. Let's detonate the bomb.
Bomb going off in 3… 2… 1…!
WHAT IS THAT RINGING NOISE. I CAN'T HEAR ANYTHING.
I CAN'T FEEL MY FACE.
TELL MOM I LOVED HER. WAIT, ACTUALLY... EH, YEAH, GO AHEAD AND SAY THAT.
So we created a huge avalanche and while we're trying to deal with the resulting stampede, that Salmanca guy just lets us go free and cleans the mess up for us? WHAT A SUCKER.

What I find strange is that Salmanca actually did let us go. He could easily have used the stampede to his advantage and taken us out. Or pretended to let us go, then attacked our rear as we pulled out.
I can't really think about that right now because Dr. Harris is shoving papers in my face.
Blueprints. For a new weapon. I'll need you to help me begin construction immediately.
Sure, let's do what YOU want to do.
... But this is okay too, I guess.
Self-contained plasma production system. Reinforced titanium steel interior with a super light thermoplastic exo-skeleton. It's durable, fast, and highly dangerous. I give you: the plasma turret.
Really? That's it? I was expecting, you know, a giant, flesh-fueled robot or something.
Well, I've gotten over my initial disappointment of not having a flesh-eating robot. I'll take the plasma turret.
I'm ready, let's go kill Rebels.
First, we'll need to test the turret in a stable environment.
Does Dr. Harris not understand how things work around here…?
My birthday is coming up and I'd like a plasma tank...
I think I singed my eyebrows just lookin' at that thing go!
Good news, I've done some more research, and I have a new hypothesis on the extended harvest period the Spiderwasps have been experiencing!
Morgan!
Floyd, I've been wanting to talk to you about this. You're a civil engineer. You are not a zoologist. Please stop meddling with nature. Do civil engineer stuff.

Way ahead of you! I was performing a groundwater survey, when I came across some anomalous data. I need to do some more research, but I think one of the more important northern rivers has been poisoned.
Sure, go put little strips of PH paper in the water or whatever. Have fun.
My degree may be in Civil Engineering, but my heart will forever belong to Science.
But… my bedtime isn't for hours?
Morgan, I've made some startling discoveries about the water in that river.
Yeah? Is there like, I don't know, some kind of fungus, and you're gonna try to kill it, but instead it will mutate and eat Perkins?

Far more confusing. The water supply is tainted, but I have no idea with what. I can't find any traces of toxins or biological contaminants. In fact, if anything, the water is too clean. there's almost no bacteria in it.
Your big concern is that the local water supply is TOO CLEAN? Floyd? Go to bed.
Well Morgan, I've done a little more work on mapping groundwater movement, and I think I can track down the source of the contamination.
Sure Floyd, sounds great. Just to check, you're aware that we're at war, right? Like, I'm actively involved in planning combat operations? That's what the meeting you interrupted was for.
I'm sure this war seems very important right now, but there's an unnaturally clean river killing plants a few hundred miles away!
Yup, the war thing still feels more important. Go play in the river or whatever.
Why would I play in a river that's killing plants and animals?
Now, there's probably some kind of cave or crevasse allowing a contaminant to seep into the groundwater and OH MY -
Hey! That crazy old guy who lives with the Imperials is here! Get him!
I'm not that old! I went prematurely grey!
He's like, what, 70?
Silverwolves are remarkably weak willed.
It's no coincidence you're here, right at the source of the contamination. What exactly are you doing up here?
I ain't sayin nothin' old man!
Ah good! I have a truth serum I've been toying with, and this might just be -
Look, we don't know anything, Stephenson just sent us up here, told us to scare anyone poking around off, that's it! Please, no needles! I hate needles!
Morgan! I have weird news and bad news!
I guess… start with the weird?
I found a cave near the source of the groundwater contamination. The cave was actually a mine. Oh! And there were Silverwolves up there protecting it.
Wow, the weird news didn't disappoint. Bad news?
There are a bunch of animals living in the mine who think it works just fine as a cave and should not be explored for Science.
Well… go ahead and get rid of them. Or don't. I've decided not to care.
It's one of my best decisions.
And who exactly is this Mr. Stephenson?
More news, and a lot of questions.
Was there another, small mine inside the mine?
No, there was uranium. That's what was poisoning the water, extending the spiderwasps harvest, and causing all these issues.
Uranium! That's that stuff we wanted! This is good, right?

Morgan, as far as I'm aware, with the fall of the empire, there's not a single facility in the world capable of refining or making any use whatsoever of that uranium. i17, MAYBE, with months of work, but even then…
Che cosa diavolo stavano facendo i Lupi d'Argento estraendo uranio.
Sergeant Ramsey! It has to stop!
What has to stop? What are you talking about?
The exercise! It's too much! You're making everyone uncomfortable! And you're… would you please stand still while we talk to you? Stop it, stop run—STOP. STOP IT. NO JUMPING JACKS.
C'mon guys, I gotta keep my heart rate up!
It's cool if I keep doing deep lunges during this, right?
Anyone have any spare blood or organs?
Here I am, running around like a maniac, when all I needed to do to feel right again was get into some live fire combat training!
Whew! Thanks fellas!
*cough*
Rest assured folks, we'll be doing PLENTY more of that to keep the whole of the 95th Rifles looking sharp!
Uh, sir...
We did it Perkins. We took down the Silver Wolves. Sure, there are stragglers, but I refuse to let that get me down. We've taken out their leadership, and nothing is going to put me in a bad mood.
Well, actually, that's—
I'm going to repeat myself. Nothing. Is going. To put ME. IN A BAD MOOD. TELL SOMEONE ELSE.
It's just that there's Rebel forces in the Frontier and—
QUALCUNO. QUALCUN'ALTRO.
I'm sorry, young man, I don't understand why you're telling me this.
It's not even that big a drink.
Lieutenant, we can't ignore this, we need to respond.
I'm finishing my drink, Ramsey.
Seriously Morgan, we need to figure out what's going on.
And we will. But whatever it is, it's going to wait until I finish my drink.
So this isn't a coincidence, is it. We finish with the Silver Wolves, and suddenly there are Rebels crawling all over the Frontier.

It seems very unlikely. Perhaps Mr. Stephenson made his escape east. It's also plausible that after reaching the size necessary to defeat the Silver Wolves, we're simply too big to ignore at this point.
We can guess all we want. We need answers.
They've got a command post in the Heartland. You could hit 'em there, see if you can find out what they know.
Better than waiting for them to come to us.
I miss the Raiders.
Eh, they're not ENTIRELY wrong.
The intel they have is... weird. They know a lot of stuff, personal stuff, way more than I would expect Stephenson to know.
Do we have some kind of mole? Is it you? Are you the mole?
That's just it, there's at least as much that's totally fake. Stories about us exploiting the local towns, and having some kind of super weapon under construction. We sound like genocidal monsters.
Posto di Comando Ribelle
Rebels! Here, in the Outpost!
I'll get my gun!
Quick, before they can do much damage!
You save a guy's girlfriend from killers, and everything looks rosey.
Well, it finally happened. They found us.
This is... we knew we wouldn't stay secret forever.
Hell, we did a pretty good job sending 'em packing. Proud day for the 95th Rifles!
Man, look who's Mr. Sunshine all of a sudden.
Floyd, now that the Rebels know we've been holed up out here, what's gonna happen?
Well, I imagine they'll come here and try to capture and arrest us. Failing that, they'll likely try to kill us.
I'm gonna hit my workshop. See if I can't put together somethin' to help.
It's noble that you want to spend your time aiding the defense of the Outpost.
Oh, I actually meant to help me take my mind off things, but, sure, that too.
I find cataloging soothing.
I... hadn't considered that.
Floyd, did you tell Zoey she could build those?
I did. She was feeling really anxious.
Right. And now everyone in the Outpost is anxious every time we have to walk past them.
Lieutenant Morgan. It's been some time.
Yeah, not since you screwed the pooch at Marin.
Could you not?
General. I don't know what your intentions are here, but I can tell you that we're ready to defend ourselves.
Vecchio mio!
Defend yourselves. Interesting choice of words, given the way the Empire has been exploiting the people of the Frontier since the fall of Cariston.
I can't tell if you're reading your own propaganda or if your intel is seriously that bad. The only reason any of these towns aren't on fire or ruled by warlords is Imperial intervention.
Mi stai pigliando per i fondelli?
The Empire has intervened long enough.
I'll friggen intervene you.
Uh, I'm alive too guys. I lived.
Is everyone alive? Who's alive?
Me? I'm definitely still alive.
Holy crap, we're all still alive. Nice work, team!
This is... this is all wrong. I don't know why they would tell me...
Rebels, on me. We're falling back to High Command. I need to get a few questions answered.
Sir, I've gotten word from Recoil Ridge, it appears they've been occupied by Rebel forces!
It "appears"? I mean, have they or haven't they? Not really a great time for ambiguity Perkins!
Lieutenant, I don't know that Perkins's issues with verbal concision should be our primary source of concern right now.
Your point is taken Sergeant, but don't think you're getting off easy Perkins. We WILL discuss this later.
What in the world is he talking about?
Nailed what?
Well, I've gone out of my way to aid my friends and neighbors in Recoil Ridge, which means now I just wait for Sheriff Colt to insult me and tell me to leave, and this'll be a wrap.
Lieutenant Morgan! What in the hell do you think you're doin'?
Nailed it.
Look, I know every time someone attacks you that's somehow my fault because I'm the one who made them mad, but I don't think you can blame me for the Rebels.
Except in a very loose sense where, as a member of the Empire, I share some blame for their actions, but I feel like that's rhetorical metonymy and you're better than—
Look, you took out some patrols, great, but what about Rebels stationed at the Barracks you built? What about the Rebels quartered in CIVILIAN HOMES?
Well, I supposed I could shoot all of them as well?
Not really the point I was making.
The waters?
See! It's easy, you just put bullets in them and then they leave!
It AIN'T easy, and you ain't listenin'. What you're doin' is dangerous, and the people you're putting at risk are the regular folk from Recoil Ridge!
Well if they didn't want to be endangered by reckless military conflicts, maybe they should live somewhere more isolated?
Why the hell do you think they moved out here in the first place?

Look, Lieutenant, I know you want to help, but the situation here is complicated. Hell, a lot of folks out here remember their daddies talking about fighting the original Emperor Henrik for independence.
I get it.
I just need you to trust me, not stir anything up, and give me time to—
Sir! We've got a Rebel resupply convoy incoming!
Facciamoli saltare in aria!
Squirrelly little sumbitch.
Wait, Sheriff Colt said he likes me! I KNEW IT.
Got 'em!
Sì!
Morgan! Would you stop blowing things up and listen for a damn second!
Look, I like you, I think you mean well, but the truth is, this was only barely an Imperial town, and with the Rebels showing up, not everyone here is on your side.
Give me time. Let the Rebels wear out their welcome. I'll need your help, but not now.
So… you're saying I should go?
Yes, for now. Let me figure out who we can trust, and when the time comes, Recoil Ridge will remember what you've done for us.
Caravan Ribelle
Morgan, have you looked at the blueprints for my new workspace? I think you'll find it quite cost effective.
Look, I told you already, until you give me one good reason why you need a new workspace, I'm not allocating any of our scarce resources to it. Am I clear?
The asbestos, Morgan. It's everywhere.
Oh come on, you're going to have to try a little harder than that.
