Fine, I guess I'll go and finish up my chores taking care of the animals. I guess that's all I'm good for these days.
I mean throw a tantrum, why don't you?
I've been a Scientist for thirty years! What do I have to show for it?
Morgan, I'd really like to talk about the asbestos-infested workstation—
Aaaand all the raptors have escaped their stalls. Good going, Floyd. What material did you use to make them out of, your tear-stained thesis statements?
I'm not a carpenter. I'm not a raptor feeder, or a veterinarian. I'm a civil engineer.
Well, these raptors aren't just going to put THEMSELVES back into their pens.
Floyd, this is your fault, so get those raptors back in their pens RIGHT NOW.
Since my workspace is filled with deadly carcinogens, I'll have to make an impromptu one to write my resignation.
That's it, after this fiasco, I'm resigning.
Guess the raptor pen will have to do… it's the only place of quiet I have these days.
Strange turn of events, really.
Well, we cleaned up your raptor mess. You're welcome, Floyd.
Morgan, I need to talk to you about something—
Oh, and while we were busy with that, Dr. Harris was kidnapped by Bigfoots!
Wait, you say Dr. Harris was kidnapped by Bigfoots? At this time of year? But that doesn't make any sense... it's not even their mating season!
Yeah, don't worry about it, Ramsey is getting the troops to go to Bigfoot Country and wrangle her back.
No, I know what's happening. They won't be there. I… I don't have time to explain! Perkins, come with me!
I mean, it would have taken a few seconds to explain, but sure. Run off.

As the bigfoot females approach puberty, the elders herd them to a secondary location away from the males as they undergo their transformation. Since we're genetically similar to bigfoots, they must've mistaken Dr. Harris' pheromones for one of their own.
There they are! I knew it!
That's great, can we get her back now?
Grrahahs!
I suppose diplomacy is out of the question at the moment?
Ghhhhhhu!
I don't need an asbestos-free workplace, I'll just cure cancer!
Well, I hope you're not expecting thanks for rescuing me. You're glad I don't charge you and the entire Imperial army with malicious negligence.
We came just in time—
To find out Floyd already dealt with the situation? Weird, but okay.
I'm the only one around here who knows about the rituals of Bigfoots and the sleeping cycles of sandworms! I'm the only one who can save us!!
Morgan, I rescind my resignation. It's obvious now you'd all die without me.
Floyd was going to retire? News to me.
Sir, I'd really like to follow-up on the Rebel intel indicating that they have sources in Recoil Ridge.
What, are you just going to wander up and be bland next to every person in Recoil, and hope they'll get bored and mention that they're giving aid to the enemy?
Actually, I was hoping to hire some people, a sort of impromptu surveillance network, to inform on their friends and neighbors.
That'll either work or blow up in your face. Either way, it's worth the money.
I can't tell if I want him to fail or not.
Ha! Disaster it is! Morgan wins again.
Perkins, gimme a sit-rep on that time I let you spend 100,000 gold on some dumb plan.
Well, it's a little complicated sir… I wouldn't call it a failure exactly. I am getting a LOT of reports about suspicious movement and other irregular behavior.
Have you been following up?
I have! Unfortunately, so far, it's all just my informants informing on my other informants. Just following each other around and acting really suspicious. It's kind of a disaster.
Sir, I've got another idea. I'm going to distill a large amount of grain alcohol—
Proceed.
Uh, that is, I'm going to distill it in order to throw a party, and loosen lips down in Recoil so I can—
No, I've already approved the plan. Do it. Make all the liquor. You have my full support.
You catch more flies with honey, or grain alcohol, than vinegar.
Wow, I'm almost… proud of him?
How did the plan to get an entire city drunk work out?
It went really well! A fair amount of boasting, and more than a few untoward comments. Lots to follow up on!
Any unintended side effects?
Nothing the civilian authorities can't deal with on their own. I've got military business to attend to, sir!
Alright Perkins, you've got some solid leads. What now?
Well, like they say, you catch more flies with honey than vinegar.
They say that? Why are they so into catching flies? That's weird.
But now that I've caught some, it's time for the vinegar.
What do they do with the flies? Why vinegar?
SOMEONE EXPLAIN THE FLY SITUATION TO ME.
Perkins, I want you to explain the fly thing to me. What's going on?
A dead end, sir. We found a few informants and even a cell of Rebel sympathizers, but none of them had the kind of intel the Rebels had on us. This wasn't the leak we were warned about.
OK, fine, there's still a leak. WHY IS ANYONE TRYING TO CATCH FLIES?
This inventor Dr. Harris y'all told us about, you think they got anything useful? Weapons and such?
It's possible, but Dr. Harris absconded from the facility several years ago due to… ideological differences.
And we don't have the resources to spare for a search mission.
I ain't got nothin' better to do. Any idea where to start?
There were rumors of a laboratory hidden in the mountains outside of Skarborough, but I'd be wary of trusting tales gathered from civilians.
And I wouldn't go out there by yourself. Dr. Harris is… quite an antisocial person. I imagine security measures were put into place to deter visitors.
I'll build a rover to scout the place out then.
You have access to that kind of technology?
I got some old hard drives and a set of tires. I can throw the rest of it together.
The Imperials run things rather strangely down there…
I'm almost afraid to see what Zoey would create with the proper tools.
Quite an impressive rover, for your lack of tools.
I've rigged it with a camera and some basic environmental sensors. If there's something in those mountains, I'll find it.
Sheriff Colt! Fancy meetin' you here! Say, do you know where Lieutenant Morgan is?
I hear he's out scoutin' Silver Wolf troop movements. That or hiding in his tent hung over. What did ya need? Trouble in Skarborough again?
Sceriffo Pierce.

Oh, no, not this time, thank goodness. But our troubles did convince me that I needed more training, so I don't have to run here every time something goes wrong. I was hoping the Lieutenant could teach me to be a better sheriff.
And you were gonna ask Lieutenant Morgan...? Look, he don't know a lot about... frontier matters. Why don't I give you some tips? I've lived here all my life, so I think I can help ya out.
Really? You'd do that for me? I'd be honored!

Don't have to go *that* far, son. Okay, then, lesson one: you have to look the part. Look like you have authority, and you can command authority. Your uniform's okay and all, but how about somethin' a little more... professional-like.
So your inseam's, what, 33 inches?
'Course, I'm a pussycat.
You know, you're right! I feel more in charge just wearin' this!
Confidence an' attitude. That'll get you real far with a lot of people. Always remember that, and you'll get out of a lotta sticky situations.
Next lesson: you gotta know about local threats and how to handle 'em. There are usually a few that cycle over and over again, so having a plan in place for 'em saves a lotta hassle.
Fer example, Recoil Ridge is really close to a migration path for a bunch of local critters. Sometimes they get confused and wander too close to town.
How often do they come through?
Pretty regular during the spring an' fall. Like now, fer instance. Take a look at how I handle 'em.
Watching a veteran at work... This is excitin'!
Kid's too naive for his own good...

Y'see what men I took to the fight with me? How we decided which critters to take out first? That's what a good plan's like. If we hadn't had that, we would've taken a whole lot longer with a whole lot more casualties.
I see! Boy, with all the attacks the Outpost gets, I'll bet Lieutenant Morgan's a tactical genius by now!
Uh... Yeah. Probably. Sure. We'll go with that.

'Course, as you already know, keepin' the peace doesn't always mean bustin' heads. You gotta listen to folks too—get an idea of what they need and what you can give 'em. How about we go down to Skarborough and I'll demonstrate?
Sounds like a swell idea!
Hopefully this won't be a "town-threatening emergency" day...
Howdy there, Foreman Henderson! How's things in the mines?
Pretty good, actually. Only a couple of hiccups...
Oh? What kinda hiccups?
Well, some of the machinery is starting to show its age. And a few of the outbuildings are about to fall apart.
See? Y'gotta interact with the people often, get a sense of what's needed and what you can do. And thanks to the Outpost, this here is somethin' we can take care of!
Did someone authorize this use of Imperial facilities...?
I do like ice cream, though...
Thanks, both of you! I'm glad that my efforts at improving the lot of the proletariat are finally being taken seriously.
See there, Sheriff? An open ear can prevent a lotta problems before they start.
Uh, as long as you're here... The men have also been talking about "Free Ice Cream Tuesdays"...?
Free bonus lesson: you also gotta decide what problems are *worthy* of yer attention.
Final lesson: just as keepin' the peace doesn't always mean bustin' heads, sometimes it does.
This is where lesson 2 comes in handy: when we talked to Henderson, did you notice those unsavory lookin' fellers hangin' around nearby?
Come to think of it, I did. Something about their attitude seemed... off.

That's 'cause they're well known rabble rousers from Recoil Ridge. I reckon they're in Skarborough to stir up trouble for the mines. And 'cause I know them, I can tell you now that the best way to deal with 'em is a little brute force. Allow me ta demonstrate.
Bene!
I won't make 'em martyrs. Just... knock 'em around a bit.
Maybe now I won't have to bother the Lieutenant. As much.
Woo-wee! You sure took care of them!
I only got what smarts, experience, and a cool head get ya, son. Ya got your heart in the right place, and you're plenty smart; I'm sure you'll be a fine sheriff in the years t'come.
Thanks for the vote of confidence, Sheriff Colt. I'll take your lessons to heart and do my best for Skarborough!
I know you will. As long as you never forget who you're servin', I think you'll do good.
Silver Wolves spotted south of the Outpost.
Didn't we defeat them already? I have really clear memories of defeating them.
We got Bronson, but there are still stragglers.
I'm sick of dealing with these halfwits who don't even know when they've lost.
Let's get this over with…
I can't believe this.
We didn't want any trouble! We were just looking for food!
Orphans use it all the time.
Storia plausibile.
They can barely hold their weapons. They're starving.
We got cut off from our supplies after everything went down in i17. We've got no leadership left.
Are there any more of you out here?
I heard talk of some of us going to look for food in Skarborough.
We'll deal with you later.
Rimani li dove sei.
What'cha planning on doin' with the Silverwolves, L.T? Don't seem right to kill 'em when they're starving and they surrendered and what not.
They're enemy troops Zoey, we can't just let them go.
Everyone, just let me think, all right?
Either way, we need to go check up on Skarborough.
L.T's actin' more blue than usual.
Looks like the Silverwolves really got to the Lieutenant...
Talk. What are you doing out here?
We were just going to take some crops. We didn't want to harm anyone.
You mean now that we kicked your ass and your leaders are gone, you don't.
Maybe they've got some useful information. Could be more of them out here.
We'll tell you whatever you want, please just give us something to eat.
Fine, I'll play nice and get some food for the Silver Wolves.
Since when did we start coddling our enemies?
They might as well be useful to someone.
We got your food, now what's the intel? Are there more of you in hiding?
Well uh, yes… if you just go along the mountains...
They don't know anything.
Ramsey, roll in the tanks.
Much as I like violence and giant weaponry, I'm not sure I'm comfortable with that idea.
Nemmeno io.
….To be honest, neither am I.
Why don't we put them to work?
Do we have to go to Skarborough? My grandma lives there.
I should visit my grandma.
Lieutenant, you know how I hate being the bearer of bad news…
What did the Silverwolves do?
Most of 'em have been happy to work for pay and get some food in their bellies. But others…
Well, they're stirring up trouble and sayin' one of the Steel Mills belong to them.
I should've gotten rid of them when I had the chance.
I feel a bit strange sending people into forced labor…
Thanks for the help. Never thought I'd be saying that.
We just want to get on with our lives.
And it's not bad here. Hard work, but good food.
And I've even got a girlfriend now.
Well, you're doing better than me.
I'll take care of the troublemakers and put 'em back to work in the mines. I don't think we'll be getting any more resistance soon.
Sirs, shouldn't we be following up on that stuff General Ashe was talking about? The incredibly dangerous enemy hiding in the shadows, turning the world against us?
Yeah, cool idea Perkins.

Instead of, like, running the Outpost, trying to survive Rebel attacks and keeping the Frontier safe, I'll spend all my time following up on the deranged last words of a man who betrayed every army he ever joined.

I know the source is less than reliable, but think about it. What makes more sense, that we're the target of some kind of evil mastermind, manipulating events against us, or our luck is actually just THIS bad?
I'll be going deep undercover.
Also, don't ask about the blood stains. Also an order.
What the hell is this? A Rebel uniform?
Perkins!
I'm going undercover, sir. I need to find out more about their source.
Are you kidding me? It's suicide! I don't care what Ashe said! You're to stay at the Outpost. That's an order.
Also, can you get the blood stains out of these pants? That's an order too.
Are you sure about this Sarge? Lieutenant Morgan seemed pretty pissed off at the very idea of me going undercover.
Look, either you'll turn out to be right, and you'll get the intel, or he'll turn out to be right, and then he'll have an excuse to punish you. Either way, Morgan is happy.
Alright Sarge, what's the plan?
It's The Prodigal Son, Perkins, a flimflam. We'll intercept some Rebel reinforcements, wipe them out, then give you the identity of the lowest ranking man.

You say you hid, your whole unit was wiped out, not sure how you survived, very traumatized, all that jazz. Then when their backs are turned, you steal everything you can get your hands on and hit the bricks.
Wait, why was Ramsey so excited to involve me in a con game?
I think the overwhelmed part is going to come pretty naturally.
Alright Perkins, you'll be taking on the role of Private Buntain. Remember to respond to your fake name, act really overwhelmed, and try not to get killed.
Hey, you there, old man! Please, we need help!

"Old man"? Really? I'll grant that I have more days lived than pending, but "old man" just feels so reductive. I mean, "you in the hard hat!" That's objective, specific, and far less likely to upset someone's feelings.
OK, sure. Fair enough. That was really insensitive of me to just reduce you down to your physical characteristics like that, and I apologize.
Sure, my people in Sundale are being overrun by Silver Wolves, and I'm kind of in a rush, but that doesn't give me a license to ignore the feelings and needs of others. Now would you please—
Your people? Isn't Sundale anarchosyndicalist? Each person there is very specifically their OWN person, or isn't that the point?

A fair point, and absolutely true. I occupy a sort of informal spokesman position, and I suppose when interacting with those outside our enclave, I can take on a rather paternalistic tone, which I appreciate you pointing out.
Well, I certainly appreciate the rigor with which you reflect upon your own actions and attitude. Did you want me to find some of the people with guns to help?
Oh, yes please!
Being taken seriously is exhausting.
Even creeps can be useful.
Thanks for the hand. What happened there? I thought the Silver Wolves were kind of… dealt with?
Evidently not. Any idea where they headed?
Useful Joe says his cameras caught them heading toward Shigurman's Bluff. Seems like a good place to hide out.
Useful Joe?
Yeah, he's got a bunch of cameras and other tracking equipment set up. We used to call him Creepy Joe, but that's personalityist.

So, obviously I love that Silver Wolves are still running around, attacking small towns, and I love that we're still chasing them, but what I love the most is that they were smart enough to wait until this assassination crap threw the Outpost into utter chaos.
Really? Those are all extremely odd things to love. I, for one, am extremely dismayed by each and every one of them.
Wait, seriously? I was… that was ironical and sardonic. You know, classic Morgan sarcasm? Floyd, you know that, like, 30% of everything I say is a bitter, angry joke, right?
I would not have estimated it that consistent, no.
Maybe if your jokes were funny instead of just depressing...
It seems phenomenally inefficient.
End of the line folks. Survivors, who wants to talk indentured service under guard while proving your desire to reform?

Screw you, Morgan. We ain't playin' nice so you can put us to work in a mine. I mean, if you wanna lock us up, fine. Better food and accommodations than most of us are used to anyway. Lead the way to three hots and a cot.
No chance of me just letting you go with a promise that you'll stop the stealing and killing and what have you?
Oh, sure thing. I'm sure we'll make use of the variety of marketable skills we can leverage in this thriving economy.
See Floyd, that's sarcasm again. He said a thing that he didn't mean, as a way of making fun of me.
Floyd, what are the odds we can put together some kind of safeguarded prison that isn't just one big human rights violation?
Zero? I'm going to say zero. The chance of it happening is none. None chance.
Well, way to be a real Negative Nelly about it. OK. Alternatives?
We could kill 'em.

It's certainly practical. We can't afford to keep them alive, and we obviously can't let them go. For what it's worth, I'd put the odds of us being able to dig a mass grave at around eighty to eighty five percent likely.
In addition to being kinda bummed out by how low those odds are — I mean, it's a hole, I really think we can pull that off — I'd like to try something a little less mass murder-y.
We could put them in chains and abandon them in the desert. I bet some of them would survive.
Well, call the moral relativism world records, that actually feels like the most reasonable solution.
"It's a hole" is exactly the thinking that results in failed attempts to dig a mass grave.
So, is working in the mines still an option?
Silver Wolves, form an orderly line, and we'll get this over with as quickly as we can.
What, did you build us houses, then put some fences around us? Are you gonna invite us to the chili cook off?
Nope. We're chaining you to large balls of iron, and each other. Then we're going to drive you into the middle of the desert wasteland without weapons or supplies. Then we're leaving you.
You can't do that! That's—

Hush now, I haven't done the spooky part. Anyway, between lack of water and food, the brutal weather, and the extremely hostile wildlife, it won't be long before a lot of you are starving to death while chained to the dead body of someone you used to know.

For those of you who survive, I want you to remember: this experience, what's about to happen to you? This is what I consider humane and generous. I'd keep that in mind the next time you consider coming anywhere near me, or any people under my protection.

Perkins my boy! I've discovered what I believe may very well be a cache of pre-disaster Ancient textbooks! Even if they're designed for children, they should have a wealth of information about the lives of—
Percival. I'd love to go kill the giant bears that breathe fire or whatever we have to do to get at those books, but things are REALLY busy right now. The whole thing with the peace talks…
Certainly. Do you mind if I wait here for you? It wouldn't hurt to get some rest and relaxation before heading back into the field. Perhaps it's time I patch up these old boots.
Sounds great, I'll get some boots for you.
That wasn't really my intention, but I never turn down a gift.
I've kind of got to give him credit.
A very thoughtful gift lad, but, as you didn't ask my size, I'm afraid these came out a bit large for me.
Oh, that's just how Imperials make them. One size fits all. You're supposed to adjust them by packing sand into the toe so they don't slide around too much.
Perkins, that simply isn't the case. Imperial boots come in a wide variety of sizes.
But then why did Lieutenant Morgan tell me… oh, of course.
Perkins, quickly! I've found myself afoul of a band of Raiders! They claim I've defiled their sacred lands in my tresspasses!
The degree to which this is not the time is just… it's astonishing.
You! Old man! You cannot avoid us forever!
As the man says Perkins, the timeline is not exactly in my control. Please, help me defend myself from these fanatics!
Fanatics? What's he talking about?
One must understand that certain risks and sacrifices are unavoidable.
Well struck, fellows! I'd have been in quite a pickle without your assistance!
Well, I'm glad we could help out. Try not to enrage any more locals, if at all possible.
Perkins, while I can promise nothing, I shall do my level best.
Yep, Rebels.  Maybe I can sneak past them.
Aaaand… they've spotted me.
The perfectly logical thing to do would be to follow him...right?
...That's it? Where did everyone go?
We're too late, I'm afraid. It looks like they've already moved the tank.
They? You mean… you, right? And what tank?

The Rebellion formed from the many nations crushed by the Empire. Without a shared enemy, we aren't so unified these days. There are some of us who would seek to cause as much destruction as possible. I am not one of them.
And…unfortunately, a lot of that destruction seems to be directed at your little outpost.
Us? Why is someone out to get us?
I have a few hypotheses, but I really can't stay and talk.
Wait… What's casting that imposing shadow?
Salmanca did mention a large tank...
Why is the ground rumbling?
AAAAAAGGGHHH! Look at the size of that thing!
I gotta warn everyone at the Outpost!
So Perkins comes back to the Outpost, with big, wide-eyed fear in his eyes, and tells us there's a supermassive, high-tech tank headed this way.
And the smart thing to do is round up all the troops and try to stop it? Because to me that sounds… idiotic?
If the Rebels are as fixated upon your destruction as their actions make them appear to be, then the logical assumption is that they'll be taking the tank here next.
I'm sorry, were you invited to this conversation? We're talking military things. If I want someone to research like... soil pH levels... I'll call you.
... Lieutenant Morgan, do you really want to go down that route with me?
Oh god, those eyes.
I'm sorry!
I agree with Dr. Harris. We need to get rid of this tank before it gets rid of us.
Actually, I'd prefer you had ME check soil pH levels. It's kind of my specialty…
I just can't believe after all that money and effort wasted trying to find out what the Rebels were planning, we figure out they're building a giant super tank because Perkins took a stroll.
I mean, I used to read books on how to treat ladies and stuff and never had any luck. But me and Cassidy. Well, we just kind of happened.
So you're saying if I treat the Rebels like I treat my dating life, then all the intel will just stumble into our laps and we'll live happily ever after?
Wait. No. Never mind. That analogy makes no sense when applied to me.
I mean, there was that thing with Yenchka—
Shut up, Perkins!
At least SOMEONE loves me!
I mean, have you ever fought a GIANT ANCIENT ROBOT?
The path is clear to the Rebel tank.
Lieutenant Morgan, though I thank you for your assistance, you should not have come. My men and I can handle it from here.
No offense, General, but we didn't come here to assist you.
And it didn't really look like you were handling anything until we showed up.
You have a point, Lieutenant. Though I would warn you this vehicle is more dangerous than anything you've ever faced.
I really, seriously doubt that.
I doubt that.
Perkins, give me the binoculars.
Yes, sir, but you're not going to like what you see…
Yep. It's a multi-part, multi-manned giant tank.
Why didn't Dr. Harris build us one of THOSE? I'm so jealous I can't even be mad.
What's the strategy, sir?
... Go in and blow it up? I mean… I guess I don't understand why you'd ask that? When is that not the plan?
The strategy is always to blow things up, right?
Perkins, don't look at his teeth! His perfect teeth!
Oh look, it's that rebel General guy with the perfect teeth, riding in on his white horse after we cleaned up his mess.
Lieutenant Morgan, though circumstances have made us enemies, I cannot thank you enough for the service that you have provided for the people of the frontier.
These citizens may rest safe, knowing that such a hero like you has rescued them from certain destruction. I know I will not forget it.
His charm is blinding me, what do I do?
Uhh...
A word of caution. I wouldn't rest, or seek comfort in easy answers. They won't stop coming for you, and any information you can gather is liable to be false.
Hey, LT, did you authorize some kinda secret, after hours tank trainin'?
Uh… no?
Well, are you rentin' the tanks out for personal use and pocketin' the cash?
I mean, that's a pretty good idea but… no? I mean… not yet, anyways?
Well, then someone else is stealing our tanks, using up a little fuel and ammo, and then sneaking them back in.
Well, we should find them?
On it, LT!
That was strangely circuitous.
I mean, he ain't wrong.
Alright, we got the cameras all set up. Should just be a matter of time.
Aw man. How long?
Well there ain't no way to know! You just gotta wait!
ASPETTARE E' NOISO.
Hey, did you ever figure out what happened with those stolen tanks?
Well… yeah… about that, it ain't quite so simple...
What, is it bees? Are bees stealing our tanks? You know I don't trust them.
It's the Raider Kids.
Well, I guess we better go get 'em.
Wait, don't they already have their own tank?
I've got something in mind.
WE WANTED TO PRACTICE SOME NEW STUFF WITH OUR TANK BUT WE NEEDED OTHER TANKS SO WE BORROWED THEM AND AND AND—
ZOEY MI DISPIACE!
Kids, you know better than to borrow somethin' without askin'! Y'all are in for some serious punishment.
Yeah, about that… Zoey, you should leave this to me.
Imperials have a saying, "Let the punishment fit the crime." Do you Raiders have anything like that?
Kind of? "An eye for an eye. An eye for a tooth. An eye for a hand. An eye for a boar." They really encourage blinding people as punishment.
Well, this is kind of like that. As punishment for stealing our tanks, you guys are going to need to steal some tanks. Oh, but from the Rebels. That's the punishment part.
Imperial punishments are weird.
Part of respecting your elders is making sure they get a cut.
It was really scary but we managed to get one of their Heavier Tanks!
I hope you've learned your lesson. It's not okay to steal. Unless you're cutting me in on it, that's different.
Good day, Lieutenant. How would you like to earn quite a bit of money? I need someone to—
Whatever it is, I'm in.
I thought you'd say that. One of my assistants is visiting her sick mother, so I need someone to fill in for her. I pay her *very* well, so I would pay her replacement *very* well.
Assistant? Like taking dictation, running mail, stuff like that?
More or less. In fact, your first task would be to make a small delivery of paperwork to Sundale.
Huh. I didn't know hippies did paperwork. But sure, if the pay's that good, I'm in!
This'll be the easiest gold I've ever made!
Damn, what are all these critters doing around here? Is Sundale feeding the animals again? I TOLD Jonsey that raptors aren't cuddly!
Looks like I'll have to get rid of them to get by...
I'd better get paid extra for this...
I'd rather just keep bleeding.
I have... paperwork from... Ma Pierce...
Tremendous! We always get a good price for our organic fertilizers from her!
Yeah, that's super for you guys. Look, do you have any antiseptic? I've got a few raptor cuts I need to treat.
You don't need that! Just put this all-natural, dung-based salve on them and cover them with some rough, scratchy willow bark, and that should— Hey, where are you going?
I hear you had some minor trouble...?
Ben fatto, tenente Morgan.
Yeah, "minor trouble" with razor sharp claws, ten inch tusks, and two tons of mammoth stomping on my skull. So what's next?
There's a delivery I need you to pick up in the Heartland. I have some relief goods for Trotbeck coming in from elsewhere.
Uh, from where? The Empire's gone, and aside from the Outpost, we don't really have any allies that would—
I said, from *elsewhere*.
Okay... got it.
I do what I must to help my kin and my business.
Huh... That must be Ma Pierce's supplier.
The guy who's surrounded by Rebels trying to confiscate his stuff. Swell.
"Pick up a delivery." Thanks, Ma.
Mean woman, that Ma...
This was supposed to be a delivery of food and farm equipment parts, not bullets.
The Rebels threw those in for free. I still have some lodged in my backside if you want more...
That won't be necessary, Lieutenant. Though I must admit that the scorch marks do bring out the color in your eyes...
Really?
No.
So, how are you going to try to kill me this time?

Oh, this one is very simple. You don't even have to leave your Outpost. Young Zoey has agreed to build some non-lethal weapons to arm Trotbeck's militia with. All you need to do is oversee their construction.
A fabrication job? That's all?
That's all. Of course, as my representative, you'll need to test each and every one for quality, but surely with Zoey in charge, that won't be an issue?
She's doing this on purpose, isn't she?
Never a dull moment at the Outpost... unfortunately.
Well, Ma, the weapons are working well. Sometimes TOO well...
Mm, yes, I see that. I didn't remember your uniform having quite so many holes in them.
Yeah, Zoey's inventions never go halfway.
I don't know if you've noticed, but a lock of your hair is still on fire.
Hm? Oh, I'm used to that. It happens a lot around here.

Okay, Ma, I've been, let's face it, a pretty incredible sport about this, but there is NO WAY your normal assistant gets shot, maimed, or set on fire as often helping you as I have been. I think I'm going to have to tender my resignation.
Calm down, Lieutenant. All I want you to do is to watch my pie as it cools while I make a business deal in Skarborough.
That's it? That's all I have to do? Watch a pie? It's in a normal place, and it's not made out of killer creeper vines or anything like that?
You're so paranoid, child. It's an everyday cherry pie sitting on my own windowsill. I think you can handle that, don't you?
It IS very good pie, though.
Okay... This is good... It is just a normal pie. It's not like I'm going to have to risk my life protecting it...
We have come for the pie of the Pierce Matriarch! We will shoot at anyone who gets in our way!
Of course.
It is very good pie.
Though that really IS very good pie...
I'm back. Did anything happen while I was away?
You... You...!

Ah, my pie is ready to eat! Would you like a slice, Lieutenant? I've been wanting to talk to you about the increased support the Frontier needs. I mean, you've seen first hand what we go through to get anything done.
Ma, you're a canny, scary woman.
Predoni del Dessert
So I ain't much of a reader, but I've been goin' through these archives I found stashed in the cave and looks like Dr. Harris did a lot of research on the ancient tech.
It was Dr. Harris' special interest. And one of the reasons we became divided. Research into ancient artifacts is dangerous and costly, and the benefits are unknown.
I think I might know where Dr. Harris is hiding. I'm gonna need to borrow that laser buggy again…
Where else would a mad inventor go except the place with the coolest stuff?
These traps are definitely newer. Just look at the detail on these here latching mechanisms.
I was so busy lookin' at detail I almost got my face bit off.
I oughta bring some scraps home and build a robot or somethin'.
Someone's definitely living around here, but they're hidin' pretty darn well.
I better head back into the tool shop and see what I can do to flush 'em out.
No mad inventor can resist puttin' a hard-to-get-to lab in the middle of nowhere. I think it's in the handbook or somethin'.
Once a mad inventor, always a mad inventor.
Dr. Harris was always a rather difficult person to work with.
Just what do you hope to accomplish if you find Dr. Harris?
Maybe I'll get lucky and find a cure for world hunger or a time machine to go back before this crap started.
But really, I'd want anyone with traps like that on our side. Did I tell you 'bout the raptors?
Were those Old World raptors, or Mediterranean Raptors?
Nevermind, that doesn't matter.
Better hurry on back to the Ancient Ruins.
I always wanted to live in a junkyard as a kid.
Hmm, I'm not pickin' anything up. Dr. Harris is good. Either that, or she's cleared on outta here too.
Hey, is that a deadly killer robot?
I don't remember that deadly killer robot being here before.
That's my home she's talking about…
What the hell kind of things you been doing up here? What was that thing?
...Can I take another look at it?
You didn't get the hint I didn't want visitors?
You'd think the traps would have given you a clue. Did they remove all the communications courses from the Imperial PhD requirements?
I ain't never been to college. Even so, every trap you made, I got past 'em. So I figure you could at least talk to me.
Am I supposed to be impressed? You didn't even stumble on the really good ones.
I came here to ask for help. We got armies coming down on us from all sides, and I heard you were the inventor that could help us win this thing.
You're with the Empire, aren't you? Or at least, what's left of them?
Go home. Why would I waste my time with the last remnants of a dying Empire that clearly needs a mercy killing?
I wasn't really expectin' something this big…
Experiment X17, she's not a threat. Stand down.
Bene, io sono fuori da qui, LT!
I'm still waiting on that spring-loaded coffee maker you promised me for my birthday! I was going to use it to scald-slash-prank Ramsey.
Cosa? Non puoi smettere ora!
I'm enterin' the Trebuchet Contest at Recoil Ridge, remember? You made me submit about twenty forms about it last month.
I put 'em in your inbox.
Smettendo? Io non sto smettendo!
Inbox? I don't have a... Wait, did you seriously not realize this was a trash can?
Well, if you're leaving the Outpost, I'm coming with you. You're a key part of this organization, and I won't tolerate any risk to our investment.
Also, I really want to find out what a "trebuchet" is.
Welcome, siege engineers, to the seventh annual Recoil Ridge Trebuchetathon!
Siege engineers? You mean a "trebuchet" is a weapon? This suddenly got *way* more interesting.
It's more than a weapon. A trebuchet is where physics, engineering, mathematics, and creativity combine, for the purpose of throwing small things really hard into bigger things!
I've never seen you so ... poetic.
So why are there so many Raiders here? All these gas masks are making me nervous.
Buildin' things that throw other things is a joy that crosses all cultural boundaries, LT. It's a celebration of all we got in common!
Usually, Raiders just like throwing things at *me*...
Maybe she could have beaten them a little less?
And the winner... by a sort of embarrassing margin... is Zoey from the Outpost!
Even the *trophy* is a workin' trebuchet! Though I figure I could make a few improvements to it ...
Woo! Guarda questo, LT!
Um ... Zoey? Those Raiders don't look too happy that you won. Maybe we should leave. Now.
All right, now the Raiders are following us.
Maybe they just wanna talk about trebuchets! I can do that all day.
It definitely has *something* to do with weaponry. Most of them have their guns out.
They're shooting at us! Shoot back! Shoot back!
If only we had some kind of enormous siege weapon ...
I wonder if we could get a baby raptor into it ...
That trebuchet was incredible! Why don't we have, like, fifty of these things?
I guess I figured y'all only cared about noisy engines and big honkin' guns.
But this trebuchet is something special. There's no limit to how many different things it can throw! It's like a smorgasbord of destruction!
Beh... naturalmente, sì!
Sir, we've got—
Perkins, I told you not to disturb me unless the life of someone I cared about on a personal level was at risk.
And then you spent like fifteen minutes making sure it was clear that I was not on the list. I remember.
Do you remember when I listed all the people who are on the list even though you're not? Like… I had ARCHIBALD on the list. I barely know that guy.
Sir, can we talk about this later? Ma Pierce is under attack.
Honestly, I don't even like Archibald much.
Enemy sighted, sir.
Yeah, we can all see them, Ramsey. They're right over there.
Morgan, I lost nearly everyone I knew when the Empire fell, and my girlfriend lives on the other side of a few hundred miles of frozen wasteland. If you don't let me have this, I have nothing.
Wow, yeah, your life is kind of a bummer. Permission to take things real seriously and act all formal, granted.
I ask for so little.
The day I can't control a platoon of Rebels is the day I start planning my retirement.
Well, if it isn't my knight in shining armor. Nice to see you wantonly discharging weapons and risking lives in my town again, Lieutenant.
Shucks, what's a few dead soldiers between old friends.

You know I don't brook firearms in Trotbeck, but the Rebels are soldiers, and I know how to manage them. This isn't a Silver Wolf raid, and I don't want my home to become a battlefield again, if I can help it.
Honestly, Lieutenant, I appreciate it, but you oughta head home.
Well, you know where to find me if they get out of control. Take care, Ma.
Morgan, we've received word from Ma Pierce. I guess we stirred some things up when we shot all those guys.
Man, the Rebels are such drama queens.
"Oh, you shot some of us, waahh!" That's how they sound.
Sir! There are Rebel troops outside Trotbeck — it looks like they're planning to intercept us!
Let's not disappoint them, folks!
Get ready to intercept my fists! Into your faces! Cause I'm punching you!
A darn shame.
You know, if it weren't for the overwhelming numbers, and the significantly stronger economic and supply infrastructure, I feel like we'd really be giving these guys a run for their money.
Yeah, it's a shame about them having all that stuff that wins wars.
Alright folks, I'm glad we had fun, but Trotbeck still needs our help. Let's get the lead out.
It's a good thing I never ever get tired of shooting guys.
Wish I could say I was glad to see you folks. I'm afraid these Rebels haven't exactly behaved like gentlemen. I was hoping you could help them blow off some steam.
I figure we can give them something more interesting to shoot at than your stop signs.
Of course, these targets shoot back.
So… what the hell just happened?
Platoon, stow your weapons and withdraw with all due haste.
Cease fire!
Wait… what? Does anyone know what's happening?
Hey! No!

My apologies, Mrs. Pierce. The behavior of these troops was absolutely unacceptable. We'll be withdrawing to a safe distance, and please be assured that I'll be personally conducting a disciplinary investigation at the first opportunity.

Lieutenant Morgan, I regret meeting you under these circumstances. It's clear that your presence here was requested and provided in good faith. Given the situation, we'll make no attempt to pursue, and request that you do the same.
So… you're just gonna leave. And you want us to just leave. And then we all agree to not shoot each other for a while? I… who are you exactly? This is a trap, right?
I am General Salmanca of the Revolutionary army, and I swear on my family and homeland, for which I have fought and killed, that this is not a trap.
Yeah, ok. Let's give it a shot.
Huh.
Lieutenant, we're in a real pickle. Not only do the Rebels have way, WAY more troops than we do, they've taken control of Imperial weapon facilities. We're on even footing, Imperial equipment wise.
Well, thanks for pointing out that we're screwed. It's super good for morale.
No, my point is, we still have something they don't. I17.
Oh yeah, we are friends with an experimental weapons facility. I guess that could come in handy.
Man, helping people is finally paying off!
Hey, so, you've probably heard about how we're screwed, right?
We're aware of recent developments, yes.
And you're aware that if we're not around, the odds of you guys winding up alive and not in some kind of science gulag are pretty low, right?
If you're suggesting we assist you, we're already working actively on new devices. We're going to need supplies to enter production though.
Oh, good. My threats started to get way less veiled after that.
He thinks those threats were veiled?
I think it's thoughtful.
Sweet! What do we get?
You get a production line ready to start producing prototypes once we have the parts. We'll have actual weapons soon.
This is just like someone giving you one of those "we planted a tree in your name" cards on your birthday. Crappy.
We've got a design we're pretty excited about, but we're going to need shock absorbers. We could retool the machinery here, but it would take days...
So you want us to do it.
Actually, we just need some Gas-Powered Twisters, for parts. We'll do the rest.
Well, at least I know what those are.
Where's Ramsey? He vanished as soon as we got here…
Yes, these will do nicely.
Cool, is it a super weapon yet?
You literally just handed them over. I'm still holding them.
If I wanted excuses I'd talk to Perkins.
Ramsey! Where have you been? We're gonna field test the new weapon, and you almost missed it!
Sorry, I've been… real busy.
Oh man! Did you come out here as an excuse to make out with your girlfriend? YOU TOTALLY DID DIDN'T YOU.
Shut up. Don't be weird.
Hahaha! That's awesome!
I'm so proud of him!
So… where do I find Dr. Harris?
Uh, yeah, we'll totally take it.
Yes, I know. We invented it SPECIFICALLY for you.
Can you, you know, invent some more stuff?
We're working on it. If only Dr. Harris was still here. I'm a talented engineer, but Dr. Harris's mind was just… decades ahead. I've never seen anything like it.
You know what I miss? A good glass of whiskey.
Specifically, Imperial whiskey. The best I've ever tasted: made in a small distillery in Bernmoth. Single malt whiskey, aged for three years in charred white oak casks.
Not really much of a drinker myself, sir.
Are you kidding me? You couldn't find a lover better than this whiskey.
And to think it might all be going to waste after the Empire collapsed.
I just came to tell you that we've got more rebels approaching the base. Possibly hostile.
Let Perkins deal with it. I've got better things to worry about. Like preserving the artifacts of our culture.
Floyd, you like culture and shit, right? Let's go.
Not much of a drinker? Does Ramsey have no soul?
Sheriff Pierce, what are you doing here? I thought Bernmoth was destroyed.
I owe Bernmoth a long overdue favor and I'm helping them rebuild. Finally families are beginning to move back in. What are you doing here?
Well, are all the operations in working order? The farms? The mills?
...The whiskey distillery?
...Tutto a posto, allora.
We're preserving culture.
Our crops were raided by silverwolves, so we're still playing catch up. We had to shut down the distillery to focus on repair efforts.
What an unfortunate loss to…. culture.
You wouldn't happen to have any casks left?
Last time we went into the distillery, the casks were gone. Probably silverwolves, but we don't know for sure.
Morgan?!
Oh, we're surrounded by angry Bigfoots. Again.
Floyd! Non vedi che sto avendo una conversazione qui?
Can't we preserve culture somewhere with less angry hominids?
Bigfoots drinking my whiskey? This is a crime against nature.
Damn those things!
The Scare-Foots we put up just aren't doing the job anymore.
Bigfoots are gentle creatures. They don't become aggressive unless provoked.
Did you provoke these poor, hulking 600 pound beasts?
You're thinking about Northern Bigfoots. Southern Bigfoots are angry drunkards.
I thought I smelled whiskey breath. Pierce, do you know where those Bigfoots usually camp out?
Just a few miles south of here. If you're thinking of being stupid and heading over there, at least take a Scare-Foot with you.
Let's head to the Bigfoot Camp.
Great! I've been working on my Bigfoot language skills.
Floyd, if you start talking to the Bigfoots, you'll just get attached. Remember that Sandworm?
His name was Melvin!
'Quel Verme della Sabbia'?
Floyd, stop carrying around that stupid Scare-Foot.
I was right. The Bigfoots have been drinking Imperial whiskey. I can see the casks right there.
Ugh, and they've been drinking it with cheap mixers? The brutes!
I never want to see another Bigfoot again.
By 'let's' I mean you, Floyd.
At least they didn't drink all of it. I might've had to commit Bigfoot genocide.
What a shame. I didn't even get to practice my Bigfoot dialect.
Let's carry these casks back to the Outpost.
Let's get these casks into the distillery and let them age.
It's a shame, to think about all we've lost when the Empire fell. And how much more we could lose.
I already lost my pet sandworm.
Meh, the whiskey isn't as great as I remembered it being.
Hey L.T, you called me over here? What's up?
Can this wait? Terrance in the Raptor Ranch has a stomachache and I need to give him medicine.
Can't…. breathe…. silverwolves...outside of town...
This is a special occasion. I want you all to taste perhaps the last Imperial whiskey that'll ever be made.
Zitto, Perkins.
I guess I could have a glass for the Empire…
This is for the Empire, and to those we lost.
To the Empire!
To the Empire!
Hey Morgan, I was talking to Floyd earlier and… hasn't it kind of been a while since one of those lovesick Raiders showed up to win Yenkcha's hand? What's up with that? Did she die or something?
I still don't remember meeting her but… eh? Honestly, I don't really have time for this right now, Ramsey.
I keep getting all these complaints about the quality of the workmanship at the Uniform Factory. I'm heading over for an inspection.
Huh… I mean… I GUESS I hope not?
Isn't that more of a Floyd thing?
Right, like I'd trust a civilian to oversee the production of our boots. Good one.
Why don't I just have Floyd take over control of all combat operations while I'm at it!
Morgan's management style is… idiosyncratic.
So, how did the inspection go?
I honestly have no idea. It turns out I don't know anything about textiles or manufactured goods.
Which I mentioned beforehand. What, did you think you'd just magically know if they were doing a bad job?
I mean, it sounds dumb when you say it like that… I figured they'd be, you know, shiftless. And I could be all "cut that out! Be less shiftless!" Y'know. Manager stuff.

Perkins, I remember that you're in trouble for something, but I can't remember for the life of me. Ugh, man, I have no idea where my head is these days. I'm just all… I'm overwhelmed, but I'm also distracted and…

It's hard, because I want to talk about it, get some advice, but, let's be honest, all of you are insane. Though Elder Taos, aside from all that terrifying cultural stuff, could actually be the most rational person around. I guess I could try talking to him.
You know, sometimes I really find myself wishing Judge Pierce was still alive.
Thanks, Perkins.
He's right, he IS easy to talk to.
Ahh, the Skinny Beast. What calamity have the winds brought to your door now?

Oh, nothing. Well, you know, Rebels, mysterious powerful people or groups conspiring against us in the shadows and giant bugs and stuff. But nothing new. I'm kind of in a funk, honestly. Not sure why.

Indeed? Rare is the man who can see himself, rarer still the man who knows for what he searches.  You will not find her here. Yenkcha has rededicated herself to her Dustwalker training in order to measure up to the Skinny Beast.
So, first, I still don't remember her, and that's NOT why I came here, but if I DID care, where would I look?
Directions to the training grounds cannot be given, they must be earned.
Is there anything Raiders don't resolve with violence?
That explains all the very obvious training equipment there.
Well fought, Skinny Beast. You will find the Dustwalker training grounds in the fields around Blades in Moonlight's camp.
Huh. Yeah, that's pretty obvious in retrospect.
It's kind of a "hide in plain sight" thing, you know?
Yeah, no, I get it. I get it.
I mean, if you hadn't said you'd tell me, I think Crazy Blade's Base is probably the very first place I would have checked, honestly.
True, but you do not think like one of my people. Only an outsider would ever venture to the home of Blades in Moonlight without good reason.
I'm not saying I'm thrilled to go there, but still, it just doesn't seem reasonable to say the location "is secret" when you really mean "is in a really scary place".
It's just disingenuous.
You have arrived late.
Well, I didn't actually tell you I was coming. I mean, when someone barges into your home there's no "late" or "on time". It just happens when it happens.
Take one rock from the mountain. Take two. Take two thousand. When do you take the mountain?
Hey, cool, so… is Yenkcha around or whatever? Cause I guess I kind of feel like knowing what she looks like?
You see so little, Scrawny Beast.
Hey, it's Skinny Beast, which is less upsetting!
Also, rivers totally swell by standing still. That's how dams work.
No heart propels your blade. You travel in a blizzard. You walk in circles and call it progress.
Yeah, I use a gun? The blades are your thing. Aside from being crazy, they're like, your WHOLE thing. Besides, I was asking about Yenkcha, not for inappropriately familiar personal assessments.
The river does not swell by standing still. There is power in motion. She will envelop you.
So… she's gone? And she's… moving to gain power… and she still likes me? If that's correct, say something terrifying.
His crop is man. Mountains shed their cloaks to hills, and still he plans. You call him friend. He would not call you pet.
Cool! I'm taking that as a yes.
I've got some good news and some bad news. The bad news is that those horrible zombie monstrosities of yours are running amok in the Outpost. Again.
Hey Floyd!

They're not "zombies". They're simply the unfortunate side effect of trying to make nanopods go a bit further. In hindsight, creating the Black Nanopods and attempting to heal Imperial troops with them was a bit… misguided.
You said there was good news?

Good news for me, at least. I'm assigning you and Zoey to take care of the problem. That way I don't have to deal with these rampaging horrors. Try to keep the morally questionable experimentation to a minimum, OK?
I'll start settin' up the traps!
"Zombies". There's no such thing. It's silly.
Are you guys done yet? I wanna use my hot tub.
Well, we managed to take out quite a few of 'em. Still a bunch wanderin' around though.
Such is the nature of things, Zoey. I doubt we'll ever be able to get rid of every single one of them but at least we've thinned the herd, so to speak.
We'll have to keep watch for more around the Outpost for the time being. This will also give us a chance to collect more of those Black Nanopods… for research purposes.
I thought the LT said to not do any evil experiments?
Science is never evil if used properly!
So, uh, Floyd? Have you used any of those Black Nanopods yet? Some of those injured soldiers in the Hospital are probably going to die anyway.
Just sayin'.
You mean, have I used any of our wounded troopers as guinea pigs to infect with these horribly misappropriated nanopods in order to create our very own army of… ahem… zombies?
Right. That's pretty much the EXACT thing I just asked you.
No Morgan, not yet. Remember, there's no cure for the infection and we would need a special facility—
Well get the lead out! Build us a special Infection Test Facility and get this horror show on the road! Man, it's like pulling teeth with you.
As an ethical man, I'm against this, but as a Scientist...
I'll try not to harm the mindless killing machine, sir.
Alright Morgan, your abomination is ready.
Abomination? This is a thing of beauty! Imagine wave after wave of infected soldiers fighting for the Empire! *sigh* It almost brings a tear to your eye.
Perkins!
Yes sir?
I'm curious to see how strong this thing is, so I'm ordering you and it to arm wrestle. Don't hurt it.
Success! HAhaha!
Floyd? What are you maniacally cackling about? Have you created another highly contagious strain of "The Mondays"?
No Morgan! Far more exciting, I've been able to establish communications with our infected former fellow soldiers. What we thought were mindless killing machines are still thinking, feeling beings!
Oh, that's pretty neat, I guess. What are they saying?
Oh, uh, well… it seems that they are quite angry and, oh no. They want to kill all of us. They're challenging us to a massive battle.
This kind of thing seems to happen every year, so, this year I invited a "consultant" to the Outpost. She seems friendly, unless you're a zombie.
I hope she knows this is a seasonal position.
She's beautiful...
OK, so, she's scary and deadly.
Ramsey? What's your professional opinion?
Ramsey! Stop drooling. She might take offense or mistake you for a zombie and lop your head off.
Vespidi
Imbroglione
Yoo hoo! Scouuuut! Where are yoooooou?
Uh, Ramsey? How'd this weirdo get past our perimeter?
I am not weirdo! I am Misha, Heavy weapons guy! I here because—
Yeah, I don't have time to care. You don't look like a Rebel, but if you don't want us to toss you into a cell, you'll have to prove to us that you won't kill us all.
Rustle up some chow, take care of those Rebels attacking us, shore up our defenses… Whatever. Perkins, watch him while he does that.
Er… What am I supposed to do against HIM if he does try to kill us all…?
I said I don't have time to care, didn't I? I did say that, right?
I attack this like I attack everything: WITH ALL I HAVE!!!
That was hurtful, sir.
Hey, this sandvich… uh, sandwich isn't bad! You're not such a bad guy after all.
THAT'S all it took?
That's what's important to me right now. I was hungry!
So, uh… "Heavy weapons guy," what were you saying you were doing here? Y'know, the part I interrupted because I didn't care then?
I work for company called BLU. I am looking for comrade Scout who went poof around here. He is short, scrawny, little boy.
Hey, we have one of those! Do you want ours?
Man, that Heavy weapons guy sure did a number on those Rebels! Ramsey, I think I might have another friend in the "big violent guy with a huge gun" category!
Look, Mister… uh, Heavy, we're the Imperial Army. We're a highly trained and cohesive fighting force. We can't go accepting a stranger just because they happen to be able to shoot well.
No, I shoot GOOD! I kill more of your Rebels than anyone!
Anyone…? Sorry to disagree, but *I'm* the top Rebel shooter around here.
Then we have contest! We go shoot Rebels! Highest body count wins! Is good, yes?
Oh, yeah, is good! I love a good shooting competition!
It's been a long time since I've met someone with my kind of interests!
Whew! That was a pretty good workout! How many Rebels did you take down, Heavy?
So many, I lose count! Piles and PILES of them! Hahahahaha!
Same here! Hah, you really aren't such a bad guy! Hell, welcome to the Outpost!
Morgan, I think we should find the Scout that my buddy here is looking for. He may have some valuable intel. We might even convince him to help us out too.
It's worth a shot. So where is he?
If I knew, I not look here! I find him already!
You know, maybe it takes a Scout to find a Scout. If we can train some of our guys to think like he does, we might have better luck.
Huh, the man has a point.
I show latest in BLU training techniques!
My comrades not as strange as you people.
Well, the men are trained up. They look a little… weird without the gas masks, but they seem to have the skills we need.
Fan them out across the area. Have them report anyone who looks or is acting strange.
Hey, LT, I finished that new automated milkshake machine I was tellin' ya about! Only it's still a little, uh, homicidal, so don't turn it on just yet, okay?
… I mean besides us.
Sir! We've gotten reports of someone who fits the Scout's description at the Raptor Nest!
What are these "raptors"? Good to shoot?
Only if you enjoy having your intestines inside your body. Come on, we'd better get going before you have to retrieve your friend with a mop and bucket.
I get to shoot so many things! Is good day!
Hey, isn't someone gonna answer me?! Hey!!
Yo, Mickey, yer a sight for sore eyes! I was almost lizard chow! Who're dese bozos with ya?
"Bozos" who just saved your life, and are carrying highly sophisticated weaponry. Hint hint.
So, Scout-whose-name-I-don't-know, what were you doing here in the first place?
Ehh, I got lost. Oh, but Mickey! I found out sumptin'! Sumptin' BIG!
About mission?
Yeah!
Wait, what did you find out? What mission? What were you doing sneaking around to begin with?
Okay, you people have exactly five seconds to tell me what's going on before I start volunteering you both for Floyd's genetic experiments.

See, we're on a real vital mission! We're fightin' a company called RED. My team an' I have been all over this place, trying to find their base so we can take the important item they got! And I found out where it is!
The base? Yes! We must tell comrades at once!
Great, there are more of you? No, no, really, I'm thrilled.
I'd call 'em, only my radio kinda got clawed up by those raptors, and none of yours got the frequency codes I need.
No problem! We got a Tool Shop here you can use to make yer own!
Cool! But, uh… Looks like some o' those raptors followed us back here. Guess I must smell good, huh? Heh...
This is technically insubordination, but keeping Zoey busy makes her happy.
Perkins, front and center! I gotta exert some unnecessary authority!
Got 'em! Beta Team's gonna meet up with us at the coordinates I gave 'em!
Good! Well, friend Ramsey? Join us?
I just gotta grab my gun. Let's do this!
Why are people making decisions without consulting me? Is this, like, one of those things where I'm really dead and nobody can hear me? Hello? I'm pretty sure I still outrank almost everyone here.
Okay, fine, where is this RED base?
It's northwest of here. We got no idea what to expect.
Of course not. Floyd, Zoey, hold down the fort while we're gone.
Zoey, if Floyd tries to insurrect, hit him with a wrench.
That's why I always wear the hard hat.
Mikhail, finally! Where the hell have you been?! In case you haven't noticed, we're in the middle of a MISSION here!
Making friends! Here they are!
Friends? Friends?!? This is WAR! Friends are for the weak and underprivileged!
Fine, we're *allies*, though I regretted that decision even before this conversation.
Well, why didn't you say so? Welcome aboard, private! Your mission is to help us ANNIHILATE these mewling RED pansies guarding their base!
… Private?!?
It's served me well so far.
Ach, who were those howlin' scunners with the RED tossers? I ha'nt seen the likes of them before.
We have. Guess the Rebels teamed up with RED.
Y'know, it's oddly comforting to always expect the worst. You're never unpleasantly surprised.

If the Rebels and RED are fighting together, we're going to need some kind of edge. Otherwise, I'd just start hashing out the details for our terms of surrender. You know, something with a little poetry to it.
I'll tell you what would be an edge: MORE OF ME!
Alright, well, why don't you go supervise the training of some of our troops at the barracks in your ... unique style.
That way, you leave me alone for a bit AND I get to go do something more important. I can't think of anything right now so maybe a nap? Yeah, that sounds good.
Now you're making sense! I'll show those pansies the sheer BRUTALITY of BLU training techniques!
Eh, I prefer Imperial methods. They're elegant in their efficient sadism.
Such a waste of military resources.
Sir? Why do we have so many extra crates of rocket ammunition lying around?
Those BLU Soldiers burn through twice as many rockets as Imperials since they seem to spend half their time doing idiotic things like...
Whoooooooo!!!
Oh my god! Did you see that Lieutenant? That guy just blasted himself into the air like 30 feet!
Yeah. That's one of the idiotic things I was talking about.
Cummoan ya bampots! That RED Base isn't about ta breach itself! We need ta get moving!
Stay sharp, men! Our objective is in sight! We march on the RED base at once! Failure is NOT AN OPTION!
Is a nice bourbon an option? Because I'd rather take that.
I'd even take an adequate bourbon at this point.
Well, we're finally here and that RED base is over there, crawling with Rebels and versions of you guys wearing red uniforms. This was a nice walk. I think I'll go back to the Outpost now.
We've come all this way, sir. Shouldn't we help them out a bit? You've seen what these guys can do in a fight. Having evil versions running around with our enemy seems like a bad idea.
Uggghhhhhhhh! Fine. Let's go do the "responsible" thing instead of doing the thing I want to do. Man, I'm thirsty. Can I have a swig of your soda?
ATTAAAACK!
Seriously!? That was RIGHT in my ear!
We're through their outer defenses! I can practically feel the prize in my hands already!
Scout says true things. I see more enemies to kill though!
Incoming second wave! Prepare for battle, troops!
Natascha is hungry!
One more push and we'll have the item, sir.

Excellent news Ramsey. Let's get this over with quickly so we can go back to fighting our regular enemies. If we beat these guys fast enough, there's still enough time to make it home for the weekly orphanage talent show.
I'm a judge this week!
Little Timmy better watch that vibrato!
No, really, every single one of you should die in a fire. ESPECIALLY the Pyro guy.
Wait… THAT'S your "valuable objective"? A FLAG?!
What were ye expectin', lad? Gold? Haggis? A briefcase o' military intelligence?
I mean... Yes?
It's not just a flag! It's a symbol of PRIDE, man! Of VICTORY!
I hate you all.
The Infected
Zombies
Niente di danneggiato.
C'é un piccolo insediamento di predoni qui, costruito attorno ad un'orrenda cosa di metallo conficcata nel terreno. Perché? Chi puó dirlo con questi tizi?

Risalente ai tempi dell'Antica Civilizzazione, queste rovine sono rimaste sconosciute ed indisturbate fino ad oggi. Sarà stata una città? Una struttura di ricerca? Una SPA con connesso centro fitness? Nessuno lo sa, ma molti si stanno (letteralmente) ammazzando per scoprirlo.
Antiche Rovine
Bracconiere

La carcassa a pezzi di quella che un tempo era un'impressionante struttura di ricerca. Fa piú paura ora che è una rovina spettrale, oppure quando era pienamente funzionante e sputava fuori enormi mostruositá meccaniche? Difficile a dirsi.

Popolazione Massima
Scommetto che potresti considerare questo un "deposito per approvvigionamenti", ma sembra piú una manciata di tende piene di spazzatura inutile.
Non siamo certi di come riescano i Predoni a far crescere qualcosa nell'area secca, montagnosa e coperta di rocce in cui vivono. Se lo scopri, fammelo sapere.
I Predoni sono stati visti da queste parti aggirarsi sotto basse mura e arrampicarsi sopra quelle alte. Sicuramente si stanno ribellando.
Non ci credo che abbia una fortezza cosí grande. È praticamente una tenda formato famiglia e tre cammelli.
Pieno zeppo di Raptor. Stanno sicuramente proteggendo alcuni dei Raptor più piccoli qui in giro, si tratta dunque probabilmente di un nido.
